Title: Red Kite Tree Tent - Ynys Affalon
Description: ['About this space', "Escape to one of these two fabulous Tree Tents. Suspended high above the canopy, it‚Äôs time to appreciate life from a new perspective. Featured on George Clarke‚Äôs Amazing Spaces, these Tree Tents are a feat of aviation technology. Tree Tent comes complete with fire pit, outdoor kitchen and shower with hot water. You‚Äôll discover a comfortable bed and cosy wood burning stove. Part of the Red Kite Estate, along with our barn and its sister tree tent, the first ever built in the UK, Dragon's Egg.", 'The space', 'The space\nThe true joy of this place is how wonderfully simple it is (aviation technology aside). Days are filled with fireside discussions, wildlife watching and stunningly beautiful walks. With the nearest mobile signal a ten minute walk away, it‚Äôs a great place to ditch the digital and truly escape. Head over the bridge to your own private deck that happily houses a clever outdoor-kitchen and shower (complete with hot water). It‚Äôs the perfect spot to fry up breakfast whilst basking in peace and tranquility. There is also a flushing toilet situated just up the hill.And don‚Äôt worry, you‚Äôre not totally left to your own devices, on arrival you can expect bed linen, towels and a load of dry wood and kindling. If you feel the need to leave your new found homestead in the trees then the local area has lots of suitably chilled things to do. Head out on a moorland walk to take in some magical views - and perhaps even grab a pint at the local pub en route. Further afield, the stunning Elan Valley, a landscape bursting with impressive dams and reservoirs, is well worthy of an explore. And for those needing supplies - and perhaps a flat white - then the friendly market town of Builth Wells is just down the road.', '', '', '', 'Other things to note\nYou are entering a remote woodland hideaway for a digital detox: there is very patchy mobile signal and limited internet connectivity.']

Title: Az Alom Cabin - Treehouse Tree to Nature Cabin
Description:
['About this space', "Come and spend a romantic stay with a couple or family, on the Domaine de l 'Arbre in Cabane

A very pretty forest of 5 hectares shelters 8 beautiful huts they all have the dream names, unique and unprecedented.

They are housed in centuries-old trees out of sight, in osmosis with nature.

The site is preserved, your peace is assured. Nature is everywhere

A treehouse to indulge, relax and go where no one will be looking for you!", 'The space', 'The space
Cabin perched in trees 8 meters high.
This cabin is beautiful. Its access via a board walkway and its platform adjoining 3 individual beds seduce them to the highest degree. It has a capacity of 3 people.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
You will have access to the entire cabin, forest and park.
Sanitary facilities (showers and toilets) are at the reception, a 3-minute walk.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Are you ready for an unusual stay?']

Title:
Cabane Entre Les Pins
üå≤üèïÔ∏èüå≤
Description:
['About this space', 'Rustic cabin between the pines, 3 meters high and 28 square meters on the banks of the Austreberth River üå≤üèïÔ∏èüå≤', 'The space', "The space
Our cabin between the pines is a great alternative for those looking for contact with nature and want to rest, enjoy together or have fun with family or friends. With 3 meters high and 28 square meters, it accommodates 4 people. Located on a 1.2 hectare property by the river Austreberthe, our rustic treehouse shares the space with our garden rabbits and dumplings, as well as wild dumplings and our beloved khenty mare, who loves apples and carrots. A tranquil retreat, with efficient thermal insulation and heaters for the colder days. Equipped with a double bed, sofa bed, kitchen , duvet and toilet.


We provide:
Towels
Bed linens and pillows
Kitchen detergent and bathroom soap
Paper towels & toilet paper
Cooking utensils
Coffee, tea, salt and pepper, herbs of provence
What to do in the area's guide

I'll follow us on Instagram @entreespins", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests can use the space around the cabin.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
*When it's windy, the cabin squeaks, but there's nothing to worry about.

*Do not use candles or objects containing a fire inside and outside the cabin as the polyester is flammable.

*Smoking outside only please.

*Our dear pets are allowed but with the commitment of their guardian not to leave them on the bed and furnishing fabrics, as well as being responsible for their waste.

*Pine needles often fall on the balcony, which doesn't mean the space hasn't been cleaned.

*As this is literally a house between the trees, it is common that there are insects and cobwebs outside but with the door closed it will prevent them from entering the cabin.

*With the arrival of the cold season, we see that the internal temperature is between 15 and 18 degrees.

*Check-out time must be respected so as not to change the arrival time of the next guest."]

Title: Tree Top Cabin with log burner & private hot tub
Description:
['About this space', 'The Tree top cabin is situated in our peaceful woodland in the heart of Snowdonia. It has a shower (hot water included)and w.c and washbasin (no hot water in the washbasin).
Lighting is provided from a 12v solar panel system.
A log burner is provided with free wood.
There is a double bed.
The private wood fired hot tub is situated on a balcony overlooking the woodland area.
Pet friendly.
Outside seating is provided.', 'The space', 'The space
This unique glamping experience has everything you need for a restful and idyllic break from everyday life. Wake up to bird song and the sound of the stream. Enjoy your own exclusive hot tub whilst sipping a glass of bubbly. Our Cabin is fully insulated and has everything you need for that perfect "rustic" getaway without compromising on quality and convenience.

ALL bedding and towels are included in your stay. You may like to bring extra towels for hot tub usage.

A small log burner inside to keep you nice and cosy.

There is limited telephone signal.', '', '']

Title: Treehouse near Paris Disney
Description:
['About this space', 'Charming cabin nestled in the leaves, real unusual and cozy house in the trees with all the modern comforts, just 45 minutes from Paris, 28 km from Disneyland or Provins and 5 minutes from the Parc des F√©lins. This cozy nest awaits you year-round for an unusual romantic or family experience. A parenthesis of relaxation and relaxation, ideal to offer yourself or yourself. See you soon :)', 'The space', "The space
La Cabane Perch√©e de Chambonni√®re awaits you over the seasons and offers a comfortable and cozy setting amidst the trees, the opportunity to escape from everyday life during a romantic stay with two or family, for one or more nights.

You will be seduced by this treehouse full of charm with neat decoration.
- Access by gentle slope, ideal for welcoming you easily.
- Charming living room with bioethanol fireplace (only in cold weather and exclusively for couples or families with children over 7 years old)
- Fully equipped kitchen.
- Double bedroom + 1 bedroom with 2 single beds upstairs
- Shower room with shower and real toilet
- Magnificent private terrace of 36m¬≤ with garden furniture and deckchair.


This cozy nest in the trees offers all the modern comforts (electricity, heating, bathroom with toilet and standard shower, flat screen TV, and a kitchenette with multifunction oven, refrigerator, hob, wifi internet access...). For your arrival, all beds are made.

The shack perched in chambonni√®re is ideally located to allow you to discover the charms of the Seine and Marne and the Champagne region:
> the Parc des F√©lins,
> the medieval city of Provins with magnificent equestrian and falconry shows in season,
> Disneyland Paris & La Vall√©e Village 25mn,
> the castles of Vaux le Vicomte, Blandy les Tours and Fontainebleau
> and for the most sporty (depending on the season):
- tree climbing,
- paintball,
- karting and other motor sports.
> You'll also have a chance to go for nice walks around on foot or by mountain bike and tennis in the village.

A parenthesis of relaxation and relaxation, ideal to offer yourself or yourself .

Looking forward to welcoming you‚Ä¶


The rates shown in the calendar are for 2 people. Rates for 4 people are calculated automatically when booking

A surcharge may be charged if the general condition rendered is indecent.", 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
The owners reserve the right to cancel your stay at the hut if the weather conditions are very bad, whether they are known a few days before, or even on the day of arrival, whether you are already on the road or already arrived on site, or during your stay (weather alert, severe weather events, strong wind, storm, thunderstorm). If this happens, we'll try to relocate you to other types of accommodation nearby, subject to availability and at no extra charge. If we do not have a relocation solution available, and in this case only, you will be offered a date extension at the choice of the owners or you will receive a 50% discount on a next equivalent stay in a cabin in the current 12 months. In any case, no compensation or reimbursement can be claimed."]

Title: Lodge Gregan
Description:
['About this space', 'Our lodges are pretty eco-chalets equipped with 2 bedrooms, bathroom, kitchen and living room. Their covered terrace will allow you to make the most of breakfast or aperitif because the luxury here is space and nature !
For a week or more, treat yourself to a breath of fresh air in this nature hotel, unique in southern Brittany!', 'The space', 'The space
Dihan (break in Breton) is a very natural cocktail of history, unusual,
travel, and love of Brittany.

A few kilometers from the sea, between Carnac and Quiberon peninsula, this
original structure, the first unusual European ecolabel site, precursor of nights in huts in the trees is an ecolodge born from the old family farm.

Since then, many unusual accommodations have gradually nestled on our 25-hectare estate in Ploemel.

Treehouses, yurts, hobbit houses... Get ready for an out-of-time experience, where vegetation is king ! Here, you can light up with a candle and a dynamo lamp and forget about your mobile phone...
With a space dedicated to relaxation, enjoy our hamman, sauna and massages from around the world.

On the catering side, breakfasts are served in baskets and hoisted in huts perched thanks to a system of pulleys. In the evening, meal baskets are available, upon reservation. For a friendly moment with family or friends, head to the Caf√© Lounge area located on the terrace of our wooden pool and enjoy our snacks made in Breizh products.']

Title: CABANE DES GIROLLES - IN THE TREES
Description:
['About this space', 'Above all, this is a breathtaking setting that we invite you to discover during your stay at Les H√©bergements de Qu√©necan. We invite you to escape to this natural and unique horizon in the heart of nature.

In the heart of the immense forest of Qu√©n√©can, near the water points or overlooking the former iron and steel village of Les Forges, enjoy the peace and quiet to take a moment to recharge your batteries, away from everyday life.', 'The space', 'The space
Located at a height of 10 meters in an oak of nearly 200 years, the Cabane des Girolles takes its name from the good girolles harvests that are made regularly for the happiness of all.

It is equipped with:

A bed in 90
A bed in 140 above
A toilet corner with water reserve, dry toilet, wipes.
A spacious, sunny terrace overlooking the listed village of Les Forges des Salles. Ideal terrace for breakfast or summer evenings.
Extra heating when the need arises.
You can have sanitary showers, toilets arranged for you at the reception to enjoy several days of our site.
It is ideal for a couple and a child.

It is accessed by a long fully secured footbridge that will delight young and old alike.

- We remind you that each of our accommodations has a small toilet area as well as a dry toilet - and a sun terrace. Breakfast is included - the evening meal can be delivered by reservation -']

Title: RENARDI√àRE HUT - IN THE TREES
Description:
['About this space', 'It is above all a breathtaking setting that we offer you to discover during your stay at Accommodations in Qu√©n√©can. We invite you to escape to this natural and unique landscape surrounded by nature.

In the heart of the immense forest of Qu√©n√©can, near the water points or overlooking the old steel village of Les Forges, take advantage of the peace and quiet to take a moment to recharge your batteries, away from everyday life.', 'The space', 'The space
In the forest, on the edge of the private furnace pond (12 hectares), the Renardi√®re cabin is built at a height of 5 meters while Douglas-fir and larch, naturally impenetrable wood. This cabin for 6 people is ideal for an exceptional moment with friends or family. Located in an oak tree and supported by 5 pillars, this large, very spacious and clear cabin will seduce you with its originality.A spiral staircase will take you to the southwesterly facing terrace overlooking the furnace pond.The occupants of the cabin will be able to settle in for dinner at sunset. The cabin is composed of a living room with coffee table and benches, a bed in 140 retractable, 2 beds in 90 including a 90/140, a mezzanine with a bed in 160, a small toilet with dry toilets. This hut will please aspiring pirates, indeed, our builders have planned a drawbridge to maneuver to drop the moorings and start the adventure!', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Access indicated during booking. Private parking at the foot of the cabin.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
On the estate, enjoy the steel village of Les Forges des Salles (free visit). This former well-preserved steel industrial site brings you back to the daily life of a 19th century blacksmith!
Around, Lake Guerl√©dan, the Abbey of Bon Repos, the Museum of Electricity, the Valley of Saints are all sites that open their doors to you']

Title: La Cabane Les Faines
Description:
['About this space', 'The Les Faines cabin, perched in a 150-year-old beech tree, will make you live an unusual nature experience in Normandy year-round.
We are located 12 km from Dieppe (Seine-Maritime), 2 h from Paris and 3 h from Brussels.', 'The space', 'The space
Nestled in a 150-year-old beech tree, 8 m high, this hut is oriented northwest : sunset ensured on the terrace (10 m¬≤), between the branches overlooking the horse meadow and you can watch for the passage of animals, among others, deer, who like to sleep nearby.
This hut (10 m¬≤), built with total respect for the tree and its environment, accommodates 2 people (adult or 12 years minimum accompanied by an adult).

Access is via a beautiful spiral staircase, then via a 15 m long walkway.

It is undoubtedly the easiest access deckhouse, combining height and ease.

This hut also gives you exclusive access to another large terrace, common to the 3 bridge huts, perched 20 m from a 190-year-old beech tree: it is the tallest terrace in France, accessible by a magnificent crinoline ladder, fully secured ! Change of scenery and relaxation guaranteed !

Without running water or electricity, but rustic comfort for a unique adventure in the wild. Water supply (4 l), dry toilet and heating. Bathroom at the reception.', '', '', '', 'Other things to note', '', '']

Title: CLEARING HUT - IN THE TREES
Description:
['About this space', 'Above all, this is a breathtaking setting that we invite you to discover during your stay at Les H√©bergements de Qu√©necan. We invite you to escape to this natural and unique horizon in the heart of nature.

In the heart of the immense forest of Qu√©n√©can, near the water points or overlooking the former iron and steel village of Les Forges, enjoy the peace and quiet to take a moment to recharge your batteries, away from everyday life.', 'The space', 'The space
In a 145-year-old sessile oak tree, the Cabane de la Clairi√®re sits 10 meters high.
Close to the Pond du Fourneau, on the banks of Morbihan, this hut stands out for its very original access: a colimasson staircase that our artists built around an oak barrel, a first circular landing and a long footbridge that leads you through the foliage.
The hut, with a capacity of 4 people or even 5 (possibility to add a driver) is large and exposed west to make the most of the lighting of the pond that reverberates.
The arrival at the hut is quite spectacular, for the attention of subjects to the vertigo, we will propose instead another hut !

It includes :

a sitting area with two 90 beds, possibility of extra bed
a toilet area with water reserve, toilet bowl, dry toilet, wipes.
a lovely mezzanine with a double bed in 160.
a large terrace, where are installed a table and 4 chairs where it will be nice dinner with family or friends...
You can have toilets : showers, toilets arranged for you at the reception to enjoy several days of our site.

- We remind you that each of our accommodations has a small toilet area as well as a dry toilet - and a sun terrace. Breakfast is included - the evening meal can be delivered by reservation -']

Title: Guadeloupe perched hut
Description: ['About this space', 'The Guadeloupe hut is a little paradise perched in trees that would make you jealous! Sanitary facilities are available nearby. See you soon in our branches !', 'The space', 'The space\nTo prepare your stay, we offer different options : like preparing your bed, you also have the option to dine in a cabin and/or have an aperitif on the terrace. The baskets are delivered to your accommodation. A wellness activity with the horse is offered on site (equicoaching) by appointment. All you have to do is tell us which options you want at the latest 48 hours before you arrive. Simply send us an email.']

Title: Heavenly Treehouse w/ Wrap Around Deck & Farm Views
Description:
['About this space', '‚òÜ Welcome to the Treehouse at Bluebird Farm Connecticut ‚òÜ

This 40-acre farm sanctuary is suitable for anyone looking to visit a Farmstay.

The town of Willington offers:
‚úî Hiking Trails
‚úî Antiquing
‚úî Local Diners
‚úî Vineyards & Breweries
‚úî Drive-In Movie Theater

We are close drive from:
‚óè UCONN (10 Mins)
‚óè Hartford (25 Mins)
‚óè Boston (1.5 Hours)
‚óè NYC (2.5 Hours)', '', "The space
The Treehouse is custom built for your comfort!

You will have all the essentials in your kitchenette, bathroom, and shower. You also have shared access to the garden's gazebo.

Are you sleeping among the clouds? Almost! The main bed has a memory foam mattress and is encircled by what seems like endless windows. Rest easy among the surrounding trees.

NOTE #1: The Treehouse's fire place is propane-based and does not use fire wood. Temperature regulation of the unit is easily regulated via a simple thermostat and ceiling fan.

NOTE #2: It might get rustic! There is no guarantee of running water from November 15 to April 15 due to seasonal freezing of the Treehouse's water line. This means running sink water and shower will most likely NOT be in use during this period. The toilet is eco-friendly and in use year round.

Amenities:
‚úî Free Coffee and Tea
‚úî Outdoor Gas Grill
‚úî Indoor Gas Stovetop
‚úî Bathroom Gear (Towels, Soaps, Shampoo, Conditioner)
‚úî Back-up Toothpaste/Brush
‚úî Classic Board Games (Clue, Battle Ship, Monopoly & Sorry)
‚úî Free Parking On Premise
‚úî Fire Pit for Bonfires
‚úî Interaction w/ Farm Animals
‚úî Close Proximity to Trails and State Parks", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
‚úî Guest will have access to property grounds, gazebo, and Treehouse.

‚úî Guests have access to the animal pasture only when guided by Host.

‚úî Guest may use of the gas grill on the patio of the Treehouse.

‚úî Guest can use the bonfire... and we supply the wood!', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please note this is a functioning farm - livestock, tractors and work is conducted daily. As a Guest, you and your party understand and are aware you may encounter potential sound and smells accustomed to a farm experience. You understand that you may be exposed to pollen, insects, and other environmental factors accustomed to being in nature and a farm.

You understand that you MUST CLIMB STAIRS AND STEP-LADDERS ‚Äî There are two flights of stairs to get to the Treehouse. There is a step-ladder to the main bedroom. You understand you can NOT sit on the patio rails.

‚úî NO PETS ALLOWED
‚úî SHOWER AND KITCHEN SINK ARE MOST LIKELY NOT IN USE FROM NOVEMBER 15 TO APRIL 15 DUE TO FROZEN WATER LINES
‚úî TOILET IS ECO-FRIENDLY AND IN USE YEAR ROUND

Additional Fees and Instant Booking Requirements:
‚òÜ After more than: 1 guest, a extra charge of $29 per person, per night will be issued ‚òÜ']

Title: Lovely Treehouse in the Woods next to Stream
Description:
['About this space', "Note: Please read the covid travel restriction information below before you book.

You will feel the stresses of life wash away as you sway in the trees and listen to the sounds of the beautiful stream just feet from the treehouse deck. You'll never want to leave! Enjoy a bit of solitude or some special alone time with a loved one. It's hard to beat Stone City Treehouse to make your time away special!", 'The space', 'The space
COVID INFO - 10/17/21

I had not been updating Covid info, so here's the most recent info:

Vermont does not currently have any travel restrictions or behavior restrictions around Covid. I do not have any such requirements for the treehouse either. However, I am vaccinated and wear a mask in public indoor space.

Let‚Äôs all be respectful and kind!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

After your day of hiking, skiing, or touring local breweries and distilleries, come home to this beautiful, private tiny house in the trees! Or, just spend the day lazily relaxing by the fire and reading, while the sound of the stream soothes you.

Walk through the woods, up the stairs, and enter into another dimension - one that you won't want to leave! Much thought was put into the design and local, natural, and recycled materials were a priority in its construction.

Soak in the curated interior design while you relax in the living room space and gaze out the large, recycled windows (from an old, local schoolhouse).

Enjoy the deck that overlooks the year-round stream (that may be frozen over in the winter) and let the sound of the water wash through you. You may even see some critters if you're still enough!

There is a sweet sitting area, hammock, and campfire space just below the treehouse right on the stream, with a dramatic view of the treehouse. And a hanging bed underneath!

You can cook simple meals on the propane campstove (with a griddle option) or use the small charcoal grill in the space under the treehouse. There is a mini-fridge with a separate freezer to keep your fresh produce from the farmers' market and your yummy local beer nice and cool. There's a very primitive (and limited) water system you can use for washing dishes.

We also provide some basic condiments and cooking basics, like olive oil and salt and pepper. We also offer coffee, hot chocolate, and lemonade. Most of the products we offer for your use, and our cleaning supplies and paper products are from Public Goods and you can get a 25% discount on your first purchase with the coupon code TREEHOUSEPGA

There is a basic composting toilet in the treehouse for your convenience, but you also have access to a full, modern bathroom at the house, with a beautiful shower.

When it's time for bed, climb up the loft ladder to "the nest" and sink into the comfy bed. Open up the windows to hear the nighttime sounds of the forest!

We prioritize our earth and take environmental considerations into every decision: we generate solar electricity; we compost and recycle; we use environmentally friendly cleaning products; we avoid disposable items as much as possible; and we used many local and recycled materials in the construction of the treehouse.

The interior structure is 10'x16' with a loft and the deck is 4'x16'.', 'Guest access', "Guest access
Although official check-in is at 5pm, if you'd like to check in before this time, please inquire and we may be able to accommodate.

You have exclusive access to the entire treehouse.

The treehouse is about 200 feet from the driveway and house, yet it's very private in the woods.

I have a garden cart you can use to transport your belongings to the treehouse.

If you arrive early and the treehouse is not ready yet, you are welcome to leave your things on the porch at the house.", 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
You must be physically able to climb stairs and ladders to stay here. The sleeping space is in a somewhat-tight loft, but the limited space has not been an issue for even our taller guests. We do not allow dogs (or any other pets) in the sleeping loft.

This area of Vermont (the Northeast Kingdom) has snow all winter, and sometimes mud, especially in the spring. The treehouse is located on a dirt/gravel road that can sometimes be challenging if it's muddy or even snowy or icy. We can get a lot of snow sometimes and you could possibly get stuck on your way here or in the driveway. I do my best to keep the driveway clean and sanded, but it's not always possible all of the time. We live in a rural area and services are not always immediately available.

All of that being said, most of the time there are no issues but if you have access to a 4WD vehicle, ideally with higher clearance and snow tires, that is the best case scenario. Keep an eye on the weather and plan ahead: the Northeast Kingdom of Vermont is probably not like where you're from and being prepared for weather and challenging driving conditions is absolutely the best policy.

There is a primitive composting toilet in the treehouse, with regular bathroom access (toilet, sink, washer, dryer, shower) in the main house, which is about 200 feet away.

Wifi is not (barely?) available at the treehouse, but it is at the house. There is a phone (landline) at the treehouse and minimal/intermittent cell reception.

I provide at least two gallons of water that can be used for either drinking and/or washing. I encourage you to fill the water up at the house if you need more than this (there is a faucet option in the shower) rather than bringing in bottles. Our water is great!

There is a camping cookstove available (with a griddle), a charcoal grill, toaster oven and a mini-fridge. You should be able to find all you need for basic cooking there.

Please understand that you are likely to come across various critters - anything from fairly large spiders (most likely - they love the water) to bears and moose (less likely). Walking down to the treehouse you may come across our resident chipmunk, and will often hear owls and loons at night. So, if you want to stay here you must be comfortable with insects and wildlife! We are in the woods and nature and spiders and insects are part of the package."]

Title: Tullihas in the Trees
Description:
['About this space', 'Tullihas in the Trees is an off-grid treehouse adventure. The treehouse has no electricity, no running water, no central heating, and limited cell service. There is a composting outhouse on site and potable water is available a short distance away. The treehouse is a great place to hammock, sit around the campfire, explore trails, and unwind while glamping on a lovely wooded farm.
Sleeping bags are highly recommended during the cool months. The small propane heater will only take off the chill.', 'The space', 'The space
The treehouse has one double bed, a single bed and two cots. We provide sheets for the double bed and single bed, however it is highly recommended that you bring a sleeping bag and pillows. If you plan to use the cots, you will need to bring your own bedding.
There is a single burner propane stove, a coffee pot and French press. There is also a small propane heater for the cold months to take off the chill.
The treehouse is situated on a 230+ acre farm which is available for exploring and hiking all spring and summer long. Restrictions apply October and November.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
To access the treehouse, we give you the address for the mailbox directly across from the treehouse. When you put that address in your GPS it takes you right there! You park right out front of the treehouse.
This is the country, which means dirt roads and no streetlights.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Remember: this is a treehouse with no electricity and no running water. This means, we do not have a shower, no air conditioning, no central heat, and no refrigerator. The potable water is available on the farm. Guests are welcome to build campfires in the ring. We provide you with one double memory foam mattress, one single memory foam mattress, and a two cots. Hammocking is strongly encouraged. Think of it as Glamping. :)

- In the cooler months, bring warm bedding/sleeping bags. The propane heater is intended to take off the chill - but it will still be cool. We supply you with extra propane tanks, located in the cedar chest. They last for about 8 hours on low.

- We do spray for bugs - but it is a treehouse, therefore be prepared to meet an occasional fly, spider, ladybug or wasp, as they think the treehouse is super cool too!

- Guests are free to hike the trails, explore the woods, creeks, and farmland from December to October. Some restrictions apply October and November.

EXPECT:
‚Äì Ladybugs on your pillow, and the occasional cricket if you‚Äôre lucky. Please watch out for wasps‚Äîthey seem to like the treehouse too.
‚Äì The noisy Amish cows and goats that will work better than an alarm clock.
‚Äì A million stars, and even more birds.
‚Äì The opportunity to walk out your door to the stream and watch wildlife. (Literally a few steps away).
‚Äì To be treated like a houseguest, not a renter.
‚Äì No cell phone service. (You can always walk up the hill to make a call).
‚Äì Campfires, hiking trails, nearby fishing, swimming, etc.
‚Äì The best hammocking (yes, this is a verb) in all of Ohio.
‚Äì A sunset view that will take your breath away.']

Title: Cherry Treesort "Big Nick"
Description: ['About this space', 'This tree house is very unique. It features two separate sleeping quarters to give renters the ability to accommodate more friends and enjoy time together but also have private time at night. Its 25 feet up in the trees and has plenty of nature coming through and around the decks. Its also has all the amenities one would want for comfort in the main house with heat/ AC, TV, Shower, and Toilet. The bunk house also has TV/DVD, heat and AC. Come enjoy nature at its best.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note\nThe shower is very unique in that it is an outdoor shower. Its located high up in the trees with the main house and is very private. It has very good water pressure and very hot water. Just thought we should let everyone know. Also, we do not offer WIFI.']

Title: Romantic Treehouse Getaway with Breathtaking Views
Description:
['About this space', "Discover the ultimate romance in trees 30 feet off the ground! This luxurious treehouse offers the perfect treehouse lodging in Ohio for a romantic escape. Private setting in the woods on a 38-acre property in the heart of Ohio‚Äôs Amish Country. Enjoy a king bed and a living room with a sofa and sitting chair. A covered porch will help you enjoy the breathtaking treetop views. Come see why these incredible one-of-a-kind Treehouses were featured on HGTV! We're sure you'll have an incredible stay!", 'The space', 'The space
Living Room:
Roughhewn beams and split pine planking surround you as you relax in the comfy sofa and matching chair in front of a live edge coffee table. Flip the switch to ignite the fireplace encased in hand-cut stone and curl up with a good book or take a much-deserved nap. You can also catch up on your favorite shows on the large screen TV with cable channels that are mounted above the mantle. Windows on each wall allow plenty of natural light and outdoor beauty to enter your hideaway.

But make sure you spend lots of time outside on the wrap-around balcony. Allow the peacefulness of your wooded retreat to soothe your mind and soul as you rock gently in the rockers and absorb the serenity that surrounds you.

King Bed:
Before snuggling into the King size bed featuring an Amish-made pillow-top mattress resting on an elevated pinewood base, make sure you unwind in your private two-person jetted tub. The ceiling-high waterfall fill supplies the hot water that will be jetted over tired muscles creating just the right mood for the perfect night.

Kitchen:
Your kitchen is home to a collegiate-sized refrigerator with a freezer and a 2-burner stovetop. There are ample pots and pans if you feel like making your favorite vacation meal, or a microwave oven for heating up the leftovers from one of our amazing restaurants in town. A toaster and drip coffee maker round out the appliances which are at your disposal. The Amish-made wood table and chairs are the perfect spots for breakfast for two.

Bathroom:
A sliding barn door opens to reveal your tiled floor bathroom. An artisanal counter rests on legs made from logs and supports an above counter stone basin. The expertly tiled shower is large enough for two and can start your day or end your night on just the right note.', '', '']

Title: Baumhaushotel Krautsand Haus JOJO
Description: ['About this space', 'The tree house Jojo is the 3 tree house on our paddock. It rests on stilts at an altitude of about 6m above the pastures. The tree house stands between old pastures and you have a magnificent view of the meadows. Here you can go back a gear.', 'The space', 'The space\nthere is a hotpot on our premises that you can use at any time. There is also a ground, seminar or meditation house for max. 12 people. We live practically next door, but are also far away that we do not disturb you. If you need any help or tips, just come over.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note\nYou will deliberately not find a TV in our treehouses. For this there is music or free access to Wi-Fi. An iPad is also available for surfing the Internet. If you want to see which ship is passing by or when the next flood is.']

Title: Chulavista Dome
Description:
['About this space', 'The Chulavista Dome is a geodesic dome high up in the trees. Our two-storey treehouse is built around 3 Fresnos (European Ash), a tree native to Cantabria. The huge windows and large terrace offer panoramic views of the valley, mountains and forests.', 'The space', "The space
Fantastic for romantic getaways, the cozy bedroom sleeps two and features a seating area, nespresso coffee maker and heating.

The garden under the dome is very secluded, and offers a gas barbecue, picnic table and a jacuzzi just for the two of you. The only sounds you'll hear are birds chirping and cow bells ringing.

Enjoy this unique experience of sleeping under the stars, surrounded by nothing but nature, with all modern comfort such as a full bathroom, wifi and a microwave."]

Title: Nature‚Äôs Nook- A Modern Treehouse
Description:
['About this space', 'Set in the heart of wine country, this treehouse is where nature meets globally inspired, modern design. The compact interior sleeps up to 4 people in layered bunks, lofts and nooks while the exterior space sprawls overlooking the fern filled valley below. This property is the perfect getaway for adventure, relaxation, wine tasting or hiking. Built around a living oak tree this treehouse embraces the beauty nature offers and still has creature comforts such as Heat, AC and a full bathroom.', 'The space', 'The space
Nature‚Äôs Nook is the culmination of the fine work of a number of craftsmen. The overall design was crafted by Susan Scranton. There are so many unique features that set it apart. Below are a few.

Hand scribed live edge poplar floors
Large deck for outdoor enjoyment whose shape mirrors the treehouse itself
Back deck perched high above the fern forest with two custom whiskey barrel Adirondack chairs
Main bed is a queen tucked into its own nook with views out the massive window
Custom cabinets in kitchen and bath built by the Treehouse Squad
A Living roof covered in moss (will be planted this fall in the cooler weather)
Built around a massive oak tree that runs through middle of the treehouse
Huge glass window overlooking the Fern Forest
Concrete site poured countertops
Shou Sugi Ban cypress siding- an ancient technique where the wood is charred using a torch. This makes the wood rot and insect resistant.
Glass tiled shower with rainfall shower head.
Whiskey barrel Adirondack chairs custom made by the Treehouse Squad
All rainfall is channeled to the back of the roof and directed at the base of the tree ensuring the tree has plenty of water.
Deck boasts a grill and a built in YETI cooler for extra cold storage.', '', '']

Title: Luxurious Secluded Romantic Treehouse with Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', '***2020 #1 Airbnb Most Wish-listed property in North Carolina***

Take a short walk on well lit path to an oasis in the woods. A swinging bridge welcomes you to a quiet, cozy home in the trees, surrounded by native Laurel and abundant hardwoods. Listen to the birds while having your morning coffee on the deck or relax in the hot tub below. The home is located on 14 acres. Old Fort is 10 minutes to Black Mountain and 20 minutes to Asheville.', 'The space', 'The space
The treehouse has luxury bedding, LED fireplace, full internet connection, cable tv, heat/air, microwave, cook top, and refrigerator. We have an outdoor shower with hot water and composting toilet, all located on the deck overlooking the forest. Our driveway is approximately 1/3 of a mile long through the woods. The gravel driveway does have some hills and curves. It DOES NOT require 4wd but if you have a very low profile car you may scrape in some sections. If you drive a Prius, you may have trouble getting up the hill. If you have a rear wheel drive car or truck, you may spin slightly in the gravel on the hills. If you are uncomfortable driving on a gravel road, drive a low profile vehicle, or if we have a heavy snow, we offer ‚Äúdrive in‚Äù and ‚Äúdrive out‚Äù service on our UTV. We‚Äôre always available to help!']

Title: Bed+Bough, an enchanting Treehouse Retreat
Description:
['About this space', "This is the stuff dreams are made of! Nestled in the North Georgia treetops an hour north of Atlanta, Bed+Bough is the Luxury Treehouse you've been waiting for! Enjoy your own private nature retreat with the luxurious accommodations you've come to expect. Built by our team of craftsman with artisanal details and a whimsical flair, the Treehouse sits on 5 acres just outside of Dahlonega's award winning wineries, waterfalls and historic Square. For travelers seeking rest, romance or adventure.", 'The space', 'The space
Bed+Bough has so many unique features, including a king size bed in the loft, a fold out couch with a queen size bed, a full bathroom, a living room, a kitchenette, with a microwave, a toaster oven, a sink, and a French Press for that morning coffee. Nestled among 5 acres of beautiful trees, you will feel as if you are in the middle of nowhere and yet you are just minutes from restaurants and shopping. The grounds of Bed+Bough offer a firepit with Adirondack chairs, a picnic table, a pizza oven, a protected sitting area and a grill as well as Wifi speed of 40 mgbs.

Debra Stipe, as your super host, with over 800 reviews and a 4.9 overall rating, invites you to come and experience this unique treehouse in North Georgia.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Access to the whole treehouse, grounds around the treehouse as well as the Firepit & picnic table area.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
This is a treehouse and as such, is high among the trees and this height must be respected for safety reasons. Therefore the Treehouse is not suitable for young children but kids 7 years and up are considered on a case by case basis. There is a kitchenette with a microwave, a toaster oven, a electric hot water kettle, French press and Keurig for coffee, a mini fridge and freezer, and a sink. Additionally it has running water, hot and cold, a full bathroom with shower, sink and toilet. Heat and air conditioning is also provided. The treehouse is set on 5 acres of forest with a covered outdoor seating area, a front porch, and a built in Yeti cooler for additional food and beverage storage. The outdoor area has a built in grill, a picnic table, a fire pit and a built in pizza oven. We recommend you pick up some firewood at a grocery store or convenience store on your way as ours gets wet outside. If using the pizza oven we recommend picking up pizza dough at the Publix located off of 400 in Dawsonville.

Follow us @staydahlonega']

Title: Raven Rock Treehouse
Description:
['About this space', 'Radical off grid therapy. If you want a walk on the wild side this is your spot. Perched on the apex of the Eastern Continental Divide, Raven Rock Treehouse is nestled in the trees near Raven Rock Cabin in a 40 acre wilderness wild life preserve. In spite of our remote setting everything is close by. Hiking, artisan shops, wineries, and unique dining abound. From complete seclusion you are just 10 miles from the Asheville airport and 5 miles away from the quaint town of Hendersonville.', 'The space', 'The space
Access is ALL WHEEL DRIVE ONLY! Gravel road is well maintained but too steep for 2 wheel drive.

The bathroom is a clean Porta Potty 50 ft from the venue (also 50 feet to the ground!). There is a pee bucket with a toilet seat for night time convenance that guests empty in the porta potty and rinse at the outdoor kitchen.

Spring water dispenser with 6 gallons is on the deck along with a propane cooktop. A 500 watt Goal Zero solar generator will charge your cell phones and laptops although service is sometimes spotty depending on your carrier.

We supply a crate of kindling and precut wood (10") for the Dwarf mini wood stove. Additional crates are available next to the port potty for $10. (cash or Venmo)

BRING YOUR OWN SHEETS AND BEDDING. (Queen). our mattress and box spring are hermetically sealed and disinfected for your protection.

This site is off grid, no electric. There is a gravity fed spigot with COLD water if you want to wash or rinse off.

Bears are extremely shy but hungry, please store all food.
If you are an early riser and quiet you may see bobcat, fox, deer, turkey, hawks, falcons, grouse, owls and of course ravens. It', '', '']

Title: The Majestic Treehouse romantic, luxury retreat
Description:
['About this space', 'At this time we are fully booked until March 2022, Check out our other listings!
COVID-19 safety measures: 150+ point cleaning & disinfecting checklist performed for every guest, health-screening for all guests. We recommend bringing food with you so you can stay put and enjoy nature and quality time in the safety of the woods and our farm.

LIVE LIKE KINGS & PLAY LIKE KIDS in this extraordinary, award-winning treehouse.

We are 25x Superhosts! Named the Most Popular Airbnb in SC!', 'The space', "The space
Why do people travel thousands of miles from around the world to stay in our treehouse? Come and see for yourself!! Transport your spirit, and feel a thrill that can only be discovered in the treetops! Experience the one-of-a-kind blend of youthful bliss and grown-up luxury for yourself. The faster you get here, the sooner you change your pace and unwind in our wooden paradise.

This luxury treehouse was designed by Seth Bolt (from the band NEEDTOBREATHE), who grew up on Bolt Farm. Larry Bolt (Seth's dad), proprietor, Eagle Scout and licensed custom home builder has been building & remodeling homes for over 40 years in upstate SC.

Larry and Seth both love creating masterpieces (they built our home from timber they harvested from our land) and this romantic, luxury treehouse is one of their finest works of art.

Seth & Tori Bolt were married at Bolt Farm and honeymooned in the treehouse suite. Tori manages branding, press, and runs the social media pages.

Regina Bolt (Seth's mom), the queen & caretaker, is one of the top producing real-estate agents in South Carolina because of how much she genuinely cares for others and helping their dreams become reality. She will make sure your stay is comfortable and unforgettable!

WE HAVE HEATING & AIR CONDITIONING! This is a year-round destination. We do have a bathroom with a toilet and washbasin in the treehouse and an amazing outdoor shower with a hot water supply for you to use just a short walk away!", '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
*Due to high demand (and to make booking fair to everyone), we release more treehouse dates at 12 noon EST on the 15th of every month. For more information go to our boltfarmtreehouse website. Dates are first come, first reserved, and sell out fast! Set your reminders for next month's Treehouse Release Day & follow us on social media to stay updated on last-minute openings!

NEW OFFERING: THE VIP TREEHOUSE EXPERIENCE! Our goal as Airbnb Superhosts is to ensure every guests' treehouse experience is truly unforgettable! Going VIP adds a wonderful variety of fun activities, sweet treats, keepsakes - enjoy our "luxury s'mores" around your own private campfire, and even get a coupon for $100 off your next stay! Be sure to ask us about how you can access our VIP Treehouse Experience.

Please let us know what you will be celebrating during your stay. Also, at this time, please make us aware of any special needs you may have.

In order to ensure all of our treehouse guests have an unforgettable and safe stay at Bolt Farm, we require our guests to sign a simple liability waiver prior to check-in. Professional photoshoots are welcomed with advanced notice and approval. For media inquiries, please contact us on our boltfarmtreehouse website. Thank you for celebrating our treehouse and the joy it brings!']

Title: √Ö Auge - River Eye - Treehouse
Description:
['About this space', 'Experience being in the trees, falling asleep under the stars and waking up to the sound of birdsong in this spectacular treehouse. If you are looking for an intimate, simple and restful retreat, look no further.', 'The space', "The space
Towering six meters above the Tessung√•e river that runs down from the great plateau of Norway, Hardangervidda, you will feel truly immersed in nature from your unique vantage point. Take in unparalleled views over the rushing river and into the forest beyond through full-length windows spanning the entire living area.

The cleverly designed space has a surprisingly generous capacity, so not only is it ideal for a couple on a romantic getaway, it can also accommodate families and large groups. On the lower level, you will find two sleeping alcoves, complete with premium double mattresses and leafy views. Upstairs in the mezzanine, there is a cosy sleeping loft with queen sized bed, panoramic windows and a huge skylight, so you can enjoy a magical moment drifting off to sleep with a view of the constellations above. You'll surely sleep soundly here at the treehouse!

Light candles in the evening and cook up a storm in the fully functioning kitchen, which features a powerful gas stove and all the necessary equipment.

Dine on the covered terrace with the river flowing below you, while being enveloped in thick greenery from the trees that support the treehouse. It‚Äôs an enchanting place to drink a coffee watch the sun set or the snow fall, while staying warm curled up in a soft woollen blanket. The terrace also includes a full sized bed, so those who want a real outdoors experience can sleep here in summer.

You will never feel cold in this well-insulated treetop cabin thanks to double glazed windows and an efficient wood fired stove taking pride of place in the center. You can enjoy long evenings in golden light, feeding the fire with firewood felled sustainably from the surrounding forest.

Heat up some crystal-clear river water and wash yourself with an Indian-style bucket bath in the custom designed wet room. Or, if you want more of an ‚Äòoutdoor spa‚Äô experience, take a bath in your private riverside tub and soak in the steamy water while taking in the spectacular view.

You also have access to your own heated, well maintained outdoor composting toilet, designed to adhere to our eco-friendly principles.

Instead of electricity, we provide candles, solar lamps and a solar phone charger. If you need to connect to the outside world, free WiFi is available in the nearby cabin (50 meters walk), along with plenty of power-points for charging.

In this secluded off-grid retreat, you will have a memorable experience made up of the simple pleasures that come from slowing down and disconnecting from technology, all while savoring the comforts of top quality modern architecture.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The entire treehouse and its surroundings are available for you during your stay.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
It is also possible to rent the whole location, called √Ö Camp, for gatherings or parties. Please get in touch here!']

Title: PRIVATE romantic TREEHOUSE ‚òÖ The Lions Lair
Description:
['About this space', "Take in the rustic, fairy tale vibe of this custom-made treehouse in the midst of towering trees! Star gaze on the top deck or swing on the bottom deck while listening to the nightly sounds of the forest. The fire pit is also an amazing area to fellowship, unwind and make s'mores. In the morning, walk to the trailhead and explore the stunning forest of the Red River Gorge.

If your travel dates are not available on this calendar, visit one of our sister properties by visiting our profile!", 'The space', 'The space
At night, listen to gentle owls and enjoy the twinkling stars as you disconnect from your normal busy! Warm up near a fire while enjoying the solitude that the forest has to offer.

In the morning, walk to the national trailhead location while the sun breaks through the trees as you hear the gentle stream of a nearby creek! When you return, swing underneath Lion's Lair with a designated covered outdoor patio surrounded by ambient lighting.

We are a RARE find in the area located on PRIVATE land, and one of the few rentals in the Red River Gorge that is located so conveniently INSIDE the National Park just walking distance to great nearby hiking trails!

If your dates are unavailable, be sure to check out our other listings as well such as "The Eagles Nest" and "KENTUCKY BREEZE" each providing their own unique accommodations.

This treehouse provides both heat, electricity and a full bathroom! We guarantee you this combination of outdoors & amenities provides a truly unique, adventurous, magical, and relaxing getaway experience with your friends or and loved ones! Perfectly designed for small families and romantic couples looking for a weekend getaway.

We look forward to having you stay with us, and be sure to book soon before it fills up fast!!', '', '', '', '']

Title: Treasure Hunt Tree House in Metro Atlanta
Description:
['About this space', 'Welcome to Treasure Hunt Tree House, located in Kennesaw GA (about 20 min drive from Atlanta)
This is a truly unique three floor tree house complete with many fun features as well as this cool activity: This backyard tree house has an adventurous twist in the form of a treasure hunt for any guest who stays in this fun little bungalow. Again, this is a backyard treehouse.




.', 'The space', 'The space
This unique two structure tree house connected by a rope bridge sits high among the bamboo leaves in our backyard. Down below you will hear the sounds of a trickling stream that runs underneath the treehouse, a bridge and the hammocks. This simple intimate setting provides quiet spaces to rest and relax, with an added bonus of an escape room style treasure hunt hidden amongst the tree houses.
The first structure consists of a 144 square foot bedroom with 3 sets of French doors and a vaulted ceiling supported by pine beams. There is a wrap-around porch on 3 sides surrounded by bamboo railing. The tin roof provides a calming sound when it rains. All six doors open fully to allow maximum airflow, but the treehouse bedroom is also equipped with a ceiling fan, and heating and air conditioning. The bed is a comfortable memory foam/ coil hybrid mattress with high quality sheets. Trees run through the deck and the interior of this room. Most of the d√©cor was handmade by the owner.
As you walk across the rope bridge you‚Äôll enter the 2nd structure which is screened in with a table and chairs to sit in. Along the center tree is a ladder that leads through a trap door to a crow‚Äôs nest observatory above with bamboo railing. This floor has a bucket that is raised via a rope and pulley system that is turned by a boat helm. (Just for fun). All three levels are lit up at night via stringed lights magical feeling ambiance.
A full bathroom consisting of a sink, toilet and marble shower is reserved on the ground level exclusively for tree house guests. Guests are provided with towels, handmade soaps, waters, and snacks. There is a small mini fridge, a microwave, and a coffee maker in the treehouse as well. Guests are encouraged to look at the online guidebook we have created which highlights the many great restaurants and activities available in the Kennesaw area.
For those adventurous types looking for more fun than just a simple quiet retreat, these bungalows hold a secret: many complex clues, puzzles and riddles are hidden throughout the structures and promise to surprise and delight the inner child of all who plays the game. No assistance is given to find the treasure, so work together. Those who win the game will have the eternal honor of signing their name amongst the past legends who have overcome this challenge. (And you will get a prize too :)
We try our very best to exceed your expectations in our little backyard bungalow and aim to make it a truly memorable and relaxing time to escape and unwind in a fun and unique setting. This treehouse, as most treehouses are, is in the backyard. The bathroom is about 30 steps from the treehouse on the ground level and is attached to my house (but is exclusively for treehouse guests). The electronic key code for the tree house is the same code as for the bathroom.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
all three treehouse levels and the bathroom on the ground level']

Title: Luxury Stone and Timber Treehouse on 40-Acre Farm
Description:
['About this space', 'Stay in the gorgeous Treehouse for a luxury "glamping" experience! Perfect for anyone looking for a peaceful getaway. Surrounded by towering pines on a 40-acre farm estate in Concord, you feel like you are in the mountains of Asheville. Enjoy the hot tub, fire pit, walk our trails or visit the animals- all within minutes of historic Concord and Kannapolis. Book a 60 or 90 minute individual massage or coffee tasting during your stay at the farm (please contact them directly for availability)!', 'The space', "The space
The Treehouse is a large, one-room space featuring a Queen bed with hand-crafted furnishings and a small table with chairs. There is also a private deck for enjoying your morning coffee looking out over the trees. Outside of your space is a propane grill as well as an outdoor table with chairs for dining under the stars.

The space includes A/C and heat, all linens - including bath and swim towels, robes and extra blankets - a mini fridge, and a coffee bar with a Keurig coffee machine, ground coffee, assorted teas and hot cocoa as well as assorted sweeteners and half&half. We also provide you with a selection of eco-friendly compostable plates, bowls, napkins, silverware and cups.

A short walk from your space is the Main Barn, where you will find the shared Farm Kitchen. It includes a full-size Fridge, microwave and sink as well as all necessary cooking supplies (tools, oil, seasonings, and more) and grill-friendly pots and pans. You can also find an iron and ironing board, picnic blankets and nest hammocks in this space.

Also located in the Main Barn is Cairn Coffee Roasters, Harmony & Balance Massage Studio and our Farm Store! You can contact them directly after booking to check availability for a 60 or 90 minute individual massage or a tour of the roasting facilities.

The Eco Bathrooms are located within a short walking distance from your space. They contain separate men's and women's eco-toilets with a shared exterior sink. The main Eco Bathroom also includes an amazing attached outdoor rainforest shower with organic shampoo, conditioner and bodywash. No worries- our tankless hot water heaters provide unlimited hot water for you during your stay!

Whether you're visiting the Eco Shower or relaxing in the hot tub, we provide you with robes, rainboots and cozy socks to keep you comfortable and warm going to and from your spaces.

You will also have shared access to our beautiful above-ground pool and deck (open seasonally) and a 7-person hot tub and a fire pit (open year round).", '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We do not allow pets in this rental space. However, pets are allowed at the Barn Loft and Greenhouse with advanced approval.

The set up of our spaces are for adult occupany only and therefore we do not allow children to stay with you at the farm regardless of age.

You may not invite anyone to visit you at the farm during your stay, the property is only available for the use of our registered guests.

If the Treehouse is not available for your trip or you would like to see our other spaces, please check out our Airbnb Profile.

Professional photoshoots are not allowed with Airbnb bookings.']

Title: Epic Luxury Treehouse - next to Dog Mountain !
Description:
['About this space', 'The Outpost Treehouse is a beautifully handcrafted retreat, nestled amongst the evergreens atop Spaulding Mtn and adjacent to the nationally renowned Alerin Barn event venue. Located .5 mile from Stephen Huneck Gallery/Dog Mountain, 3 miles from the historic Town of St. Johnsbury, in the heart of Vermont‚Äôs North East Kingdom. Mountain Bikers are just over 10 miles to The Hub at Kingdom trails, 15 miles to Burke Mtn ski and bike park, and we are 2 exits north I 93 from Littleton & White Mtn‚Äôs NH!', 'The space', 'The space
The Outpost Luxury Treehouse has been a lifelong dream and labor of love, handcrafted with reclaimed Timber and vintage salvaged finds by Husband and wife design team Alexa and Aaron Airoldi. Designer finishes, soft linens, Pendleton blankets, and a eclectic mix of antique rustic alpine lodge decor, in a magnificent setting among the treetops, looking out over Alerin Farm Cattle pastures, Private ski trails and Green Mountain View‚Äôs. Cathedral great room with GAS FIREPLACE ( we turn it on from October -May) main heat: Renai gas heater, full kitchen :full size gas stove, under mount Mini wine/ fridge, small Ice Maker, ( no freezer/but we provide outdoor beverage station for iced beverages) Antique Farmhouse sink, Bathroom, 1 king on main floor, 2 queens in the sleeping loft tucked under the Eve , 2 story deck with exterior dining table, exterior bar with barstools and covered porch, with private parking and use of fire pits. There is a exterior cooler for beer on the porch. The Treehouse is a natural retreat space , located in the woods ..... you may see bugs outside , you will feel Pine needles drop on the out side decks ....... this is as much about the setting in nature as it is the vintage Aesthetic. There is NO AIR-CONDITIONING, but there are double French doors that open with screens and create a draft. We have 4 plug in fans for cooling if needed and screens on all French doors. The Treehouse is well insulated and under tree cover and remains cool in summer. This is a TV and WIFI free zone, but cell reception works great and you can use your cell as a hotspot easily to activate laptop or tablet etc....... an orange wireless Bluetooth speaker is included in the rental, for music. There is a Weber Charcoal grill at the fire pit, for guest use. This place is perfectly equipped to handle a couples getaway for two, a family with children.... or a few friends!

Please review our description carefully and decide if this is the right space for you and your guests before booking ....Remember ‚Äú NO TV, NO WIFI, NO AIR CONDITIONING, ‚Äù.........This is a small unique space, made with salvaged treasures and eclectic finds, it is a cozy escape literally in the trees, that means steps to climb and in the hot summer - Fans and old fashioned open screen doors to cool down..... In the winter, that means winter boots and 4x4 drive to get up the mountain......that being said you may see bugs, hear animals at night, and maybe even rediscover yourself by the fire !', '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
NOTE: Please review our description carefully and decide if this is the right space for you and your guests before booking ....Remember ‚Äú NO TV, NO WIFI, NO AIR CONDITIONING, ‚Äù.........This is a small unique space, made with salvaged treasures and eclectic finds, it is a cozy escape literally in the trees, that means steps to climb and in the hot summer - Fans and old fashioned open screen doors to cool down..... In the winter, that means winter boots and 4x4 drive to get up the mountain......that being said you may see bugs, hear animals at night, and maybe even rediscover yourself by the fire !

Winter rentals : Driving to the treehouse in the winter: we are located 1.8 miles at the top of Spaulding Rd on Spaulding Mtn, the road is steep, and the drive down into the treehouse is a hill as well, for driving in snowy conditions a 4x4 or AWD vehicle with snow tires would be preferred to get up the road, in lieu of bad weather road conditions. The road and driveway are fully plowed, salted and maintained, But sometimes Vermont winter conditions, can make it difficult, so plan accordingly.

REVIEWS If you loved your stay, please leave us a review online at Airbnb, and in our guest book at the treehouse, and pass the word about this enchanting place ! Lets stay connected....

PETS We will consider upon request, a well adjusted, mature and well behaved dog. A dog is allowed for a fee of $50.00 per dog and that is to be paid upon booking in special requests and fees . A dog must be crated while unattended in the treehouse. Please provide your own dog clean up supplies. Please scoop poops, and if you see our friendly cat Targhee please leash your dog. If you are attending a Alerin Barn or wedding next door absolutely No Dogs are permitted on Alerin Barn grounds. Dogs must remain at the Outpost. If you walk your dog you can hike down the lower cattle fence below the treehouse down the hill ( if you walk the upper fence DO NOT GO FARTHER THAN THE CATTLE BARN) DOGS are NOT Permitted in the Alerin Barn Compound !!!!!!']

Title: Trailside Treehouse - Riverside in Richmond, VA
Description:
['About this space', 'Fulfill your childhood dream of camping in a treehouse! From this central spot by the river, easily explore the trails and river. Then, relax on the deck and enjoy the magic of the trees.

‚Ä¢Airbnb ‚ÄúTop 20 Places to Stay in VA‚Äù
‚Ä¢"Best of Richmond" by Style Magazine
‚Ä¢Featured in Airbnb article on hospitality
‚Ä¢One of "8 Great Airbnbs" in the U.S. by Inside Hook

‚Ä¢Complementary bikes
‚Ä¢Comes with bathroom, kitchenette & lounge apartment in host house
‚Ä¢Dog-friendly

Social media: @trailside_treehouse', 'The space', "The space
When you stay in the treehouse, you‚Äôre not just embarking on an incredible adventure for your family‚Äîyou‚Äôre also helping the Richmond-area community by supporting non-profits that are aligned with our mission of supporting children and the outdoors. We donate a large portion of your payment to local non-profits and thank you for being a positive part of our community.

~~

Here's your chance to fulfill that childhood dream of running away and camping out in a treehouse. This is not a tiny house wrapped around a tree or a glamorous treehouse complete with running water and a kitchen. Instead, this is an authentic treehouse that we built for our nephew in 2014, complete with reclaimed redwood walls and windows from our old house. It's an authentic kid-like treehouse experience; a space devoted to the stuff of childhood dreams.

LOCATION: The Trailside Treehouse is centrally located in Richmond, Virginia, just minutes from I-95 and I-64. It is directly across the river from one of Richmond's popular parks called Maymont. The James River Park System and Buttermilk Trail also come through the property, thanks to an easement we have given the city. The treehouse property itself includes five wooded acres with nationally-celebrated single-track trail and is adjacent to the river--just hike down the trail and cross a single train track and you'll find some of Richmond's best fishing and swimming!

THE SPACE: As we designed the treehouse space, we asked ourselves one question: what would we have wanted in a treehouse as kids? The Trailside Treehouse is our answer to that question--it's a magnum opus to childhood.

Please note: There is a zipline on the property. Per our insurance company, guests are not allowed to use it. Please prepare your children ahead of time so they're not bummed when they arrive!

WHAT TO EXPECT: The treehouse isn‚Äôt an inexpensive place to stay. It‚Äôs not simply a comfortable room to call home as you pass through town, as are many Airbnb‚Äôs. Instead, it‚Äôs an unparalleled experience that we hope transforms our guests by bringing them back to their childlike centers. It‚Äôs a place to practice juggling or learn new yo-yo tricks. It‚Äôs a place to flip through a book about bowling rules and get curious about things you haven‚Äôt wondered about since you were a kid. There are notes to discover in the nooks and crannies. There are games you may not have played with since you were a child. There's a bin of junk food and a fridge with sodas. We've stocked the treehouse with activities that we hope reminds you of the curiosity you had as a child. We want you to feel that your time here is invaluable‚Äîthat it is a priceless trip that sets you up for a transformative week or month or year. Reinvigorates. Rejuvenates. Renews your very sense of self.

VALUABLE MEMORIES TO LAST A LIFETIME
We know the treehouse experience is an investment that many families save for. Our goal is to provide you with value beyond your expectations so that you truly feel that your time exploring here with your friends and family was worth every cent. Our guests who get the most value from the experience are those guests who are willing to leave their phones in their bags and truly live in the simplicity and wonder of the moment. We want you to imagine that you are your 10-year old self and have packed a backpack with all of your favorite things and run away to your neighbor's treehouse in the woods. Even those guests bringing kids should feel ready to loosen the reigns of responsibility for awhile to just enjoy the space and get optimum value from their time here.
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

DESIGN AND TOUR HISTORY
This two-story treehouse was designed by renowned Richmond architect, Henry Tenser, and modeled after a western firetower. It was featured (alongside the modern home where the hosts live) on the 2017 Virginia Home and Garden Tour as well as three Westover Hills Neighborhood Association tours and the Modern Richmond Tour.
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

TRAILSIDE LOCATION IN THE CITY
The treehouse sits in our back yard at the top of a wooded gully that leads to the James River Park System and is mere yards from the popular Buttermilk Trail--one of the most celebrated urban single-track trail systems in the entire country. For trail-lovers and adventure-lovers, you simply can't find a better spot to stay the night in Richmond, Virginia.

**please note that we are located within the city, so you can expect to hear city sounds, which may include trains, sirens, traffic and other things.
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

BRIDGE TO CHILDHOOD
To access the treehouse, you'll cross a wooden bridge and enter onto the main deck. If you're ready to play, jump into the twisty tube slide and play on the playground equipment beneath the main floor. If you're ready to relax, take a seat on the deck and enjoy your wooded surroundings.
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

PORCH LEVEL
Enter the main floor screened porch through the screened doors. The main floor is screened in on all four sides and features two hammock swings--the perfect place to read a book or recount your day on the trail as you rock amongst the trees--mosquito-free (a rare summer treat for Richmond).

When more than 4 people wish to stay in the treehouse, this first floor can be transformed into an additional sleeping area with a fold-up memory foam mattress or single cots. Just let us know if you need those!
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

SLEEPING LEVEL
The sleeping area on the second story is located up a knee-hole ladder and through a trap door. The second story is surrounded by windows on all four sides, including two fish-eye windows so you can poke your head into the concave plexiglass and get a look at the ground three stories below. The second story also features a balcony, which is accessible through a screen door. You'll sleep soundly under the corrugated corten steel roof. The sleeping quarters features a queen bed with a memory foam mattress and a bunkbed cot.

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
LOUNGE, BATHROOM AND KITCHENETTE
Inside the host house, you'll have full, private use of our basement, which includes a temperature-controlled lounge area with a TV, sleeper sofa, bean bag chair, kitchenette with sink, microwave, and Keurig, and full bathroom. The entrance to the lower level is private and accessible from the exterior of the home.

The bike room is also in this basement space. You are welcome to take out a bike as long as you sign a waiver and wear a helmet! There are 4 bikes to use for free.
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

GUEST COUNT AND SLEEPING COMFORTABLY
Please let us know in advance how many guests are in your party so we can set up beds, set out the appropriate number of towels, pillows, blankets and make sure there are enough snacks and drinks.

Our standard guest limit is 6. If you want to bring a larger party, we have some options. Let us know and we will help you figure out whether the options suit your travel style, including the sleeper sofa inside and putting two children per level of the cot, and sleeping in any of the hammocks. ~

Standard sleeping arrangements are as follows (let us know if you'd like something different):
-1-2 guests: queen bed on 2nd floor
-3-4 guests: queen bed + bunkbed cot on 2nd floor
-5-6 guests: queen bed + bunkbed cot on 2nd floor + fold-up memory foam mattress on 1st floor NOTE: when there are families with more than two kids, we recommend fitting two kids per level of the bunkbed cot so everyone can sleep on the same level
~~
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

DOGS ARE WELCOME!
If you‚Äôre bringing your dog(s), please let us know. Our dog is very friendly.

Single night options are available upon request and availability. Contact us for more info.

We can‚Äôt wait to host your adventure!!!", 'Guest access', "Guest access
You'll have full, exclusive access to the treehouse, firepit, and basement of the host house, which includes a full bathroom, lounge area with a sofa bed, massive bean bag and television.

This is also where the bike room is, complete with adult-sized bikes for you to use.

The entrance to the basement is private so you can come and go as you please without feeling self-conscious!

Our insurance company does not allow guests to use the zipline.

Drink water from the kitchen and sink faucets, but not the garden spigots. Garden spigot water comes from rainwater collected from the roof.", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
summer guests‚Äî yes, it can be hot. Again, think of the treehouse of your childhood dreams. It doesn‚Äôt have ac! Overnight temps are typically in the 70s and we have fans. If you need temperature controlled environments, plan to spend time and sleep in the basement lounge of the host house. If summer glamping isn‚Äôt appealing, book your stay in the spring or fall when temps are milder. :)

Winter guests: see above only opposite.

Single night options are sometimes available. Contact us if you'd like to book just one night.

Please‚Äîno candles or open flames in the treehouse, including grills or propane cooktops.

RIVER ACCESS‚ÄîThe treehouse property includes five wooded acres with trails for you to explore. A train track borders our property to the north and just on the other side of the track is a popular river swimming and fishing spot. You can hike to the river easily and spend a day enjoying swimming, floating, fishing, water sports and exploring. Rock hopping is very popular in Richmond.

FOOD ODORS‚ÄîPlease no fish or fragrant food/items in the treehouse or lounge. This includes cologne, perfume, fish, fish, incense, fish, and any other odors that may take a few days to air out, especially, but not limited to, fish.

ZIPLINE‚ÄîThere is a zipline on the property. Per our insurance company, guests are not allowed to use it. Please prepare your children ahead of time so they're not bummed when they arrive!

TRAIL ACCESS‚ÄîThe trail off of the treehouse property is a single track trail that leads to 40 miles of a nationally recognized trail system. It‚Äôs very technical for riders and should only be attempted by advanced riders. It‚Äôs great for hikers and runners at all levels. If you are borrowing treehouse bikes and want to ride the trail, avoid the single track Buttermilk trail...you‚Äôll want to ride the bikes a mile downriver on the road to Reedy Creek to pick up the fire road, which is flat and awesome for riders at all levels. From the fire road, ride down river two miles to Belle Isle then circle the island or ride all over the city, including the canal walk and Capital Trail. Togwatee‚Äîfrom here you can go anywhere!!

BONFIRE‚ÄîWe have firewood, lighters and fire starters. Plan to have a bonfire. You may want to bring your own starter log if you‚Äôre unfamiliar with starting a fire. The kind you‚Äôd use in a fireplace works!

EGRESS AND LADDER‚ÄîThe sleeping quarters are up a ladder and through a 24"x24" opening. Please be comfortable climbing the ladder and moving through the opening. If you're pregnant, you may want to measure your belly.

WEATHER‚ÄîWe do not refund cancellations for weather reasons. Please be aware when booking that you could get inclement weather, including storms, snow, wind, etc. For that reason, you need to be comfortable assuming some weather-related risk before you book.

RESCHEDULING‚ÄîWe do allow guests to reschedule in some cases as long as they request the rescheduling 10 days prior to the day of stay or more.

URBAN NOISES‚ÄîThe treehouse is located on five wooded acres in the center of Richmond City. Our property is only one of about a dozen riverside properties in the entire city, so you will have easy access to the river while enjoying life in the trees. Along with lots of wildlife, you will hear city sounds, which we refer to in our family as ‚Äúurban waves‚Äù like the sounds of beach waves. These noises may include sirens, trains, and traffic, along with all the sounds of nature and your loved one‚Äôs laughter and cheer.

HOST FAMILY INTERACTION AND SPACE USE‚ÄîOur family lives in the property and our home is very close to the treehouse. Our family plays in the front yard when guests are in residence and we leave the back yard for guests to enjoy on their own. Guests should be comfortable and open to seeing our kids in the driveway and front yard. :)

ELECTRICITY LIMITATIONS‚ÄîThe treehouse is on a 20 AMP power circuit. If too many devices are plugged in and running, the breaker may trip, causing power loss. Please let us know right away if you lose power.

HEATERS‚ÄîWe provide heaters that are approved by our insurance company. Please do not bring your own.

HOT PLATES‚ÄîDue to safety concerns, please do not use hot plates or other heating or cooking devices within the treehouse.

GUEST COUNT‚ÄîPlease let us know in advance how many guests are in your party so we can set up the beds, set out the appropriate number of towels, and make sure there are enough snacks and drinks. We want everyone in your group to have an awesome experience. If we don‚Äôt know a guest is coming, we won‚Äôt have set up a comfortable space for him/her and he/she will not have towels, blankets, pillows, snacks, drinks, and all the fun stuff that makes glamping in the treehouse such a memorable experience. Thank you!


WATER‚ÄîDrink water from the kitchen and sink faucets, but not the garden spigots. Garden spigot water comes from rainwater collected from the roof.']

Title: BREEZE, in a tree The Appleton Retreat
Description:
['About this space', 'BREEZE Treehouse, is located at The Appleton Retreat on 120 acres of private land, bordered by 1,300 acres of a protected nature conservancy. To the south is the Pettengill Stream a resource protected area and to the north a large secluded pond. BREEZE guests may reserve the wood fired cedar hot tub and the sauna, at an additional charge, which are close by and private. The Appleton Retreat is less than a 30 minute drive to Belfast, Rockport, Camden and Rockland, charming downeast seaside towns.', 'The space', "The space
Total privacy, alone in a tree, the ultimate getaway.
The 1st floor of BREEZE is over 20' high and the sleeping loft is approximately 40' off the ground. To gain access to BREEZE requires climbing three flights of stairs. Two are very easy and code compliant, the 3rd is a ships ladder - most dogs will need a lot of coaching or need to be carried up. The sleeping loft is also accessed by a steep set of stairs.
BREEZE is NOT a great place for young children.
You will experience the uniqueness of being in a tree! Windowed walls overlook the treetops and a glimpse of the ridge to the south. There is a large deck for hanging out....
(CAUTION: In winds over 25 mph you may experience some movement and noise - not to worry!)
Although BREEZE appears to be a rustic structure, it has many amenities including: Air Conditioning, a full galley kitchen; a shower and traditional toilet, as well as good old electricity........ so you will not be roughing it.
Although there is not wi-fi at BREEZE you may tap into the wi-fi at Braeburn by getting in that proximity.
There is private parking at the treehouse.", '', '']
