Title: Water Forest Retreat- Tree House
Description:
['About this space', 'Water Forest Retreat Tree House is a 168 sq ft. private heated and electrified tiny home with stained glass windows surrounding an oak tree nestled in 100 acres of forest. Enjoy your favorite drink out on the deck up in the trees while watching the birds. There are 2 1/2 miles of hiking trails with a brook, waterfall, marsh and pond. Come here to hike, fish or just relax in this beautiful forest. We also have an OCTAGON and HIKER‚ÄôS HAVEN house. Please click on our profile picture to read more.', 'The space', "The space
Regarding the Corona virus, we follow all CDC cleaning protocols. We also supply sanitizer wipes, Lysol and hand sanitizer.

Water Forest RetreatTree House is a great place to rejuvenate and enjoy all that Nature has to offer. Here you can hike, meditate, relax, read, write, mushroom hunt, fish, create art, music, photography, bird watch, cross country ski, snowshoe, and star gaze as there is little light pollution, along with many other activities in a private woodland setting.

The space, which is 168 ft.¬≤ or 15.6 m¬≤ has electricity, but not running water. Hand sanitizer is provided along with a wash basin or you can use the sink at the main house to wash your hands. Soap, wash cloths, and towels are stored in a container under the bed. On top of the cabinet there is complimentary hand made glycerin soap. Bottled water is provided or you can fill up a container at the shower as the well water is very good. The composting toilet is conveniently located in the tree house and is vented so there is no odor. Toilet paper is provided. There are directions on the bathroom wall on how to use it. PLEASE READ CAREFULLY so that it will function properly. NEVER urinate with the chute open.

The tree house has a locking door and six large windows with screens and shades for privacy. The key is located on top of the cabinet. There are two stained glass transoms above the front windows and two more in the apexes. The space has a queen size bed with a comfy hybrid coil memory foam mattress. There are 400 thread count sheets with plenty of pillows and quilts along with a faux fur throw. Two bed side tables with Tiffany style lamps complement each side along with two tall white birch logs decorated with branches, crystals and fairy lights. Behind the bed side tables are USB ports with cords so you can charge your iPhone. Above the bed hangs a stained glass panel and a ceiling fan for your comfort on warm nights. There is also an electric fireplace for cold nights or you can just enjoy watching the flames without heat. On very cold nights we also supply a propane heater, though the electric fireplace is usually sufficient.

Although there is no traditional kitchen, there is space inside on top of the cabinet, table and outdoor tables to prepare your meals. There is no fridge or microwave. We do have a large lobster pot and a tripod pizza grill available upon request.

There is a cabinet which stores some camping essentials such as a propane camp stove, dinnerware, cutlery, cutting board, sugar and sugar substitutes, spices, oil, tin foil, creamers, pots, pans, lighters, scissors, wine bottle and can opener, extra light bulbs, mugs, dish drying cloth, umbrellas, first aid kit, paper towels, Lysol cleaner, flashlights, propane, insect repellent and a battery powered lantern. A Kuerig coffee machine is provided with assorted coffees, chai latte, tea, hot chocolate, and hot apple cider. There is also a turquoise inlaid wooden table with two chairs where you can dine, write, or use your computer and a small wall rack for hanging clothes. On top of the rack are two wine glasses, binoculars and a mirror. Under the bed there are an assortment of games. Two pottery mugs are provided which Nancy made. The mugs are for sale at 34.00 each. Atop the cabinet is a bowl of snacks and a book binder with more information, maps, menus, and directions on how to use the coffee machine, propane stove, propane heater and electric fire place.

There are 2 1/2 miles of well maintained wood lined hiking trails with some that follow Goldmine brook to a waterfall that once hosted a grist mill back in the 1700's. You can still see the large stone foundations. Along the trails you will see many of the iconic stone walls that are unique to New England. Maps are provided in the book binder and trail markers are posted along the way. There are many benches and chairs along the trail where you can sit, relax and enjoy the scenery. While hiking the trails walking poles or sticks are suggested as the terrain is hilly with some stone steps and steep areas. Two walking sticks hang on the wall in the tree house. Because of the terrain hiking boots are strongly recommended. Due to the nature of the trails no ATV, dirt or mountain biking is allowed. These are hiking trails only. We ask that you please respect the private sign as this trail leads to the Octagon where guests may be staying. There is a good distance between the buildings so you will not be able to see each other even in winter. We wanted to make each site secluded and private. While hiking, please stay on our side of the brook as the opposite side is owned by our neighbor.

It is a five minute walk to the spring fed pond which is part of Goldmine brook. The brook is rated class A and supports a myriad of wildlife including river otters, mink and great blue herons. If you like to fish bring your gear to try for pickerel, large and small mouth bass, white and yellow perch, shiners and native trout. Previous guests have had great luck fly fishing here.

If you are looking for a place to swim, canoe or kayak visit Gardner Lake state park in Salem which is only 15 minutes away. ( you will have to supply your own canoe or kayaks) Depending on water flow, you can also take a dip right here in the small pool below the Goldmine brook waterfall which is a 20-25 minute walk down the trail or you can go for a swim in gold mine brook pond which is only a five minute walk away. We supply water floats that you can borrow. Looking for some ocean fun? Bluff Point state park in Groton is another good choice. Here they have a beach along with hiking and biking trails. Bluff Point is about 24 minutes away. Both places are free of charge. Please check out our guide book on Airbnb by clicking our profile picture for more things to do in the area.

The outdoor living area is conveniently layered with crushed stone. Enjoy a fire in the fire pit and meals either outdoors or in. On the deck there are two chairs and a mosaic glass table for outdoor dining along with a propane grill and a Mayan style hammock that seats two people. At ground level there is a fire pit with additional tables and chairs, zero gravity lounge chairs along with tiki torches for extra light and ambiance. Seasoned wood is available for 6 dollars per five gallon bucket and includes fire starter. Please, no wood deliveries after dusk. You can bring your own wood or use any of the wood on the forest floor as long as it is not being used to mark the trails.

There is a Walmart and Big Y one mile away where you can buy food, drinks, ice and other supplies. Looking for a liquor store? Bozrah Wine and Spirits is one mile one the right heading west on route 82. Since there is no refrigerator you will need to bring your own cooler or you can borrow ours. If you do not wish to cook there are many good restaurants close by. We provide a few menus in the book binder for you to look through. Some restaurants even make deliveries or you can use a delivery app. such as door dash.com

Enjoy a hot private outdoor shower down at the main house. The distance to the shower is about a one minute walk. The shower is private while you are using it , but is shared with other guests. Plush towels, washcloths and soap are stored under the bed in a container. Shampoo and conditioner are at the shower. There is a sink here where you can wash your dishes. Under the bed there is a black plastic container to use for dirty dishes. Dish soap and scrubber are provided at the sink. There is a dish drying cloth in the cabinet back at the tree house. Due to freezing temperatures, the shower and sink are not available in winter. A wash basin is provided for sponge bathing. The basin is stored under the bed. Simply use the coffee machine or camp stove to make hot water. Guests staying two nights or more during this season are more than welcome to use the inside shower up at the main house. In winter we will take care of washing the dishes.

Because of the distance, Wifi is not available in the tree house, but is available in the parking area and pottery studio which is a walking distance of about 300 feet. If your device is supported by an Internet provider you will be able to get online.


For the nature enthusiast, take part in a guided nature walk where Nancy will discuss the history, plants, animals, geology and mushrooms found in the area. The walk costs 15 dollars per person and lasts about an hour and a half to two hours. We usually cover 2 miles and may go off trail. After the hike we will go to the house and sample some Autumn berry syrup, Shagbark hickory syrup, sassafras syrup, spice bush pepper and acorn or mushroom cookies when available. We also have shagbark hickory syrup for sale. You might want to bring something to drink, a snack, and your camera.

BEFORE YOU BOOK, please keep in mind that this is a fancy form of camping (glamping!) that is semi off grid ( no running water in the Treehouse) with all that camping entails including insects, animals, sudden weather changes, rocky paths and hilly terrain. It is a one minute walk from the parking lot to the tree house and shower. You may get to hear our resident barred owls, red fox, eastern coyotes or possibly come across a white tailed deer or mink while hiking the trails.

The distance from the parking area to the tree house is about 300 feet with 170 feet of that being in the forest. Since the tree house is small please pack appropriately. We will be more be more than happy to help you with your luggage.

Be mindful of check in and check out times. If you tell us you plan to arrive at three and do not show up until 9 o‚Äôclock, realize that we have been waiting many hours for you when we could‚Äôve been doing something else. We have also been running electricity and heat which is wasteful. If you are going to be late, please have the courtesy to let us know. Unfortunately our tiny homes are not conducive for lockbox entry and we need to show you around. We also need time to clean after check out for the next guest and are on a tight schedule.

Please read House rules.

Smoking is not allowed inside the tree house, but is allowed outside of it.

For people staying two nights or more I will leave you a check in text to see how you‚Äôre doing.

We also have a pottery shop-studio that you are more than welcome to visit. There are many items for sale including hand woven scarves, earrings and Shagbark Hickory syrup that I make.

Check out is easy! Please leave the key on top of the cabinet and you‚Äôre all set to go! If you would like to stay longer and hike the trails after check out you are more than welcome!

Bert and I will do everything we can to make your stay relaxing and enjoyable. Please feel free to contact us at anytime during your stay if you need anything. We look forward to hosting you!", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Hiking trails, yard, shower and parking area. Please respect the private signs as these trails lead to the octagon or Hiker‚Äôs Haven where guests may be staying. You will not be able to see the octagon or Hiker‚Äôs Haven from the tree house nor they you. We wanted to make all places private and secluded. While hiking please stay on our side of the brook as the opposite side belongs to our neighbor. Thanks for your cooperation!', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please bring your own personal toiletries, food, drinks and ice for your cooler. If you do not have a cooler, you can borrow ours. We also have extra ice packs if you need them. Also bring suitable footwear for hiking, outdoor shower or if you want to walk in the brook as the stones can be slippery. We do not do wood deliveries after dusk, but if you would like more wood we will get some ready for you and leave it by the basement door outside.']

Title: Treehouse for dreaming
Description:
['About this space', 'Our "Cuckoo's nest" tree house is close to many destinations. It is hidden above a small village at the edge of the forest and is good for couples and families with children.', 'The space', 'The space
The tree house stands on the edge of an oak forest overlooking the small village of Bottenbach. Through your own access from the road, you are also independent of the associated farm. At night you can switch on a lighting of the path from the parking lot, otherwise there is no lighting in the village between approx. 24:00 and 4:00. City-dwellers are always very enthusiastic about the sight of the clear starry sky.
In summer, the terrace offers shelter from excessive heat from the canopy and can sit outside for a long time in the evening and enjoy the view. In winter, the sun comes through the bare branches and inside, the marble plate heater creates a cozy atmosphere.

For child restraint, there is a fold-down grid on the ladder in the upper sleeping area (see picture) and doors with latches on the two entrances on the outside on the terrace.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Our guests are welcome to come to the farm to watch the daily work, pet the animals and also to stoke and grill a campfire. Unfortunately, this is not possible near the tree house because of the fire hazard.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
In the neighbouring village of Rennhofen there is a beautiful beer garden "Baumhaus". :) Just google :)
We have 2-3 bikes to rent at the farm.']

Title: Treehouse with Jacuzzi bathtub + infrared cabin
Description:
['About this space', 'Enjoy your holiday amidst vineyards in a unique apartment at 4 meters altitude. From the new living area you can access a terrace where you can spend cozy hours, as well as watch magnificent suns rise and set.', 'The space', 'The space
21 steps at a height of 4 meters with a magnificent view of the Krems Valley
Our apartment has a small kitchen, dining area, toilet and bathroom with shower and whirlpool , as well as a bedroom in the upper area. Ideal for 2 people, but possible for four. In the living area there is then an additional sleeping possibility for two people.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The tree house is only available to you.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Starting point is our tree house in a perfect location for many wonderful hikes, cycling trips, mountain biking and visiting historical sights in our beautiful Wachau and in the forest district.']

Title: An Adirondack Tree House Retreat
Description:
['About this space', 'The treehouse is one of the most sought after places for couples to reconnect with nature.


Nestled in the foothills of the Adirondack Mtns. and just 9 miles from Saratoga Springs NY, boasting quiet solitude.

The winding staircase leads to a sleeping area and covered porch.
Also, outdoor kitchen, deck, fire pit and full bath just a few steps away are included.

Please keep in mind that our treehouse is meant as a quiet retreat for 1-3 people.', 'The space', 'The space
This private wooded setting offers many unique features such as: private parking, outdoor kitchen and dining with charcoal grill,refrigerator, microwave, fire pit, hot and cold running water as well as outdoor lighting.

The narrow circular stair case leads to a comfortable sleeping area including a double bed, plus a loft. Just outside the sleeping quarters is a covered porch for reading, writing or reflecting.

Electric heater and fan are included.

Provided are sheets, blankets, pillows and pillow cases.

A full bathroom is just a few steps away. Provided are towels, soap, shampoo and paper goods.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Modern treehouse on working maple syrup farm.
Description:
['About this space', 'Welcome to Quinn‚Äôs treehouse. We are located on a 500 acre working maple syrup farm at the base of Robbins Mountain. There is endless outdoor opportunities. Hiking, biking, boating, swimming and skiing are right outside the door. The treehouse abuts Camels Hump State Forest, however is close to local shops, dining and the interstate for easy travel.', 'The space', 'The space
This is a unique treehouse experience with modern accommodations yet nestled in the woods. The space works best for couples or a family with 2 children. We are located on a very steep private driveway and in the winter you will need a 4 wheel drive vehicle.
The treehouse is on an owner occupied property, but our house is completely out of sight. The treehouse has heat, air conditioning, wifi, and an incinerating toilet, which requires some unique procedures to operate, but very easy to use. We have a smart TV available for your use. There is no cable, but have basic streaming options to use with your personal account.
We have a small kitchenette with a mini fridge, hotplate, toaster oven and Keurig coffee maker. A sink and barbecue occupy the outdoor kitchen, and there is an outdoor hot water shower. There is no indoor plumbing including shower or sink. The toilet runs on electricity and cleanly incinerates waste.
We supply plenty of drinking water. The outdoor sink and shower water is not suitable for drinking. In winter months, we have a portable on demand hot water heater that runs on propane. As there is a specific procedure to follow we are going to have to set up times for water delivery and showers. We will supply water from our house and set everything up for you.', '', 'Guest access
The treehouse is surrounded by miles of hiking trails, multiple rivers and an abundance of mountain biking and skiing opportunities. Numerous established mountain biking trails are minutes away and there are 2 local ski resorts within 5 miles from us. There are endless opportunities to ski, bike, hike, swim, fly fish, paddle, Or‚Ä¶ just float down the river with an inner tube to our local brewery in Richmond- (Shuttling can be arranged for an extra fee).
As the treehouse is located on a maple syrup farm, you may have an opportunity to witness maple syrup making in action. Sugaring season is typically March through April, but tours of the sugarhouse and sugarbush are year round and can be easily arranged.
Visit sweetAbbys.com for more information.', '', '']

Title: Treehouse Village - The Box
Description:
['About this space', "The Box is a shipping container with a modern design that is set amidst the trees. There is a bedroom with a queen-sized bed and an air mattress to add space for two more guests should you want to make it a family affair, or bring a few friends. There is a full bath, a kitchenette, and then the rest of the space is made into a living area with all you'll need to enjoy your stay. At the end of the living area, you'll find yourself surrounded by huge windows looking high into the treetops!", 'The space', "The space
The Box is a shipping container with a modern design that is set amidst the trees. There is a bedroom with a queen-sized bed and an air mattress to add space for two more guests should you want to make it a family affair, or bring a few friends. There is a full bath, a kitchenette, and then the rest of the space is made into a living area with all you'll need to enjoy your stay. At the end of the living area, you'll find yourself surrounded by huge windows looking high into the treetops!", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
You will have the whole treehouse to yourself!', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Since these are treehouses, you will need to e-sign a liability waiver. We are located in the woods so all animals and insects that come with nature, will be prevalent.
Since we are in a rural area, we have limited wifi available. Also, there is a long, hilly driveway. If the weather is rough, you will need to be careful. If you get stuck, we will assist you if we are available. A four-wheel drive vehicles is recommended if there is snow.']

Title: Luxurious Two-Story Treehouse | Minutes from Lake Sunapee | Peaceful
Description:
['About this space', 'A four-season TREEHOUSE packed with all the modern amenities! An experience to remember with exquisite craftsmanship throughout, enjoy the unique features yet simple pleasures of life in the trees! The Treehouse is equipped with radiant heat flooring and a propane fireplace for the winter and air conditioning for the summer! With two bedrooms and one bathroom, you will find romance, privacy, and charm, all nestled in the woods near Mount Sunapee and Lake Sunapee.

Knock this one off your bucket list: SLEEP IN A TREEHOUSE!', 'The space', 'The space
A four season TREEHOUSE packed with all the modern amenities! An experience to remember with exquisite craftsmanship throughout, enjoy the unique features yet simple pleasures of life in the trees! The Treehouse is equipped with radiant heat flooring and a propane fireplace for the winter and air conditioning for the summer! With two bedrooms and one bathroom, you will find romance, privacy, and charm, all nestled in the woods near Mount Sunapee and Lake Sunapee. Knock this one off your bucket list: SLEEP IN A TREEHOUSE!

Every inch of this one-of-a-kind treehouse has been crafted with the utmost attention to detail that invites you to discover the many surprises it holds‚Ä¶ including a mouse house!

Other features include wrap-around deck raised high above the trees where you can relax and enjoy the solitude surrounding you, and a lower deck with bench seating and a Weber Spirit grill that converts to a griddle ‚Äì cook your morning pancakes in the great outdoors! In the evening, sit back and relax around the fire pit with your favorite drink!

Walk through the hand-crafted ‚ÄòHobbit Door‚Äô to discover a welcoming main room with radiant heated Travertine stone flooring and walls covered with reclaimed barn board from the 1800‚Äôs. Dine at the table built on a kiln-dried tree stump. The galley kitchen is equipped with a microwave convection oven, two-burner cook stove and under-the-counter refrigerator/freezer.

A soapstone propane stove keeps the house cozy on snowy winter days, while a central air conditioning cools down the heat of the summer.

The treehouse offers two bedrooms to comfortably sleep four. The lower level bedroom has a full size bed, and the upstairs bedroom has a queen size bed.

The kitchen is fully stocked with utensils, dinnerware, pans, a toaster and Keurig coffee maker with coffee and creamer.

The tree house is a self-contained private area, located on a well-lit road with parking for two vehicles.

Must be 21 years of age or older to rent.', '', 'Guests have access to the entire property.']

Title: Ash hill treehouse, in the Adirondacks
Description: ['About this space', '*Brand New* The Ash Hill Treehouse is suspended between Ash and Maple trees. This is a real treehouse built in the trees and you won‚Äôt want to miss out on an experience like this! Five steps will lead you up a path as you embark on a 100 foot winding bridge, elevating you from ground level into the canopy of the trees where you will start your much needed getaway. Relax by the propane fireplace. The perfect place for couples or solo travelers that want to getaway, and enjoy the sounds of nature.', 'The space', 'The space\nThe Ash Hill Treehouse is the perfect mix between rustic and modern.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access\nFeel free to walk the 15 acre property and experience nature.']

Title: Observatory Tree House
Description:
['About this space', 'The Observatory tree-house is a vacation experience that quite literally rises above the rest! Built not for the faint of heart, this tree-top adventure offers the best views of the Red River Gorge.', 'The space', 'The space
Once you trek up to your new home in the swaying Eastern White Pine, you may feel exposed to the unforgettable raw nature of the canopy!  This tree house is designed for able-bodied folks and is NOT meant for unsupervised or small children.

Ascend the wandering wooden staircases into the canopy to begin your exploration of this pirate ship in the trees.  You`ll discover spectacular views from a glass bedroom with built-in skylights, a screened-in hammock lounge with plenty of storage, and a cozy kitchen with a wrap-around porch.  As you navigate from room to room through floating walkways and steep ship ladders, you may be wondering what it must have been like to create such an epic abode...', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Access to Wifi on our red office porch and in the office parking lot.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Kitchen: The Observatory kitchen has a gas stove, french press coffee pot, cookware, dishware, soap and kitchen linens . Above the sink you‚Äôll find a 5-gallon water dispenser for your cooking and cleaning needs. We supply two 5-gallon jugs of potable water during your stay. For perishables, a 75 L Yeti cooler is provided. Please bring your own ice.

Living/Dining: Screened-in lounge on the lowest level with a futon and two hammocks, a porch and bar-style seating for two on the mid-level, and the most spectacular views from the highest level on the Observation deck that leads to the bedroom.

Bathroom: Observatory has a private composting outhouse. You are also welcome to use our guest shower and bathroom at the RRG Headquarters at any time during your stay.

Bedroom: A full bed above the trees and a full-futon in the lower hammock lounge. Please note that while this tree-house was designed for two, there is room for two additional guests in the hammock lounge.

Additional Amenities: Weber charcoal grill, wall heater in the bedroom, solar powered kitchen lights and solar charging station for small electronics, battery-powered lanterns, and a private fire pit with camp chairs.

**Important** While we allow dogs at our rentals, we do not recommend them for Observatory. Your furry friends will most likely not be fans of the steep ladders/stairs.

4WD and high clearance vehicles are recommended but not required.']

Title: KY Breeze PRIVATE Treehouse ‚òÖ  Romantic RRG Forest
Description:
['About this space', 'Take in the rustic, fairy tale vibe of this custom-made treehouse in the midst of towering trees! Open the 15 ft glass garage door & watch the sunset over the mountains, or try your hand at some stargazing on the stargazing deck while listening to the nightly sounds of the forest. In the morning, step out on the trailhead and explore the stunning forest of the Red River Gorge

If your travel dates are not available on this calendar, visit one of our sister properties by visiting our profile!', 'The space', 'The space
At night, listen to gentle owls and enjoy the twinkling stars above on the stargazing deck, warm up near a fire while enjoying the solitude that the forest has to offer. In the morning, walk to the national trailhead location while the sun breaks through the trees as you hear the gentle stream of a nearby creek!

We are a RARE find in the area located on PRIVATE land, and one of the only rentals in the Red River Gorge that is located so conveniently INSIDE the National Park just walking distance to great nearby hiking trails!

If your dates are unavailable, be sure to check out our other listings as well such as "The Eagles Nest" and "Lions Lair" each providing its own unique accommodations. This treehouse is one of our newest additions providing AC, Heat, and Electricity!

We guarantee you this combination of outdoors & amenities provides a truly unique, adventurous, magical, and relaxing getaway experience with your friends or and loved ones!

We look forward to having you stay with us, and be sure to book soon before it fills up fast!!', '', '', '', '']

Title: The Tree house in Ano Korakiana
Description:
['About this space', 'Although this lovely and romantic tree house is set in the woods, it is light and airy with a balcony that overlooks the verdant landscape so typical of Corfu.
The detail as well as the tasteful fabrics adds to the ambience. Whilst small it has everything you need. It will enchant you.', 'The space', 'The space
The treehouse is part of an estate called "Vradi Estate" which is located in the foothills of the village of Ano Korakiana. As part of the estate there is a guest house with 7 bedrooms, three cottages, an A-frame house, a treehouse and a horse trekking center. The cottages were built in such way so that our guests can enjoy the peace and the privacy that the place has to offer. Each property has it‚Äôs own outdoor space and it‚Äôs own unique view of the field where the horses graze every evening. Near the cottages there is a vegetable garden from where guests can help themselves to fresh produce.
Anyone that is a nature and animal lover and is looking for a quiet place away from the touristy spots will enjoy it. Friendly cats an dogs roam around the estate freely.
The Vradi Estate is quite central located on the island making it a good base for guests to explore both the north and the south of Corfu.
The nearest beaches are Ipsos, Dassia and Barbati which are all within 10 minutes distance by car or scooter . Approximately 5- 6 km. Palaiokastrisa, one of Corfu‚Äôs most popular attractions is 15 minutes away.
Corfu town is 15km away so 20 minutes by car.
Corfu airport and Corfu port about the same. 15-16 km away, 20 minutes by car or scooter.
A car of scooter is required as there is no public transportation.
The horse trekking center just 20m from the cottages is nicely busy in the summer but not noisy.
Breakfast is also available at an extra cost at Luna Inn (the adjacent b&b)', '', '', '', '', '', '']

Title: Panorama: Magnificent treehouse,cozy
Description:
['About this space', 'www . valterria . com

The Totem Houses of Valterria are located in the Valterria Adventure Park located in the privileged environment of the Merindades.

Imagine sleeping among trees, jumping on zip lines, taking a ride on our ebikes, enjoying the sunset on your terrace with unique views. You can enjoy the tranquility of the rural world and immerse yourself in countless adventures.', 'The space', 'The space
Treehouse, located in the forest of the Valterr√≠a adventure park.
Its hexagonal shape accommodates two people, with the possibility of a double bed or two single beds.
It has a toilet and a shower.
The terrace of this cabin has east orientation.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
An adventure park at your feet:

- Climbing, zip lines and jumping in a single tower of 24 meters high. Climb up its climbing and climbing tracks or from the stairs inside. An adrenaline monster through which to access the circuits of high rope bridges.

- Hanging bridges. It runs 18 extra long bridges at 11 meters high through the canopies of an oak forest.

- Giant zip line. Jump and slide along the large double zip line of 300 meters in length.

- Enchanted forest of molars. Turn on your imagination thanks to a circuit built between giant rocks joined by bridges and with different challenges.

- Cafeteria. Skewers, rations or some dishes that come out of our kitchen‚Ä¶ In a family atmosphere and with the best views of the Merindad.

- Food Truck. Come and see our Foodtruck mounted on the chassis of an old bus that will delight young and old. In the you can enjoy our pizzas and focattias with a wide variety of ingredients, waffles, creps, ice cream and much more in our adventure atmosphere.

www . valterria . com']

Title: Treehouse Canopy Room: Permaculture Farm
Description:
['About this space', 'Our lovely space is a lush urban oasis and permaculture farm. Enjoy goats, pigs, emus, roosters, parrots, tortoises, cats, and friendly people. Located in "Little Haiti," near art district, 15 minutes from airport and South Beach. Fresh veggies, eggs and honey when available! Late night train horns and early rooster crows also!
Please check in by 7 pm on arrival day.', 'The space', 'The space
Walk up narrow staircase to the 3rd level of the treehouse, nestled within the pithocilobium tree. Feel like you're living in the trees! Beautiful view of canopy and animals. There's a double bed for two. Shared kitchen downstairs. The Bahamas style bathroom is located a few steps away from the Treehouse and the lovely outdoor shower is also close by. Bathroom and shower have hot water.
Due to height of treehouse, no children are allowed (sorry). From the canopy room, you will hear animal sounds and possibly midnight train horns.
Mosquitos are at their peak during rainy season (June-September) we have a net over the bed, citronella candle, two fans and incense to keep them away from you in the Treehouse, but that's not a guarantee.
Miami summer is hot. While our beautiful canopy of trees helps keep the farm a lot cooler than other parts of the city, be mindful that the Treehouse only has fans for cooling. It does not have an air conditioner. Please consider our "Cozy Cabin room" or "Cute Cedar Camper" listings if you are sensitive to mosquitoes or prefer air conditioning. Click on my photo, and scroll down to see all our interesting listings on the farm!
Please check-in by 7 pm.', '', 'Guest access', '', '']

Title: Eagles Nest Tree House
Description:
['About this space', 'Come stay in your very own Tree House!

This rustic luxury treehouse is nestled away 17 feet high in the treetops. Eagles nest will accommodate up to 4 guests. Thrill your inner child staying in a treehouse, but with all the luxury you expect as an adult!

This beautiful 900 sq ft treehouse is furnished in a rustic luxury style and has all the luxurious amenities you want with the fun of a treehouse! Stairs are necessary to enter the treehouse. Check in is after 4pm. Check out is 11am.', 'The space', "The space
***We sanitize the cabins and change the hot tub water before and after every guest***

Walk right onto the 1st screened porch where you'll find a 4 person hot tub. Then into the treehouse, you'll find a kitchenette, washer/dryer, wifi, in house surround sound, gas fireplace, King bed (upstairs) and two fold-out memory foam twin beds (convertible to a King) downstairs. There is a half bath downstairs and a full bath with a tiled shower upstairs. You can also enjoy the upstairs screened-in porch sitting area right off the bedroom.

There is 280 ft of open deck and a lower patio area with a gas grill and picnic table for an additional 160 sq ft. You can also relax outside on the deck in the hanging rope chairs, or under the treehouse by the lower patio area in the swinging play forts (weight limit 250 pounds). So much fun to be had and so much relaxing to do!

Your payment constitutes your agreement to our rental contract, so you do not need to sign and return it to us. Rates are based on DOUBLE OCCUPANCY and do not include tax, processing, additional guest fees or insurance fees.

ADDITIONAL ADULTS ARE $25 PER NIGHT PER ADULT, ONE CHILD FREE PER PAYING ADULT (IF you have children instant quote will include in the price, please contact us before instant booking so we can correct the cost.)

Minimum stay 2 nights, 3 night minimum for Holiday dates. Other discounts may be available, please contact us for more information.

We do require payment in full at the time of booking unless other arrangements are agreed to at the time of booking.

Non-refundable Pet fee $75 plus tax per dog, we do not allow cats, 2 dogs max.", '', '', '', 'Rates are based on DOUBLE OCCUPANCY and do not include tax, processing or insurance fees. Rates may change at any time without notice.

ADDITIONAL GUESTS ARE $25 PER NIGHT PER GUEST. We offer weeknight 1-night minimum stays. Weekend Minimum stay is 2 nights, 3 night minimum for Holiday dates.

Please also note that if you plan to bring our fur family member(s) we have 2 do max, and there will be an $82.73 ($75 plus tax) non-refundable, per dog fee for the entire trip. Note that this is not a per night fee. This charge will be billed to you through the Airbnb resolution center. Please contact the manager with any questions or concerns. We do not allow cats.

We are available 24/7 to answer your questions and are here to make your stay with us unforgettable!']

Title: Nomad Jungle Treehouse - surf / yoga (shared bath)
Description:
['About this space', "‚ÄúLa Selva at Nomad Tree Lodge‚Äù is an adventure accommodation offering a Home to surfers, yogis, and nomads from around the world.

We offer daily yoga, and foot access to 2 world class surf breaks (intermediate/ advanced).

We're not perfect, we're not luxury, but life here is really beautiful in it's raw simplicity. If you sign up for this adventure, commit to surrendering to the jungle and immersing yourself in this unique experience.

NOTE: wifi in communal space only, no guest kitchen.", 'The space', "The space
Our rooms are all uniquely beautiful in their rustic simplicity. Think of the space more as ‚Äúglamping‚Äù than as a hotel.

You will get to your cabin by a series of pathways & rope bridges through the trees. Nestled in the jungle, your little a-frame treehouse Cabina is your own little jungle nest to reset & relax.

The Treehouse is breezy and open (even though it's 100% screened and protected from bugs), and you'll often see monkeys right out your front door! Listen to the waves crashing at night and the jungle sounds in the morning. Your little Paradise.

You‚Äôll have access to the shared bathhouse with a bathroom and shower shared with 1 other cabin.", '', "Guest access
You will have access to the pool, yoga shala, and the main lounge, where we have wifi connection and seating. For an additional charge, we offer breakfast and daily yoga classes.

We don't have a shared kitchen! But, there are plenty of restaurants nearby.", '', '']

Title: Treehouse Escape on 5 Acres- TreeHausATL
Description: ['About this space', 'Come sleep in the trees...This is the perfect place to come when you need a break. This beautiful treehouse sits on five acres of wooded property minutes from the 75/285 and less than two miles from the The Battery and Truist Park. After your walk down the sparkling path past the firepit, you enter the house by crossing three bridges to the porch. Has a full kitchen and bathroom. The sleeping loft has a ships ladder and a king size bed with soft linen bedding. Truly awesome place to recharge.', 'The space', "The space\nThe large 400 square foot deck sits 23 feet in the air. full in suit bathroom, fiber internet, kitchen and AC/Heat. It's a great way to recharge your soul when you need a break from the norm.", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note\nPets are welcome, but there is a $65 pet fee.']

Title: The Sugar Maple Treehouse @ Vermont ReTREEt
Description:
['About this space', "The Sugar Maple Treehouse was hand built by us as a peaceful and serene reTREEt in central Vermont. Surrounded by the wilderness of the Green Mountain National Forest and perched high above the ground in three maples trees, there is no place better to escape to. There are so many things to do in this area between Killington and Sugarbush, I can't list them all! Between the cozy bed and in-house massage therapist you probably won‚Äôt want to leave anyway. Please read the entire description.", 'The space', 'The space
You can relax in the treehouse and enjoy being surrounded by nature or you can be adventurous and go explore the surrounding forest.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
After you park your car, you will get to walk along the path and across the beaver creek bridge and up the path some more until you come across the treehouse nestled in the forest perched up on three beautiful maple trees.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
While we tried to make this treehouse as easy to access as possible, the path to the treehouse is 650‚Äô in length up a slight hill. With the treehouse being located in a forest the walking path can be a bit muddy, bumpy, snow covered, perfect, of a combination of everything so please bring appropriate footwear.

We expect to clean the treehouse after each guest so there is no additional cleaning fee, but if you leave a mess we will contact you and ask for a cleaning fee.

We love animals and enjoy when guests gets to bring theirs! We just do not like cleaning up after those furry family members so we are asking for you to bring a bed or blanket for the furry one to sleep on. We do have a fee of $20 per day per pet for normal wear and tear. Airbnb is set up to charge you for the first night, but any more nights will be added manually. This fee does not include any extra cleaning or damage to the treehouse. If you bring a pet with out telling us a head of time, we will add on $50 since we use different linens when pets are visiting and won‚Äôt be able to change them out on your arrival. (I do apologize if this sounds over the top in anyway, a few bad apples are why we had to implement such things).

Please let us know your estimated time of arrival on arrival day so I know when to come down from the trees and keep an eye out. Showing up without giving me a heads up could cause up to an hour wait time until I can get you checked in since I could be in the middle of a project in the forest.

We try to be as accommodating as possible by having a 4 hour check in window, if you want to check in out side of that time frame we will do so to the best of our abilities at a charge of $30 per hour.

The bathroom consists of a composting toilet which is on the same treehouse platform. We have a seasonal heated outdoor shower which is operational in the warmer months. We will provide you with some drinking water in a bottle and hand sanitizer.

The treehouse is well insulated and has electric heaters that will keep you plenty warm on the coldest of Vermont nights.

For those that want to disconnect while still being able to connect we now have internet and a small smart tv in this treehouse!

We will help bring your belongings up to the treehouse upon your arrival but can not guarantee help bringing them back down as we both work in the mornings.

We want to make sure everyone who visits our treehouse knows what they are booking by reading the description and not just our glorious reviews because the experience at our treehouse is not for everyone. To indicate that you have read all of this please include your favorite type of tree when you message us!', 'Licence number', 'Licence number
MRT-10126712']

Title: The TreEscape
Description: ['About this space', '1st true treehouse in Gatlinburg/Pigeon Forge built by The Treehouse Guys from the DIY network show. Features a loft br, full bath with rain head-tile shower, unlimited high speed internet, fully equipped kitchen, very comfortable power reclining leather couch, 2 live trees growing through the interior, 2 live trees growing through the enormous deck space, covered hot tub, 2 outdoor bars, suspension bridge to crows nest deck around a 5th tree, and so much more...', 'The space', 'The space\nOur space was designed primarily for a unique experience that we would describe as luxury in the trees! The setting is perfect for a quiet writers retreat, honeymoon or romantic getaway, or an unforgettable family trip to the Smoky Mountains. Our property is the best of both worlds as you can be in Gatlinburg or Pigeon Forge within minutes, but still feel like you have your own private setting in the woods. Below the house is even more to explore including a pub table with hanging/swinging chairs. There is also a nice charcoal grill and fire pit just off to the front and side of our place.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access\nOur guests will have complete and exclusive access to all amenities at the Treescape.']

Title: Gypsy Treehouse Gazebo - Walk to Beach
Description:
['About this space', 'This beautiful large gazebo is detached from our home but is accessed via the back porch and deck. Plenty of windows overlook the trees and pond. Inside find this eclectic haven for the wandering soul with hanging bed and 2 foot deep tub. Find us on "FB" under "Treehouse Gazebo."', 'The space', 'The space
Eclectic is an understatement. One of a kind indoor modern out-house and cattle trough tub. Enjoy privacy overlooking a large yard and access the deck to cookout, read, relax or just soak in some sun. It's a trip back in time but with modern amenities. The suspended bed is super comfortable and all of this is found in one room nestled among the trees just a few blocks from the beach or a short walk to the Nags Head Woods Preserve forest.

****Note**** Bed is Full Size (54x75) this may not be comfortable for those fortunate enough to be over 6 foot tall.

A mini fridge, oven toaster, microwave oven, and Keurig single brew coffemaker are available for your convenience, there are also USB charger ports at bedside. Underneath the bed there is a wooden chest, inside you will find the blu-ray dvd player, 12 ft. HDMI cord, iron, ironing board, blow dryer and first aid kit (please write down supplies taken from kit so that I can replace them). Underneath the sink there is a small broom and dustpan if you want to clean the sand from the floor. A drying rack is provided for your wet bathing suits, you may set it up outside or over the tub (located in shower). Light switch for the bathroom lamp is on the lamp itself. Cable for the TV is on the SPECTRUM app as there is no longer a cable box. You may also use NETFLIX under "Treehouse guest" profile and we want you to enjoy this unique experience, so if you have any special requests or recommendations, we would love to know.', '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Bed is Full Size (54x75) this may not be comfortable for those fortunate enough to be over 6 foot tall.']

Title: 02 - Treetop Flyer
Description:
['About this space', "NOW WITH ELECTRIC!! The Treetop Flyer is a small, one-room treehouse with a loft, wrap-around porch, lower deck, propane grill, and nearby fire pit. There is NO PLUMBING, but we provide a jug of spring water and there's an outhouse at the base of the stairs. The farm also has a centrally located Community Kitchen and a Bath House which are shared with other guests on the farm. NO PETS - NO EXCEPTIONS. Please read ALL the house rules and full description. HomeGrown HideAways is also on FB and IG.", 'The space', "The space
HomeGrown HideAways is a hundred-acre farm, campground, and event facility with treehouses, yurts, cabins, camping, etc. The owners, Nathan & Jessa, live onsite with a parade of dogs, cats, chickens, and ducks. For the safety of our own animals (and yours), we cannot allow any additional animals onto the farm. Anyone arriving with an animal of any kind will not be allowed to stay and no refund will be given.

INTERIOR: The interior of the Treetop Flyer is complete with 4 double beds, pillows, sheets, and light blankets (2 futons that fold open on the main floor and 2 mattresses in the loft), barnwood table with 2 benches for eating and playing games, and a jug of spring water. There is an electric fireplace for heat, but no indoor plumbing. You get the entire treehouse to yourself. A trash can is provided, but we do not have trash service on the farm so you need to take your trash to town with you upon departure. (NOTE: Please let us know if you plan to bring your own linens. We offer a linen discount of $3 per person if we don‚Äôt have to do extra laundry. Beds will still come with a fitted sheet and pillows with pillowcases, just no blankets or top sheet. You can request the discount as a refund or farm credit to use towards eggs, firewood, or other items).

EXTERIOR: The treehouse features a covered, wrap-around porch above and massive deck below with swing, picnic table, propane grill, and firewood bundles (bring cash). The upstairs porch and lower deck have solar lights. Please note that the lights do not come on until dark and they will only stay on for as much time as the battery was able to re-charge during the day. A private outhouse is just a few steps away from the base of the stairs or you can use the shared-use bath house in the main camping field. There is also a nearby firepit that overlooks the gardens. Parking is available at the base of the treehouse is but very limited. If you are bringing a group, some will need to park in the parking area near the Community Kitchen.

CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT: Guests can check in any time after 4pm, but we do recommend arriving before dark. Depending on our cleaning schedule, we may be able to accommodate an earlier arrival time with advance notice. Rentals are unlocked so guests can just follow the instructions sent with the check-in email to find their location and let themselves in. Check-out is at 11am so that we have time to clean the rental before the next guest arrives. If something comes up and you need to leave before your scheduled check-out date, please do us the courtesy of sending a message once you have cell service so that we know not to expect you.

UNPLUG AND RECONNECT: HomeGrown HideAways does not have cell service or wifi, but there is a landline in the Community Kitchen for guests to use. We hope that you will take the opportunity to re-connect with nature, yourself, your family, and other guests. In addition to the shared kitchen space, we also have a pavilion with cornhole set up for rainy days, and a massive bonfire area where we encourage guests to pitch in on firewood to share stories and s‚Äômores. Please note that quiet hours are from 10pm ‚Äì 7am and sound carries far in the holler.

SHARED BATH HOUSE: In addition to year-round outhouses, there is a seasonal BATH HOUSE with 4 flush toilets and 2 solar-heated showers. The bath house is rustic with a concrete floor so we recommend shower shoes or flip flops. Towels and toiletries are not provided, but we do have extra for purchase if you forget yours. In the winter months, when the bath house is closed, we open the restrooms in the community building for showering (1 full bath and 1 half bath).

COMMUNITY KITCHEN: The farm has a brand new (2021), centrally-located, solar-powered, chef-inspired COMMUNITY KITCHEN with 4 ovens, 5-burner gas cooktop, microwave, refrigerator with farm-fresh eggs, coffee-maker, toaster, dishes, cutlery, baking sheets, basic cooking supplies (oil, salt, pepper, etc), plus HomeGrown farm goods, s‚Äômore kits, and other goodies. BRING CASH for the honor system. Please remember that this space is available for ALL visitors of the farm so guests are expected to clean up after themselves and not to loiter when others are waiting. To prevent over-crowding, we ask that a maximum of TWO people from your group occupy the space at a time and children MUST be accompanied by a guardian at all times. Meals may be eaten at the picnic tables on the porch, under the pavilion, or you can take food back to your site. FOOD SCRAPS MUST BE PUT INTO THE COMPOST BIN ‚Äì NOT IN THE TRASH. Please do not discard food on the ground as it can make our animals sick and attract unwanted wildlife.

THE FARM: We are a farm in the mountains so we have all the good (beautiful views, babbling brook, hiking trails) and the bad (insects, howling coyotes, poison ivy) that nature has to offer so come prepared. We recommend hiking boots, bug spray, and weather-appropriate clothing. Be prepared to encounter INSECTS (mosquitoes, ticks, chiggers), WILDLIFE (deer, turkey, snakes, toads, and dare we mention the bear track we spotted one spring?), WEATHER (hot, cold, rain, snow), TOXIC PLANTS (poison ivy, stinging nettle, wild mushrooms), just to name a few. There is a steep and rugged 1.5-mile hiking loop that takes most folks about an hour (if they can get past the first 10-minute uphill climb). We also have playground swings, disc golf, hula hoops, a croquet set, and a creek full of geodes to hunt.

CAMPFIRES: Most sites have their own fire pit except for the primitive camping area. There is also a large communal fire pit near the Community Kitchen. Due to the spread of invasive insects, we ask that you DO NOT BRING FIREWOOD unless it is store-bought/kiln dried. We have bundles for sale here for $5/bundle (bring cash) or you can scavenge dead wood from the forest floor for free. DO NOT cut down live trees and DO NOT burn plastic, glass, trash, gas, or anything that isn‚Äôt wood or paper. There is plenty of fire-starting materials under the Pavilion next to the bundles. On your way to the farm, you will pass the local fire department. Please make note of the fire danger sign. If the fire danger is high, a campfire may not be advisable ‚Äì please check for local burn bans.

SMOKING: Smoking is not permitted within the vicinity of any building on the farm. Please do not discard cigarette butts in the firepits or on the ground. They must be completely extinguished and can be thrown in the trash.

TRASH: In case you missed it before, we do not have trash pick-up on the farm and very much appreciate it if you can take your trash with you when you leave the farm. We do have recycling bins for clean plastic and aluminum cans. Paper and cardboard can be put in the box next to the firewood bundles under the pavilion for others to use for starting fires. We also have a compost bin available for all food scraps, paper napkins, and paper plates. Please do not discard food on the ground as it can make our animals sick and attract unwanted wildlife.

MOTORIZED VEHICLES: We do not allow ATVs, 4-wheelers, golf carts, or any non-medical motorized transportation. Bicycles are welcome and encouraged.

GENERATORS: We highly discourage the use of generators as they can be quite noisy and produce toxic fumes. Please talk to us in advance if you require one for a specific purpose.

ACCIDENTS: If a child or member of your party has an accident involving bodily fluids, please take the time to clean up after them. First aid kits are supplied in most rentals and in the Community Kitchen. If bedding is involved, we have coin-operated laundry facilities in the Community building to begin the washing process. Please notify us of such events.

COOLERS & CANDLES: Coolers should be left outside so that the condensation doesn't damage our floors. Candles are not allowed due to too many wax spills.

NEARBY: We are just 8 miles from the Berea Pinnacles, 6 miles from Get Outside Ky (they rent canoes, kayaks, SUPs, and e-bikes), 3 miles to Tater Knob Pottery, 20 minutes to Anglin Falls, and a scenic hour from Red River Gorge. Berea is known for its arts and crafts, the historic Berea College, and outdoor recreation. In addition to hiking at the Pinnacles, there are several other trails throughout town and the newly opened Silver Creek Bike Park.

NOMS: Our favorite places to eat in Berea are Noodle Nirvana, Native Bagel Company, Happy Jack‚Äôs World Sandwich Bar, Nightjar, Apollo Pizza, PapaLeno‚Äôs, and El Rio Grande. In Richmond, we like Masala Indian, Purdy‚Äôs Coffee Co., and Thai Smile. Note: Madison County is DRY, Berea is MOIST, and Richmond is WET so plan your alcohol accordingly.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests have access to all 100 acres of the farm EXCEPT the private rentals, the residence, and the chicken/duck houses. DO NOT LET YOUR CHILDREN CHASE THE BIRDS!

We HIGHLY recommend arriving before dark. There are very few streetlights on the road coming in and none on the farm. It gets REALLY dark out here and some of our city guests have a bit of trouble with this.

Rentals are unlocked for your arrival. Be sure to save/screenshot/download the check-in instructions you receive in your inbox as there‚Äôs no wifi or cell service once you arrive.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
Items we recommend bringing: CASH for firewood, eggs, and farm goods; bug spray; hiking shoes/mudboots; slippers; earplugs (sometimes the coyotes throw big parties); and shower shoes (the bath house is rustic with a concrete floor).

We live onsite. If you have any issues during your stay, PLEASE come knock on our door so we can assist. There's nothing worse than finding out in the review that you didn't enjoy your stay and it's something we could have easily fixed.

We are constantly striving to make the farm better and sometimes we forget to update the listings with the latest changes and improvements. For the most up-to-date information, we suggest you follow our HomeGrown HideAways social media accounts where we also advertise on-farm workshops, classes, and events."]

Title: Treehouse on the Blue Ridge Parkway near Boone
Description:
['About this space', "This hideaway was built on camera for an episode of Animal Planet's Treehouse Masters. Perched in trees just off the Blue Ridge Parkway, it's ideal for guests who would like to reconnect with nature, and it's a great home base for exploring the High Country. This property offers many unique features, so please read the entire listing before booking. We look forward to having you!", 'The space', 'The space
Located on the Blue Ridge Parkway, this beautiful cabin is literally nestled in the trees. Built with special touches throughout, you may not want to leave this unique treasure once you get here. As you drive down the private drive you will feel the stress of daily life melt away. The treehouse is below the main house and has views of the vast forest surrounding you. Enjoy your breakfast on the back deck with total privacy from the outside world. Inside the cabin you will find a fully stocked kitchen and charming sitting area with comfortable futon that pulls out into an additional sleeping space. A comfortable queen-size bed is upstairs in the loft and surrounded by windows so you will wake up in the trees.
The treehouse uniquely features an outdoor shower and a composting toilet.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The treehouse is yours during your stay. Guests can explore surrounding land and hiking trails on the property.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
**Please note: There is no shower available in the treehouse during the winter months when it is below freezing. The treehouse does have a bathroom with a composting toilet. If you are staying for two nights or more, you are welcome to request shower access in our private home.**']

Title: Mountain Dreams in Big Canoe-Escape the masses!
Description:
['About this space', "Beautiful views of Lake Petit and the mountains all YEAR! This chalet has been completely remodeled and is just beautiful! If your wanting a romantic getaway in the mountains, it would be hard to beat this one. The lake with boat rentals and miles of hiking trails. The cabin is close to Big Canoes core amenities and trails. This cabin has upgraded high speed WIFI and TV's in each room. Many of our guests come and end up buying a home here. If your looking to relax, THIS IS THE PLACE!", 'The space', "The space
This chalet has one bedroom and one bath. It is approximately 600 square feet. The kitchen is completely stocked with everything you would need to cook a full meal and then some. There are two TV's in the cabin, one in the bedroom and one in the living room. Both have smart devices attached to them if you have netflix or some other streaming service. The couch is also a sleeper sofa that turns into a queen bed. This cabin is maintained IMMACULATELY. If your looking to come to the mountains, this is the place! We occasionally allow guests with a child to stay in the cabin as a fourth person. But, you must ask. WE DO NOT WANT MORE THAN TWO ADULTS STAYING IN THIS CABIN.

**Owner is a licensed real estate agent lic#370513
The owner is a licensed real estate agent with Harry Norman Realtors and is always willing to show properties in Big Canoe and nearby communities with", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
All of chalet. Laundry room is only available if guests are staying over three days or if specifically requested by the guest.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
NO SMOKING OR PETS INSIDE THE CABIN!']

Title: Nights of Cimes - The Cabane du Bois Mauret
Description:
['About this space', 'Unusual accommodation open all year round: dream cabins, just for you, perched 10 meters in the trees (easy and secure access). Isolated from everything, peace is guaranteed for an unforgettable night in the heart of the forest, for lovers, families or friends, ideal as a gift for those you love.', 'The space', 'The space
Perched on a magnificent tree, the Mauret wood hut is comfortable and rustic. Access is from a wooden staircase and then a footbridge fully secured by a net that leads directly to a small terrace. Inside many windows create a bright atmosphere and allow you to fully enjoy the surroundings.
It is equipped with dry toilets, a kitchenette with gas and sink, a cozy seating area, additional heating, tables and chairs inside and on the terrace, storage areas and solar electricity (lamps and socket).
This cabin does not have a shower. We provide you towels and gloves for a rustic toilet in the kitchen sink.
Upstairs, there are two small bedrooms under the rooftops. In all, the cabin is designed to accommodate four people in hotel formula, that is to say clean and prepared beds... you do not have sheets to bring and breakfast is provided.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
A 10-minute walk in the forest from the parking lot takes you to the foot of a staircase (plan a pair of sneakers). This leads you to the departure of a suspended walkway to the terrace of the cabana.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Breakfast included in the price. For meals, you can cook in the cabin or go to a nearby restaurant.']

Title: Treehouse perched in the trees  of Cassis
Description:
['About this space', 'Text idea for your hut


" As long as there are huts in
the woods, nothing will be totally lost. "

Whether you are a child in the countryside or in the city, the hut is a part of your childhood.
What if, for the time of a getaway, you find the joys of these suspended moments?
Go for an atypical stay by combining well-being and respect for nature in a chic and intimate setting offset from everyday life.
All in newly clothed wood.', 'The space', 'The space
Unique... Cassis cabin. The cabin is installed on a wide platform hanging from the trees and supported by stilts. Accessible on one level thanks to the natural slope, you will however have the real feeling of being high with 5 m under your feet.
the cabin is insulated in sheep's wool. It ensures natural softness in the middle of the season and freshness in the summer. It includes a 140 cm bed that faces a glazed window. Lying down, you'll have a bird 's-eye view of nature. a hanging wooden walkway

A "bathroom" is at your disposal : a shower , a sink and a private toilet. The bathroom is private to the hut , Towels are provided

The hut has electric light but also photophores for a more romantic atmosphere!

If you can't separate from your mobile phone or computer, you will be able to charge it on a socket.

A small fridge in the cabin and an espresso coffee machine are provided , no breakfast scheduled.

You will spend a stay in lazy mode during summer, bucolic during spring, shimmering during fall and in trapper mode during winter !', '', '', '', '']

Title: TreeHouse~Aliyah~Off  grid+hiking+family friendly!
Description:
['About this space', 'A whimsical magical treehouse! A real tree house with a red oak that resides in the living room. Sleeps total of 2 adults 4 kids. Full bed in loft of main cabin. A swinging bridge connects to the snuggle palace bedroom 50 feet off ground that has bunk bed. A fire pit lights up the entire place. Hike 285 acres with trail head right below treehouse, play games. Cook full meal in stocked kitchenette. Dates taken? Check out our tree houses The Pete Nelson, Hickory or Tiny home Schoolie-The Love Bus', 'The space', 'The space
We are excited you found us!

We are Earthjoy village and have three treehouses on 200 acres of privately owned land strategically placed to give you privacy and close enough that you can rent out all three. One built by Master Pete Nelson.

You will have private access to the 285 acres with over ten miles of rolling hiking trails of varying degrees of difficulty. There is a laminated map inside your treehouse with descriptions on the back. There are hammocks, and tire swings along the way. There are creeks to explore, play and hike. Your trail starts right below your treehouse

The listing you are looking at presently is the Aliyah treehouse. What makes it unique is that the snuggle palace is 50 feet high ...this is our tallest treehouse. It‚Äôs great for when you‚Äôre a family that likes to spread out. In the main cabin is a full size bed and across the swinging bridge is a bunk bed with a twin & full size bed.

What stands us apart is the quiet, seclusion and options to add on adventures like our unique guided tree climb.

THE ALIYAH. This tree house is for those wanting an, "off the grid nature experience." It sleeps 2 adults and 3-4 kids. This is TRULY, a one of a kind experience.

Inside this particular tree house you are greeted by a tree in the room. As in: a more-than-100-year-old, two foot wide trunk right there in the middle, lichen and all, reaching straight through the roof, one of two red oaks that support the tree house.

Neighboring limbs hold a second tree-house bedroom accessible by a suspended rope-and-plank bridge to a deck. It‚Äôs an excellent place to sleep, without light or sounds, except for the nighttime woods.

It‚Äôs trees as far as the eyes can see. The woods hold different marvels all times of year, so there is no off-season.

Guests also relax with a swinging cabana tree pod below, a hammock village, a outdoor patio set, a stacked-stone fire-pit, cafe seating outside the main tree house on the deck, and shaded hiking paths (including the popular 3.3 mile Heart Trail) that wind through the 285-acre private property, each bend bringing old growth forests full of white and red oaks, hickories, blackberry patch for you to pick your own, ponds, and creeks. Plus the NEWEST are two of largest tunnel landslides in Ky. to enjoy (over 150 feet)

There is a space heater for winter for both spaces and back up propane if needed.

Bathrooms
You have a compost toilet 5 second walk outside the treehouse for quick trips and a private bathroom marked Aliyah bath house up the road about a football field away with shower, flushing toilet, sink, towels, wash rags, soap, shampoo, paper towels and toilet paper. Heated in the winter.

Cooking: It has a fully stocked kitchenette inside and everything you need to cook all your meals including propane stove, 3-gallon tank of water, pots and pans, plates, bowls, cups, mugs, and utensils, French coffee press, and cooler. With a portable sink for clean up. A charcoal grill outside. Bring your own preference of charcoal

Beds: A full memory foam mattress in the loft above the living room in main cabin.
The snuggle palace bedroom has a full size memory foam mattress below and twin bunk above. Snuggle Palace gives you that true treehouse feel so you will have to draw straws.

This TreeHouse is recommended for Nature lovers, people who seek time away from technology and love being outside. It is an experience.

Because it is truly a off the grid experience we want to alert you to a few things you may have to navigate during your stay. We have lighting for you by makita light, ceiling light, and mini lights. We recommend bringing your own head lamps. You have two electrical outlets in this treehouse mainly for space heater. You can charge your cell phones via the USB ports on the Makita battery source.

The tree grove is available to you to book a guided tree climb. Here, our professional facilitator will take you step by step to the top for the best views! Challenge by choice and always on rope. You can learn all the tree tricks, including coming down, upside down. Or you can always just hang out in the GIANT green net!

A fire-pit is strategically placed to view from the all parts of the tree house. Build a fire and roast marsh mellows. You can buy a bundle of split firewood for $40.00 that will be delivered to your treehouse with a small fire starter, about 20 pieces that equals one night or bring your own firewood( It must have state compliance code)

Pets are welcome for 50 a pet per stay. Maximum 2.

You can go on scavenger hunt to find the 5 ponds, (scavenger bingo is supplied for you and in the tree house.) A favorite of guests is to explore an abandoned 1800s settlers log cabin...proceed with caution, wade and play in several cool creeks! Bring your fishing poles for kids fishing ponds.

We now have two large land slides over 150 feet on property for you to explore. Bring wax paper if you want to go super fast

Make sure to play the survival card game in the tree house to get everyone engaged and off their phones!

Check out our nature invitations in the tree house manual as a tool to enhance your self-awareness, connect deeper to nature, and others.


We cannot predict the weather. When it is sunny and warm things can be peachy. The tree house can also be fun when it rains just prepare ahead of time. We will send out a welcome letter once you book with detailed info for a rainy day and other important things to note.


In good dry weather you will have much easier time to navigate right up to the tree house! However, if snow is in forecast, we recommend four wheel drive or front wheel drive with good tires. If you are afraid you will get stuck during your stay we ask you do not pull down further than the green farm house at entry of property. From there you can use a wagon next to farmhouse to take your things down or pre-arrange someone to assist you


We have a detailed manual inside the tree house for more details about everything in the tree house.

You will also receive a detailed welcome letter after you book with what to bring, what to expect and local information like where to get groceries.

We love our guests and love to MEET everyone. However first and foremost we respect your privacy. If you would like to meet us simply give us a text during your stay and if we are on the property we will meet you. We do not live on the property and hour away so you will need to be coached for any problems via phone


Please take note*** This adventure includes Wildlife. The tree house is in the middle of the woods you may encounter mice, wasp, bees, ticks, deer, turkey, flies, ants, water bugs, hear coyotes, and owls especially out on the trails. THIS IS THEIR HOME! We ask that you be a person that loves and respects wildlife. If interaction with bugs, insects, animals and nature is disheartening to you we do not recommend this tree house experience for you.

Local Tips
**A favorite of guests is visiting the Historical town of Augusta Ky. Childhood home to George Clooney. The Irish Pub is a great place to eat (call ahead for open hours) and have a ice cream after at the general store across the street. Visit the small red train with historical info and take a stroll along the beautiful Ohio River just two blocks to the left of the pub. Augusta is also home to underground railroad.

Another favorite for more fine dining right on the river is the Beehive. Call ahead to make sure they are open during your stay and to make reservations.

From Augusta you can take a magical ferry ride across river and visit small town of Ripley. Find a place to eat along the river. You can take bridge back to Maysville and visit their historical downtown. Eat at Parc Cafe-A Italian cafe replica or at the five star LILJUMBO cafe

For quick bite to eat order a Pizza from the Germantown 1st stop Gas station 4 miles and pick it up. Phone number is in the treehouse or order from Snappy's in Brooksville and they will now deliver as far as 3 miles from tree house by Palmer funeral home at beginning of 875


Back story. The Tree houses are our dream come true. We both wanted treehouses at a young age. For me being in nature brings me peace. When I was 9 I would play in the woods with my siblings and build my tree house with small branches, using rocks as our furniture and moss as our carpet. I never let go of having this space and thought about it often.

When Bill and I started our dream company EarthJOY Tree adventures in 2007. Whereas we take clients to the top of trees on ropes. As part of this venture we wanted to give them another experience. Why not be able to stay in a treehouse too??

We set off to take Pete Nelsons LEARN HOW TO BUILD A TREEHOUSE in 2009 workshop.

After the workshop we looked high and low for the perfect property to have this dream come true. We ran into many obstacles one being not able to afford it or not the right trees.

When we saw Pete on Animal planet I thought I would just apply for the fun of it. We didn't even have a place. When they called and accepted our application I called Dad. I asked him if we could build a treehouse on his 200 acre farm. He laughed and then said YES! He said he was tired of running two farms and would now change gears to have a few tree houses.

In 2017 we built our second tree house. This one you are reading about!

IN 2019 we finished our third tree house built by Bill ~ co-owner and my husband. He put love into every single nail and board. It is unique in that it has play elements like a slide, 2 swings and double loft. He made 50% of the tree house from the land itself using cedars and re-purposed wood and roof from one of the old farmhouses .



*** Important *** No RESCHEDULES or CANCELLATIONS within 30 days of your stay! This is a strict policy! As a small business, we are no longer able to accept cancels or reschedules unless it is a death in the immediate family! However you are able to transfer it to someone else that is 21+. If it‚Äôs outside 30 days before your stay and you absolutely need to cancel or reschedule your date, there is a $75.00 Change of reservation fee. We DO NOT accept CANCELLATIONS beyond 30 days, RAIN OR SHINE. Please DO NOT call if you are cancelling weather related.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
285 acres of rolling trails. Approximately 7.9 miles to be exact. You can hike, walk or mountain bike if advanced. There are also a kids fishing ponds. A three person hammock on hidden trail and 10 hobbit tree houses to find hidden in the trees on Hobbit trail. Find the tree pod along cabana trail.

Play in 2 largest land slides of Ky 150 feet long!

Newest trail is Jacobs Ladders Trail in honor of my late nephew killed in a motorcycle accident. Guests from all over the world bring a chime to hang in memory of someone', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
From your car is 10 second walk to the tree house. Bring your ice we have a cooler. There is charcoal grill outside and inside camp stove.

If it is snow you may need to park at top of hill. It is about 200 feet walk down on gravel. We recommend four wheel or front wheel drive or simply park at the top of the hill']

Title: Pioneer Cabins + Luxury Treehouse  with Lakeviews
Description:
['About this space', 'A collection of 2 pioneer built cabins (moved and rebuilt at this location in 2003) and a luxury treehouse on 12 wooded, private and gated acres. The breathtaking lake views await you at once you step out on to the back porch of the main cabin.
The property sleeps up to 14 people, yet each structure is on the smaller side and brimming with character!', 'The space', 'The space
Perfect for couples or families who want to be together but still need some privacy! The large screened in porch has incredible views of the hilltop across the lake, and don‚Äôt miss the hot tub, outdoor shower, horseshoe pit, and extra large fire pit seating area. The porch bed swing is the most popular place to relax with a good book!
I loved the challenge of renovating these structures and bringing
luxury to a rustic setting! The string lights will guide you down the steps to a fabulous view of the water off the back of the property. Kitchens are fully equipped to cook a great meal, and the treehouse boasts a Keurig coffee station with a small fridge for leftovers from the main meal!
Wood burning fireplaces and coziness await! Take a soak in the jacuzzi tub,
then head outside to listen to the sounds of the deep woods and see the sky full of stars‚Ä¶
Sligo Marina is 10 minutes away where you can rent a pontoon for the day, and Burgess Falls has the most incredible hiking and waterfalls also 10 minutes away. There are many beautiful nature parks also nearby! Come enjoy the finest of Tennessee treasures‚Ä¶']

Title: Treehouse perched in the forest
Description:
['About this space', 'A treehouse 4 m from the ground where you will sleep in the intoxicating smells of wood. Here nature gives you all its secrets, without electricity, with dry toilets and well water, a return to springs away from the world. Village at 1km.

NEW !
In winter, Philippe offers extra heating for warm evenings in the hut.', 'The space', 'The space
Philippe and C√©cile built this spruce cabin, made of douglas and insulated with straw, it offers rustic comfort. The 25-square-metre platform is accessed via a milled staircase. There is everything you need to sleep, rest and have fun for children : a sofa bed, games, reading, a small table and two Chilean girls for the terrace ..
When handing over the keys, a bottle of water, 4 cups, a garbage bag and a battery lamp will be provided. All you have to do is plan your picnic and bedding kit.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
In a forest of 10,000 m¬≤, a zip line, games, branches to make huts will delight young and old alike.
A picnic table, a dry toilet, a pump on the well for a toilet in the wild.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
At an altitude of 940 m, nights can be cool !
C√©cile and Philippe recommend that you come equipped with a warm down.
For your winter evenings, if you'd like, you'll be offered extra heating for ‚Ç¨5 for refuelling.

We also rent a lovely "Ecological House Gorges de l 'Ard√®che " in Chauzon.
You can find all of our rentals on airbnb.']

Description:
['About this space', 'Come sleep among the trees and spend your days hunting and/or hiking on more than 130 acres of land!great place to bring your dad to hunt he can keep up fire while you hunt he will see deer guarantee-from glass sliding door great shot he will see more than you jan 20/2020 now making syrup come see taste', 'The space', 'The space
Very quite no one around all woods only noise maybe a airplane no roads or house,s within one mile very secluded pets welcome please have crate and pee pads. Do not leave pets unattended', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
For deer hunting price Is 50$ extra per person a day .lots of deer', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We have two twin beds. There is an out side bath room. If you need shower come to our house! (At this time with the COVID going around,we do not allow taking showers at our house.) We will supply drinking spring water.we have generator for 25$ run time about 7 hr.']
