Title: Ecotoo+tree room pres de la Plage de Juan y Lolo
Description:
['About this space', 'You will appreciate this bungalow for its privileged location (Playita beach is at 75 mts) it is perfect for couples with 2 children.The large garden has 2 traditional bungalows made of palm wood, comfortable with small kitchen (fridge and gas stove 3 fires) bathroom, open air shower, queen bed, 4 chairs with table on the terrace as well as a bench with cushions and comfortable armchair inside..NEW AND UNIQUE A L.G. 2nd BEDROOM (full bed) IN ARBRE.Wifi 1 USD/24h.', 'The space', 'The space
New and unique in Las Galeras la chambrarbre....a queen bed mosquito net in a bedroom perched in a tree. Also all the construction as well as the philosophy of the deco is based on ecology and recovery, green tellurian tray for wastewater treatments....In the garden there are banana trees , 1 guava tree, 2 tamarind trees, 2 almond trees, 2 cherry trees country , passion fruit, 1 moringa, 3 coconut trees 1 gina and 1 avocado....', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The garden is to be shared between the 2 bungalows but each has its own privacy and privilege.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We can arrange your pick-up with a taxi from all airports in the country....
Paid Wifi has 1 USD / day.']

Title: Robin Hood Cabin
Description:
['About this space', 'The Robin Hood Cabin is ideal for a family or a group of friends of 4 people.
It is available from 3pm and must be released by 10am.', 'The space', "The space
The campsite les Castors is located in the valley of the Doller in Alsace
Stay wooden hut, wooden hut in the trees, wooden hut on water, wooden cottages, mobile home, Alsatian cottages, cottages by the lake ...


The campsite les Castors in the Haut-Rhin in Alsace is ideally located at the entrance of (F) 68116 Guewenheim, at the foot of the Vosges in the Valley of the Doller between Masevaux and the Pont d 'Aspach.
This campsite of 4 Hectares has 170 pitches including 36 rentals, everything is together so that you have a pleasant stay.
It is placed on the edge of forests and river, with a pond designed for natural swimming as well as for fishing.
20 minutes from Mulhouse, 5 minutes from the A36, the campsite les Castors welcomes you in a green site. It will ensure you peace and quiet.
You will find large pitches of 100 m¬≤, a playground for children, a volleyball field, petanque, many activities and events will be proposed to you."]

Title: Casa da Mouta - Douro Valley
Description:
['About this space', 'House with 2 bedrooms and an ideal room for families, overlooking the Douro River. Good sunlight, an equipped kitchen, a living room with a TV and a playstation and a covered terrace for meals and leisure. The house is set on a farm with vineyards, fruit trees, aromatic herbs and vegetable gardens. On the farm there is an infinity pool and a treehouse that enchants children. Nearby there is the Casa de E√ßa de Queiroz, the Caminhos de Jacinto, the Termas de Ar√™gos and the Douro River.', 'The space', 'The space
Quiet and quiet space, great for resting. Guests can enjoy the farm, go hiking or get to know this region by bike. In the surroundings have good regional restaurants.', 'Guest access', "Guest access
Guests will see the entire farm, and can even take part in rural activities if it's of interest to you.", 'Licence number', 'Licence number
74231/AL']

Title: Large wooden house. ENSUE√ëOS. Little Corn Island
Description:
['About this space', 'Here we are in the middle of nature, facing the sea and the forest... If you like nature, you will fall in love with Dreams.
The Canadian house was built by two Canadian friends in wood. Features two separate bedrooms, a functional kitchenette, and a spacious terrace overlooks the ocean.', 'The space', 'The space
Choose destinations that are friendly with the environment.
Valance your flight CO2 footprint with a 100% ecological destination.

The money that you pay to stay at Ensue√±os will be of much help to protect 1/10th of this island‚Äôs forests and coasts.

Ensue√±os uses just alternative sources of energy -sun and wind- and we recicle all that wastes that we produce. We have a lovely permaculture garden. We grow our veggies with no artificial fertilizers nor pesticides. We have plenty fruit trees and we enjoy a peaceful and harmonic existance with all beings around.

Of you are comming to Little Corn Island, we invite you to know our simple way of life. We can happily share with you the ‚Äúmagic‚Äù secrets to take care of our planet and enjoy a quite and healthy existence.

Choosing traveling destinations that are fully respectful with nature, contributing to its environmental valance is the wisest thing that we could all do when we decide to go and discover the world in a respectful & sustainable way.', '', 'Guest access
Dreams is a natural space with many common areas: the garden, the beach, the forest. It is only expected in return, the respect nature deserves.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note

Valance your flight CO2 footprint with a 100% ecological destination.

The money that you pay to stay at Ensue√±os will be of much help to protect 1/10th of this island‚Äôs forests and coasts.

We grow our veggies with no artificial fertilizers nor pesticides. We have plenty fruit trees and we enjoy a peaceful and harmonic existance with all beings around.

Of you are comming to Little Corn Island, we invite you to know our simple way of life. We can happily share with you the ‚Äúmagic‚Äù secrets to take care of our planet and enjoy a quite and healthy existence.

Choosing traveling destinations that are fully respectful with nature, contributing to its environmental valance is the wisest thing that we could all do when we decide to go and discover the world in a respectful & sustainable way.']

Title: The Dogwood in Treehouse Grove at Norton Creek
Description:
['About this space', 'Towering above the Grove is the Dogwood Treehouse. This grand treehouse provides the endless joy of a day up in the canopy, looking down and out upon the forest around you. Your personal cabin in the sky is built with the finest techniques acquired over a lifetime of effort by Pete Nelson of the Treehouse Masters TV show. The quality and attention to detail found in the Dogwood will remove your stress, clear your mind, and fill your soul with life.', 'The space', 'The space
A sturdy staircase leads you to the Dogwood and its covered viewing area. Feel free to spend some time sitting here, looking out at the other treehouses in the Grove below you. There is a serene beauty in this area, where modern man and nature unite in the harmony so many have dreamed of. You will experience this feeling during your stay with us.
The interior of the Dogwood is tastefully furnished and decorated with wooden features. The bedroom offers a comfortable area with quality bedding. Your bathroom is complete with a frameless rainfall shower that feels luxurious.
First-rate ceramic dishware lets you prepare a meal in the kitchenette. Have you ever sipped a warm apple cider while sitting in a treehouse in the winter or a fine spiced wine on the viewing deck in summer? No matter what time of year it is, your treehouse is kept at the perfect temperature by a green HVAC system.
Your perfect getaway is waiting. Book today!', 'Guest access', 'Guest access', '', 'Other things to note
As much as we love pets and our furry friends, Treehouse Grove abides by a strict no-pet policy.']

Title: Imbana, paradise cabin on the Pacific.
Description:
['About this space', 'It is a cabin built with local construction techniques;
the roof is woven in bitter Palma and has a mixture of local woods such as Choib√°, Guayac√°n and Flor Morado.

It has a dry bath, garden in Zoteas and surfboards for those who want to learn.', 'The space', 'The space
-The bathroom is outside the house and is a compost bathroom that requires a particular use that will be explained to you and we ask you to follow the instructions with the respective attention.

- Every day Hermes will come - the lady who takes care of the house - to do the toilet ‚Äì the schedule depends on the tides, but she will communicate to them.

- If you want to lease the tables we coordinate it beforehand.

- Surf lessons can be coordinated at Thermal Baths.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note

Title: Llama Meadows Farm Purple Palace TinyTreehouse
Description:
['About this space', 'Our Purple Palace TinyTreeHouse here at Llama Meadows Peace Farm: We welcome all who wish to find the nurturing peace and solitude of nature at Our Peaceful Organic Retired Llama Farm, we no longer have llamas. We truly enjoyed raising Llamas for 24 years, our oldest one live to be 25 years and 10 days old here in Beautful Benzie County. .A True Camping Experience
The tree house is nice & cozy just right for 1 or 2 people, Children 7 yrs or older are welcome with parents. Limit is two.', 'The space', 'The space

Accommodations that are created, they are made from natural materials (wood, straw, earth, stone, wax, ...), which are found in the vicinity and are therefore best suited for the place of residence.

Tree house is in the top 20 tree houses in the world! Im so proud!

I built it with LOVE!

House "Ramona" I built for all seasons. Winter spring, summer, autumn
In the old days, when we still lived in closer contact with nature were homes still much smaller, but still comfortable, nice, dry and regulated. Serve as a man instead of a man serving him, as is happening today.
House, which I have built is for lovers, enthusiasts of open windows in love with nature, beautiful views and freedom.
It also means cheap, if not free home that you can afford each. If such a man leaves home, with time itself recycled, composted, That kind of freedom is no trash in nature.

Tree house made from natural materials-wood in a natural environment.
The use of wood is environmentally friendly and can not cause ecological disasters. House is brown green (like a house which owns the mom) and does not interfere with the surroundings.
,,,socializing with their peers, friends, deter them from computers - computer games, phones ... At the same time encourage the attitude to nature, authentic games and learn about nature and a return to traditional values-talk , sincerity, order in nature, a healthy environment, clean air ....
The house I built for my nephew Vid.

The idea of living in a tree stems from religion, philosophy and mythology of ancient
peoples from ancient Egypt to China and Central America.
The tree is like an emanation of the very magnificent. Because of their size, strength, length
and the diversity of life forms constitute the subject of endless inspiration and
admiration. With roots in the earth and branches in the air represents the physical link between
heaven and earth (and symbolic link between heaven and hell).
The tree is a strong role model, an inspiration for the creation of ancient building structures;
without trees probably would not be without pillars are not temples in early architecture. tree
represents a model of Gothic architecture.
Nature is the most complete and creative designer. Therefore, it is an inexhaustible source of inspiration
artists, designers and architects, who always resort to imitation
these priceless creations. I created a work of art tree house "Ramona"


The wall of the house draws attention to the problems of forests. The satellite imagery is clear that all disappearing faster largest forest in the world, the Brazilian rain forest. He also called the lungs of the planet, as produces more than 20 percent of oxygen on Earth.

save energy
care for cleanliness

As it has been said in Ramones song :"Too though to die."

Let your heart beats in the natural rhythm of the tree brother and sister Julia and Jacob.
-The house will accepted you with its charm, warmth and arms and heart wide open.
Breathe with nature, be aware that we depend on nature, not technology!

Here‚Äôs how trees make a difference:
Trees improve air quality by producing oxygen. They also store carbon, offsetting harmful byproducts of fossil-fuel burning.
They moderate the effects of sun and wind, and they clean the air by trapping dust, pollen and other pollutants.
Planted in the right places around buildings, trees can significantly reduce air-conditioning costs. This means less Freon, an inflammable and odorless chemical emitted from air conditioners. It is considered to have damaging effects to the ozone layer.
Trees increase property value.
Trees generate jobs and contribute raw materials for buildings, newspapers, books, etc. They are renewable, biodegradable and recyclable.
They provide shelter and food for wildlife such as birds, squirrels and bugs.
Trees make people feel good. Workers are more productive when they see trees along their commute routes and from their office windows.
Landscapes that include trees help relax us, lower heart rates and reduce stress.']

Title: Secluded, Romantic Tree House Retreat
Description:
['About this space', 'Pamoon is a contemporary style treehouse sleeping 2, with stunning views of Pigeon Mountain. Nestled within the tranquil hills and valleys of the Appalachian Mountains of North-West Georgia, it is surrounded by natural beauty and panoramic backdrops within its very own 15 acres of private woodland and walking trails.', 'The space', 'The space
For a video tour of the Tree House, 'Pamoon', visit our website:
lifeshouldbe.net

PLEASE NOTE: We are unable to accommodate check-in on the following days; Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, New Years Day, Memorial Day, July 4th, Labor Day, Thanksgiving & Sundays.

Pamoon boasts a light and airy open plan living space with modern, fully equipped kitchen. The bedroom has its own screened in porch for relaxing and taking in those stunning views. Our beautifully decorated bathroom has a full size shower with luxurious bathrobes for your comfort.

You will find the gas bbq on the rear deck along with seating and sun loungers. Our beautiful, calming Japanese Ofuro soaking tub, situated on a separate relaxation area amongst the trees, is a big hit with all of our guests.

This heated cedar tub has no jets, which leads to a beautifully calming experience, the perfect way to cleanse the mind and soul in the natural surroundings. A tin roof covering this space adds to the experience when rain or snow decides to fall.

Take time to walk the peaceful wooded trails on your secluded 15 acres that are home to deer, turkey and the beautiful Red Cardinals.

Life should be...living alongside nature.

In the evenings as the sun sets, spend time by the fire pit, perfect for roasting s'mores and relaxing with a loved one, sipping cocktails and enjoying quiet conversation.

Whatever you choose to do with your time, just relaxing or hiking and exploring, rest assured, you will make many wonderful memories at Pamoon. Our hidden gem will offer you peace, seclusion and privacy for your well-being and the chance to just sit back, take a moment and re-charge.

Our property management team are close by if you have any issues or queries during your stay ‚Äì we are very lucky to have them as our neighbours.

For your arrival information, the tree house is situated at the end of a long driveway. The first part of the drive is shared with our two other vacation homes but then splinters off with sign posting, leading to your very own hideaway in the trees.
Amenities include:

- Covered Japanese Ofuro Soaking Tub, heated all year round (the water is replaced, and the tub is sanitised ready for each new guest).
Please Note: This is not a traditional hot tub/jacuzzi and has no jets.

- Bedroom, sleeps 2, Comfortable mattress and good quality linens. Hairdryer provided.

- Open plan living area/kitchen.

- Wireless internet, WiFi. Due to our rural location the internet speed can be slower than in urban areas.

- 43" 4K Ultra HD Resolution Smart TV with 'HULU' streaming service.

- Fully-equipped kitchen, full-size stove, fridge/freezer, microwave, dishes, pots, cutlery, Glassware, dishwasher, Coffee maker (Keurig & Drip) and toaster.

- Dining table for two.

- Gas BBQ on Rear Deck (gas & utensils provided).

- Fire Pit and Seating (wood provided)

- Outdoor Hook and Ring game

- Laundry closet with full-size separate washer and dryer.

- All Linens/towels and soaking tub towels provided.

- Large, enclosed shower unit with detachable shower head. Unisex bathrobes provided.

- Fully furnished throughout by a professional interior designer.

Note : Pamoons' interior and exterior has been designed with adults in mind. Our home has no child safety locks on doors/windows and the soaking tub area is not gated.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Parking on Site', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
Pamoons' interior and exterior has been designed with adults in mind. Our home has no child safety locks on external or internal doors and the soaking tub area is not gated.

The Japanese soaking tub is a heated, calming experience. It does not have jets like a traditional hot tub. It is emptied and sanitized after each departing guest."]

Title: The Treehouse of Borgo Stazione Salionze
Description:
['About this space', 'You can experience the thrill of sleeping at a height of 5 metres, among the leaves of the great linden tree.
The suite is built entirely of wood and furnished with natural materials, in line with our eco-friendly philosophy.
A very comfortable king size bed, an area with an exposed shower and bathtub, and a living area with a sofa bed, LED TV, a corner infusions, and a minibar. The terrace, exclusive area for guests of the suite, is an extraordinary observatory of the sky and the river landscape.', 'The space', 'The space
Uniqueness and hospitality in an old station, returned to life to live a green vacation, on two wheels, surrounded by extraordinary nature.
You can choose the type that best fits your needs, one of the rooms built in the double or family station, a mini apartment or the Tree House Suite 5 meters from the ground.
You will find a full service dedicated to cyclists, and discover the territory with a sustainable approach by renting electric bicycles or bringing your own.
The outdoor pool in the heart of the village will allow you to relax in the reflecting body of the sky, you can choose to relax your muscles after a day spent cycling in the heated whirlpool (up to 35¬∞ in winter) or simply stay in the sun on our solarium.
A SPA area for exclusive use can end your days of relaxation (service included for the Tree Suite).', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
An indoor parking lot will welcome your car, being a little close to the A4 Peschiera exit (Valeggio direction) it will be easy to find us along Via del Garda on the right side.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
WANT A SURPRISE Or ARE YOU CELEBRATING A SPECIAL DATE?
We can offer support and suggestions: a bottle of bubbly, a cake or a bouquet of flowers, your favorite photos, or a romantic setup.

DO YOU WANT TO BOOK YOUR BIKE ON THE DAY OF YOUR ARRIVAL?
E-bikes, muscles, mountain bikes, or racing bikes?

Send us a message! (services for a fee).']

Title: Full bath, Seclusion, Mtn View- Kitchen, Fireplace
Description: ['About this space', 'Woodberry‚Äôs Farm Treehouse! Retreat to total seclusion and privacy at the far side of our 94 acre farm. Tucked away in the trees on a ridge is a fully functional, 380 sf treehouse with a small kitchen, full bath with double shower heads. Relax on the wrap around deck, soak in the distant mountain views. Hang the hammocks from below or fire up the pit for s‚Äômores. Lounge on the sofa in front of the gas fireplace, play some board games or watch a movie. Cook together or hike to the on-site lake.', 'The space', 'The space\nGuests will have the privacy and exclusive use of the entire treehouse. Located at the back end of our 94 acre farm which neighbors several thousand undeveloped acres, guests are guaranteed a true getaway. When you step through the French, mahogany doors you are faced with a 9‚Äôx20‚Äô span of glass wall looking out over the valley to the distant mountains. The 380 square foot floor plan has a 5x8 full bath with double head shower tiled in antique, reclaimed roofing slate. The jade basin sink sits atop a real tree root retrofitted to accommodate it. The kitchenette is also tiled in the reclaimed roofing slate and has a mini fridge, microwave, toaster, gas stove with small oven and coffee service. The dining space is graced with a beautiful Italian marble bar table with a reclaimed wood base. The cozy living area has a relaxing gas fireplace and the sofa is super comfortable. Stretch out in the king size bed with memory foam mattress. The wrap around deck features a longe area, a high top dining set. Grab the hammocks and hang them under the treehouse or go for a hike and find your perfect spot. Guests are also welcome to take the short hike to our private four acre lake. Perfect spot for a picnic and you can use our canoes and paddles. Bring fishing gear, if you like. You can catch and release or have a fish fry.', '', '']

In the heart of a small wood You will be charmed by this studio recently furnished in a shed. Its exceptional situation will allow you to visit our beautiful Basque Country. You will be in the middle of the campaign while being

Title: Glamping at Deer Camp
Description:
['About this space', 'This is a complete glamping experience! Think tiny house. This 12x12 tree house is equipped with an outdoor kitchen, a table for two, lounger and chair, wifi, smart TV with Netflix, Hulu and showtime, HBO now. air conditioning, board games, books, comfy queen bed, air conditions, gas log, coffee, greenhouse bathhouse, and fire pit.
It is located just 16.2 miles from Fall Creek Falls State Park and 9 miles from Savage Gulf Natural Area on the Cumberland Plateau.
And now with an outdoor theater!', 'The space', "The space
This glamping experience will give you something to talk about for a long while. Close to great hiking trails in both Savage Gulf and Fall Creek Falls State Park, secluded in the woods, yet close (3 miles to dollar general and 12 mikes to Walmart) to a few groceries and gas, if you love glamping, you'll love it at Deer Camp!
The cabin is 12'x12' and every piece of furniture has been specifically chosen for your experience. It is COZY!!! Besides the queen bed and lounger, there's a table for two, a chair, a gas log fireplace, throws and throw pillows to snuggle up in. Board games and books and a smart TV with Hulu and showtime, Netflix, and HBOnow are the various forms of entertainment, or you can sit around the fire pit and make s'mores or roast hot dogs or just tell ghost stories. Or if you have the talent, bring your guitar and play a few songs. Now, we've just added an outdoor theater: This is a nighttime experience with hammock chairs, cozy blankets, propane fire ring, and big screen with projector and a amazon fire stick with all the shows and movies you love. This experience is available rain or moonlight and will be for use from March through December. Please turn off the propane fire ring when not using the theater.
Coffee can be made in the 12 cup stainless percolator or the pour over method is available. Or make hot cocoa or hot tea.
Showering offers its own experience in the greenhouse bathhouse with the on demand, unlimited hot water camp shower. This is its own experience. Have you ever showered in a greenhouse? With a gas log fireplace?
And the entire camp is lit up with string lights. So even if you need a trip to the bathhouse at night, the rock path is well lit when you turn on the porch light.
It's glamping. All the feels of camping without the work. The camp kitchen is stocked with pans and paper plate and cups and utensils, you have a warm bed to crawl into, firewood is provided for the fire pit, coffee and hot beverages are provided, and soft towels in the bath house. All of the camping experience without camp neighbors and without the packing. Just bring your clothes and food and enjoy this unique experience!
And if you sit quietly on the porch, you're almost certain to see many forms of wildlife. If you don't see it, you'll certainly hear the coyotes yipping and howling and the owls hooting. A bear sighting is possible as is a bob cat and / or coyote (both sighted in the middle of day running through camp) and seeing deer is almost a certainty. There are mountain lion, though they are the most reclusive of all.", '', '', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
There is cold running water in the outdoor kitchen via a spigot (and because it's 8' off the ground, once you turn it on, it takes about 5 seconds to get water). There is hot water in the bathhouse.
You do have to cook outside.
Camp plates, cups, cooking pans and utensils are provided.
There is a complete hot beverage station with coffee, tea, and cocoa.
A cooler and ice are provided.
It's just almost an oxymoron: it's a 12x12 but you have lots of space. Between the various stations inside the cabin to the fire pit to the outdoor kitchen and bathhouse, there's plenty of living space.
Yes, pets are allowed at Deer Camp. We do love and welcome fur babies! However, due to the allergens of future guests and the extra cleaning that must done, there is a pet fee of $60 - $100 based on weight that is separate from the cleaning fee. Pets must remain on a leash per TN state law when outside. Pets are not be left alone inside the cabin. Please either take them with you or if you need to leave them behind, travel with a crate. We have very strict time constraints between guests and we do not have time to make these types of repairs in this time frame. Even the most well behaved fur babies experience anxiety when left alone in a strange place.

Check in is 4pm Central Standard Time. Check out is at 11am Central Standard Time. This is not optional unless prior arrangements have been made as we have to have time to prepare for the next guests. And we do ask to please be respectful of these."]

Title: Massanutten Rustic Cabin with Views
Description:
['About this space', 'COVID-19 UPDATE: We're still open for guests. Place has been cleaned and disinfected with commercial-grade cleaning products.
#############################

A simple, yet comfortable small shaker cabin placed in the middle of the Massanutten Mountain with views to die for of the Shenandoah River and National Park. Wake up to the sight of the magnificent "Blue Ridge Mountains" and the town of Luray, VA from 1,500 feet.', 'The space', 'The space
We debated long and hard whether to list this place on airbnb. After all, this is our hideaway, with a view that regretfully only a few will ever get to enjoy. But because we love it so much, and in the spirit of the sharing economy, we felt compelled to open its doors to others and allow you to experience the wonderful warmth that this small and rustic cabin will bring to your soul, your heart and your sight. While here, every sense is lifted, every smell improved, every sound a symphony.

If you're looking for modern comfort and the latest gadgets, this is not your place. Instead, if you want to warm yourself up, you'll need to place wood in the stove. If you want to check the latest stock prices, you'll need to call your broker because Internet is NOT available. If you want to watch TV in your room, please look elsewhere.

However, if you prefer to wake up to the most extraordinary sunrise in your life, simply sleep on the futon couch and open up your eyes in the early morning. If you find delight while hearing the buzz of a hummingbird, just place a few seeds in the balcony. If you want to reconnect with your inner self, seat in one of the shaker rocking chairs, pull up your legs and open that book you always wanted to complete. If you're lucky, you may even see a black bear or two roaming around (no worries, they are not dangerous).

The Cabin is located at about 1,500 feet overlooking the Shenandoah River, the town of Luray, and the "Blue Ridge Mountains." The view is a feast to the eyesight. But don't stop there. Visit the Luray Caverns, 6 minutes at the bottom of the hills. Hike to your heart's content on the Massanutten (Stephen) Trail a mile above or in one of the dozens other nearby paths. Bring a road bike and challenge yourself to the top of the mountain. Go horse back riding. Explore the Virginia wine country. Or just...relax.

Welcome to a place where time has finally slowed down!', '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Q & A:

Q: Why do you rent this place?
A: We use it one month per year at most. Why keep this jewel to ourselves? Please enjoy it as if it's your place as well.

Q: Why is there no Internet?
A: I work in the high-tech sector. I am connected 24/7. I wanted a place where time stands still, be close to nature, and could truly get away from it all. We want to share not only the place, but the experience as well.

Q: What if I need something from you?
A: Just send me a text message or give me a ring. You'll get my number after your booking is confirmed.

Q: The fridge is very small, will we starve to death?
A: Hey, no drama here. Yes, the fridge is small, but there is also an ice cooler you may use. Simply bring your own ice and please drain it before leaving. That should keep you alive for a bit longer :-)

Q: Should I bring sheets and towels?
A: No worries. We will provide bedding and towels, blankets, soap, shampoo and toilet paper. If you need anything else, please let me know and I will do anything in my power to have it ready before your arrival.

Q. Nice wood stove, do I can have to purchase firewood?
A. No need to do so. I usually provide plenty of firewood for my guests. You may find it in the back deck. Please cover the wood with the tarp after you're done to protect it from the rain and allow other guests to warm themselves too :-)

Q: I love this place, can I extend my stay?
A: If available, sure, knock yourself out. Simply get to an internet cafe or use your smart phone and book again. But please contact me beforehand out of courtesy.

Q: Great decoration, what style is it?
A: Shaker style. From wikipedia, "Shaker furniture is a distinctive style of furniture developed by the United Society of Believers in Christ's Second Appearing, commonly known as Shakers, a religious sect that had guiding principles of simplicity, utility and honesty. Their beliefs were reflected in the well-made furniture of minimalist designs." We are not shakers, but we are guided by the same principles.

Q. What's the sleeping situation?
A. Well, you're welcome to sleep any way you'd like :-) But to be more specific, there are two bedrooms, both with full-size beds. One bedroom has a platform bed with a memory foam mattress, and the other one a Murphy bed with a memory foam topper. There are also two full-size futons located next to the stove in the living room. If you're not into futons, there is also a comfy inflatable full-size bed found in the closet where the Murphy bed is. Please take your pick.

Q. There are no bathroom faucets!
A. Mmm, that wasn't a question, but yes they're there. These faucets and vanity were a DIY project of my own design using copper piping and shut-off valves and reclaimed wood. Just turn the valves one quarter of the way counterclockwise to open the water supply. Pretty cool, hugh?

Q. Is the Cabin self-sustainable?
A. Not yet, but I'm working on it. With your booking contribution, I created a system to capture rain water to the cistern below (the mountain is dry and water is a precious commodity here), and eventually I will install solar panels on the roof. Currently, all waste water goes into a septic tank, so as soon as I implement the above steps, the Cabin will technically be able to be off-grid.

Q. What other environmental measures have you implemented?
A. In addition to capturing water from rain and eventually energy from the sun, I have renovated the bathroom and kitchen using reclaimed wood, some of it from a nearby old farm. The dish and body soaps and most house-cleaning products are environmentally-friendly to help natural decomposition of waste water in the septic system. The floor is made up of natural cork and wood, and the entire place was recently re-insulated to improve energy efficiency. If you'd like to know more about our eco-efforts, please contact me.

Q. Why are there so many water jugs in the kitchen?
A. Drinking water in colorful jugs, as well as the 5-gal dispenser just outside the kitchen, comes from a nearby natural water spring (best tasting water I ever had). I leave plenty of it for you because TAP water is NOT potable. In fact, I ask my guests to be mindful of tap water usage because there is no well or city-piped water source. Instead, water is collected to a cistern below from rain or trucked in (by me) if need be. It is therefore a precious commodity. Simply shut off faucets when not in use, be careful not to leave the toilet running, and take shorter showers if possible. That's it! :-)

Q. How is the house heated?
A. The main source of heat is the wood stove. You'll be surprise how efficient this rustic appliance is. Depending on the temp, it may take a couple of hours to bring the thermometer up to your standard, so exercise a little patience. There is a heat-infused fan and a tea pot on top of the stove. The fan will propagate the heat efficiently and the tea pot (with water) will act as a natural humidifier, making you more comfortable. In addition, there is a wall heater in the kitchen (dial) and another one in the bathroom (switch) that you can control. Finally, a baseboard heater in the entrance hallway will keep the bedrooms (and water pipes) warm. In short, you'll be cozy!

Q. OK, so I will be warm in winter. What about the height of the summer heat?
A. Oh, you'll will be warm in summer alright :-) But seriously, there is an old and fairly inefficient AC wall unit in the dining room. There is also a ceiling fan in the living room and another one in one of the bedrooms. I've found that opening the windows creates a nice airflow that cools the place down. But if you're looking for a in-house refrigerator, this small cabin may not be for you.

Q. What's the deal with you being a Superhost?
A. Well then, since you ask...I'm a Superhost because we're relaxed about our guests despite us having full-time jobs of our own. However, I've come to be rather fond of that "title," and I don't appreciate when a guest leaves a review saying that the place was too isolated, or that the place was not what they expected (there's only about 40 pictures). If a guest does not read the detailed description where I specify the exact distance to places, or the meticulous portrayal of the house, or whatever, then their reviews should be kinder. I truly enjoy 5-star reviews. If there's something you do not like while here, I beg you to let me know and I promise to do what I can to revert your perspective. Remember, communication is king.']

Title: Silent Paradise in a Tree House - Monte Huam Hu
Description:
['About this space', 'In the south Portugal, in the middle of the Alentejo, lies a powerful gem. In the midst of a forest that has been untouched for decades lies the tree house. Ancient cork oaks, olive trees and birds surround you. You sleep in the the pure nature and experience the power, silence and coolness of the forest.
Up on the hill you have a wonderful view. There is an outdoor kitchen with a fireplace, and a shower.
There is the possibility to rent a caravan and to put up your own tent or van.', 'The space', "The space
The area around the tree platform with its seating area is completely private, as well as the toilet there.
The ruin with its open outdoor kitchen and fireplace can be shared. So the composting toilet and the outdoor shower.
Natural places in the forest with hammocks and stumps invite you to linger.
The entire area is freely accessible.

If it's raining, it is possible to put a tarp over the platform. You can also sleep in the ruin.

CATERING ON THE MONTE HUAM HU

Breakfast and Dinner for 15 ‚Ç¨/person

A delicious breakfast with a fantastic view
between 5‚Ç¨ and 7,50‚Ç¨

Vegetarian dinner (often from my own garden): 9,50‚Ç¨

On request there is a midnight snack for 5‚Ç¨/ person under a gigantic starry sky


Own catering in the common outdoor kitchen is also possible (small note: next Minimercado: 11km & supermarket: 35km away)", '', '', '', 'Exempt']

Title: The Dreamweaver at Treehouse Mountain!
Description:
['About this space', "Come relax in the mountains at Treehouse Mountain! Our treehouse has everything you need to enjoy a few days of relaxation. Bring your pup, we are dog friendly too!

This is our first treehouse that is great for a romantic getaway for couples! It comfortably sleeps two with studio style floor plan featuring a queen size bed, but there is a twin sized futon if there's a group of three.", 'The space', "The space
Our treehouse features heating and air conditioning, as well as a Smart TV for Netflix, Hulu, and others with your account. There is also a Bose Bluetooth speaker available for your use.

There is a kitchenette which features a half-size refrigerator, a COLD sink (no hot water in treehouse), a microwave, a coffee maker, a water boiler for tea and hot chocolate, a mini rice cooker, and a toaster. On our wrap-around porch, there is a grill with a side burner for additional cooking needs. **We will provide tea, coffee, creamer, sugar, and coffee mugs, as well as basic cooking items such as rice, salt, pepper, spices, oil, utensils, plates, a pot, a pan and a cast iron skillet.

Located on various parts of the property there are fire pits for your use. We provide fire-starter and firewood for you.

There is a bathhouse 40 yards away from the treehouse which has two hot showers and two bathrooms with hot water, all climate controlled for year-around comfort.


Here at Treehouse Mountain, our goal is to provide everything that we would want if we were to travel to other Airbnbs. During your stay, you can find that we are readily available if there's anything we can help out with or want help planning your trip to the area as well.

If you have questions about any of our treehouse rentals (we have four total), send me a message! We also offer discounts* for military, weekly stay, return guests, or renting more than one treehouse during a stay.

*Guests can use up to two discounts for a reservation*", '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
There is a climate controlled bathhouse just 40 yards from the treehouse that features two bathrooms and two showers. We clean this facility daily. We provide all linens and towels needed as well as soap and shampoo.

The other three treehouses may be booked during your stay and other guests may have dogs off leash on the property because we are fully dog friendly. If this is a concern to you (due to fear of dogs or your dog is not friendly towards other dogs) let me know and I would be glad to request any guests staying to keep their dogs on leash.

Each treehouse has a private fire pit with firewood and starter provided.']

Title: White Mountains Heated Treehouse PLUS Campsites!
Description:
['About this space', "Sleep high or sleep low! Bring your own sleeping pad and a sleeping bag and other creature comforts. This treehouse plus tent sites sits alone on a nearly private acre 100' from the Baker River shore. This is a carry-in/carry-out, full sized sleeping main area for two adults and a loft for two small adults....And a tiny area for kids that a really cool view.

The White Mountains are every where!', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note

Title: Phelps Pharm, I Was Almost A Treehouse
Description: ['About this space', 'The treehouse you always wanted as child but can enjoy as an adult. I started out next to three trees that had to be removed but you still may feel a treehouse sway if the wind blows the right way. We are a working farm raising beef cattle and offer horseback riding lessons, arena rides and trail rides along with kayaking down our local river in McMinnville. Our guests have the opportunity to experience farm life and assist us in gathering eggs, feeding the cows or helping with the horses.', 'The space', 'The space\nThe treehouse has a studio style main floor with a kitchenette that includes a refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, small electric skillet and Keurig coffee pot; Full Bathroom and queen size bed, there is also a loft with a queen size bed. Guests have the option of a family style country breakfast typically served at 8am or can be provided with country eggs and homemade sourdough bread to cook their own breakfast included with your stay. Your choice will be requested at the time of your reservation.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access\nGuests have full access to our farm which encompasses 70 acres for hiking and trail rides. A gas grill is available for guests to use along with an outdoor wood fire pit or a gas for pit on our cover patio. We are centrally located 1 hour from Nashville and Chattanooga in Viola Valley TN. Area attractions include Cumberland Caverns, The Caverns, five plus State Parks and recreational areas for hiking, kayaking, fishing, swimming etc within 30 minutes. We offer horseback riding lessons, arena rides, pasture rides and guided or self guided trail rides for experienced riders. Kayaks are also available for rent during your stay with us.']

Title: White Mountains Treehouse
Description:
['About this space', 'Three room treehouse with huge windows in a reading room area set at the end of a field looking towards Mt Moosilauke. Walking trail to the river is outside your door.
Like camping but better! Surrounded by forest and fields. w/ your own Firepit and new for 2022 ..outdoor shower (with heated water!).
We are a 10 min drive from many trailheads, two access points to the AT and Rumney Rocks (trails and world famous rock climbing). Relax and enjoy your solitude.', 'The space', 'The space
Have a White Mountains farm experience and a tree house stay all at once. Currier Brook farm is a 250+ yr old, 22 acre working farm located along the Baker River. The tree house is located along the forest line in the back pasture. It has three small rooms plus a sleeping nook. One of the rooms has large picture windows for walls and makes for a comfortable space to read while enjoying the outdoors inside. The tree house is equipped with a camping propane stove, cast iron skillets, utensils, plates, bowls, drinking vessels and potable water containers. **We provide an ample supply of potable water at the treehouse. There is an indoor composting toilet and a solar shower bag. Fire ring and charcoal grill are also at the tree house area. Enjoy walking, running or mountain biking along the extensive old railroad trail that cuts through the farm and goes from Montreal to Central NH. Like hiking or climbing? We are 10 mins from Rumney Rocks, Mt Moosilauke, and sections of the AT. Planning to hike the AT and need a ride to the farm? We may be able to provide transport with advance notice. The treehouse is far enough away from the workings of the farm and the farm house that you can expect privacy unless you initiate a visit to the farm area. You will need to walk in all of your belongings unless we are available to use the lawn tractor and trailer to take it back. It is a 5 minute walk from where you will park. NO ELECTRICITY. Bring your headlamps, lanterns, etc ***NEW*** Propane heater buddy available (safe to use inside). Propane provided. If you decide to use there will be a $10 charge for propane.
Note: You may or may not be able to drive to the treehouse (it depends on time of year and how wet the drive is. There is a cart at the parking area about a 5 minute walk from treehouse. New for 2022! Private outdoor shower house. Solar charging station for your devices. Wood for the firepit provided (additional charge per bundle). Propane provided for indoor cook stove and an indoor propane heater for those cool mornings and evenings.', '', '', '', '']

Title: NORTH DECK CABIN 3 - Sea View, Air/Con, Private
Description:
['About this space', 'Perched on the side of the lush green Northern Range forest, adults can unwind, bird watch, savor the sunset or soak in the sounds and beautiful sea view of the peaceful North Coast. Perfectly surrounded by nature to focus, regroup, relax or simply switch off. Nearby hiking trails to beaches. Only 12 minutes by car to the famous Maracas Bay.', 'The space', 'The space
Your own private cabin floating in the trees with breathtaking sea views. Brand new with modern finishes, high ceilings, amazing engineering. No trees were cut or damaged. North Deck is next door and you can check out the building of North Deck from the beginning on YouTube - https://youtu.be/EAiWzC-njkE', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
All the common areas as well as North Deck where there are lots of hummingbirds and other type of birds including toucans.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We also offer a service where we can go to the supermarket and pick up whatever food supplies you would like and have your private kitchen in your cabin fully stocked for your arrival.']

Title: Unique tree house on Lake Malchiner See
Description:
['About this space', 'The rustic tree house with a direct view of Lake Malchin invites you to enjoy the lake panorama or a wonderful sunset from the terrace or the balcony.

On request additional sleeping space available for children (boat available with sleeping cabin in the garden).', 'The space', 'The space
It consists of a living room with a double bed and a small kitchen.
Even a satellite TV is available in the house. There is also a flushing toilet in the tree house. An outdoor shower of course with warm water is located below the tree house on the spacious terrace. The treehouse also has an upper terrace with direct views of Lake Malchin.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Tree House and Terrace', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note

Title: Innatural Land
Description:
['About this space', "The Gaia association organizes an experience in the woods, a stone's throw from the Franciscan route, between Gubbio and Assisi, for people who want to regain contact with nature.
Sleep close to the communal kitchen and bathroom, but surrounded by the wild nature of the central Apennines, with a maximum of 10-15 other guests.
Trails and routes with online maps, on foot, on horseback or by bicycle, right on CAI's path n2 and within walking distance of the San Francesco trail", 'The space', 'The space
The farmhouse where we live, is in a completely isolated valley, with a beautiful view of Gubbio and the largest Christmas tree in the world, but only a 10 minute drive from the village, 30 minutes from Perugia, 40 from Assisi and 20 minutes from the E45.
The silence, the night darkness and the completely uncontaminated vegetation make this place perfect for those who love relaxing in nature, walking in the woods and rediscovering a lifestyle that connects us to the times of nature.
Near the house there is a kitchen area, a space covered by a large vineyard, a common area with a stove, fridge, sink and worktop, to spread out the pizza to be cooked in the wood-burning oven or to be cooked on the grill with the large barbecue.
At 7 km there is one of the best restaurants in the area, quality food and reasonable prices, in agreement with the property.
In front of the kitchen area, there is a large lawn in the shade of large cherries and hazelnuts, with hammocks, sofas , chairs and tables for every need of relaxation or work, wifi is on request and is not recommended for use :)
There are several pitches available for tents or tent trolleys, both near the shared kitchen and the services, which are about fifty meters away from each other.
The curtains present with mattress, are an extra 10‚Ç¨ per night, for sheets and blankets, it takes an additional 10‚Ç¨.
If you want to book the treehouse, write a message and we will give you the availability
There are then in the vicinity of the parking lot, some pitches for campers and caravans, close to the services, without the possibility of discharging the black water for now, nor connect to the electricity network, except for emergencies.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Gingerbread Tree House In the Sky- Nature in Sync.
Description:
['About this space', 'The Gingerbread Tree house is the biggest&most unique tree house in the Caribbean located in the parish of St. Mary on the island of Jamaica. Nestled among numerous fruit trees is The PGBT tree house sturdily affixed in a mango tree Fifty feet above the river.The Tree house is 30ft. x30ft. with two loft‚Äôs ,with king and queen beds, Kitchen , Bar&large Dining room table seating eight persons with plenty of elbow room &a large bathroom.A private bed room with queen size bed, and private bathroom.', 'The space', 'The space
A Veranda with table for two in an intimate setting overlooking the river below. Opposite side of the tree house is a table overlooking the river below and mountains above which can seat eight.Fruits are available to our guests when in season. Pick mangos from inside the tree house. The rope bridge (160ft) supported steel cables and one inch ropes leading to the tree house entrance.The spectacular view is very therapeutic; the sound of the river is music to the soul.
A History
A huge mango tree, beckoned me to come build a tree house on its huge branches. The tree bordered a river overlooking a mountain range. I took the challenge!!!!!! I built the frame on the ground using 4x4‚Äôs, sandwiched by2x6‚Äôs, 20 feet long, bolted together. Workers pulled up the 20 feet by hand 50 feet above the ground. The beams were put onto the huge branches and bolted together. I used primitive tools with no level or square. The support beams below were sturdy and strong. Chains holding up the tree house from above adding even more support which made the uneven slanted tree house, strong and sturdy .To keep the weight to a minimum the lightest material available was used, every scraps found a place.No lumber was wasted. I kept building, adding on the 20 ft. frame. Verandas were added making the tree house a huge 30ft by 30 feet. The sides of the tree house were left open for the wind to blow through.Being 50 feet above the ground meant no peeping Toms to worry about.The tree house took years to build and it is still being worked on. Good better best, never let it rest, until the good is better, and the better best. I am a perfectionist, we never seem to finish, we just run out of time.

The PGBT Tree house was designed and built by a Vietnam Veteran who served with the 173rd. Airborne Brigade in Vietnam in 1965-1966 as a Forward Observer-Infantry.', '', '']

Title: Finca Valeria treehouses Jungle
Description:
['About this space', 'Have you always dreamed of sleeping in the trees? As wrapped by the forest, you will enjoy a view at 380¬∞ without leaving your bed .
The sounds of tropical birds, the cracking of frogs , the cries of howling monkeys will punctuate your awakening ...

Rocked in a hammock, enjoy the Jacuzzi overlooking the river, riding horses to discover the beaches, an excursion to discover the region and wildlife , you will enjoy the sweetness of living in Costa Rica .', 'The space', 'The space
The rooms are small houses perched in the trees, with views of nature,the Rio and wildlife, large bay windows on 4 walls , access is via a staircase leading to a private terrace . The toilets are private in a small building at the foot of the rooms .', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Dining room from the main house.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We can offer breakfasts and dinners with a supplement to be paid on-site .']

Title: Stylish barn with pool near Horsham, West Sussex
Description: ['About this space', 'The Granary is a self-contained, cosy and private bolt-hole. There is plenty of parking and access to a walled garden and swimming pool (June to September). All amenities are provided including a breakfast hamper. There is a small kitchen with cooking facilities, fridge, kettle, toaster and coffee maker. Slinfold village has a friendly pub, shop and post office within walking distance. Westerns Farm shop is a local icon and is just around the corner.', 'The space', 'The space\nThe Granary was converted in 2019, it retains all the charm and character of the original building but with the modern features and facilities expected of luxury accommodation. There is underfloor heating throughout the ground floor, fast wifi and a large smart TV. The 2 sofas in the seating area fold out into beds suitable for adults or children (please message to pre-approve extra guests. This will incur an additional charge.). The shower room on the ground floor is sleek and modern containing a deluge shower. Shower gel and shampoo/conditioner are provided. Upstairs is a large vaulted room (with some low beams), a very comfortable king size bed, chest of drawers and hanging rail. A hairdryer is provided for your convenience. Washing machine and tumble dryer are available for guests on request.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note\nPlease be aware that we aim to heat the pool between June and September. The pool temperature will vary according to the weather.']

Title: Cosy Barn with a Vineyard View
Description:
['About this space', "Nestled in open countryside next to our vineyard on the outskirts of Bishop's Stortford, an ideal base to explore East Herts & North Essex or visit London & Cambridge. The Cowshed is a recently converted barn sleeping 5, complete with fully equipped kitchen, dining area and comfy seating around a woodburner. Egyptian cotton linen and black out blinds in all bedrooms. Outdoors enjoy the wood burning hot tub, feed the chickens, take a stroll round our lake or discover the zip wire in the wood!", 'The space', "The space
Fresh eggs are available from the kitchen garden located at the end of the 2 acre orchard that backs onto the property. Nestled in the woods you'll discover the zip wire and play area with plenty of trees for den building!", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Entire space. There are 3 bedrooms, 1 single bedroom downstairs, along with a twin room (2 single beds) and master room with king-size bed upstairs.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
We have a minuimum 4 night stay during the week, with a check-in on Monday. Weekend check-in is on Friday with a minimum 3 night stay.

Please note that the hot tub is a wood burning hot tub it is chemical free and filled with fresh water each use. You will need to light the fire and tend to it (adding logs regularly) it will take upwards of 3.5 hours to get hot. We provide logs for your stay, instructions and will be on hand to offer guidance. The hot tub will comfortably fit 5 adults.

Whilst we don't have an EV charger there are several outdoor plug sockets to charge your car at."]

Title: The Buzzardry, Luxury Woodland Treehouse Retreat
Description:
['About this space', 'Come away to beautiful East Sussex to experience a unique stay in The Buzzardry. This stunning structure will not disappoint ‚Äì from the luxurious copper bathtub with exquisite views over woodland grounds to the extravagant beamed ceilings that protrude through the building, this magnificent treehouse offers unparalleled style and luxury. With full facilities available, including two en-suite bathrooms with showers, a fully equipped kitchen, a barbecue and drinks deck at the front.', 'The space', "The space
This fantastic 2-bedroom treehouse is generously spaced for you to fully enjoy the lofty environs. Climb up the spiral staircase and across the walkway to find a delightful decked terrace; a perfect place for balmy evenings in the treetops.

The Buzzardry sleeps 4 people in 2 bedrooms (which can either be used as 2 doubles or 1 double and 1 twin), each room has its own ensuite shower room. The master bedroom also has a luxurious copper bath with views over the woodland.

The open plan living area and kitchen has all mod cons; oven, induction hob, fridge, dishwasher, microwave, kettle and sink. There is a dining area for four, and a comfortable seating area which includes a TV and woodburner (wood provided) to make things extra cosy in the winter months. There is also underfloor heating throughout the treehouse. We are plumbed in and on grid with broadband available.

Double glass doors give you access to the open plan circular living area, with gorgeous views over the woodlands from each angled window. The lounge includes comfortable seating, a TV and a cosy wood-burning stove, which despite the property's mod cons, provides heating with the old-fashioned way for this well-insulated space, as well as underfloor heating to keep your toes toasty. There is also a dining area for four, with views through large windows and glass doors for the feeling of al fresco dining, a small kitchen complete with oven, hob, microwave, kettle and sink.

To the right is a super king-sized bedroom which can also be used as a twin room and is so spacious it comes with wardrobe space and a beautiful morning view of leafy light. The jewel in this cedar crown is the master bedroom, which fans out into its own spherical space, containing a king-sized bed, wardrobe space, and an opulent copper bath tub. This room is not just metres above the ground, it's miles above other self-catering accommodation - this is treehouse chic. Both bedrooms are beautifully appointed with their own en-suite bathrooms.

Outside is a spacious deck, where you can look over the lakes into the gardens and fields beyond. It has a table and chairs for outdoor dining, and a gas BBQ. The lake gardens are available for you to enjoy, as is the tennis court in the grounds of Marklye.", '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please note that although this property welcomes children, we advise parents that the treehouse is high in the air and advise vigilance when staying here with youngsters.']

Title: Countryside location with hot tub and sauna
Description: ['About this space', 'We are offering our pool house which consists of sauna, hot tub, kitchen, double shower room, bedroom/living room with separate wc. Beautiful countryside views. This building is located in our garden which is an acre in total. From the garden you have the added bonus of seeing Llamas and wild deer in the adjoining field. We are situated close to the cuckoo line and there are beautiful walks nearby.', 'The space', 'The space\nsole access to hot tub, sauna, double shower, separate wc, kitchen and dining area.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note\nif you download the app what3word under our check in instructions there is a photo of the exact location of the building so you shouldn't struggle to find us."]

Title: ‚ÄúThe Stable - self contained modern conversion‚Äù
Description:
['About this space', 'The Stable is a unique one bedroom self catering apartment for adults only, set in the grounds of a small independent working farm that rears cattle, sheep, dogs & chickens. The original oak & wrought iron railings divide the double bedroom with en-suite shower, sink & WC from the open plan kitchenette with two ring halogen hob, microwave, fridge with freezer compartment, kettle, toaster, smart TV, sofa & breakfast table with 2 chairs.', 'The space', 'The space
The Stable is all ground floor level, with vaulted ceilings & modern fittings. Private parking with secure electric gate. Your own Garden seating area & fire pit (bring your mashmallows to toast) sticks & wood available to buy.
OTHER THINGS TO NOTE
Guests have use of a private wood fired eco hot tub which typically takes 3 hours to heat up in winter. We provide stick & wood to buy.
Our hot tub can be pre-lit & maintained until your arrival if pre arranged at a cost of ¬£20. Once checked-in it‚Äôs the guests responsibility to heat the hot tub.
If using hot tub addition days ¬£10 for wood only.']

Title: Trinity: luxury lodge in a stunning, lake location
Description:
['About this space', 'At Cambridgeshire Lakes, we believe that your holiday should start from the moment you drive down our rural, tree-lined track and into the serenity of our stunning lakeside location. The lodge provides a stylish and comfortable accommodation for couples or groups of four people. The vaulted living area includes a large dining table, two comfy sofas surrounding the wood burner and a large flat screen Smart TV. We currently have four lodges available on the site (sleeping 16 in total).', 'The space', 'The space
The modern kitchen is equipped with all your kitchen essentials including oven, dishwasher, wine fridge and a large breakfast bar.

The spacious bedrooms have individual lakeside views, featuring super-king sized beds (which can also be split into singles on request for a ¬£25 charge per room) and flat screen TV‚Äôs. Each bedroom has a large en-suite bathroom with a free standing bath, double vanity basins and separate walk-in showers. If you wish to add an additional children to your booking, there are 2 additional underbeds available for children under 10 years old (for a charge of ¬£100 per bed) in each lodge. All associated bedding, towels and bathrobe will be provided. Please note, the underbed is low to the floor.  

The open plan living area has French doors leading on to the decking area which includes garden furniture and private hot tub.']

Title: CABIN X GPF
Description:
['About this space', 'Nestled amongst the trees, our little wooden cabin transports you to the great outdoors. Its simple and honest interior comfortably sleeps two with wide views overlooking woodland where nature abounds. It provides the perfect base for those looking to get out amongst it, or those that would rather stay in and enjoy a relaxing retreat.', 'The space', 'The space
The comfortable double bed is positioned so you can enjoy a morning coffee whilst watching the wildlife through the window.

The bathroom with its huge walk in shower has amazing views of its secluded, tranquil surroundings so you can shower with nature for a uniquely memorable experience.

During the warmer times of year the cabin opens up to its serene setting offering the perfect escape from a busy life and the chance to explore the country side. On those cooler, rainy days (or for those that would just rather stay tucked up in bed) you can watch the wildlife outside the window through our binoculars whilst staying firmly under the blanket.

We provide you with a delicious breakfast and there is tea and coffee making facilities in the cabin as well as a small kitchen.

The nearby farm shop and cafe (2 min walk) sells delicious local produce as well as some very tasty cake!', '', '']

Title: The Retreat Sauna + Hot Tub Boutique Rooms
Description:
['About this space', 'Secluded, cozy and charmingly rustic, the Retreat is perfect for a romantic rendezvous or for small, intimate gatherings with family and friends.

Set against the beautiful Cambridgeshire countryside, The Retreat is in a secluded area with its own garden and amenities, however, despite its seclusion, the hideaway is only a 30-minute drive to the bustling historic city of Cambridge.', 'The space', "The space
The Retreat is a beautiful barn conversion and an idyllic space to relax and unwind, set in the quiet village of Great Paxton, Cambridgeshire. The secluded hideaway is situated in a perfect location, being only a 5-minute drive from St Neots and only a 30-minute drive to the historic city of Cambridge.

The cabin itself is within walking distance to various amenities including a sweet little village shop as well as a local pub serving delicious food, gazing out onto the fields of the surrounding Cambridgeshire countryside.

Our stunning accommodation is also within close proximity to the mainline railway station, allowing you to reach the city of Peterborough in 20 minutes as well as the phenomenal capital city of London in just under an hour.

The Retreat is a beautifully-private space, suitable for a romantic getaway or a get together with a small number of family and friends. In addition to possessing a fully-fitted kitchen, complete with all the necessary amenities, it features an exclusive Sauna Cabin to help you unwind and let all your stress melt away.

Relax with friends in the Jacuzzi between 10am-10pm or dare to take a dive under the cold water bucket! Take in the last few rays of sunshine in our private garden, gazing at our enchanting Koi pond, or wrap up with your loved one with a glass of wine and enjoy the smokey warmth coming from the stone fireplace. It is up to you how you choose to spend your time here with us at Boutique Rooms, and we will do our very best to make your trip a memorable experience with moments to cherish.

** If you would like to use the facilities during your stay please let us know in advance the date and time and we will get everything ready for when you are wanting to unwind! **

Further amenities and features include:

‚òÖ Modern, stylish space perfect for recharging and relaxation
‚òÖ A large back garden with slide and swing, perfect for children
‚òÖ Exclusive, private use of the Sauna Cabin and Jacuzzi for you and your treasured guests
‚òÖ An enchanting Koi pond to sit near and ponder the beautiful world that surrounds you
‚òÖ A laptop-friendly workspace
‚òÖ Pristine shower rooms
‚òÖ Free complimentary WiFi
‚òÖ Free parking for 3+ vehicles.
‚òÖ Fully-fitted and equipped kitchen to create delicious meals for everyone to enjoy
‚òÖ Two large bedrooms with 6 beds, spacious enough for up to 6 guests
‚òÖ Pet-Friendly - Additional Fee's apply - ¬£25 per pet per stay (up to 4 pets)

Our goal is to offer you high quality, beautifully furnished accommodation for a truly relaxing stay. We want you to feel right at home when you stay at Boutique Rooms.

With us, you can expect sublime comfort, tasteful decor, and superb customer service in order to give you an unforgettable experience.

We are happy for our guests to use the space for the following:

- Christenings
- Mothers/Fathers Day
- Family gatherings
- Work gatherings
- Business retreats
- Birthday celebrations
- Valentines Day
- Christmas
- Boxing Day
- New Years
- Easter
- Bank holidays
- Weekends away

Please contact us beforehand if you are looking to use our space for an occasion.

** Kindly note this area is not suitable for loud parties, we respect our neighbours :) .**", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
You will have access to The Barn (sleeping accommodation), exclusive use of the traditional Sauna Cabin (housing the sauna, jacuzzi & cold water bucket), as well as private use of the garden.

The entire accommodation is for you and your guests to enjoy, so please feel free to make the most out of the idyllic, relaxing space and create moments with family and friends to cherish for a lifetime!', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We love our small furry friends and we welcome up to four pets. Additional fees apply ¬£25 per pet.

Facilities are available from 10am-10pm (expect the day of check out) If you wish to use the facilities longer there is a ¬£25 charge per hour up till midnight.']

Title: Forest Den
Description:
['About this space', "Welcome to The Forest Den set in almost 1 and a half acres which has just been beautifully renovated offering a chic rural retreat. Forest Den is probably the closest accommodation to Pooh sticks bridge and set in the Heart of the Ashdown Forest with direct access into the famous 100 Acre Wood from AA Milne's Winnie the Pooh!
Forest Den is a super cosy rural retreat offering a get away from it all lodge at the same time as offering all the creature comforts for a holiday or weekend break.", 'The space', 'The space
Thank you for interest in The Forest Den!
Due to recent circumstances... I want to assure all our guests that the Den is thoroughly deep cleaned after every guest with antibacterial wipes and sprays. The sheets, bedding, towels and tea cloths are also washed on 60 degrees with dettol antibacterial too. The safety of our guests is paramount!

Forest Den has been totally refurbished for July 2019 and offers a cosy studio cottage. It has luxury lounge and sleeping space with a high end brand new sofa bed with memory foam mattress, feather plume bedding, and cotton sheets, with a fully equipped brand new studio kitchen with twin hob, microwave, fridge/freezer, sink (cold water) brand new and spacious separate outdoor bathroom (cold water sink, hot shower, toilet), flat screen HD TV (DVD player) on the wall and a dinning space. Outside guests can enjoy exclusive access of the apple orchard for relaxing. In addition guests will have gated parking and free tours of the forest on request.
So if you like walking, this is the place to be! We are set in the heart of the Ashdown forest! üå≥', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests can access our garden , orchard and field. We would like you to feel like you are at home !', '', 'Other things to note
We have 2 dogs and 3 cats that have free roam of the garden. They don‚Äôt have access to the den as there is a fence surrounding the den.
When you come out of the gate of the den you will probably meet them. They are very friendly though and love people!']

Title: Water's Edge
Description: ['About this space', 'A hand built solid Cedar Log Cabin overlooking Naseby Reservoir, beautifully finished to a very high standard. The log cabin also benefits for a hot tub and set within its own paddock.', 'The space', 'The space\nThe cabin is newly built from Uk sourced Cedar. It is a a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom cabin with a stunning veranda, complete with hot tub and breathtaking views over the water.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access\nWhether its a romantic break, a fishing trip or away in business you can use the cabin as if it is your own, with the exclusive use of the whole cabin and its private paddock.']

Title: Standlake Glamping - No2 The Owl Shepherd Hut
Description:
['About this space', 'Welcome to Standlake Glamping - your unique get away with access to many amazing places to visit locally. Hot Tubs on its own decking - If you fancy a more chilled weekend why not explore the picturesque village of Standlake? Its within walking distance of local pubs and even boating on the Thames. We are proud to present 2 Deluxe Shepherd Huts which we have incorporated everything to make your stay unforgettable! you could have a go at Golf as there is a golf club and some balls. No dogs.', 'The space', 'The space
You have access to your own Hot tub on its own decking, Decking outside of the Shepherd hut with table and chairs and sun lounger. Access to 4 acres - even can hit a few golf balls - Golf club in hut. You have BBQ & firepit - will have matches , firelighters and coal for your first visit - can purchase more in B&Q or local garage within 15mins.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Standlake is a lovely village - can walk to the Blackhorse - please note no street lights in the village.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Sorry no dogs.']

Title: Best Log Cabin
Description:
['About this space', 'A very private luxurious log cabin, set in the middle of an island in its own 5 acres with your only neighbours being our herd of highland cattle! Perfect for a romantic retreat for 2', 'The space', 'The space
The best log cabin is unique as in the fact it is totally private with no immediate neighbours.It has been built using the traditional methods that have used for hundreds of years.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Our guests have access to all of the cabin, the island and the lake which is excellent for fishing, there is also a rowing boat available.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note

Title: Little Cowdray Glamping - The Log Cabin
Description:
['About this space', "The space
Our Log cabin is a beautiful self contained home from home, with all the necessities needed for a relaxing break away. Lots of love and attention has been poured into Little Cowdray Glamping's Log cabin, with special touches such as the hand made, hand carved king size bed and bunk beds, to the personalised kitchen companion Paddy pig who greedily oogles your kitchen delights. The Log cabin has it's own private area, with a hot tub for 4 people, a garden and patio overlooking the animals, outdoor seating, BBQ, parking and a private shed with a heater to store bikes, or dry your wet weather gear...it is still in England after all! Designed for 4 people, with a King size and 2 Bunks but on request and a *small additional fee can hold up to 6 with the bonus of a double sofa bed. The bunk beds are generous singles, so suitable for adults too.
*¬£15pp per night for an extra guest", 'The space', "Guest access
The Log Cabin comes with it's own garden, patio, and private hot tub suitable for 4 people, all of which overlook our fields and animals and best of all the beautiful sunsets.
For a small additional cost at ¬£15 per person per night (after 4 guests) we can host 6 people, and will set up the double sofa bed in the living area.", 'Guest access', "Other things to note
For a small additional cost we welcome a well behaved dog, but they must remain on a lead at all times outside of the private garden, this is not only due to our livestock, but because of large machinery operating in and around the farm, and we'd like your four legged friend to stay safe during your stay. We usually just allow one but in certain circumstances this maybe flexible. We request that no pets are to be left alone in the Cabin."]

Title: Gorgeous cosy winter getaway in rural Kent
Description:
['About this space', 'The Snuggery is a converted outbuilding that has been set up for a cosy stay with a wood burning stove and lots of snuggly wraps to cuddle up in. The open plan interior, high vaulted ceilings and natural oak flooring create an interior which is fun, light and airy. Walking enthusiasts will enjoy walks from the back door straight on to the North Downs Way and there is a bench by the front door fitted with a heated element, perfect for warming up your walking boots. ', 'The space', 'The space
A self-contained one bedroom outbuilding perfect for a romantic break away', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The Snuggery is separate to the main house and entry is with a key that‚Äôs kept in a key-box by the front door. I will send you the code a couple of days before arrival. When you are here, guests will have access to the immediate garden surrounding the Snuggery which includes a small patio with a table and 4 chairs', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We provide tea, coffee, sugar, muesli, milk, salt, pepper and oil. There‚Äôs also a nespresso coffee machine and we provide capsules.

The kitchen is well equipped with all the basics you will need to cater for yourselves including washing up liquid, dishwasher tablets, kitchen roll, cling film and silver foil.

For bathing we provide hand soap, hand cream and shower wash.

If you run out of any of the above during your stay please just let me know and I can restock for you!']

Title: The Place for Ewe - rural Shepherd's Hut
Description:
['About this space', "Shepherd's Hut in delightful rural setting yet within minutes of all that Oxford has to offer. The Perch Pub (where Morse regularly visited) is a five minute walk and serves excellent food. There is a Golf Driving Range five minutes in the other direction. Waitrose is a ten minute walk.", 'The space', "The space
Our self-contained Shepherd's Hut offers the unique opportunity to enjoy a base in the countryside but only a 25 minute walk to the centre of Oxford. A kitchenette (a small fridge and a hob but no oven), shower room and wood burner provide all home comforts. Towels provided. Microwave can be provided on request (in advance).", 'Guest access', "Guest access
We are happy to accommodate dogs but they must live in an outside pen next to the Shepherd's Hut. Due to the wooden floor dogs should not go into the hut.", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Dogs welcome but only with prior notice and should be housed in outside kennel.']

Title: Milestone House
Description:
['About this space', "A cosy and spacious self catering home nestled in the heart of rural Cambridgeshire . Ideal for Family Getaways, Short breaks or Long Term rental. With tranquil surroundings, five Bird Reserves within a 3 to 20 mils radius perfect for Dog walkers , Hikers , Birdwatchers ....
30 min drive to Cambridge City Centre , 30 min to Ely Cathedral , 20 min drive to Huntington station , 15 min to Historical St Ives built on the banks of the River Great Ouse , 1 mile from Somersham and it's amenities .", 'The space', 'The space
Milestone House comprises an airy Modern Cottage with beautiful surrounding views . Double bedroom with en/suite bathroom is located on the first floor and is accessed from outside of the house. The second bedroom is located on the ground floor with two single beds and en/suit .
Spacious living area together with fully equipped kitchen , TV and WiFi .
We are very happy to host your well behaved pets as we are animal lovers. In the interest of hygiene we would just ask not to leave them alone in the house and keep them off the furniture (beds and sofas). Please, feel free to bring your own linen if you wish your pet to sleep on the bed. Dogs are also restricted to the downstairs part of the cottage only.
We place these rules in order that all our guests may enjoy the cottage - non pet owners and pet owners alike.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Use of private driveway and car port . Access to our private paddock and front garden .', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We are very happy to host your well behaved pets as we are animal lovers. In the interest of hygiene we would just ask not to leave them alone in the house and keep them off the furniture (beds and sofas). Please, feel free to bring your own linen if you wish your pet to sleep on the bed. Dogs are also restricted to the downstairs part of the cottage only.
We place these rules in order that all our guests may enjoy the cottage - non pet owners and pet owners alike.']
