Title: 5 Star, 2 Bedroom Scandinavian Lodge with Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', 'Award winning, 5 star 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom log cabin with private HOT TUB (sleeps 4). Located in the centre of a 18 hole Championship Golf Course just 3 miles from the historic city centre of Winchester. Vaulted ceilings and exposed wood provides a tranquil setting. Fully equipped kitchen, open plan living-dinning area with cosy fire, smart TV with streaming services. Living room opens onto a private deck with HOT TUB and views over the guest putting green, ancient woodland and nature trails.', 'The space', "The space
The Lodge in detail:
Living area- The vaulted ceiling and exposed log walls of the open plan living dining area provide a relaxing and stylish room for relaxing and entertaining. An electric log burner effect stove provides a cozy and warm environment to kick back and unwind. The lodges are heated throughout and are lovely and warm even when its chilly outside. The living area leads out onto a large private decked balcony with luxurious HOT TUB overlooking the ancient woodland, nature trails and guest putting green.

Multi media- Large smart TV with streaming services and bluetooth speaker in the Lounge area and another located in the master bedroom. Free WiFi access is available in every lodge. Free WiFi access is available in every lodge.

Kitchen- The lodge offers a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, fridge, freezer, oven and washing machine. A complimentary welcome tray is provided with locally sourced produce, ground coffee, a selection of teas and other yummy goodies to ensure the perfect start to your stay with us.

Bedrooms- The two bedrooms are light and airy and with beautiful soft furnishings and luxury bed linen and towels. The EnSite master bedroom is presented as a kingsize bed but can also be arranged as two singles beds on request, the second and third bedroom are arranged as twin rooms. The master bedroom has the added benefit of a flat screen TV. Hairdryers are also provided in each bedroom.

Bathrooms- All our lodges offer two bathrooms, a family bathroom with bath and over head shower as well as an ensuite shower room. Soft fluffy towels are provided as well as luxury, locally produced toiletries from Lavender Log Barn.

Outside and access
All our lodges have a private decked balcony opening out from the living area with views of the ancient woodland or guest putting green. The luxurious HOT TUB is fully serviced during your stay an ready for you to jump in and enjoy! Outdoor furniture, putters and golf balls are provided for guests to enjoy our putting green during their stay. Each lodge has its own BBQ stand suitable for use with a disposable BBQ pack. BBQ utensils and lighters are provided.

All our lodges are accessed via a ramp from the private parking area. Once inside the accommodation is arranged over one level.

Parking
Private parking for two cars is by the front door of each lodge. Some overflow parking is also available on site on request.

Self Catering
To make your arrival as easy as possible all major supermarkets deliver to our lodges. We are also just 2 miles from a Sainsbury's supermarket and local butcher and bakery (Oliver's Battery). If you would rather take a break from cooking why not book one of our delicious meals offer on our 'dinners to your door' menu. Or book a beautiful English afternoon tea on arrival, served on bone china and three tiered cake stand. (menus available on request)
Winchester is fast becoming a foddies mecca, Rick Steins, River cottage Canteen, Raymond Blanc- Brasserie Blanc, Black Rat (1 Michelin star), Chesil Rectory (voted 3rd most romantic restaurant in UK), Wykeham Arms (voted best town pub in UK), The Plough, Sparsholt (multi award winning country pub) to name but just a few. Winchester offers a fantastic range of restaurants to suit all tastes, budgets and occasions

Families
Children are very welcome to stay and our lodges are the perfect safe environment for children and parents to enjoy a stay with us. For our little guests, travel cots, bed guards and highchairs can be provided free of charge on request. The open area around lodges and our putting green as well as the beautiful ancient woodland provide a fantastic location for kids to play and explore in the safety of our family friendly site. Our nature trail offers a great opportunity for Wigwam building and woodland exploring.Should you book one of our Plus lodges with hot tubs, a cover is fitted to the tub for when it's not being used so your little ones will be safe.
Should you want to get out and explore the Winchester and surrounding areas there are a wealth of attractions on our door step. From Pepper Pig World (15 mins), Marwell Zoo, activity centre and play barn(15 mins), Winchester Intec Science Centre (10 mins), Beaulieu Motor Museum (25 mins) and much much more!

Golf
Set in the middle of South Winchester Golf Club we have the privilege to be able to offer guests access to the Championship Golf Course and fantastic bar and restaurant facilities within just a short stroll down the 18th fairway from your front door. Discounted guest green fees can be booked directly with us, all guests have access to the lovely lake side restaurant and family friendly bar area and sun terrace. The club also offers a short game practice area and driving range for the keen golfer. Don't forget if you just fancy trying your hand at a bit of golf our guest putting green located at the heart of our site is for all to enjoy old and young, golfer or novice!

Dogs
We have a number of dog friendly lodges so you are welcome to bring your furry friends along for a holiday too. Located on the edge of the South Downs National Park and set in woodland there are some fantastic walks on the doorstep of your lodge. Please note maximum of 2 dogs per property, supplement applies. Unfortunately, we are unable to accept any other pets.

Groups and Celebrations
If you are planning a group break our lodges offer flexible and affordable accommodation and the Golf Club House (just a 5 minute walk away) offers a great venue for a drinks reception, a group meal or function. We are also just 3 miles from the city center of Winchester with all its restaurants and bars, if you would like more information regarding a suitable venue for your group please contact a member of our staff for recommendations and further information. Our lodges are suitable for a maximum of four or six people, for insurance reasons our lodges are not suitable to host a larger group meal or get-together under one roof.

Please note that we charge a fully refundable damage deposit of ¬£250 on bookings of 2 lodges or more, providing there is no damage to the lodge on check out. With regret we are unable to accommodate Hen and Stag parties or larger single sex groups of 6 or more people.

Book With Confidence!
At your time of check in, should the UK government advise not to travel overnight within the UK (Full National Lock Down) due to the Corona virus pandemic, or that we as a business are unable to remain open, we will issue a full credit, refund or the option to move your break to a future date with no amendment fee. Please note that as a small business we are unable to cover for every situation and the responsibility is with you the guest to be fully aware of the cancellation policy that you have agreed to at the time of booking with Airbnb.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Our luxury Self-contained lodges offer the perfect location to relax and unwind. Each lodge provides independent accommodation, maintained to the highest hygiene standards and offers a beautiful tranquil setting to get away from it all!', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We understand that the last year has created a lot of uncertainty for travellers, so we wanted to proactively share the steps we‚Äôve taken to ensure your health and safety. While we‚Äôve always gone to great lengths to best maintain and prepare our lodges for your arrival, we‚Äôve since updated our operating protocols and are allocating extra cleaning time between guests to disinfect and sanitise all high-touch surfaces. We have also implemented a contactless self-check- in procedure.']

Title: The Pigsty
Description:
['About this space', "The Pigsty is Winchester's first luxury woodland hideaway, with beautiful views of Vale Farm. Less than 2.5 miles from the historic centre of Winchester, this peaceful retreat is perfect for those looking to visit the city, or escape for some peace.

The Pigsty‚Äôs domed design with wooden interior has a roll top bath, cosy open plan living space and decking area to enjoy dinner with sunset views.

Just a few minutes walk from the famous Clarendon Way, and a 30 minute walk to the city centre.", 'The space', 'The space
The Pigsty is situated on a working farm, however in a secluded corner with minimal disturbance. Access is via a well maintained private farm track suitable for vehicles, bikes or by foot!

The Pigsty offers a king-sized bed, simple kitchen, TV, along with a luxurious roll top bath and separate shower and toilet. Towels, sheets, bath robes and special toiletries are provided. There is a gas BBQ for guests to use, along with other surprise perks. Adjacent parking available.

Breakfast is provided for the first morning of your stay, however tea, milk and fresh coffee beans (that have been roasted on the farm) are available throughout your stay.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The Pigsty is designed for those looking to escape the ways of normal life, this is why we do not allow children or pets of any size.
There are a number of factors as to why but mostly because as parents we felt it was somewhere to enjoy a couple of nights off from the home life.']

Title: NEW Luxury Remote Kabin + Outdoor Bath!
Description:
['About this space', "Surrounded by stunning countryside, our beautiful cabin is the perfect place to relax and switch off. The location is totally secluded, with stunning views over the Meon Valley. Come for a few nights and we promise you'll leave feeling rested and reenergised.
During these unprecedented times, we wanted to offer a place where people can take a moment away from it all. Where you can get back to basics and enjoy the benefits of being surrounded by nature and nothing else..", 'The space', "The space
Everything has been carefully considered and beautifully designed to help our guests slow down, switch off and leave feeling revitalised. Think tiny hotel room in the wild, as opposed to your normal shepherds hut. Our cabin has electric, and made entirely using wood from the surrounding trees (all of which were felled due to dieback).

There are beautiful walks, some to cosy pubs. In the cabin you'll find some maps and our personal recommendations.

If you have any questions please just ask. Here is some more information of what to expect: The cabin has everything you need. Nothing you don't:
A large king sized bed, with luxury linen bedding.
A woodburner inside.
A firepit and picnic bench outside.
A bathroom, with flushing toilet and hot shower.
A kitchen, with two gas hobs and a fridge/freezer.
A table and dining area.
We offer a generous amount of bespoke cut woodburner logs within our rates. More of these smaller logs are available for purchase during your stay to keep you toasty warm!

We also provide a secured bin of seasoned cut logs to be used on the fire-pit ¬£10 per bin which can be purchased on arrival and can be topped up during your stay.", '', '', '', '']

Title: Romantic Oak Cabin Berkhamsted
Description:
['About this space', 'This cosy luxurious self contained oak frame cabin offers the perfect peaceful setting for a relaxing getaway. Listen out and you may hear the owls at night.
Backing onto the National Trust Ashridge Forest, this is perfect for outdoor lovers but equally suitable for a romantic night in. 1.5 miles down the road, the popular market town of Berkhamsted is offering atmospheric pubs and bars for a special treat out.
The cabin offers comfortable, spacious living with King size bed.', 'The space', 'The space
Although the cabin is within the grounds of the main property, it is completely separated off by thick hedge rows to offer complete privacy to our guests. A path alongside the house leads the guests to their own entrance of the cabin.


This cabin features all you need for a comfortable stay- a small bathroom with shower facility, a spacious open plan living room, an open plan kitchen with a hob and convection microwave oven grill and a comfortable King Size bed on the Mezzanine level, accessed by a ladder. It is furnished with cosy lighting, two comfortable sofas and a dining table. The cabin features a TV as well as a large DVD selection and Hi-Fi system.

Kitchen: We also provide utensils so that our guests can choose to stay in and prepare their own meal if they wish.

The back gate allows you to walk straight into the woods to explore 5000 acres of deer filled forest and its other wildlife. A 20 minute walk away you may wish to refresh yourself in the upmarket and cosy pub, the Alford Arms, in the idyllic Frithsden Valley where they even have their own vineyard.
The cabin is only 1.5 miles away from the popular and trendy town centre of Berkhamsted, featuring a range of lively pubs and restaurants.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Luxurious, picture-perfect, stunning treehouse
Description:
['About this space', "Hoots Treehouse (www.hootstreehouse.co.uk) is a picture-perfect, romantic, luxurious treehouse with all mod cons in an area of outstanding natural beauty - only 45 minutes south of M25. Clad in aromatic cedar wood, beautifully furnished - ideal private, woodland retreat for couples. Can also comfortably sleep 2 children (from 6 years) on single mattresses in loft area accessed by a ladder and hatch. A wonderful place to chill-out and lose yourself - you won't want to leave! Sheer bliss!", 'The space', 'The space
Minimum 2 night stay - check-in any day of the week.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Hoots has its own dedicated parking area. From here there is a boardwalk with steps that lead directly into the treehouse (about 50m).
There are loads of beautiful walks from your doorstep - access through a stunning deer park is a 5 minute walk from the treehouse.
There is a tennis court that can be used (however please bring your own racquets and balls!)']

Title: Cosy country cottage with chalk stream charm
Description:
['About this space', "A beautifully renovated and charming lodge on the river Dever, ten minutes drive north of the historic city of Winchester.

The Fisherman's Lodge is a beautiful self contained country escape with the added benefits of its own little island and brilliant views of the charming river Dever and the wildlife that lives along its banks.", 'The space', "The space
The Fisherman's Lodge offers a unique and beautiful outdoor space with all the creature comforts that you would expect to find in a cosy home.

Although there is now no fishing on site, the lodge was traditionally part of a small trout fishery. It now stands alone, adjacent to its own small island alongside the sparkling clear waters of the river Dever, a tributary of the world famous river Test.

Right outside the front door is a large covered veranda which offers a perfect spot for a breakfast coffee and croissant. A little rustic bridge provides access to the small island. The island offers lovely riverside space with both the opportunity to relax in the sunshine with a glass of cool wine or to sit beneath the trailing branches of the weeping willow that grows at its heart and watch the river life float by. Ducks, kingfishers, moorhens, coots and herons are all common visitors, whilst beneath its sparkling surface minnows, brown trout and the occasional grayling can be seen...and if you are very lucky you may glimpse the otter drift past at dusk.

Indoors the kitchen is fully equipped with a large modern cooker, microwave, fridge, freezer and breakfast bar. The kitchen retains some of its original character with a natural stone tile floor and bespoke wooden units.

The main living area is spacious and contains a dining table, sofa, bean bag and TV. Additionally there is a small downstairs cloakroom.

Upstairs is reached by a stunning oak and wrought iron staircase and leads straight into the bedroom. The large bedroom contains a double bed, dressing table, two hanging cupboards, a long mirror, a TV and two wonderful Velux windows that offer stunning views over an adjacent private lake and pond.

The bathroom is large and modern, with a huge walk-in shower and a deep free-standing bath.

The whole lodge has its own WiFi and both televisions have 'smart TV' options.

The lodge is a short walk from the village of Sutton Scotney and its facilities including a park, the well stocked village shop, Dever Stores, a great village pub, The Coach and Horses and a handy garage with post office facilities.", '', "The whole of the Fisherman's Lodge and the adjacent outdoor space as described is for our guests' use.", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
You will be parking your car inside a secure gated property just off the main road (A30). Please be aware of some road noise during busy periods.']

Title: Secluded Oak Barn Retreat with Hot Tub & Pool!
Description:
['About this space', 'Relaxation at The Oak Barn Danbury is inevitable. Surrounded by oak trees, the secluded fenced patio with comfy seating, hot tub and BBQ will allow quiet relaxation after a day exploring the Essex countryside on your doorstep. Inside, enjoy a beautiful open plan oak beamed kitchen / living area with all the amenities you could need to enjoy your stay, 3 luxurious beds and a large bathroom. Being child friendly, free parking and fast Wifi are a given. A seasonal pool is just an added luxury!', 'The space', 'The space
Welcome to the beautiful Oak Barn in Danbury. 1000 sq ft of light, quiet, secluded space for a relaxing get away.

Bedroom 1 has a luxurious king size bed with memory foam mattress, quality linen and is double aspect looking out over the tree lined garden and horses (when they arn't on their holidays!).

Bedroom 2 has an equally luxurious sprung double mattress, quality linen and enjoys views of the horses and National Trust Forest behind.

The large bathroom comprises of an overized bath for relaxing after a day exploring picturesque Essex, a seperate shower, toilet and basin. All amenities such as shampoo, soap and toilet paper are provided as would be expected.

The open plan, oak beamed Living/Dining/Kitchen area is light and spacious even for 6 people. The double sofa bed can be made up or left folded for your arrival.

The 42" TV in the living area is linked up to a Firestick for App access and live TV.

A seperate nook is available for reading or if you need to check the laptop and Wifi signal is strong so you can keep connected!

The dining table can be set for 6 and the kitchen is equipped with oven, hob, microwave, fridge (with small freezer), dishwasher, toaster, coffee machine, kettle and all equiptment you need for self catering. A selection of tea and coffee is also provided to get you started.

Washing is available at a small fee.

Outside, the barn becomes even more delightful as you can choose to see in the evening on your private patio either from your 6 person hot tub or outside seating area whilst someone BBQ's for dinner.

During the summer months (weather dependent) a private heated outdoor pool is available daily between 9am and 12.30pm unless otherwise agreed.

Parking for 2 cars on the shared drive is available.

The Oak Barn Danbury is family friendly (2 little boys live on site!), so if there are any specific child requirements please just message me before you come and I will try and accomodate.

We hope to see you soon x']

Title: The Barn @ North Lodge -Soho Farmhouse-esque Cabin
Description:
['About this space', 'Inspired by Soho Farmhouse. A stylish converted barn set in the grounds of a Georgian Lodge within the South Downs National Park. Conveniently located close to the picturesque market towns of Alresford, Petersfield, Alton and historic Winchester, it is an ideal base to both explore Hampshire and kick back and relax in luxury.', 'The space', 'The space
Rustic luxury is the barn‚Äôs style; whitewashed timber walls, heated oak floors, industrial iron Nkuku lighting and furniture sit comfortably alongside crisp White Company linen, feather duvets and generous sized pillows. Relax and restore after an action packed day with Neal‚Äôs Yard toiletries and fluffy towels. Comfort is key. Ideal for couples, friends and solo travellers alike with the option of a super king or twin beds.
A Nespresso coffee machine, toaster, kettle, fridge freezer, oven, hob microwave and egg cooker are all on hand, plus a gas BBQ & Chiminea log burner on the private Terrace. Breakfast provisions of granola, yogurt, fruit, sourdough bread and jam are provided along with eggs from our own hens for delicious boiled eggs.
The Barn is equipped with the usual mod cons with TV, Chrome Cast, WIFI and Sonos Music System.
There are Sweeping views from the bedroom french doors up the field where the majestic Redwood Tree and often Pheasants, Hare and Roe deer can be seen. You are free to explore North Lodge‚Äôs paddock to visit North Lodge‚Äôs chickens and there are several footpaths off the property, one which leads to the famous ‚ÄúPub with no Name‚Äù in just under an hour.', 'Guest access', "Guest access
Private terrace with seating & coffee table, bbq and wood fired Chiminea, additional larger table with parasol to the side of the Barn. Guests are welcome to wander around the paddock to see the chickens & meet the owner's friendly Border Terriers.", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Breakfast & Dogs!

Please note: We provide a complimentary breakfast of granola, yogurt, fruit, fresh sourdough bread, butter, fresh eggs and jam.

Dogs: We love dogs, we have two! we accept small to medium well behaved ones. We ask that they please keep their paws on the floors, not the bed!']

Title: Luxury Garden Studio Apartment
Description:
['About this space', 'Woodland View is a modern Cedar built apartment set apart from the main house. Located within a 10 minute walk to the near by Silverstone Circuit. It comes complete with off road parking and it‚Äôs own seated decking area with hot tub.
The self contained apartment comprises of a bathroom, kitchen, lounge area and bedroom with double bed.

We also can cater for private events such as birthday, anniversaries and special events as seen in some of the later photos for an additional cost.', 'The space', 'The space
Modern Cedar clad structure, Underfloor heating, Mechanical vent heat recovery and triple glazing, with green roof and zinc features. Woodland View is set apart from the main house and offers a private setting located within 1/4 of an acre garden, adjoining farm land and wooded area. The property also benefits from a 5 person heated hot tub which is perfect for those cozy evenings under the stars.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Woodland View allows private gated access and parking. This allows safe parking for your vehicle within a secure electric gated driveway.

We currently have two different sets of optional stays, Standard and Premium (all prices are standard unless otherwise stated):

Standard inclusions:
Access to the hot tub, limited to 2 hours per nights stay
Complimentary tea and coffee
A full range of streaming TV packages
Toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel)
Use of BBQ/Wood-burner (Guests to provide their own coal)
Parking for one vehicle

Premium inclusions (in addition to the standard):
Breakfast hamper, including a selection of fresh fruits, cereal, croissants, bread, juice, chocolate and cookies
Access to the hot tub, limited to 4 hours per nights stay (opposed to 2 hours).
Premium Optional cost: ¬£30

Please feel free to message us in relation to the additional Gold and Platinum event packages.']

Title: Sparrowhawk Luxury Lodge with Sauna & Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', 'COVID-19 Restrictions for England
Guests can book with confidence that we will refund any reservations that needs to be cancelled due to government COVID restrictions.

Upper Farm is a 30 acre farm located in the rural hamlet of Henton in the beautiful South Oxfordshire countryside and is around 1 hour from London and less than 5 miles from Junction 6 of the M40 motorway.', 'The space', "The space
COVID-19 Restrictions for England
Guests can book with confidence that we will refund any reservations that needs to be cancelled due to government COVID restrictions.

Upper Farm is a 30 acre farm located in the rural hamlet of Henton in the beautiful South Oxfordshire countryside and is around 1 hour from London and less than

Due to the additional cleaning and sanitisation required to keep our guests safe, we are unable to offer any form of early check-in or late check-out.

Sparrowhawk Lodge is tucked away at the edge of the farm.

With a sauna in the luxurious bathroom and with its own private year round outdoor hot tub, you are surrounded by acres of green paddocks and views over our 1 acre fishing lake. It's the perfect setting for guests who want to relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

Sparrowhawk Lodge is ideal for couples looking for a romantic getaway, walkers, cyclists, anglers and business travellers.

Kitchen / Dining
- Dining table & chairs
- Fully fitted kitchen (Oven, hob, microwave, kettle, toaster, slimline dishwasher)
- All pots, pans and cookware provided
- Fridge with integrated freezer compartment
- Tea, coffee, milk, sugar & cafetiere
- French doors leading to veranda and hot tub

Living
- L shaped sofa
- Flame effect electric fire
- LG 43 inch Smart UHD 4K Television with Netflix subscription
- Sky+ HD Satellite receiver with Entertainment, Movies and Sports channels
- Catchup TV (BBC iPlayer, ITV Hub, ALL 4, Demand5)
- French doors leading to veranda and hot tub

Outside
- Large veranda with stunning views over the lake & Chiltern Hills
- Al Fresco outdoor dining
- Year round outdoor hot tub with Bluetooth sound system
- Weber Charcoal BBQ

Bedroom
- King size bed with award winning Simba Sleep Experience (hybrid mattress, hybrid pillow, duvet)
- Egyptian cotton bedding
- Bedside tables, lamps and USB charging
- LG 43 inch Smart UHD 4K TV with Freeview, Netflix & Catchup
- Hairdryer
- Iron and ironing board

Ensuite
- Large free standing bath
- Sauna
- Walk in shower

Linens, towels, bathrobes and toiletries provided

IMPORTANT EXTRA INFORMATION
We have a zero tolerance policy on drugs. Anyone found smoking or taking drugs or any other illegal substance will be reported to the police and evicted from the property immediately. There will be no refund for any unused nights and you will forfeit the full security deposit.

There is no smoking permitted inside the accommodation. Smoking is permitted outside only. Please use the ashtray provided.

No excessive outdoor noise after 11pm.
Absolutely No parties or events.

Maximum of 2 well behaved dogs per property. ¬£15 per dog, per stay charge (payable on arrival)."]

Title: The Nest: A Unique Retreat on the South Downs Way
Description:
['About this space', 'On the South Downs Way, nestled in a beautiful spot amongst trees, with countryside views across farmland, The Nest is a hand-built wooden cabin positioned at the top of Springfields, on a family-run working farm, Springs PYO. In an area of natural beauty, yet a short walk to the PYO areas, farm shop and wonderful cafe at The Gooseberry House, it has immediate access to footpaths and is ideal for walkers and cyclists.
Private parking space and occasional distant road noise across fields.', 'The space', 'The space
The Nest has been lovingly hand built by our family during lockdown using reclaimed woods, pallets, disused gym wall-bars and many other items we could find for the interior, yet is fully insulated and equipped with modern comforts. We want guests to feel the fun and excitement of staying in something a little different, yet privacy away from daily life. There is a small kitchen area with cooking facilities, a fridge and microwave. A Feather & Black double bed, 2 comfy chairs to sit on and enjoy the view across fields with the doors open. There are several outside seating areas to enjoy the sun all around, with outside lighting amidst the trees, and a fire-pit for cosy nights outdoors sitting and enjoying the stunning sunsets. Some logs and kindling is provided but all extra is available to purchase at the farm shop.
Good 4G signal only in the cabin, (so use your break as a rest from the world!), but there is full wifi available at the farm shop cafe should you require. Guests can also bring portable dongles if require.
We would ask guests to bring some soft indoor shoes or slippers for their own comfort, as muddy shoes and boots stay outdoors!
PLEASE NOTE: There is now access to use of a private gym in a nearby farm building on Tuesday and Thursday mornings, from 6.30a.m -7.30a.m. This may also mean some distant noise at this time. Guests are welcome to join by prior arrangement when booking their stay. Please enquire.', '', '', '', '']

Title: The Old School House Liphook - hot tub & tennis ct
Description:
['About this space', 'The Old School House is a traditional and cosy one bedroom detached cottage in the grounds of our home on the western edge of Liphook village in Hampshire. Easy car access, just off the A3 and south of the Hindhead tunnel. The village has a train station.

Situated in the South Downs National Park and ideally located for the market towns of Haslemere, Farnham, Petersfield and Alton, it is only 25 minutes from Goodwood. Great countryside and lots on offer locally for holiday or break.', 'The space', 'The space
The cottage is within a secure and gated property with parking and extensive grounds. Features include: central heating, log burning stove, TV (including sky movies/sports), wifi, King sized bed with luxury bedding, a fully equipped kitchen with oven and washing machine, a shower room, private patio and lovely decked area off the bedroom and small secure garden with table and chairs. We offer use of our tennis court and you can enjoy a hot tub.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
hot tub
large garden
tennis court', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
No Smoking on site
No parties
Check in after 2pm
Check out by 11am
Minimum stay 1 night
Continental breakfast provided
some traffic noise/ noise from army training.']

Title: White Deer Lodge - Breakfast hamper included
Description:
['About this space', "'White Deer Lodge' is situated in the village of Barkway. Surrounded by open fields and beautiful countryside. It is a new build in our garden, next to our home. There is a huge driveway with private parking for the lodge. The main accommodation upstairs is open plan with an ensuite bathroom. There is a kitchen downstairs. Breakfast hamper includes, cereals, eggs, bread, bacon, mushrooms, tomatoes, jams, tea, coffee
See the deer outside your window and hear the owls at night.
Sorry no pets.", 'The space', 'The space
A beautiful oak interior with a cosy rustic feel. The setting is very peaceful and quiet, surrounded by countryside. There is a seating area outside the front of the lodge and a small area out the back of the lodge overlooking the fields. Extras available to book in advance: Movie hamper ¬£10, bouquet of flowers ¬£30, cheese and cracker selection ¬£20, Prosecco, strawberries and truffles ¬£25, homemade birthday cake ¬£25. Please message for more info or to book. Check in 3pm. Check out 10.30am', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Key code entry. Private parking right outside the lodge.']

Title: The Cabin Retreat
Description:
['About this space', 'Lovely self catering log cabin with its own private hot tub, located in peaceful residential area next to the historic Crouch Hill. Located only 1 mile from Broughton Castle, 6 miles from Soho Farmhouse, 15 miles from Bicester Village and 19 miles from Oxford & Stratford. Close to local amenities and countryside walks near by. We have mobile beauty therapist that will also come to the cabin if you would like a massage or facial, this must be booked in advance so please do let us know.', 'The space', 'The space
Studio log cabin with Kingsize bed and sofa bed suitable for children or 1 adult. Open plan snug, kitchen and dining area with separate bathroom. Lovely decking area with hot tub. The Space is suitable for either 2 Adults and 1 child or 3 Adults.We advise that people with Heart condition who are pregnant, have high blood pressure or skin diseases or disorders to not use the hot as we cannot be held responsible for any illness or accidents that may occur.

I also make beautiful candles that can be gift wrapped and left in the room for your loved one.
Please see photos on the main page.
These can be made in range of colours and fragrances.
Please message me if intrested

Treatment lists
Full Facial ¬£50.00
Full Body Massage ¬£50.00
Back massage and Indian head massage ¬£50.00
Back massage ¬£30.00
Indian Head Massage ¬£30.00
Afternoon tea is also available at a cost of ¬£22.00 for Two.

If you would like to book any treatments or Afternoon tea then please let us know in advance.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Luxury 3 Bedroom, Scandinavian Lodge with HOT TUB
Description:
['About this space', 'Award winning, 5 star 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom log cabin with private HOT TUB (sleeps 6). Located in the centre of a 18 hole Championship Golf Course just 3 miles from the historic city centre of Winchester. Vaulted ceilings and exposed wood provides a tranquil setting. Fully equipped kitchen, open plan living-dinning area with cosy fire, smart TV with streaming services. Living room opens onto a private deck with HOT TUB and views over the guest putting green, ancient woodland and nature trails.', 'The space', "The space
The Lodge in detail:
Living area- The vaulted ceiling and exposed log walls of the open plan living dining area provide a relaxing and stylish room for relaxing and entertaining. An electric log burner effect stove provides a cozy and warm environment to kick back and unwind. The lodges are heated throughout and are lovely and warm even when its chilly outside. The living area leads out onto a large private decked balcony with luxurious HOT TUB overlooking the ancient woodland, nature trails and guest putting green.

Multi media- Large smart TV with streaming services and bluetooth speaker in the Lounge area and another located in the master bedroom. Free WiFi access is available in every lodge. Free WiFi access is available in every lodge.

Kitchen- Kitchen- The lodge offers a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, fridge, freezer, oven and washing machine. A complimentary welcome tray is provided with locally sourced produce, ground coffee, a selection of teas and other yummy goodies to ensure the perfect start to your stay with us.

Bedrooms- The three bedrooms are light and airy and with beautiful soft furnishings and luxury bed linen and towels. The EnSite master bedroom is presented as a kingsize bed but can also be arranged as two singles beds on request, the second and third bedroom are arranged as twin rooms. The master bedroom has the added benefit of a flat screen TV. Hairdryers are also provided in each bedroom.

Bathrooms- All our lodges offer two bathrooms, a family bathroom with bath and over head shower as well as an ensuite shower room. Soft fluffy towels are provided as well as luxury, locally produced toiletries from Lavender Log Barn.

Outside and access
All our lodges have a private decked balcony opening out from the living area with views of the ancient woodland or guest putting green. The luxurious HOT TUB is fully serviced during your stay an ready for you to jump in and enjoy! Outdoor furniture, putters and golf balls are provided for guests to enjoy our putting green during their stay. Each lodge has its own BBQ stand suitable for use with a disposable BBQ pack. BBQ utensils and lighters are provided.

All our lodges are accessed via a ramp from the private parking area. Once inside the accommodation is arranged over one level.

Parking
Private parking for two cars is by the front door of each lodge. Some overflow parking is also available on site on request.

Self Catering
To make your arrival as easy as possible all major supermarkets deliver to our lodges. We are also just 2 miles from a Sainsbury's supermarket and local butcher and bakery (Oliver's Battery). If you would rather take a break from cooking why not book one of our delicious meals offer on our 'dinners to your door' menu. Or book a beautiful English afternoon tea on arrival, served on bone china and three tiered cake stand. (menus available on request)
Winchester is fast becoming a foddies mecca, Rick Steins, River cottage Canteen, Raymond Blanc- Brasserie Blanc, Black Rat (1 Michelin star), Chesil Rectory (voted 3rd most romantic restaurant in UK), Wykeham Arms (voted best town pub in UK), The Plough, Sparsholt (multi award winning country pub) to name but just a few. Winchester offers a fantastic range of restaurants to suit all tastes, budgets and occasions

Families
Children are very welcome to stay and our lodges are the perfect safe environment for children and parents to enjoy a stay with us. For our little guests, travel cots, bed guards and highchairs can be provided free of charge on request. The open area around lodges and our putting green as well as the beautiful ancient woodland provide a fantastic location for kids to play and explore in the safety of our family friendly site. Our nature trail offers a great opportunity for Wigwam building and woodland exploring.Should you book one of our Plus lodges with hot tubs, a cover is fitted to the tub for when it's not being used so your little ones will be safe.
Should you want to get out and explore the Winchester and surrounding areas there are a wealth of attractions on our door step. From Pepper Pig World (15 mins), Marwell Zoo, activity centre and play barn(15 mins), Winchester Intec Science Centre (10 mins), Beaulieu Motor Museum (25 mins) and much much more!

Golf
Set in the middle of South Winchester Golf Club we have the privilege to be able to offer guests access to the Championship Golf Course and fantastic bar and restaurant facilities within just a short stroll down the 18th fairway from your front door. Discounted guest green fees can be booked directly with us, all guests have access to the lovely lake side restaurant and family friendly bar area and sun terrace. The club also offers a short game practice area and driving range for the keen golfer. Don't forget if you just fancy trying your hand at a bit of golf our guest putting green located at the heart of our site is for all to enjoy old and young, golfer or novice!

Dogs
We have a number of dog friendly lodges so you are welcome to bring your furry friends along for a holiday too. Located on the edge of the South Downs National Park and set in woodland there are some fantastic walks on the doorstep of your lodge. Please note maximum of 2 dogs per property, supplement applies. Unfortunately, we are unable to accept any other pets.

Groups and Celebrations
If you are planning a group break our lodges offer flexible and affordable accommodation and the Golf Club House (just a 5 minute walk away) offers a great venue for a drinks reception, a group meal or function. We are also just 3 miles from the city center of Winchester with all its restaurants and bars, if you would like more information regarding a suitable venue for your group please contact a member of our staff for recommendations and further information. Our lodges are suitable for a maximum of four or six people, for insurance reasons our lodges are not suitable to host a larger group meal or get-together under one roof.

Please note that we charge a fully refundable damage deposit of ¬£250 on bookings of 2 lodges or more, providing there is no damage to the lodge on check out. With regret we are unable to accommodate Hen and Stag parties or larger single sex groups of 6 or more people.

Book With Confidence!
At your time of check in, should the UK government advise not to travel overnight within the UK (Full National Lock Down) due to the Corona virus pandemic, or that we as a business are unable to remain open, we will issue a full credit, refund or the option to move your break to a future date with no amendment fee. Please note that as a small business we are unable to cover for every situation and the responsibility is with you the guest to be fully aware of the cancellation policy that you have agreed to at the time of booking with Airbnb.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Our luxury Self-contained lodges offer the perfect location to relax and unwind. Each lodge provides independent accommodation, maintained to the highest hygiene standards and offers a beautiful tranquil setting to get away from it all!', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We understand that the last year has created a lot of uncertainty for travellers, so we wanted to proactively share the steps we‚Äôve taken to ensure your health and safety. While we‚Äôve always gone to great lengths to best maintain and prepare our lodges for your arrival, we‚Äôve since updated our operating protocols and are allocating extra cleaning time between guests to disinfect and sanitise all high-touch surfaces. We have also implemented a contactless self-check- in procedure and all hot tubs are fully operational and maintained to strict water hygiene standards set out by The British and Irish Spa Hot Tub Association (BISHTA).']

Title: Gorgeous Shepherds Hut, Hot Tub & Firepit
Description:
['About this space', "An absolutely stunning little escape, with boutique decor and a stylish, super comfy interior. Set in a a beautiful corner of the village just a stone's throw from the village pub, this is a truly relaxing escape. The gorgeous decor, super comfy bed along with little touches such as the Neom essential oils pod, St Kitts Herbery products, make this an extra special place to stay.Relax in the evenings with a glass of wine in the wood fired hot tub and snuggle around the Indian Fire Bowl.", 'The space', 'The space
The shepherds hut is in the centre of a pretty village, just moments from the village pub. Set on a large grassy area (that was formally a pony paddock) the hut is tucked away, but with lovely views of the church.

Little Dragonfly comes with:

Wood Fired Hot Tub
Indian Fire Bowl
Kettle, Toaster and Induction Hob
Luxury products
Neom essential oil diffuser']

Title: Self contained country cottage for 2 in Sarratt
Description:
['About this space', 'Crestyl Cottage is a delightful self contained home providing the perfect place to relax, walk, cycle, birdwatch and fish for carp in our small private lake. We provide high end accommodation for 2 people in an area which has plenty to offer in the heart of the stunning Chess Valley.
Crestyl Cottage is a conversion of a redundant barn, originally used for watercress seed drying which has been converted into self catering holiday accommodation with wood fired hot tub.', 'The space', 'The space
Crestyl Cottage boasts a fabulous super king bed with luxury bedding, towels, dressing gowns and slippers. A 50 inch smart tv, broadband, a comfortable sofa, a fully fitted kitchen with washing machine and dish washer and a shower room.
The beautiful village of Sarratt has everything you need...gastro pubs, village shop providing all your essentials, post office, garage, and stunning walks and views. We are conveniently located to Leavesden, Elstree and Pinewood studios, a 10 min drive to the M25 and the nearest train station with direct lines into London.
Weekend check in on Friday.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests have plenty of space for free on site parking for 2 cars.
There is a step up to the main private entrance.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
*WEEKEND CHECK IN ON FRIDAY.

*THIS COTTAGE IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN DUE TO THE DEEP WATERS SURROUNDING THE COTTAGE.*']

Title: The Little Cabin by the Lake
Description:
['About this space', "Sit back, relax and enjoy the ambiance of our beautiful holiday cabin and fishing lake. Set in the heart of the glorious East Sussex country side, situated in semi ancient woodland, yet only a minute or two drive from the pretty village of East Hoathly.

Our rustic cabin is fully equipped to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. Whether you're escaping for a relaxing stay, a romantic weekend, taking a ramble through the country side and Weald Ways or a spot of fishing.", 'The space', 'The space
Inside our Little Cabin you will find a beautifully rustic style living area, light, airy and comfortable. The handmade log bed adds a lovely feature to the room. The breakfast bar and fitted kitchen gives all you foodies everything you need to make any stay just perfect. The lovely large walk in shower, WC and sink all add to the comfort of your stay (we provide the towels). In the winter you can snuggle by the log burner, whilst in the summer you can sit outside on the lovely large deck that over looks the lake. The lovely view of the lake through the windows and double doors allows you to see the wildlife that is forever bustling about. Our lovely Canadian Geese return every year to have their babies are always a pleasure to watch. The bluebells appear in Spring and bursts into life! What ever the time of year the cabins always a pleasure to be in.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
There is private parking for guests at our cabin and your own entrance. The main house is some way away so you can enjoy privacy for all your stay. You can stroll around the lake and you have your own outdoor area. If you would like to walk to the village, you can, across the fields where you will find a small cafe, village shop, and pub.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
We would like our guest's to be aware that we do get some road noise throughout the day. We are close to the A22 which is great for excess but can get busy at times. Although our location is very tranquil and pretty you can hear the road in the background. Please read our reviews to see what our guests have thought so far."]

Title: The Good Shepherd Hut with wood-fired hot tub
Description:
['About this space', "A beautiful brand new Shepherd's Hut nestled in it's own little paddock, in rural Hampshire within the South Downs National Park. The hut's bespoke design ensures a luxurious stay with a comfy double bed, free WiFi, underfloor heating, wood-burning stove, sofa, kitchenette and ensuite. Outside there‚Äôs a fire pit/BBQ, picnic table and wood-fired hot tub offering glorious views across fields. It's the perfect place to relax and unwind and soak-in the hot tub surrounded by nature.", 'The space', "The space
The Good Shepherd Hut has been built by master craftsmen to a high specification with every requirement catered for. Each little detail has been chosen to create a homely atmosphere. Here you will find, a fridge/mini freezer, butler's sink, dual hob, microwave, kettle, toaster, bluetooth radio, crockery and cutlery. There's a sofa and fold down table and chairs from which to dine, watch nature, or stream movies! For added luxury, towelling robes and slippers are provided with an ensuite rainforest shower offering instant hot water and a flushing loo. Outside, you'll find your own small private paddock complete with picnic table, fire pit/BBQ, bench seat and wood-fired hot tub. The paddock offers privacy and plenty of space to take in the glorious views over fields. Sunbathe and watch stunning sunsets, or stargaze from the Scandinavian style wood-fired hot tub. Often you will see deer playing in the fields, with barn owls, rabbits, pheasants, grouse and birds of prey.
We provide a welcome bundle of logs and kindling wood and a complimentary tea tray and continental breakfast. There are hundreds of walks and bike rides connecting us to the South Downs National Park and Ashford Hangers and a variety of pubs serving great food and quintessential English villages to discover locally. If you like watersports, the coast is easily accessed within 30 minutes, or simply relax and unwind soaking in the hot-tub, gazing at the stars and enjoying the peace and comfort you will find here.", '', "Guest access
We offer private parking on the driveway of our thatched cottage, with a 70 metre walk to access the little paddock where the hut enjoys it's own secluded and private space. We are on hand to answer questions, but will leave you to enjoy the peace and quiet of the surrounds. This is an ideal location for walkers, cyclists and nature lovers and those just simply wishing to get away from the hassles of everyday life!", '', '']

Title: Delightful small converted barn
Description:
['About this space', 'Unique newly converted small barn, bright, light and self contained. Sleeps 3 adults or 2 adults and 2 children (or 2 small adults) due to restricted height space in loft. Large gravel drive behind big, wooden gates for safe and easy parking. Teas, coffee and biscuits provided.
Situated down a country lane, within the garden of the house, walking distance to pubs and restaurants. A few miles from Ascot and Royal Windsor, Train stations to London and Reading.', 'The space', 'The space
Delightful newly converted small barn offering high quality self contained accomodation. Bright, light and unique. Large gravel drive behind wooden gates for easy safe parking.
Sleeps 3 adults, or 2 adults and 2 children (2 small adults upstairs), due to restricted height space in loft. Steep staircase so not suitable for very young children to sleep upstairs. Well equipped galley kitchen , combination microwave/oven and single hob, fridge and shower bathroom.
Teas, coffee and biscuits provided.
Situated down a country lane, within the garden of the house, easy walking distance to pubs and restaurants.
Animals and chickens ( summer time with chicks ) live at the house within garden.
A few miles drive to Ascot and Royal Windsor, so great location for Ascot races and Legoland. Easy access to M4, M3, train stations, London, Reading, Marlow, Henley.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
House Rules.
No Smoking on the premises.
No candles.
No curries, cooked or takeaway ( due to stains and strong smell )']

Title: Beautiful log cabin set in a stunning meadow
Description:
['About this space', 'White Hill Lodge is a lovingly-converted log cabin situated a short walk from beautiful Shoreham village with its cosy pubs and award-winning Mount Vineyard.', 'The space', "The space
The Lodge is set within a stunning meadow with views over hills and fields. It sleeps four comfortably in a double bed and two single beds and we can add a fold-out mattress or travel cot if needed. There is a fully equipped kitchen with oven, hob, microwave and dishwasher, and a TV with FreeSat and DVD player. You will have your own outdoor seating area. The meadow (shared with guests of White Hill Hut) has a swing, trampoline and children's playhouse, and guests can use our outdoor heated swimming pool for 1.5 hours a day, all year round.
White Hill Lodge can be booked alongside White Hill Hut - a beautiful shepherd's hut sleeping 2, also listed on Airbnb.
* Please note, the upstairs bedroom with two single beds is a mezzanine level so may not be suitable for toddlers who like to climb!", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The meadow and all its amenities is exclusively for guests of White Hill Lodge and White Hill Hut. The pool can be used by the Lodge and the Hut separately for 1.5 hours a day - the family use this pool also at other times.
Please be aware that the property has an outdoor gated swimming pool and two ponds, so if you have young children, they will need to be supervised at all times.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
We have two friendly dogs on the property but they don't have access to the meadow area. Please keep your dog on a lead at all points and clean up after the, placing the bags in the bin provided.
The upstairs bedroom with two single beds is a mezzanine level so may not be suitable for young children who like to climb."]

Title: Self contained Ecopod with parking near the Downs
Description:
['About this space', 'Our unique Ecopod was handcrafted in Wales, it is beautifully insulated with sheep wool and has a lovely smell of wood. The large double glazing doors allow you to make the most of sunlight, you are in the sunniest spot of the garden! The village has everything you need, four independent coffee shops, one bakery and two supermarkets. Further down you have the beautiful Hurstpierpoint, Ditchiling and Lewes, if you fancy more action, Brighton is 10 minutes away. FULLY HEATED for colder days.', 'The space', 'The space
IF YOU CAN'T FIND THE DATES YOU WANT PLEASE MESSAGE ME AS I MAY HAVE A LAST MINUTE CANCELLATION OR THE DATES ARE BLOCKED AND NOT YET AVAILABLE.
We are close to the Downs National Park, as well as having Brighton 20 minutes away. So if you want to walk and visit the village, then it's easy. But it's equally easy to pop into Brighton for sea air or shopping.

We are located close to the A23. The nearest station is Hassocks, which is 10 minutes walk from us. This is the Brighton line to London Bridge/ Victoria. Gatwick airport is 30 minutes by car.

There's also cycle hire at the station in Hassocks, which is a 10 minute walk from our house.

Hurstpierpoint is a nearby village with lots of shops and some great pubs, 5 minutes by car or 40 minutes walking.

You also have Lewes, Plumpton, Ditchling to visit.

Cyclists and hikers are also welcome. There are two "cycling cafes" nearby Proper Cycling here in Hassocks and Velusso in Ditchling.

Pubs include The Bull, The Thatched Inn, Jack and Jill Inn, The Hassocks and more. We have a curry and chinese restaurant on the High Street as well as Fish and chips and Kebab Take away.

Finally a local lady called Carly delivers amazing afternoon teas, she organizes everything and even takes the dirty plates away so you don't have to worry about the washing up check Carly's Afternoon Teas on Facebook.

THE POD

SELF CHECK IN AVAILABLE AND OWN ACCESS INDEPENDENT FROM MAIN HOUSE.

The PODis tucked away on a corner of our family garden. It is NOT secluded and I think is not ideal for romantic weekends. If not sure please message me BEFORE booking.

You will have your own independent access to the Pod.

Own indoor kitchen area: microwave, small fridge, kettle, tea/ coffee facilities and crockery. There is no cooker so you cannot make your meals from scratch. You can buy lovely meals from COOK at our local Budgens or eat out at one of the local pubs restaurants (BOOKING HIGHLY RECOMMENDED)

You have WI FI and TV (with Amazon Fire stick), internet can be slow at times but it is normally good.

You can also have a hammock on the veranda of the Pod, we have one should you wish to relax in the Sun.

There will also be a selection of coffee, tea, hot chocolate and biscuits for you.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
you will have your own access to the POD. using the side gate of the main house', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We speak Portuguese, French, Spanish and some Italian too

Free off street parking. We also have space for 1 small car on our drive

Ironing board available on request

Some toiletries provided

Clean towels provided

Extra blankets provided too']

Title: Nettlebed Farm Holiday Lets, Barn1
Description:
['About this space', 'Beautiful oak barn set in traditional english countryside. Placed with own access within 15 acres of private woodland and grazing land, away from the main road for peace and tranquility. Guests are able to have privacy for relaxation and enjoy views of horses grazing and the comings and goings of the British wildlife. Just 4 minute drive to the market town of Bishops Waltham or you can join and follow the infamous Pilgrims Trail and walk there in just 30 minutes.', 'The space', "The space
Stunning new build accommodation set away from the road with private access. Three cabins built with privacy in mind whilst still making the most of the beautiful views and countryside Durley has to offer. Large apex windows create a warm, light and airy space to relax in with an open plan living area with dining.
With beautifully thought out living space, kitchen and double bedroom with wet room ensuite - you'll find everything you need for your stay. Finished to a high spec our barns have been built to provide home comforts whilst limiting our impact on the surrounding countryside and natural wildlife. Driving down the private road and walking across to your barn to mark the start of your stay will feel like a complete step away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.
There is ample parking for cars, horse boxes and motorhomes if required,( 240 v and water available).", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Due to Covid 19 we will no longer be leaving our welcome pack which also includes tea, coffee and milk.
Barn 1 has 2 bedrooms but also has a sofabed in the main living area so can accommodate 6 people if required.
We welcome dogs but please keep them off the furniture and bringing your 4 legged friends bed would be a good idea to help them settle.
Also we have stables and horses on the farm .
If the horses are out side the stables please pass trough this area slowly you may need to open and close the gate.']

Title: Les Charmettes  , Haslemere
Description:
['About this space', "Only two miles from beautiful Haslemere yet nestled in the heart of South Downs, Les Charmettes is the perfect getaway for all the family. Only ten minutes from Black Down; the highest point in South Downs National Park you have walks into the most fantastic countryside quite literally on your doorstep. The beauty of this location is that you are away from it all yet have excellent travel links only moments away. Haslemere station has a line running direct to London Central with a travel time of 49 minutes as well as direct line to Guildford getting you there in only 15 minutes. Excellent Sussex & Surrey pubs are within an easy taxi distance. 'The White Horse' & 'Apple Tree' pub are local and are particularly good. A little to the East towards Petworth 'Noah's Ark Inn' is another local favourite with excellent food and service. Make sure to book if you are going on a weekend evening! For those attended Goodwood Festival of Speed or Revival this couldn't be a more perfect base. You are only 30 minutes from the events and travelling via the north side of Sussex offers a less traffic filled journey getting you there smoothly across the Downs and cutting in-between West Dean & Charlton. Get in touch for more information on local routes.

Les Charmettes has a wonderful alpine feel about it tucked away into the rolling hills of South Downs National Park. On arrival you quite literally look up to the wonderful chalet like building through green vegetation and trees. Following a winding wooden stairway up to the front door you feel as if you have stepped into another world leaving the hustle and bustle of day to day far behind you. Les Charmettes has a fantastically quirky garden going uphill to the fields beyond. As you make your way up to the top you find patches of secret garden, flat decked areas with hammocks, dining tables and chairs and perfect BBQ spots.

Les Charmettes is warm and welcoming from the moment you step through the door. The kitchen dining area is the heart of the building making the perfect spot to entertain and convene with all the family over a home cooked meal or local takeaway ordered in. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need to effectively self-cater during your stay. A separate utility area with washer and dryer can be found by the front door.

The living room with open fire is the ideal spot to unwind and relax. Cosy down with a roaring fire on the chilly evenings or open up the bi-fold doors on a summers day and let country air and bright sunshine in. Stepping out of the living room you find yourself on a gorgeous decked area with plenty of room for dining outdoors. Surrounded by foliage and trees you can enjoy the peace that this holiday home brings.

On the first floor Les Charmettes has one ground floor bedroom with shower room next door. This lovely space includes desk and chair for a laptop area as well a single day bed which can be converted into a double upon request. Here is also access to the garden via a French window leading out to a space with bistro table and chairs.

On the first floor is large master bedroom with balcony. This room has a full sized cot and sofa bed which can be used for small children. Please note your own linen is required for cot and extra sofa beds. The master bedroom has a large walk through wardrobe leading to a good sized en suite.

Further along the book lined landing you will find a double bedroom and twin bedroom. A shower room with WC is also on the first floor. The landing has space to become a play area (stair gates are at the top and bottom of the stairwell) a futon is also here which can be used as a sleeping space should guests not want to share a room.

Free wifi included. Parking available for four cars."]

Title: Magical Treehouse/Cabin hidden in Ancient Woodland
Description:
['About this space', "Welcome to Treetop Lodge, it's a special, magical place to stay. Situated in 10 acres of private ancient woodland on the edge of the Surrey Hills.
Escape into nature and stay warmed by a roaring fire and watch the wildlife stroll past your windows; looking out into woodland in all directions.
The hill was part of Winston Churchill's GHQ line from Bristol to London and pillboxes can be found in the grounds, including one that provides the foundation for this unique structure.", 'The space', 'The space
The space provides a cosy, retreat whilst allowing you to watch nature from the comfort of your bed! The main room provides a woodburner for heating, a clothes rail, two bedside drawers, lights, a 42" flatscreen TV connected to a blu-ray/DVD player (note there is no access to standard TV channels, we have a wide range of DVD's available at the main house if you would like to watch something), a small fridge, microwave/oven and oven compartment in the wood burner provide basic cooking/food capability. Fairy-lights are threaded throughout the beams and roof space.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The treehouse/lodge is located in 10 acres of private grounds and woodland that you are welcome to explore. Around the treehouse are woodland trails and a bench to sit and enjoy the location. Access is via a steep grass covered hillside, so good movement is needed and care should be taken. The car park is situated approx 150m away, therefore you might want to minimise trips/have luggage that can be transported easily across grassland.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The treehouse has mains electricity and water. Due to the isolation of the treehouse and the length of electricity cable to supply the property you will need to be careful not to utilise many high voltage items at the same time e.g. oven/microwave, hob, bathroom heater or bathroom hot water. There will be wood, kindling, paper and lighter supplied for the use of the Woodburner and the top part of this can be used as a small oven for heating food. There is a cold water tap on the right hand side of the outside as you go up the stairs. There is excellent 4G coverage for the Vodafone network, I do not know for others. WiFi access is available via an external WiFI hotspot near the main house/car park.

October to March - We provide a basket of logs and half a bag of kindling per day.
April to September - We provide 1/2 a basket of logs and half a bag of kindling per day.

Additional wood and kindling can be purchased at a cost of ¬£15 per basket of wood and ¬£8 per bag of kindling.']

Title: Charming and Characterful Barn with Stunning Views
Description: ['About this space', 'Charming, spacious and characterful barn conversion with stunning countryside views, in an idyllic village setting. The barn is open-plan with oak beams, spiral staircase, wood burner and a large outdoor patio with seating. This home has been fitted with brand-new conduction hob, oven, microwave, and modern bathroom. It sits in a highly sought after and beautiful village dating back to the 1100s. There are two quality gastropubs, a village shop and several gorgeous walks and trails close by.', 'The space', 'The space\nFully furnished and thoughtfully decorated to make this space very special and homely. The barn has a mezzanine master bedroom and looks out across a pretty garden and rolling fields beyond. There is also a large TV with free view television. Secure private parking also available.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note\nWood, kindling and matches will be provided for the wood burner!']

Title: Private Woodland Cabin with own wood-fired Hot-Tub
Description:
['About this space', "A cosy, private, self contained cabin with its own wood-fired Hot-tub, overlooking our woods. The cabin is well equipped with everything you'll need for your stay, we supply a breakfast starter pack and tea & coffee, and a few treats. We are happy to help set up birthday/anniversary celebration. A gas BBQ is available on the deck of the cabin and you're welcome to bring your bikes, we have a cycle rack to use. There is only one unit on property, you‚Äôll be comfortably secluded and private.", 'The space', 'The space
This is an ideal space to relax, unwind and reconnect. Walking or cycling from the back gate can take you on river walks, to Frensham Ponds and to various beautiful places to enjoy. We are happy for you to bring a well behaved dog with you. We will get the hot tub ready for your arrival, keep you supplied with wood and happy to maintain fire each pm, if you prefer not to do it. It‚Äôs perfect to relax in after a day out, we often hear owls and see wildlife, it‚Äôs a special place.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The guests have sole use of the privately situated cabin with its own deck, hot-tub and gas BBQ. There is a grassed area to the side which they can use for lawn games or enjoy the sun, loungers are provided. They may see horses passing to the bridlepath but this is in no way invasive. We welcome the LGBTQIA+ community.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We are within easy walking distance of the Duke of Cambridge pub which is great for meals, I suggest booking as they are very popular.
We are right on the walking paths which lead to Frensham Ponds, Tilford, Hankley Common, Pierre point farm and the Craft Rooms brewery. It‚Äôs a great area for cycling too and a bike rack is available for use, as is a hose and tap to wash down muddy dogs and bikes!
Please consider covering your booking by taking travel insurance with Covid cover which will cost less than ¬£10 for a weekend in case of a positive LFT after the free cancellation window.']

Title: Ivy shepherds hut with hot tub
Description:
['About this space', 'Set in a clearing in the woods, our holiday lets offer the perfect place to relax in a socially-distanced environment. We have also increased our cleaning programme so you can be sure that your stay will be as safe as possible.
Check-in on Fridays and Mondays only. Minimum 3-night stay.', 'The space', 'The space
Set in beautiful surroundings, Ivy offers guests the chance to relax and soak up the beautiful natural surroundings or visit one of the many local attractions. Ivy comes complete with bedding, towels, logburner and wood-fired hot tub!

Ivy itself is a beautiful shepherds hut, equipped with everything you should need.

Ivy includes:
A comfy double bed
Bedding and towels
Fridge
Electric kettle
Single ring camping stove
Logburner
TV over the bed
Flushing Toilet (with an ingenious lifting trap door to convert it from toilet to shower)
Shower
Electric sockets
Fully equipped kitchen
Household essentials (toilet roll, washing up liquid, cooking oil, salt and pepper, and a pint of milk)
Outdoor seating
BBQ
Chimnea
Wood-fired hot tub (no bubbles)
1 bag of logs for each night of your stay (additional bags of logs charged at ¬£5 per bag, kindling ¬£2 per tub. Also available: instant light BBQ coal ¬£3 per bag, firelogs ¬£2).

Golf packages and fishing also available - enquire for details.

See also our other listings: Bluebell the shepherds hut with hot tub and Oak Lodge with wood-fired hot tub, perfect for 2!.', '', '', '', '']

Title: The Blewbury Studio: country walks, pubs & piano.
Description:
['About this space', 'Listed in The Sunday Telegraph as one of ‚Äò10 coolest BnB‚Äôs in Britain‚Äô The Studio is situated in a cosy Oxfordshire village, on the edge of AONB North Wessex Downs (thatched cottages, orchards, pubs & walks). Stunning, detached timber~framed barn: large living area with sofa & 2 armchairs, mezzanine & king size bed {via ladder}, kitchenette, shower room. Also parking, good Wifi, handmade crockery, microwave/grill, fridge/freezer, organic vegetable garden, Grand Piano (extra charge)', 'The space', "The space
(Currently set up for minimum 2 night weekend break. For stays longer than 3 nights please message us üôè).

For over 150 years the village of Blewbury has been a destination for artists, and, as such, The Blewbury Studio is flooded with light and colour. Beautiful paintings and objects, along with well-crafted fixtures, decorate the timber framed space, which we hope is inspiring and reflective. In keeping with the building's ECO credentials, many elements of the decor (coffee table, kitchen units etc) have been handmade on site, from upcycled pieces of timber, or found in charity shops and given a new lease of life. ‚ÄòThe Blewbury Studio‚Äô was listed both in The Sunday Telegraph and The Sunday Times as one of ‚ÄòThe 10 coolest BnB‚Äôs in Britain‚Äô (November 2020]

Parking outside our house, you are invited to walk through the garden at the back of which sits the Studio, overlooking the organic vegetable garden. Outside the back door a small private table is provided which catches the morning sun....perfect for alfresco breakfasts, or an evening drink. You are welcome to wander around our organic vegetable garden or while away the hours by the pond in our vintage deckchairs. There is a small fire pit available for when the evenings draw in (logs charged extra)

Inside, the Kitchenette comes with a decent sized fridge/freezer, and a microwave/grill for light meals. It's important to point out there is no plumbed sink in the Kitchenette; you are welcome to use the plastic wash tub/liquid and cloths provided. Breakfast (Luxury Muesli, milk, a locally baked Sourdough or Seeded Loaf, French butter, Raspberry Jam, fresh Coffee and Tea) is provided...or stroll along to the village Cafe for a Full English. For those who wish to stay in after a long day exploring, we offer a delivery service of delicious Asian inspired meals by local chefs 'Monsoon'. Using fresh local ingredients, this service is very popular with our guests..details will be emailed after booking.

The Mezzanine is a stunning feature of the accommodation, giving a unique aspect of the space. It is 2.2m from ground level, and whilst the ladder is steep it is comfortable/easy to use (10 flat treads, with brushed steel handrails on the side and at the top..see the photos). For safety reasons 'The Blewbury Studio' is not suitable for young children. The bed is a comfortable, brand new, King Size futon made of sustainable hardwood, with luxury Egyptian cotton bed linen. There is storage on the mezzanine for clothes, but we would recommend leaving suitcases/bags on ground level.

As professional musicians we take pride in our Boston Steinway grand piano. It's a stunning instrument which is available to hire by professional musicians or those engaged in serious study (payable in advance- variable rates-please message me). Otherwise the piano will be locked. There are extra music stands available to borrow. There is a large CD collection to peruse, and music system, as well as vocal scores and piano music.

There is a selection of books on the local area, plus OS walking maps to borrow. The bird life is diverse in the area, with as many as 30 different species visiting our own garden, including Herons, Woodpeckers, Sparrowhawks, a Tawny Owl, Red Kites and a Mandarin Duck! There is also a guide to garden birds and binoculars to borrow. There is Scrabble and playing cards... but no telly! Before your arrival we'll email you a file detailing information on local restaurants, shops, beauty spot recommendations, local businesses, and fun excursions like hiking routes, wild swimming or hiring canoes on The Thames.

White Company towels and Egyptian Cotton bed linen are all provided, along with 'Faith in Nature' Body Wash, Shampoo and Conditioner, and a hair dryer.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The Studio is available in its entirety for your private use, along with an outside area. You are welcome to sit under the Hazel tree by the pond..a great place for a coffee, and wander about the vegetable garden.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
There will be a Welcome Pack on arrival:
-Fresh local sourdough, butter and raspberry jam
-Milk, freshly ground coffee and tea
-Muesli
-Iced water
-Small bottle of Prosecco

-After booking we will email a local info pack, along with details of how to order delicious ready meals from local company 'Monsoon'...Asian inspired meals, made with fresh local ingredients. If you're planning a night in after a long day's walking, this is a popular option for our guests (please give at least 24 hrs notice)"]

Title: The Cowshed, Tunbridge Wells
Description:
['About this space', "New for 2018, a totally renovated and extended 1920's cowshed. This cosy retreat is 1 mile from the historic Pantiles of Tunbridge Wells and mainline station where London can be reached in around 50 minutes. It sits on the Kent and East Sussex border in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.
With its wide range of eating places and shops, Tunbridge Wells is a great base from which to explore the beautiful Garden of England.
The owners live alongside the Cowshed but respect your privacy.", 'The space', 'The space
There is external CCTV protecting the property and we have electric gates', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The Cow Shed, the grass in front and the patio at the back. One parking space. The driveway in front of our house is private.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Parking is for one car only as this is shared parking with our home. It may be possible to accommodate an additional car, but this is by prior agreement.
Sorry no children under 12 apart from non walking babies.
Also strictly no pets
There is a combination microwave and induction hob but no conventional oven.
Wedding parties incur an additional cleaning charge of ¬£30.']

Title: Garden Guest Suite
Description:
['About this space', 'Private Garden room with en-suite bathroom in the pretty village of Freeland. Self check in available. Private parking and WiFi. Freeland is a small village with a lovely village pub which is located a stones throw away. Close to Oxford 10.1 miles, Woodstock (Blenheim Place) 5.2 miles and nearest train station is just 2.6 miles away.', 'The space', 'The space
The property is located opposite the quiet Village Pub and church. It is also a few doors away from Freeland Village Hall, we back onto a lovely playing field which has a park at the far end. You have your own private outside area in front of the accommodation with seating. Please note that it is a family house and although you have your own area you may still hear my children playing in the garden when the weather permits! We also now have a black Labrador, he‚Äôs very young and likes to greet guests with a bark when he‚Äôs in the garden, please note he is very friendly and can‚Äôt get to you, just please don‚Äôt be alarmed if you see him!', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
We offer self check in, please go straight through the gate on the left hand side of the house. There on your right you will find the key safe (combination will be sent to you before arrival) containing the key to your room. The garden room is located at the end of the property, just follow the path and lights and you can‚Äôt go wrong! If you‚Äôd prefer to be shown to the suite then please message and I‚Äôll make sure I‚Äôm around at your check in time.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The space doesn‚Äôt have a fully fitted kitchen but there is a microwave, mini fridge and tea and coffee making facilities. A welcome pack will also be provided.']

Title: Beautiful  Log Cabin set in idyllic surrounding
Description:
['About this space', 'Beautiful one bedroom log cabin with separate shower room and comfortable living space.
Set in 2 acres surrounded by woodland.
Located in wonderful village of Chelsfield with 2 local pubs both serving excellent food.
Orpington Town is just a short drive away with shops, restaurants, pubs and cinema.
Orpington station provides fast train service in to London Victoria and London Charing Cross both within 25 minutes or less .', 'The space', 'The space
Just come, relax, enjoy the view and the tranquility. You will leave with your shoulders down!']

Title: Private Annex with Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', 'Located within the gardens of a quaint cottage, this private annex is modern, cosy and relaxed. The perfect place to explore the beautiful surrounding countryside or use as a base for the areas multitude of sporting and cultural events.', 'The space', "The space
The annex is split in to 4 rooms:

A cosy living room, complete with wood burning fire and 70'' TV , DVD player and free view channels . The large L-shaped sofa, is perfect to come back to after a long days out in the local countryside.

Generously sized bedroom with queen bed and stylish wood furnishing.

A modern bathroom with shower/bath and WC.

A small pantry with refrigeration, a microwave, toaster and tea / coffee . Please note this is not a proper kitchen and therefore doesn't have proper cooking facilities . However the area is full of fantastic pubs, restaurants and deli's we'd be happy to recommend. And the local shop in Kirdford does a great cooked breakfast !!

Outside is connected by a series of double doors and there's a small terrace with table and chairs, perfect for a sunny morning coffee. Here you'll also find the hot tub overlooking paddocks.", '', '', '', '']
