Title: Enchanted Glade Tiny house
Description:
['About this space', 'Return to nature with comfort and ease.
The perfect eco retreat in our off grid wooden cabin or luxury bell tents. Nestled within the enormous magical gardens of a private estate.
Relax and unwind in the serenity of our wild spa with only pheasants and deer as neighbours!
We are located in the heart of Sussex -Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB)
Excellently located, only 30 miles from central London and 45 mins Brighton The perfect getaway to return to a sense of Peace and Tranquility.', 'The space', "The space
The perfect staycation , so close to London and Brighton , yet feels like a million miles away.
Social distancing and bubble friendly holidays.
It IS possible to hire the entire glade to yourselves and have it as a private party/family gathering. Please message me for details.

Our Enchanted glade is set in a magical garden in the middle of a working farm on a plateau in the High Weald, intersected by deep wooded valleys with sandstone outcrops. We are an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and a Site of Special Scientific Interest, yet within 10 miles of Gatwick and 35 miles of Central London.

Our gardens comprise some rare and exotic Himalayan species, first laid out in 1865. The avenue of Californian Redwoods includes some of the tallest trees in England. And our woods contain bluebells, mosses, lichens and briophytes amongst spectacular sandstone outcrops

WE OFFER:

-1 Wooden Cabin, Sleeps 4 (2 adults,2 children) - There is a sofa that can be used as a bed and one Inflatable mattress. -The cabin has its own private Basic kitchen plus Barbecue outside.
Please note that this IS a 'Tiny house' and for larger families, the tents are a better option. See our alternative listing for the tents.

* 3x Luxury Bell tents with furniture and decor, decking and wood burners. Very comfortable and cosy.... Sleeps 2 adults and 2 children (single mattresses for the kids, please bring sleeping bags!)

-WOOD FIRED HOT TUB under the Stars [seats 6] available for TWO HOUR SLOTS for an extra ¬£45, Booking in advance required.

-'Missing link' brewery and cafe are onsite and open every weekend with different food vans and events. Check their website for specific details.

-Our 'WILD SPA' - Massage-Full body oil or Thai Yoga massage, Nature connection, Life coaching, Creative arts workshops, Booking in advance.

-FORAGING/WILD Banquet experience with our fully insured and very experienced local forager- Fergus Drennon who writes regularly on wild food and foraging for BBC Countryfile Magazine, The Ecologist, Country Kitchen, Bushcraft and Survival Skills Magazine, as well as contributing and/or featuring in many other magazines including most national newspapers. He has also appeared on TV.

-Shared Compost toilet with Hot shower in the Redwood forest.

-Shared fire pit for all to enjoy.

-There is an undercover basic kitchen with sink, running water, gas cooker, Basic utensils and BBQ for the campers.

-There are so many beautiful walks to explore locally. (within our boundaries and on public pathways)

- Boulders and caves to explore.

- Paintball and clay pigeon shooting is available onsite and there are so many local attractions (see our FB page for regular updates)

- Excellently located in the middle of so many wonderful local attractions including two reservoirs and Ashdown Forest. See my 'guestbook'.

Please note: Although bedding is provided, TOWELS ARE NOT-please bring your own. Tea and coffee is provided but not breakfast.
Enough wood to heat the cabin for both evenings is provided, additional wood costs ¬£10 a sack.
There is currently no fridge available, please bring a cool box if required.
There is lighting and a USB port in the cabin, but other than that there is no electricity.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
PLEASE NOTE , it is a 10 min walk from the parking spot to the site. We will meet you with our 4x4 on arrival and help you with bags to and from the site, plus offer wheelbarrows. Bring suitable comfortable walking shoes and clothing for all weathers. There are many private and public pathways that you will be able to access from our glade.
Also, as we are on a private estate, there is a security gate , this will be locked after 11pm.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
-It is possible to book a veg or breakfast hamper in advance (¬£25 from the local farm) or to have meals delivered, please let us know if you are interested in this.

-There is a local co op shop in Shaprthorne village which is 5 mins drive. There is also a village shop with local, organic produce.

-Plawhatch Biodynamic farm shop is open 6 days a week and is 10 mins drive.

- Forest Bathing- Our compost toilet and HOT shower is a 1 min walk from the cabin.

*WILD SPA*
-Private Wood fired hot tub under the stars -
¬£45 per 2 hr session [can seat 6 people]

-Full Body MASSAGE, Deep tissue or Thai yoga massage available onsite for ¬£55 pp.
This can include a cupping therapy session.

*Wood fired sauna - ¬£45 per session *

-Wild food foraging and fireside cooking experience=Includes nature awareness exercises, some basic bushcraft skills 1.5 hr walk exploring the area and learning about edible and medicinal plants, PLUS A delicious meal cooked on the fire including all the foraged items. ¬£200 for up to 6 people.

-Please note that we welcome acoustic music by the fire, but drums, speakers and sound system's are not allowed.
We must ensure peace and tranquillity for ALL our guests and the people who live on site.

*There is an 11pm curfew in terms of music in the glade and also returning back onsite. The security gate will be locked after this. *

* After some bad experiences, we have sadly decided to be a NO DOG site, we are truly sorry for those we cannot accommodate as a result of this."]

Title: Gamekeeper's Cottage, near Sissinghurst Castle
Description:
['About this space', 'Sissinghurst Castle and its famous gardens are only a 15 minute woodland walk away from this peaceful and tranquil one bedroom cottage which is set in private grounds of 18 acres and surrounded by woods and wildlife. Gamekeeper Cottage is the perfect retreat for getting away from it all, at all times of year, but is only one hour from London by train. The cottage dates from 1798 and sits directly opposite the main house. The wood burner makes it a cosy and romantic getaway. Sleeps 2-4', 'The space', 'The space
This charming one bedroom cottage is over 200 years old and has been beautifully restored, retaining many of its original features, including the wooden beams. A very large window provides great views to the gardens, large pond and impressive eucalyptus trees beyond.

The double bedroom

The cottage has recently been extended and now includes a large double bedroom which is light and airy and has wonderful views to the pond and beyond. The French doors open onto a large patio area where guests can relax and enjoy the pond, the wildlife and extensive garden area. A barbecue is available. PLEASE NOTE THAT THE EXTENSION HAS NOT YET BEEN COMPLETED SO THERE ARE NO PHOTOS YET. IT WILL BE COMPLETED AT THE END OF MARCH 2022

The open plan living room and mezzanine sleeping area

The living room has a large window providing fantastic views to the pond and gardens, There is a very comfortable sofa, dining table and chairs, as well as the woodburner. The bathroom has a shower, toilet and sink. The kitchen area has an electric oven/hob and fridge freezer. The comfortable double bed is on a mezzanine level accessed by a steepish staircase.

Please note that although the cottage can sleep up to 4 guests, it is quite small for 4.

The Woodburner
The wood burner is a favourite feature of our guests, providing warmth and a cosy atmosphere. All wood and kindling is provided. The wood is sustainably sourced from trees coppiced on the property. There are also electric heaters for those who don't want to light a fire.


The outside area
Outside the cottage, there is a large patio area where guests can relax and enjoy the pond and wildlife. There is a table and chairs and a barbecue. Guest also have exclusive access to the extensive, beautiful garden area around the pond.

There is also a "magical circle of oak " BBQ/sitting area in the woodland which is completely secluded and is a great favourite of our guests. Located in the middle of a circle of ancient oak trees, it is a wonderful spot to light a fire and listen to the bird life.

We have excellent WIFI - "superfast" fibre to the property with a download speed of 900 megabytes per second

Sissinghurst Castle and its world renowned gardens is only a short walk away by public footpath, through enchanting woods. The property adjoins the Sissinghust Castle Estate so all you need to do is walk to the top of the drive, cross the road and you are immediately in the grounds of Sissinghurst Castle - the Castle itself is about 15 minutes walk away, through an enchanting wood.

Gamekeeper's Cottage provides a great retreat at all times of year. In autumn and winter it is cosy and atmospheric, with the roaring fire and wonderful crisp walks on your doorstep. Spring and summer are spectacular, with the "Garden of England", as Kent is known, blossoming and coming to life. Bluebell season, which is usually in May, is a particular favourite, with carpets of bluebells in the woods.

The local wildlife is plentiful. As well as the resident ducks and chickens, there are many badgers, foxes and deer in the woodlands surrounding the cottage. In the dead of night you will hear the owls hooting and the dawn chorus of the numerous birds will greet you at day break.

The area has many excellent pubs, some of which are over 500 years old. They all serve very good food and first class local beer. The Milkhouse in Sissinghurst and the Three Chimneys in Biddenden are both one mile away.

There are many other National Trust properties nearby, including Castles, stately homes and gardens. The charming village of Cranbrook is 3 miles away and the Cinque port of Rye, with the golden sands of Camber, 30 minutes by car. London is one hour away by train and Canterbury one hour. There are many beautiful walks in the immediate vicinity, many of which can be started from the cottage itself.


Vineyards

The area is also known for some of the finest vineyards in England. Biddenden Vineyards, Hush Heath and Chapel Down are a short drive away.

Yoga

Henrietta is a fully qualified British School of Yoga instructor and teaches from beginner level to advanced. Classes can be arranged directly with her, either in the main house or outside in spring and summer.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Parking is immediately outside the cottage', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We have excellent WIFI - "superfast" fibre broadband with a download speed of 900 megabytes per second . However, we have a limited mobile phone signal , due to a poor signal from the main exchange. If you switch on wi-fi calling on your phone then calls work well in the apartment. If this does not work and you do need to make a call there is a good signal at the top of the drive and you are welcome to use the landline in the main house.

Please note that the main beam in the cottage is 6 feet 2 inches high and the double bed at the mezzanine level can only be accessed from one side. Public transport is limited and the country roads are not pedestrian friendly so ideally it is better to come with your own transport. Alternatively, taxis can be booked through the local firm, MTC taxis.']

Title: The Acorn - Deep cleaned and FLEXIBLE C-19 changes
Description:
['About this space', 'Brand new detached house in an elevated position above a quiet rural lane. Great night skies and horses in the field next door. Outside sitting area and private parking. Lovely king sized double bed with views and high quality bedding. Local eggs provided for breakfast. The Acorn is in the heart of the village so it‚Äôs very easy to walk anywhere and find 3 great pubs. There is also a Co-op store in the village. Fully refundable booking settings.', 'The space', 'The space
We have stayed in many places and tried to take the good parts from each to make The Acorn comfortable and relaxing for you. There is a stereo and an ekornes stressless relaxing leather chair in the main bedroom. Downstairs is a leather sofa and an extendable dining table to seat 4 and an electric shower in the bathroom.

In the fridge will be milk and local free range eggs, there are cereals and various teas and a new frying pan!
We have 2 travel cots and a high chair should you need them.

We can put another mattress upstairs if needed so it would be possible to sleep 5.

There is a lady in the village who can make chocolate brownies or Victoria sponge cake at 3 days notice. ¬£10 each so let us know if you might like to try one.', '', 'Guest access
You will have the whole house along with an outside sitting area and space to park 2 cars.
We also have a large children‚Äôs trampoline in our garden which any children can use at their own risk, please just walk round any time. The post code is MK45 4BG.', '', 'Other things to note
The house is up a short but a little steep drive which some people may find difficult to walk up/down. However there is parking available at both the top and bottom so no need to walk it.']

Title: Stansted Airport - Luxury Annexe with Parking
Description:
['About this space', 'The accommodation is separate from our house and has its own entrance.
We provide a basic breakfast essentials i.e. Bread, Fresh milk, Tea & Coffee etc.
Free off road parking for duration of your stay.
Airport transfers available.
You will require a car as we are in a rural location.
IMPORTANT NOTE: If there is any anti-sociable behaviour or taking of any illegal substances by any member of your group, you will all be immediately dismissed from the property and there will be no refunds given.', 'The space', "The space
The space

The Annexe in a quiet rural location near Stansted Airport and wedding venues. It has 2 bedrooms with the main bedroom having a double bed and the 2nd bedroom having 2 single beds. In the living area there is a double sofa bed and a corner sofa suite, table and chairs and a 40' TV. The living room and main bedroom, have views of the peaceful garden which you have access to. The courtyard has a seating area which you can sit outside and enjoy a cup of coffee or something stronger.

There is shower room with toilet and wash basin and we provide shampoo, conditioner and body wash.

In the Kitchen you will have access to Kettle, Toaster, Microwave and Washing Machine. We provide a basic breakfast - tea, coffee, cereal, fresh milk, spreads.

There is an Electric Hob, George Foreman Grill and Microwave as cooking facilities. I also provide, pans and cooking utensils.", '', '', '', 'Other things to note']

Title: Private, tranquil lakeside en-suite hut,
Description:
['About this space', 'Fantastic scenic location with superb views over open countryside towards the South Downs. Adults only. Pets (extra fee). Cosy, quiet accommodation with all mod cons, and surrounded by wildlife of all kinds. Shower room en suite. Fully equipped kitchen with cooker, microwave, fridge/freezer. Washing machine available nearby. Woodburner - free basket of logs. Welcome pack with rolls, croissants, juice, water, tea, coffee, sugar, condiments. Footpaths nearby to local villages. Disc for 3+ nights.', 'The space', 'The space
Around 20acres of farm/lake/woodland areas, with glorious views, and surrounded by wildlife of all kinds. Great fishing with many varieties available over 3 lakes. Must have current license.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
All areas accessible except where livestock kept (pointed out by host on arrival). Dogs to be kept on lead except in designated areas.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Ramp up to balcony for wheelchair/disabled users, but small space inside hut. Compact living area. Under bed storage drawers. Utiiity room (with hot water washup and washing machine has larger shower and toilet rooms with grab rails - could be ok for wheelchair/disabled users.']

Title: Charming cottage with stunning views -dog friendly
Description:
['About this space', 'Dog friendly, charming, unique ancient cottage with uninterupted, far reaching views of the Sussex countryside. Perfectly placed for guests who wish to explore the countryside, visit the historical 1066 town of Battle (within walking distance), or venture slightly further to the seaside (Hastings (8m) , Camber sands (17m), Bexhill (10m).', 'The space', 'The space
Family accommodation suitable for up to 4 guests. The cottage benefits from a large decking area overlooking stunning countryside views.
Fully equipped kitchen with oven, fridge freezer, microwave, cooking utensils.
Dedicated Barbecue area within the well maintained gardens that surround the cottage. TV and wifi also provided.
Carport parking for one car.
Please note, the inglenook fireplace is a beautiful feature but unfortunately due to the age of the cottage is not functional for live fires.
Guests will receive a complimentary welcome pack including milk, tea and coffee.
This property is a strictly non-smoking venue.
Up to 2 dogs would be welcomed.

Covid 19 cleaning will always be carried out between guests using a professional fogging machine with hypochlorous acid (HOCI) which is a hospital grade disinfectant that is also organic and environmentally friendly.']

Title: Luxury Blackdown Shepherds Hut in Surrey Hills
Description:
['About this space', "Our Shepherd's hut is situated within 40 acres of woodland, orchard and garden in an area of Outstanding Beauty set high with stunning views of the Surrey Hills. Glorious sunsets and an abundance of bird life are often seen from the hut and within the Kilnhanger estate. Although remote the hut is positioned close to our cottage for security - privacy is still available and you may park your vehicle adjacent to the hut
Our hut is not only cool in the summer but cosy in the winter", 'The space', 'The space
Shepherds Hut contains kitchennete with a fridge and two electric hobs for cooking (no oven), shower, towel rail, toilet and double bed with electric radiator to provide warmth on those cold days !', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
You are free to explore the estate, woodland and pastures but please be aware of horses and their riders that use the estate', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
As we provide a continental breakfast please advise if there are any dietary requirements.

For convenience there is private parking adjacent to the hut']

Title: Luxurious Shepherds Hut + Private Garden & Views
Description:
['About this space', 'Our cosy and luxurious Hut is suitable for singles & couples that appreciate the finer things in life. The accommodation comprises an en-suite power shower-room, compact kitchen, dining area and double bed. Facilities includes Freeview TV/Radio, WIFI and log burning stove & fuel. We provide tea, coffee, milk, crusty bread, butter, olive oil, various condiments and fresh eggs from our own happy chickens. The private garden with BBQ & furniture has fantastic views, parking space & own entrance.', 'The space', "The space
The Pilgrims Hut and surrounding lower garden is a perfect romantic retreat and is all your private space. It includes garden chairs and table, grass rug with BBQ and there are stunning views across the valley. There is also a dedicated parking space and your own private entrance.

The main garden, with high hedgerows and mature pond is the equivalent of a woodland glade and is a haven for bird life. Crows, Jays, Green and Greater Spotted Woodpeckers and of course Herons are all regular visitors, and buzzards can be seen circling high above. Bullfinch and Nuthatch are more exotic but frequent visitors and during summer nights there are hunting bats and sometimes owls to hoot you to sleep. You are welcome to wander these areas as they are enjoyed by us all.

In spring and summer the pheasants return to the garden and mallard ducks to the pond to mate. In late February Toads wake up from hibernation and begin migrating to their breeding pond in Pilgrims Garden to spawn and their croaking sounds give the gardens an equatorial feel; unfortunately the temperature doesn't match!", 'Guest access', 'Guest access', '', '']

Title:
Walnut Lodge

A pet friendly converted Barn
Description:
['About this space', 'A lovely light and airy space with a dining room/living room space downstairs. **There is no proper kitchen space, but we do provide a toaster, kettle, microwave and fridge**.

Bathroom (also downstairs) with double walk in shower, loo and sink.

Lovely bedroom upstairs with king size bed and velux windows.

Travel cot and high chair for children available on request (along with anything else we can help you with).', 'The space', 'The space
Enjoy your own access through a shared drive. Very quiet a private part of the world. Great overhead shower, TV, dining area, fridge and bedroom. Easy to use sofa bed for children and 3rd guests.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The bathroom sink plug lever is behind the taps, some guests think that it is a push plug.']

Title: Idyllic Shepherd's Hut near Chieveley
Description: ['About this space', "One of the top 30 quirky places to stay in the UK chosen by 'MuddyStilletos' travel guide. Sleeping two, the hut is perfect for couples, friends or solo travellers. It is close to beautiful walks, local pubs, farm shops and historic towns ... or simply a place to unwind, read a good book and get back to nature.", 'The space', "The space\nBeautiful bespoke Shepherds hut built on the chassis of an original hut found in a nearby copse. Located in the hamlet of Beedon Common, an area of outstanding natural Beauty just a few miles away from Chieveley and j13 of the m4. Surrounded by fields there is access directly onto byways and footpaths so perfect for anyone keen on walking or cycling. The nearby villages of Peasemore, Beedon and Chieveley are within walking distance and have super pubs for a drink or bite to eat. There are plenty of activities within a short drive from national trust properties to canal boat rides to quirky tea shops or historic market towns- more information in the welcome pack once you have booked. The hut itself is in a paddock separate from our garden which also houses a large lilly pond and a few chickens so lovely fresh eggs for breakfast. Beautiful views face across the fields to the west and across the pond to the east. We do have dogs ourselves and welcome your furry friends provided they can be trusted with other dogs and chickens. The Shepherd's hut bed can pull out to make a double or folded away to make a single. The hut is warm and cosy thanks to proper insulation, a discreet heater and a traditional log burning stove -plenty of wood provided. There is a DAB radio for your use as well as a supply of traditional games and a book swap. There is currently no bathroom in the paddock but a modern, shower room and toilet is set aside for guest use in the barn next to the main house (literally 10 seconds walk through the garden). For cooking there is a baby belling stove (hob, grill and oven) inside the hut with cutlery, cooking utensils and tea making facilities. There is a small fridge in the shelter next to the hut. For breakfast fresh eggs, bread, milk, juice, tea, fresh coffee and condiments will be provided. There is electricity inside the hut and cold running water is available outside. There is a hammock, picnic bench and a beautiful oak framed shelter with outdoor wood burner for keeping warm and cosy when sun goes down over the best views in Berkshire.", '', '']

Title: The Studio: rural riverside setting near Oxford
Description:
['About this space', 'Formerly the manor house gymnasium, The Studio now provides comfortable accommodation for two people. It consists of an open plan sitting room/bedroom, separate kitchen and shower room.
The accommodation is situated in the grounds of a riverside manor farm bordering the River Thames and is close to Oxford (on a direct bus route), Blenheim Palace and the Cotswolds.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The Studio has access to 10 acres of gardens and water meadows leading down to the Thames Path and River Thames.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please note there is high end glamping on site in the summer season.']

Title: Mary's Cabin
Description:
['About this space', 'Completely peaceful, with fantastic views-totally isolated with its own private entrance.
Set in the Chiltern hills- Mary‚Äôs Cabin is 2minutes stroll from the Restaurant of the Year-
In an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty;-walking, road & mountain biking- pub 7minutes up through the woods-
35mins from Heathrow and Oxford -Central London-50mins .
Couples, solo adventurers, and small families (with 1small child).

Sadly, since the advent of Covid, we no longer provide breakfast for our guests', 'The space', "The space
Set isolated in the garden, Mary's cabin looks across the valley, with woods on each side atop the hill, you can see for 3miles.
The space consists of one room, with double bed, satTV, internet- microwave, fridge and kettle + a shower room with toilet and sink.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Normally we try to meet you as you arrive, or failing this, there are instructions- the cabin will be open for you!', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please note that sadly, with the advent of Covid-19, we no longer supply breakfast gratis-']

Title: High Weald country side Log Cabin on Cattle farm
Description: ['About this space', 'Located on a working cattle farm, this cosy log cabin has enough space to comfortably be occupied by up to 7 people with plenty of garden space complete with picnic tables, BBQ and a fishing pond. The farm itself is found in the centre of the High Weald area of outstanding natural beauty and is surrounded by numerous castles, Bedgebury forest and Bewl reservoir. In addition to the views, only a short drive away are plenty of shopping towns, a cinema and bowling complex.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note\nPets are welcome. We have 2 dogs and 2 cats who roam the garden freely.']

Title: Swan Cabin on Taggs Island
Description:
['About this space', 'A purpose built Cabin in the garden of our river home Seahorse, which overlooks the River Thames, with views of Ash Island. You will be welcomed into a tranquil, comfortable, unique retreat with all the amenities you need for a perfect stay with us.', 'The space', "The space
Situated on Taggs Island, off the Hampton Court Road, you can drive over the island's bridge, left along the road and park in our gravel driveway next to the Cabin. It has wonderful views of the River Thames, and the sun pours in through the windows all day. We have an enchanting garden and the wildlife of the river is all around us. As well as offering comfortable, contemporary living space, you will also have exclusive use of the adjacent patio area in the garden, with outdoor seating, to sit and contemplate the river or just read and relax.

We have a dog called Dilly and a cat called Milo. There are in the garden from time to time but we will make sure they don't bother you.

Our guests have the entire cabin, which includes a bedroom, bathroom and living room. There is also a kettle, toaster, coffee machine, microwave and fridge (Please note there is no hob or oven) There is also a smart TV with internet connection.

The Cabin is entirely electric, there is no gas boiler.

(Please also note that the ¬£10 cleaning fee is for up to a 7 day stay and thereafter weekly)

Make the most of your stay by visiting one of the many places of interest around Hampton Court. The Cabin is just a five-minute walk to London's second largest royal park, Bushy Park, and only a fifteen minute walk away from Hampton Court Palace. Central London can be reached by train from Hampton Court or Kingston stations, into Waterloo. There are regular buses - the 111, R68 and 216, which stop just by the Taggs Island bridge. We also have many festivals and concerts locally, both at Hampton Court ( including the annual Flower Show) and Hampton Court Pool open air concerts. More information on the local area, restaurants, pubs and cafes can be provided . We are happy to help you with any information you need.
Kingston is also a great shopping centre and with more riverside restaurants.", '', '', '', '']

Title: The Grange (Annex Apartment)
Description:
['About this space', 'What better way to isolate yourself and your family with a completely self contained hideaway.
Situated in the remote country village of Broughton. The village boasts popular and quaint pub, renowned for its food (The Crown). The Annex is detached from the main house, Lounge/Kitchen area, Bathroom, Two ground floor Bedrooms, with a third double situated in what was a Hay Loft (not suitable for children under 14 years of age). Recently re-furbished.
Ample parking on the drive for 2 to 3 cars.', 'The space', 'The space
Three bedroomed (Isolated and separate) property, but priced for either 1 person through to a maximum of 6.

The property is situated right in the countryside and is very peaceful, quiet and surrounded by lovely countryside, fields, a few sheep, horses and of course gorgeous walks to nearby villages, and yes with a welcoming pub or two at the end!!

This is a newly renovated property, done to a high standard, with brand new furniture, Oven and Bathroom. The Kitchen is fully equipped and operational, with plates, cultery etc provided. Tea, Coffee and Sugar available after your journey and before you hit the local stores.
Most cooking equipment is available, including kettle, toaster etc.
cleaning equipment, hand wash washing up liquid, bowl all provided for. Fridge and freezer included within the property.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests will have sole access to the annex during their stay along with access to the driveway for off road and secure parking for up to three cars as required.

In addition, given the desire of many to socially distance, please note there is a key safe, allowing self check in. The property is disinfected between guests and is a real retreat for those looking for that ultimate getaway, or stop over for the wedding or party you are attending!', '', '']

Title: Willow Cottage - Sleeps 4, Benenden Kent
Description:
['About this space', 'We recently converted an outbuilding into a two bedroom house. The house is detached and purpose built. We aimed to create a space that was bright, airy and incorporated the gorgeous woodland and farmland around us.
When you stay with us you can expect to be in a peaceful rural setting with stunning views which can be admired from either the patio or through the large bifold doors leading from the main living area.', 'The space', 'The space
The downstairs has a lovely open plan kitchen and sitting room with oak beams throughout. The upstairs has a large double and a twin room, with window seats, and a stunning apex window offering fabulous views across the Kentish countryside. The shower room is also located upstairs.

Each bedroom has cotton linen, quality mattresses and Egyptian cotton towels. A travel cot and clip on highchair are available for smaller visitors. Downstairs the well equipped kitchen has everything you would need to cook up a feast. The cottage has Wi-Fi and Free View television and a washer dryer.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
You have full run of the cottage with your own private patio and views across the fields. You have your own parking space outside the cottage.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
A Full refund will be made if guests are unable to travel due to the Covid-19 restrictions.
A local catering company, Seasons Wild & Free can deliver fresh ready made food to the cottage by prior arrangement. Please follow the link below for more details. www.seasonswildandfree.com













https://www.seasonswildandfree.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/Decadently-Wild-Free-ze-Final-1308.pdf']

Title: The little Annexe
Description:
['About this space', 'The Little Annexe is a self contained detached unit. Set within our farmland near rural Warninglid, we are located within the High Weald area of outstanding natural beauty. Access to public footpaths allow you entry into the beautiful woodlands and surrounds. Ideally situated: 6 miles from both Horsham and Haywards Heath. Only a 15 min drive to Gatwick Airport. We are also local to event venues including Slaugham Place, Cisswood, Hyde Estate, Brookfield Barn, Bolney Wine Estate, South Lodge.', 'The space', 'The space
Kitchen appliances include a microwave, oven, coffee machine, kettle, toaster and fridge.
Sugar, coffee, tea is also provided.
We really hope you enjoy your stay and hope we have made it as comfortable as possible.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
There is separate entrance for guests. Off road parking for your car.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We are making every effort to ensure that you and ourselves are at the least risk during these unprecedented times. Please let us know immediately if you are displaying any Covid-19 symptoms. We would rather refund your stay then put you/us at risk. Many thanks.']

Title: Twmbarlwm Luxury Retreat - Dingle Cabin
Description:
['About this space', "*We also offer another brand new cabin @ ‚ÄòTwmbarlwm Luxury Retreat - Barnfields cabin‚Äô sleeps 6*

Luxury holiday cabin in the Risca countryside of Twmbarlwm. Built discretely into the hills, this cabin has been crafted for a relaxing vacation. The cabin has been built with great care and installed with the best insulation to ensure a peaceful night's sleep.

- Free Welcome Pack
- Private Hot tub & firepit/grill - ¬£20 for your entire stay (pay when you‚Äôre here)
- Extra logs - ¬£10/sack", 'The space', 'The space
Located near Twmbarlwm you are free to walk the entire common with a vast area to ride, we are just a 20min ride to some of the best mountain biking trails and downhill tracks in the UK.

As for the farm itself we are happy to share the space and view our animals.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
This cabin is hidden away from the farmhouse and is very private.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please respect other guests with noise and common decency must be used in and around the private hot tub area.']

Title: Toad Hall Luxury Lodge with Private Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', 'Toad Hall is our luxury lodge/ treehouse in the woods at Happy Valley Norfolk with incredible views across open unspoilt countryside with a Private Hot Tub. Suitable for 4 adults & 2 children. Under floor heating, oven, hob, toaster, kettle, fridge. Wet room. King size accommodation. BBQ. Part disable/pram friendly. Ideally located close to Sandringham, Houghton & the North Norfolk coast. 15 mins from Kings lynn station. Perfect retreat to immerse in nature. Wifi-4GBox', 'The space', 'The space
Open plan gable living room kitchen. Wet room. King size bedroom downstairs with double doors opening onto morning terrace. Watch the sunset on the west facing terrace. Double bedroom and space for children to sleep. Wet room and fully functional kitchen. Private Hot tub. Suitable for up to 4 adults and 2 children. There are space saving stairs to the first floor. These are quite steep. There is a stair gate at the top but not at the bottom. Something to note if you have small children. Outdoor dining & BBQ. The ground floor is part disabled friendly. Anyone booking must be able to open doors independently for easy escape. Covid Measures in place.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
A rural escape surrounded by woodland and open views. The lodge is hired as a whole and consists of king bedroom. Double. Fitted kitchen with oven. Sink. Hob. Fridge. Living space looking across open farmland. The ground floor is part disabled friendly. Anyone booking must be able to open doors independently for easy escape.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Hot tub may not have reached temperature on arrival due to the measures we are putting in place for Covid. Bedding is provided but please strip covers and sheets and place in laundry bag provided when you leave. Toad Hall stands alone and is private. There are blinds in the gable end and bedroom. No other curtains etc so you can appreciate the rural views.
You have to drive up a farm track to reach the lodge. All types of vehicles can drive up here, you do not need a 4x4. Downstairs has king bedroom, wetroom, living room and kitchen (oven, hob, toaster, kettle etc). We are a rural destination nestled in the woods on a traditional Norfolk working farm situated on a Norfolk Wildlife Trust. Space saving stairs to first floor. These are steeper than house stairs. Stair gate at the top. Not at the bottom. The hot tub may not be hot on arrival due to covid deep cleaning, please leave lid on and do not press buttons as this will not speed up heating times. There is a play area for children on the main Glamping site. You will need towels and to bring woodland appropriate footwear. WiFi isn‚Äôt the best but that‚Äôs due to the rural setting. Not good enough for streaming. 4g in places. A holiday to connect in nature and reconnect with each other.The ground floor is part disabled friendly. Anyone booking must be able to open doors independently for easy escape.']

Title: Alton forest lodge
Description:
['About this space', 'Alton forest lodge is a unique woodland hidaway set in beuatiful ancient forest on the edge of the peak district national park.', 'The space', 'The space
A spacious woodland lodge, sleeps up to 12 people. Located in the stunning dimmingsdale heritage woodland. This bueatiful one time youth hostel is clad in waney edge larch and nestles superbly into the sourounding forest. Gaze out from the traditional wood fired hottub into the woodland night or just lie back, close your eyes and listen to the woodpeckers.

With a 100 square meter decking area the lodge is well equiped for outdoor living.

Inside you will find further luxoury, a large living area equipped with modern open plan kitched with large state of the art range cooker, looks over the dining area with huge handbuilt pitch pine dining table following onto a generous lounge area with comfy sofas, 42" led tv and a log burning stove. The room also benefits from a bespoke library wall covered in hundreds of books.

Three large bedrooms are all individualy designed and can sleep up to 4 people. Bed layout for each room can be tailored to every booking. Just let us know if you want single beds, double beds or a mix in each room and we ll arrange it all before you arrive.

The lodge has 2 bathrooms, Each is tiled from floor to ceiling. The larger of the 2 fitted with a triple sized shower cubicle and both boasting modern power showers.

Gas central heating throughout, a logburner in the lounge and our handbuilt double glazed windows ensure that you ll be toasty warm on the coldest of nights.

Dimmingsdale is covered in a beautiful ancient woodland. The woods have dozens of footpaths which allow ramblers to discover its natural beauty year round. The area is also a very popular mountain biking area with trails from the family friendly xc routes all the way up to the gnarly and steep enduro and downhill tracks. Rock climbing is also on offer as dimmingsdale boasts some of Englands finest sandstone bouldering crags, all within walking distance of the lodge, even with a heavy mat on your back.

Set right on the edge of the beautiful and popular peak district national park, you'll find the lodge an ideal base from which to explore.

Alton towers is just 2 miles from the lodge too, so if you fancy a few theme park thrills you're in just the right place.

Thank you for reading about our lodge. We look forward to welcoming you to dimmingsdale.', '', '']

Title: Ash Cabin at Bramblewoods with stunning  views
Description:
['About this space', "Our handcrafted en-suite wooden cabin is located within a small wood on the grounds of working sheep farm with an uninterrupted view across the valley in picturesque Shropshire.
It has everything you need to retreat from the real world, whether it's for a cosy night in, in front of the log burner or a chance to sit and stargaze on the deck.
There is an abundance of walks right from your doorstep, you're even lucky enough to have the Offas Dyke within a stones throw from the Cabin.", 'The space', "The space
Handmade timber cabin set on a working sheep farm within a small wooded area with uninterrupted views across the valley.
The Cabin is finished to a very high standard with an en-suite shower room, compact kitchen, dining area for two, lounge area with log burner.
Outside the Cabin is a secure deck area with 2 lounge seats and a double hammock, it's a perfect space to bring your well behaved 4-legged friend.", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Important to note that there is no regular TV due to how isolated the cabin is - there is a smart tv so guests can log into their netflix or prime accounts to watch tv online.

There is limited phone signal depending on your provider. There is WiFi for WiFi calling.

This site is adult only and not suitable for children.']

Title: Shepherd‚Äôs Rest, camping pod with hot tub.
Description:
['About this space', "Nestled in the heart of the Forest of Bowland AONB, this glamping pod is ideal for hikers and bikers who want a base more substantial than a tent and less fuss than a hotel. Want privacy with absolutely nobody else around? We can almost guarantee you won't see a single person while you're at the pod, so you can sit back and enjoy the stunning panoramic views that stretch for miles over the Dunsop and Ribble Valleys from the hot tub, champagne in hand, with nobody to disturb you.", 'The space', 'The space
The Shepherd‚Äôs rest is set in its own valley with panoramic views. It‚Äôs location makes it the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Anyone who stays at the pod will have great access to walks, cycling and adventure. Gisburn forest mountain bike trails is a 15 minute drive, there a plenty of walks to do in the area and some great places to eat out.

The pod is made out of a solid wood frame and boasts three sides of glass to fully take in the panoramic views. The pod is split in half, with one side providing a comfortable and relaxing living area. There is a log burner, sofa bed and kitchen unit in this side of the pod. The other side of the pod is the bedroom and bathroom, complete with double bed, toilet, sink and shower.

The hot tub is located on decking outside the pod, and backs onto an old barn in the field. The hot tub is filled with natural spring water. It is a beautiful experience to sit in the hot tub as sunset falls over the valley.']

Title: Beautiful Tiny House with private hot tubs
Description:
['About this space', 'Le domaine des hauts de canche, magnificent Tiny house with brand new private spa
This atypical accommodation is quietly located on the edge of the forest, a few minutes drive from downtown Touquet paris plage.
Decorated with care and comfort you can enjoy a wide choice of services, such as ordering meals (on reservation 48 HOURS before, possibility of having the menu card on request, bike rental or breakfast service)', 'The space', 'The space
The kitchen is equipped with an electric hob, refrigerator, microwave, electric oven, coffee maker, kettle, and cooking essentials.
In the living room the sofa is convertible and you have a dining area.
Upstairs you will find a double bed (160x190 cm)
The bathroom on the ground floor has a walk-in shower, a sink, and a toilet (hair dryer on site)
Television with a wide choice of channels
Outside your tiny house you can enjoy a large roof terrace, making 2/3 of your home, as well as another terrace on the ground floor where you can have your meals, or enjoy the garden around you, its private spa will allow you to relax in the song of birds', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Enjoy access to your home and private Jacuzzi, not to mention the garden surrounding your Tiny house', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Following a few disappointments: - music is accepted outdoors with a low volume of sound in order to respect the tranquility of the neighborhood; it is forbidden after 10 pm
-the fireworks , rockets and firecrackers are prohibited
-the spa is no longer allowed after 11 pm, smoking in it is prohibited
-we do not accept more than one dog
-the decorations like banners are not allowed
IN CASE OF CONFLICT AND/OR COMPLAINT, WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO EXCLUDE THE PERSON RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DISORDER']

Title: Woodland Winter Cabin with Hot tub & log burner
Description:
['About this space', 'The Woodlands cabin is situated in our peaceful woodland in the heart of Snowdonia. It has a shower (hot water included) and w.c and washbasin (no hot water in the washbasin.
Lighting is provided from a 12v solar panel system.
A log burner is provided with free wood and fire lighters.
There is a double bed.
The private wood fired hot tub is situated on a balcony overlooking the woodland area.
Pet friendly.
Outside heating is provided.', 'The space', 'The space
This unique glamping experience has everything you need for a restful and idyllic break from everyday life. Wake up to bird song and the sound of the stream. Enjoy your own exclusive hot tub whilst sipping a glass of bubbly. Our Hut is fully insulated and has everything you need for that perfect "rustic" getaway without compromising on quality and convenience.

ALL bedding and towels are included in your stay. You may like to bring extra towels for hot tub usage.

A small log burner inside to keep you nice and cosy.

There is limited telephone signal.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Things we do provide
In the kitchen - we provide a single gas camping stove and kettle. The kitchen area is full equipped including a cool box - you may like to bring ice with you. There is no hot water in the kitchen sink.
In the bathroom - there is a shower, w.c and washbasin. Hot water is provided in the shower cubicle only.
There is a wood burner and wood and fire lighters are provided free.

Please note that this is an ECO cabin. The lighting is. 12v system run off solar panels.

Outside seating is provided.']

Title: Odli Pod- Mountain views. Hot Tub. Farm Stay.
Description:
['About this space', 'Odli Glamping Pod is situated on a picturesque working sheep and beef family farm in the heart of the Mid Wales countryside. Both cosy and private it is a place to snuggle down and unwind.

Positioned in its own private field the site is surrounded by rolling fields and far-reaching views to the Berwyn mountains. There is flora and fauna and plenty of wildlife to see with red kites and buzzards circling above and our livestock roaming in the fields.', 'The space', 'The space
A perfect couples retreat or the ideal family fun-filled break away! The pod has all the modern comforts, a fully equipped kitchen with a Belfast sink, Fridge/freezer, electric hob, microwave, kettle and toaster and a Nespresso coffee machine.

The bathroom has a WC, sink, electric shower with plenty of hot water and a towel radiator.

The double bed has a memory foam mattress dressed with a goose down duvet with crisp cotton bedlinen. There is a double sofa bed for 2 additional guests (aged 2 -16).

All linen and towels are provided.

There is an outside seating area with a Firepit with grill so you can relax with a glass of wine and listen to the sounds of nature in the evenings and enjoy the stargazing. The first basket of logs will be provided.

You will also have exclusive use of your very own private 40 jet American hot tub positioned next to the pod.

Although the pod is great for summer days, with under-floor heating and excellent insulation, WIFI, and a 32‚Äù smart TV with Netflix, it still makes the perfect winter getaway.

There is a private entrance to the site with parking, and a 60m stroll down a gravel path to the pod.']

Title: Alexa Lodge with private hot and sauna
Description: ['About this space', 'Situated in the beautiful village of Hurst Green in the heart of the Ribble valley,you will find our brand new lodge.A true romantic get away,Alexa lodge offers guests spacious 5 star quality accommodation.Set in a peaceful setting with far reaching views,yet within a 5 minute walk to 2 fantastic pubs and the village cafe.Hurst Green the winner of several best kept village awards oozes character,and a wealth of history with the iconic Stoneyhurst College,and the Tolkein Trail on your doorstep.', 'The space', 'The space\nAlexa lodge is a true home from home with all the mod cons,a fabulous fitted kitchen,sumptuous bedroom with superking size zip and link bed,which can create twin beds if necessary,a stunning bathroom with a walk in shower big enough for 2.Smart T.V with free Netflix package,Wifi,and Amazon Alexa for your convenience.Outside is a large flagged patio with your very own covered hot tub,and a private sauna', 'Guest access', 'Guest access\nguest access via lock box code 1234']

Title: Oak Lodge - Lakeside Retreat
Description:
['About this space', 'Oak Lodge is our largest Lakeside Lodge perfect for families of 4, couples wanting that extra bit of space or mixed groups.

The outside decking (child friendly!) is simply fantastic, floating high above our lakes with stunning views across the water and beyond... you won‚Äôt want to go inside!

With open plan kitchen, diner & lounge and patio doors to the decking area, it‚Äôs a fantastic communal space. The fire pit / bar-b-que and lawn area is also just out the front ready to go!', 'The space', 'The space
Our lakeside Lodges are set on Headlands Farm Fishery, 18 acres of outstanding natural countryside with two lakes and away from noise and light pollution. Our guests are entitled to walk around the lakes and grounds (dogs must be on leads at all times).

Oak Lodge is nestled into the trees with private parking (just outside), decking, access to our Lakes and totally private.

Oak Lodge has a cosy double bedroom with plenty of space for luggage and hanging, a separate bunk bed room with 2 full sized single beds, large shower room with luxury organic toiletries, a fully equipped kitchen with everything you require and a spacious lounge and diner with tv.

Help yourself to breakfast, which includes: selection of cereals, sliced bread loaf, fresh farm eggs, milk, orange juice, jam, butter, tea, coffee & sugar.

Alternatively, enjoy our on site coffee shop (Headlands Farm Coffee Shop) for a freshly cooked breakfast, lunch and afternoon tea as well as fantastic cakes and even better coffee! Open 9am - 4.30pm every day.

Enjoy a bar-b-que or fire pit on your private bar-b-que area just outside the lodge.

Please visit our Instagram page: @headlandsfarmlakesidelodges
Here you will find more photos of our lodges / Headlands Farm as well as our favourite places to visit / walk / cycle / eat / explore and do!

Oak Lodge Anglers are welcome to fish from any fishing swim around our two lakes, with a few swims within 20 meters, opposite the decking. A maximum of 2 adult anglers per lodge, with a 50% discount off our normal fishing rates. Payable in the Fishery Club house.

If Oak Lodge doesn‚Äôt have your ideal dates free, please take a look at our other Lakeside Lodges, also on Airbnb:

Willow Lodge - Lakeside Retreat:
Sleeps 4 (double bedroom and twin room) absolutely perfect for couples, families and mixed groups with shower room, kitchen/diner/lounge and decking on the lakeside.

Pine Lodge - Lakeside Retreat:
Sleeps 4 (1 double bed on a mezzanine level with a separate bunk bed room below), shower room, full kitchen, diner, lounge and a child friendly decking!

*** For your reassurance and peace of mind we are spending extra time between guests‚Äô stays to make sure all surfaces, door handles, objects, etc, are thoroughly cleaned and sanitised.

Our lodges are beautifully isolated in the countryside. There‚Äôs no need for you to see or to come into contact with anyone during your stay, including us! However we are always contactable by phone/text and on hand should you require us.

Airbnb are continually posting up to date advice regarding COVID-19 in relation to their bookings. Please check this out if you have any reason to think you might pose a risk to others ***', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
You have full access to your private Lakeside Lodge with private decking, the lakes, grounds and fishing swims at Headlands Farm as well as public playing fields within a 2 minutes walk... and all the the New Forest National Park has to offer within a 5 minute drive!


Other attractions nearby include:

Peppa Pig World - 4 miles
Paulton‚Äôs Park - 4 miles
New Forest National Park - 1 mile
Marwell Zoo - 17 miles
Stonehenge - 23 miles
Beaulieu National Motor Museum - 15 miles
Mottisfont Abbey National Trust - 8 miles
Dinton Park National Trust - 24 miles
Wellow golf club - 1.2 miles
Paulton‚Äôs golf club - 5 miles
Romsey golf club - 5 miles
Landford garden centre - 3 miles
Lepe country park (seaside) - 18 miles
Hillier‚Äôs Arboretum - 7 miles', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please visit our Instagram page: @headlandsfarmlakesidelodges
Here you will find more photos of our lodges / Headlands Farm as well as our favourite places to visit / walk / cycle / eat / explore and do!']

Title: Rectory Farm Hideaway
Description:
['About this space', 'Tucked away in the heart of the Cotswolds, the Hideaway is situated within a secluded and idyllic south-facing meadow.

Lounge on the deck by summer and cozy up by the log-burner come autumn, the Hideaway is a perfect escape for any season.

Relax and soak your troubles away in the hot tub (available at extra cost)whilst gazing at the stars sipping champagne.

Get back to nature but with a good dollop of comfort!

Your dog is welcome too!', 'The space', "The space
Facilities include:
1 x double bed (bedding & towels provided)
1 x Double sized futon (bedding & towels provided)
Indoor Log burner (fire wood provided)
Wood fired Hot Tub (this is an additional cost please enquire for more details)
Basic cooking facilities within the cabin with hot running water
Crockery, glasses, mugs & cutlery
Tea, coffee, sugar & milk
Small gas fridge
Fire pit/BBQ outside for your use (firewood provided, coal not provided)
Outdoor seating
Bathroom comprising, hot water shower, WC & sink
All bedding and towels provided together with additional blankets
Dining table & chairs
Lighting via 12v system
Limited Electricity supply (weather dependant) ‚Äì power provided by solar which is weather dependant
No Wi-Fi
Check-in after 3pm / Check-out before 11am
Your beloved dog is also very welcome at The Hideaway (we do have to take a small surcharge, payable upon arrival)

This beautiful purpose built log cabin boasts tons of character. It has been designed to offer you a wonderfully unique stay, set in a private area all to yourselves.

The comfortable log cabin sleeps 4 with a king sized bed and a double sofa bed, a cute kitchen and a perfectly formed bathroom. Everything you need for a relaxing break will be supplied, including kitchen basics, bed linen and towels. The bathroom will provide you with a hot shower after a glorious day's sightseeing.

The eco wood-fired hot tub(available at extra cost) will keep you relaxed as your supper is sizzling away on the BBQ. Treat yourself to a glass of bubbly, gaze at the stars and let the beautiful surroundings wash away your stress.

The Hideaway is supplied with solar power, which of course is dependant on the sun shining. For those overcast days you can wander down to the local pub, cozy up next to the log burner, while away your time in the hot tub or snuggle up around the fire pit toasting marshmallows.

This is an idyllic place to unwind and leave your hectic life behind. There is no wi-fi to distract you, so you can truly switch off.

You are close to the beautiful cities of Oxford and Cheltenham and the gorgeous towns and villages of the Cotswolds. Shop till you drop in the many boutiques and antique shops that the surrounding towns have to offer. Or lose yourself in the wonderful stately homes and gardens nearby. To name a few; Blenheim Palace, Buscot Park, Friar‚Äôs Court, Kelmscott Manor. Or visit one of our local villages, Bampton, where many scenes of Downton Abbey were filmed.

The Cotswolds is dripping in history, from ancient churches and barns, to Roman ruins and gothic monasteries, there is a wealth of activity on your doorstep.

If the great outdoors is your thing, you are spoilt for choice with wonderful walking and cycling opportunities. The Cotswold's Way is close by and boasts over 100 miles of trails through picturesque villages and ancient woodland. You also have the river Thames just a couple of miles away.

If all that activity sounds like hard work, just kick off your shoes and spend the day lounging on your deck and enjoying the beautiful countryside.

The Cotswolds is a designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and you will be staying in the heart of this wonderful area.

If the ‚ÄòHideaway‚Äô is booked for the dates you are looking for, please look at our converted railway carriages - 'Rectory Farm Retreat' and 'Rectory Farm Camp'. All set in a similar setting as The Hideaway!", 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
As we mentioned, the Hideaway is only powered by solar power, so you many experience a limited power supply. Don't fret too much, you are close to many towns and villages if you need a WiFi hit.

The eco hot tub is wood-fired and comes at an additional cost, please enquire for further information. It's well worth it as you can enjoy a wonderfully warm outdoor soak. If you would like to make use of the hot tub, please let us know prior to your arrival so that we can make sure it is ready for you."]

Title: Y Pod @ Bryntalch - Private glamping pod & hot tub
Description:
['About this space', "Set in beautiful surroundings, our stylish, compact two-person wooden pod is perfect for that relaxing break away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.
Stay with us on our family farm, and unwind to the tranquil sounds of the brook below, enjoy the picturesque sunsets from your own private wood fired hot tub, or explore the rolling hills of Montgomeryshire, with footpaths right on your doorstep, and Offa's Dyke just a stones throw away.
We look forward to welcoming you!", 'The space', 'The space
The pod has all your everyday essentials - fully equipped kitchenette (with fridge freezer, electric hob, kettle and toaster), bathroom (shower, toilet and sink), double bed as well as a spacious outdoor area, with you own wood-fired hot tub and seating area! There is also an electric heater inside, to keep you warm on those cold nights.
Bed linen and towels are provided.
There is a private parking space nearby with a 50m stroll down a gravelled path to the pod.
The pod is fenced off however, be mindful of livestock in adjoining fields.
There is no Wi-fi in the pod, however there is good phone signal and 4G in the area.
There will be a Welsh welcome hamper on your arrival containing tea, coffee, sugar, milk and chocolate.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Even though we supply towels, maybe bring a couple more to use with the hot tub. It might be an idea to bring suitable footwear (sandals/slippers)to walk from hot tub to pod.

We will supply a bucket of logs for hot tub use.']

Title: Pinetree Lodge, romantic getaway in the Cotswolds
Description:
['About this space', "Pinetree Lodge is a romantic, high end luxury Cotswold getaway, nestled in it's own small, enclosed wood on our active working farm. It‚Äôs outside living at it's finest, with a well equipped outdoor kitchen, fire pit with accessories to cook a beautiful BBQ, roast or chilli. A gas BBQ also provided for ease. An efficient wood burner provides ample warmth on colder evenings and during the winter months. The Kitchen is basic, a little gas stove gives for a nice cuppa and a breakfast fry up indoors.", 'The space', "The space
The Lodge has been a dream of mine for years and a wonderful Australian couple have made my dream a reality! Literally from a pencil drawing I gave them on a scrap of paper, they lovely created my beautiful bespoke, cosy, luxury tiny home where guests can unwind and have a wonderful time away from the rest of the world!

The small wood it's has been built in is only a short distance from the hustle and bustle of the farm but this only adds to the feeling of being out in the true and very real countryside. There are sunsets most evenings and footpaths that run straight from your door, gorgeous Cotswold villages to visit and scrummy places to eat.

It's definitely a place all to yourself, a space in the heart of the countryside to enjoy, for the majority it's peaceful and tranquil, but maybe with an occasional visit from the young friendly farm sheep dog, Woody! or the hum drum of the tractor beavering away, nature at it's best!

It's conveniently close to all local amenities without knowing it! We have 2 great pubs, fabulous local butchers and shop with all you need. You are close to all the most beautiful Cotswold villages, Chipping Campden, Broadway (my favourite), Bourton on the Water, Moreton in the Marsh, Stow on the Wold. Your local town is Stratford upon Avon, Shakespeare's birth place. National Trust Gardens, Hidcote Gardens and privately owned gardens at Kiftsgate Court where the famous Kiftsgate Rose comes from.

There is so much to do in the area and places to see.", '', '', '', '']

Title: Hillside hideout in the Upper Wye Valley
Description:
['About this space', 'Cosy cabin for 2 with a natural swimming pond, views of Hay Bluff, surrounded by countryside and walks.', 'The space', 'The space
Guests have exclusive use of the cabin, private deck and washroom (separate building) that has a kitchen area with sink, extra fridge and a separate room with wc, wash basin and large walk-in shower.
The garden, natural swimming pond, paddocks and woodland are open to all to enjoy.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The cabin is located at the owners small holding set in 10 acres with a stream, woodland and paddocks that are grazed by 4 friendly Shetland ponies.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The Washroom, which consists of a kitchen area, shower room with toilet facilities are located in a separate building a short walk from the cabin next to where your car will be parked.

The cabin itself doesn‚Äôt have running water. It‚Äôs has a small sink and drinking water. Running hot and cold water, along with a full sink and drainer are located in the washroom nearby.

The cabin is heated by an efficient wood burner with firewood provided. There is also a portal heater in the washroom that can be used in the cabin if needed.

Your host also lives at the property in the farmhouse.']

Title: Rectory Farm Retreat
Description:
['About this space', 'Tucked away in the heart of the Cotswolds, the Retreat is situated within a secluded & idyllic south-facing meadow.

Lounge in your private area by summer and cozy up by the log-burner come autumn, the Retreat is a perfect escape for any season.

Relax and soak your troubles away in the hot tub (available at extra cost) whilst gazing at the stars sipping champagne.

Get back to nature but with a good dollop of comfort!

Please note there is no electricity at this site.

Your dog is welcome too!', '', 'The space', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
As mentioned, the wood fired hot tub comes at an additional cost. Please enquire for further information.

The Retreat does not have a power supply or WiFi. There is lighting via a 12 volt battery system.']

Title: Cosy Glamping Pod with private Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', "The 'Ludlow' Pod is nestled snugly in the South Shropshire Hills, Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.
Situated alongside a working farm, with plenty of walks from the doorstep, this cosy Glamping Pod provides the perfect escape to relax and unwind.
The accomodation has been individually designed and furnished in a bespoke style to provide you with a restful stay, with a private hot tub included.
Luxury 100% cotton bed linen and towels are provided, along with tea, coffee, sugar.", 'The space', 'The space
Wet room with shower
Double Induction hob and microwave oven with grill
Double bed with Hybrid Memory Foam Mattress
32" LED Freesat TV
FREE WI-FI
All year round heating
Outdoor decking area
Uninterrupted views', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Travel cot & high chair available for ¬£10 per stay
Iron & Ironing board available for ¬£5 per stay']

Title: Stylish House By The River To Escape & Relax
Description:
['About this space', 'The property include a comfortable king size bed, fully equipped kitchen and bathroom, TV and internet and car parking facilities. All the architectural details have been created by our talented local designer to produce for you a relaxing interior style using natural and sustainable materials to inspire an earthy feeling without forgetting all the modern comforts you need. ', 'The space', "The space
Otter's Rest

You will be immersed in beautiful nature and surrounded by the sound of the water. You can enjoy the tranquillity of our award nominated Eco -House with two lovely covered terraces for a nice weekend retreat where you can read a book or just relax with a cup of tea.

Otter's Rest is located in Clitheroe, Lancashire in the grounds of a listed building built in 1795 with a long history associated with the Lancashire cotton mills.

We are at the edge of the town so whilst you are secluded, all the amenities are within just 10 min walk. This area of the Ribble Valley is very beautiful and sits at the edge of the Forest of Bowland with Stonyhurst College only 15 minutes away. Downham and other picturesque villages are very close for you to visit and enjoy for walks and visiting the wonderful pubs.

It is an ideal base for visiting friends in the area, for a walking holiday or for just the peace and quiet to have a break from chaotic cities. If you are a foodie, the Ribble Valley is peppered with gastronomic experiences to suit all pockets.  Clitheroe is a really charming old town with individual shops, a market and even a micro-brewery situated in the beautifully converted Holmes Mill just a short walk from the house.

For a very different and very special experience try our little paradise!!!", '', 'Other things to note']

Title: Beautiful Handcrafted Cedar Lodge with Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', 'This beyond the average bespoke 2020 build is ultimately pleasing to the eye, with it‚Äôs curvaceous smoothed oak rail staircase, handsome pillars and waxy satin cedar beams which embrace this appealing handcrafted lodge. An open plan living area leads onto 2 bedrooms with beautiful en-suites. Sitting in a field amongst the vivid greens of the Shropshire hills on an expanse of decking where you can open up the bifold doors and bring the outside in and enjoy the deliciously warm hot tub.', 'The space', 'The space
Sunlight floods the stylish rooms showing off the gorgeous comfy furnishings. A log burner sits in the living area where you can hunker down on a winters day. An eclectic style kitchen of chunky wood and midnight blue cupboards with an accent of copper is well equipped. The honey hues of the king size oak four poster bed with its enticing plump bedding, leading to wide opening bifold doors out onto a balcony with mesmerising views. The en-suite bathroom is luxuriant with its double rainfall shower heads, two sinks and heated floor. The second bedroom is welcoming with its deliciously comfy bed which cleverly can a king size double or two singles. The perfectly conceived en-suite has a heated floor and a shower to die for. In a field amongst an abundance of fruit blossom in the spring and broad leafy woods in the summer. This alluring place is tantalising in its serenity and you can‚Äôt help but fall into its bewitching peaceful rhythm.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
A Private track lined by oak and sycamore trees will bring you up to a gravel parking area, where you can unload and take the well lit footpath to the Lodge. We have 9 acres of private woodland with tracks for you to use right outside your front door and a field with the river Onny at the bottom which is easily accessible.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
There is no extra charges for fire wood and kindling or use of the hot tub. The Hot tub will be ready for use on your arrival with towels along with bathroom towels, hand towels and bed linen. We provide a welcome pack, this includes tea, coffee, sugar, milk, butter, eggs, homemade loaf of bread and Jam. Toilet rolls are provided. Soap powder and softener for washing machine along with washing up liquid.']

Title: Luxurious log cabin & private indoor hot tub!
Description:
['About this space', "Our luxurious log cabin is close to family-friendly activities, public transport, countryside and river walks, public footpaths and country pub & restaurant.

The log cabin is great for solo adventurers, couples, families with kids and furry friends (pets) and business travellers. It's an ideal location for unwinding with friends or family.

The secluded hot tub is a touch of luxury for your exclusive use during your stay, operating all year round it is usually hot and ready for your arrival.", 'The space', 'The space
You‚Äôll love the peaceful ambiance, the light, the sunsets and the dark starry nights. The outdoor space with fully enclosed garden provides a secure environment for both pets and children.

Nature lovers will enjoy the birdsong during the day and often owls and sometimes nightingales at night; not to mention the free-ranging chickens, affectionate cats and nearby a couple of friendly pygmy goats!', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
You will have full and exclusive use of the cabin, its private garden with BBQ and of course the indoor hot tub!', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
A hot tub is fully operational and available for the exclusive and private use of guests staying in the log cabin.']

Title: Canadian Log Cabin with Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', "Our BRAND NEW traditional Canadian Log Cabin sits at the top of the mountain overlooking the Ceiriog Valley and Berwyn mountains. It is ideal for romantic breaks or just to relax and unwind making use of your own private hot tub after long walks in the hills. A mere four miles from Llangollen you'll find a great base to make the most of all the fantastic outdoor activities and places to visit that we have to offer in the local area and further afield in North Wales, Cheshire and Shropshire.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests have access to a spacious garden and an undercover private hot tub spa, which is right next to the cabin and exclusively for use of guests of the cabin.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
WELCOME PACK:

We provide a welcome pack for guests: Generally consisting of a few tea bags and some coffee so that you can have a brew on arrival without having to worry about unpacking all of your stuff. Along with other homemade produce dependant on what‚Äôs in season and what I‚Äôve been cooking / baking, a slice of cake or maybe some jam may be available.

All said and done if there‚Äôs anything at all that you need during your stay, please don‚Äôt hesitate to come and ask us and we will always do our best to help.

WI-FI:
We are currently without WiFi .

PETS:

With pets of our own we understand how much people like to bring them on holiday. Therefore we do accept one well behaved pet on request.

For this we make a small charge of ¬£35 for three nights stay.
For four nights plus we make a ¬£50 charge which is payable on arrival please.

We also ask our guests PLEASE NOT to leave their pets unsupervised in the log cabin as they can become quiet stressed in a strange environment.

Any questions, please don‚Äôt hesitate to drop us a message.']

Title: Cabin In The Heart Of The New Forest
Description:
['About this space', "Social distancing to a ‚ÄòT‚Äô !!
‚ÄòLittle Gate House' is an idyllic country retreat for couples in the heart of the New Forest National Park. A cosy self-contained cabin with enclosed garden.South facing elevated position with gorgeous views.The New Forest is literally on the doorstep but yet there is easy access to visit the nearby towns, villages, cities and beaches.
Fab pub,2 cafes (1 with farm shop) all an easy walk.
1 dog allowed - ¬£25 total payable in cash.
10% off week stays
Min. 3 nights", 'The space', 'The space
* In light of the Covid 19 pandemic, I‚Äôd like to reassure my guests that I have a very high standard of cleanliness and I clean and disinfect all surfaces, the bathroom, the kitchen and high touch surfaces such as handles, tv remotes, light switches, etc. The bedding and towels are washed at 60 degrees and I will remove all scatter cushions and blankets if you‚Äôd like me to. However, I do spray them with a disinfectant spray. We are positioned in the middle of the countryside where you don‚Äôt have to come into contact with anybody else if you don‚Äôt wish to. You have more chance of meeting a wild pony! It‚Äôs self check in so you don‚Äôt even have to have any contact with me! I even disinfect the key!!
If you book and then we are put into a lockdown during your booked dates, in the first instance I would hope that you would consider postponing your stay and changing your dates. However, if this is not an option for you and you need to cancel then I would instruct Airbnb to issue you a full refund.

*Length of stay discounts automatically applied. Up to 10% off for week stays.

*Late booking discounts automatically applied.

*Please contact me if your required dates won‚Äôt fit in. Sometimes there is some flexibility.

*Please let me know if you‚Äôre booking to celebrate a special occasion!

*First load of kindling and logs included but thereafter charged at ¬£5 per load.

*No extra cleaning fee or security deposit
charged.

*Feel free to bring a bbq.

*Extra charge of ¬£25 in total for a dog payable in cash during your stay. Please enquire if you‚Äôd like to bring more than one dog.

*Contactless check in - just book and arrive!

Little Gate House is located a short drive up a forest gravel track set on it‚Äôs own in the corner of our 3 ¬Ω acre grounds providing visitors with a high degree of privacy and peace. The site once formed part of Ibsley RAF base during World War II and Little Gate House was one of the original maycrete buildings. The block of stables that you look out onto is the old latrine block and a couple of Stanton air raid shelters are in the paddock. Literally to the rear of the cabin is the open New Forest providing a whopping 140,000 acres of stunning landscape to explore. Horse riders frequently go by as well as wildlife such as the New Forest ponies, cattle, donkeys, deer, foxes, badgers and an abundance of birds such as owls, woodpeckers and buzzards which are often seen circling above the trees during the summer months.

Well designed, the Little Gate House provides a compact yet light and airy space. Inside the heated and fully insulated bespoke cabin, you'll find all the comforts you would expect from luxury self-catering accommodation. Living room open plan with fully equipped kitchen/dining area with full height ceilings, a wood-burning stove and double French doors opening onto a large area of south-facing decking. Cosy bijou double bedroom with full height built-in wardrobe and extra storage space above the bed useful for storing bags etc. En-suite bathroom with over-bath shower, basin, electric ladder radiator and toilet. Wooden floors throughout. Many guests have described Little Gate House as being "Small, but perfectly formed and equipped with everything you need". Enclosed private garden to the side of the cabin ideal for your dog to stretch their legs!

Although guests have the convenience of access straight onto the New Forest, there is also quick and easy access to all main roads for visitors to explore the many villages, towns, cities and beaches that Hampshire, Dorset and Wiltshire have to offer.

Riding stables 10 min drive, watersports/fishing 2 miles, award-winning 'Hockey's Farm' shop and caf√© 10 min walk, the lovely 'Royal Oak' thatched pub and restaurant 20 min walk, 'The Potting Shed' caf√© at Hyde 20 min walk (highly recommend - closed on Mondays). Ringwood (with a Waitrose, Lidl and Sainsbury's) 5 miles and Fordingbridge (with a Co-op and Tesco Express) 2.5 miles.
Please see 'Getting Around' section for walking directions to local farm shop, pub and cafe.

*** Please have a look through the ‚Äòhouse rules‚Äô and it‚Äôs important you follow my directions to find us easily.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The entire space. It is for the sole private use of our guests.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We have dual band wifi. If your device gives you the choice then please select Gate House 5G (if not, then Gate House 2.4G). The password is TOUCHWOOD. However, us country folk don‚Äôt have as good a wifi as city folk so please be mindful of this. We have recently had a new router fitted and fibre optic brought all the way to the house so touchwood so far the wifi has been great!

Our property is accessed from a gravel track which has two ends. One end has a ford which is passable 90% of the year. When we have had an extreme amount of rain the ford may be too deep to drive through, but there is access by coming in and out the other end of the track. Our property is 0.2 mile from the ford end and 0.5 mile from the other end. General maintenance is carried out on the track a few times a year. Come in through the electric gates and the Little Gate House will be directly in front of you on the left hand side.']
