Title: Luxury romantic couples getaway with hot tub
Description:
['About this space', 'Family owned one bedroom lodge set in secluded private grounds with mature woodland and tree lined entrance. In a superb location accessed by private electric gates, our lovely cabin has a large deck with a brand new 4 person hot tub.
Ideal for romantic couples it is nestled in an area renowned for walking and cycling and is on the edge of the Peak District.', 'The space', "The space
Our exceptionally well designed lodge provides everything you need for a cosy holiday in an area of outstanding natural beauty. The large, double glazed windows offer wonderful views, making it feel as if you're part of the great outdoors. Relax in centrally heated comfort indoors, in the wonderful hot tub outdoors, or mix and match in either summer of winter!

The lodge is very, very private, with a cosy kitchen, comprising a 2 burner induction hob, a table top oven and a separate microwave. There's a spacious living room with electric reclining armchairs, a comfortable bedroom and well equipped shower room. The entire lodge is beautifully laid out and equipped and under previous ownership was listed in Hoseasons' luxury range. The perfect place to chill throughout the year!", '', 'Other things to note
Please note that BBQs are NOT allowed on site.']

Title: Stoke Leigh Barn
Description:
['About this space', 'The property is a self contained oak-framed barn. The Barn is situated just inside the entrance to Leigh Woods National Park and overlooks beautiful open countryside and the woods themselves. The woods boast excellent walking and mountain bike trails.

The Barn is a five minute drive/twenty minute walk to Clifton village and a ten minute drive into Bristol city centre and harbour side. There is a bus stop a short walk away with direct links into Bristol city centre / bus / rail links.', 'The space', 'The space
The Barn is open plan and there is a king size oak framed bed. There is a bathroom with a walk in wet room / shower. There is a fully fitted kitchen with fridge / freezer.

The Barn has Sky tv including all sports and cinema channels accessible on a 120‚Äù cinema and surround sound. There is Netflix and an Amazon firestick and also a large collection of dvds.

Outside there is a large decking area overlooking open fields with a hot tub for guests individual use.

The Barn is safe and secure and resides behind Forestry Commission gates which are locked every evening. There is a gate key for guests.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
There is a cinema screen with Sky TV / sports / cinema / surround sound, free WiFi and private use of a large hot tub.', '', 'Other things to note
Fresh bedding and towels will be provided.

Bristol airport is 20 minutes away and there is long stay parking and drop off / pick up on request for a small additional charge.']

Title: Woodpecker Lodge - Log Cabin with Private Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', 'Each solid wood log cabin is encircled by trees for your privacy yet open enough to let sunlight through. We aim to give you that cosy, romantic log cabin retreat experience with a solid wood burner, private hot tub and free access to our seasonal outdoor heated pool (end May - Sept).
If the dates you require are already booked, please look at our other cabins:
Tawny Owl Lodge (also with private hot tub), Hedgehog Lodge or Roe Deer Lodge.', 'The space', 'The space
Genuine Scandinavian Log Cabin tucked away in mature oak woodland', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Explore 8 acres of woodland with WWII Pill Boxes Balcony, Play area, Hot Tub, Heated Outdoor pool (seasonal - end May to Sept)', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Great pubs and restaurants close by, local attractions like Forde Abbey, Donkey Sanctuary, Cycle Path. beaches at Lyme Regis, Charmouth, West Bay, Beer, Seaton, Sidmouth etc.
Pets are welcome, we make a small additional charge of ¬£25 per stay to cover additional wear and tear and cleaning. Please let us know when booking, the extra can be paid on arrival.
If the dates you require are booked, please look at our other cabins:
Tawny Owl Lodge (also with private hot tub), Hedgehog Lodge or Roe Deer Lodge.']

Title: Elite Suite Two Oak' s  Adults only
Description:
['About this space', 'Elite Suites is My Luxury concept in Country stays. 2 Oaks is the first of my Elite Suites. I have created a surreal safe space for Two adults to enjoy. set in the small village of Offenham, with state of the art 5 seater hot tub.. luxury Egyptian cotton Bedding, soft furnishings, Kitchen fully equipped and shower Room Ensuite. Large private decking with seating and loungers, outside log pit, with stunning countryside views for that ultimate romantic time away, on the edge of the cotswold', 'The space', 'The space
set in a private area un disturbed , this unique pod is designed for comfort but has 5 Star quality.. with its own hot tub and decking area, designed for adults only, no children or dogs allowed on site. For those special romantic adults only break away. on the edge of the beautifull cotswolds', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Elite Suites is safe, tranquil and above all a delight to stay in. it has all you need for a luxury romantic break for 2.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We have the historic town of Evesham with its Abbey and victorian waterside gardens only 2 miles away, Broadway and its historic Tower is only 4.5 miles away..trully both are worth visiting. not to mention our national trust oldest pub/restaurant The Fleece, Bretferton only 3 miles away ... Great food and atmosphere']

Title: Ceirw Treehouse high in the canopy & river below
Description:
['About this space', 'Towering above the River Ceirw is the enchanting, romantic and magical Ceirw Treehouse. If you want an incredibly romantic cabin experience, lantern lit under the starry skies for a night or two then this is the place for you. Ideally located within easy reach of Snowdonia National Park, you can enjoy beautiful waterfalls, lakes and the Berwyn mountains.', 'The space', "The space
Our unique treehouse cabin is sure to provide you with a halcyon escape from everyday busy life.

Accommodation is accessed from ground level and from here the real attraction is the balcony where the stunning view boasts an impression of being set high amongst the canopy of trees overlooking the Afon Ceirw (Deer river). After a mornings hike, imagine spending a peaceful and relaxing afternoon here reading a book with a glass of something nice.

Ceirw Treehouse is a cosy one room log cabin measuring 9ft x 9ft. It has a comfortable double bed with a 13.5 duvet to keep you cozy, electricity, fridge and a two ring hob for a fry up in the morning. 5 star luxury we're not as there is no shower, however there is hot and cold water and a sink and a very clean compost loo.

The balcony has chairs with cushions and blankets, lanterns provide the atmosphere along with solar fairy lights. Sitting here listening to the sounds of the countryside in the evenings is what it‚Äôs all about.

We have an abundance of wildlife including owls, herons, pheasants, red kites and buzzards soaring overhead. Our wildlife camera has pictured foxes, badgers, mink and otters. You will be surrounded by our own animals too - cheeky nosey Pygmy goats, hens and Alan the cockerel.

We are trying to do our bit to be as eco as we can, our water is from a bore hole, solar electricity, recycled rugs, sustainable cotton bedding, eco products and compost loo.

We have free ranging hens and our girls produce the best eggs you‚Äôve ever had. If you fancy some for your breakfast we usually have them available and cheaper than the supermarket."]

Title: the pod@springwater
Description:
['About this space', "The Pod at Springwater is a unique, handcrafted property set up amongst the trees. It has two bedrooms: one double, with a large window and a view into the trees and the smaller, twin room, with offset bunk beds. The living room has a smart tv on a swing out bracket. There's also a well equipped bathroom with a great shower.

Downstairs is accessed through a trapdoor in the floor to the kitchen. Double doors open onto the backyard, which has an outdoor fireplace, pizza oven and bbq.", 'The space', "The space
As well as the accomodation, guests have full access to the field in front of The Pod, with a Willow grove and mowed pathways. Amongst the Willow, there's also a firepit, den and rope swing.

The Pod at Springwater is a great place to reconnect with nature and is in easy day-tripping distance for many of Devon, Somerset and Dorset's highlights.

You will also have three pygmy goats as neighbours!"]

Title: Oak SPECIAL WINTER OFFERS - Hot tub & Log burner
Description:
['About this space', 'Situated in a private tranquil woodland in the Snowdonia National Park. The accommodation is approximately 4 miles from the seaside town of Barmouth.
Sheep and lambs roam the fields around the pod.', 'The space', 'The space
The pod has a double bed and bedding is provided. There is a small kitchen area which is equipped with a two ring gas hob, crockery, cooking utensils, cutlery, pots and pans and table and chairs. There is no hot water in the kitchen area. We provide a cool box - you may like to bring ice with you.
Towels are provided (one bath towel and one hand towel per person). You may like to bring extra towels for hot tub usage.
A wood burner and wood is provided.
A private w.c./shower is located approximately 10 metres from the pod. Hot water is provided.
The glamping site runs off solar power and because of its location there is a very limited phone signal. Please bring a battery pack to charge your mobile phones.
The hot tub heats up using wood which is provided free of charge. It is important that you follow the instructions featured in your check in details. Failure to do this and the water will take longer to heat up.
Please note that complimentary tea and coffee is provided for your arrival only and oil and salt and pepper are not provided.
Two camping chairs are provided.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Ash WINTER RETREAT- Hot tub & Log Bruner
Description:
['About this space', 'The Ash is located in a peaceful woodland overlooking the amazing snowdonia landscape. Sheep and lambs roam in the fields around the pod.
A wood fired hot tub is provided and full instructions are given prior to arrival. Wood is provided.', 'The space', 'The space
The pod has a double bed and bedding is provided.
There is a small kitchen area which is equipped with two ring gas hob, crockery, cooking utensils, cutlery, pots and pans and table and chairs. Hot water is provided in the kitchen area. We provide a cool box - you may like to bring ice with you.
There is also a wood burner.
Towels are provided (one bath towel and one hand towel per person). You may like to bring extra towels for hot tub usage.
The pod has its own shower and w.c. Hot water is provided.
The pod runs off solar panels and because of its location there is a very limited phone signal. There is a USB point to charge your mobile phones.
The hot tub heats up using wood which is provided free of charge. It is important that you follow the instructions featured in your check in details. Failure to do this and the water will take longer to heat up.
Please note that complimentary tea and coffee is provided for arrival only and oil and salt and pepper are not provided.
Outside seating is provided.']

Title: Mountain View Glamping
Description:
['About this space', 'My Mountain View glamping pod is situated overlooking the Black Mountains at the Southern tip of the Brecon Beacons National Park, offering the best glamping experience and a true opportunity to experience nature in luxury. Located on a working hill farm guests can find excellent way-marked walks that start right from the door.

The outdoor heated hot tub overlooks the mountains and is perfect for either a romantic break or just a well needed escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life.', 'The space', 'The space
Set between the trees inside the pod you will find a self contained kitchen, shower room, dining area and a comfy double bed along with satellite TV & DVD player.

The pod has underfloor heating, a microwave, fridge and all basic requirements including a fire pit and gazebo covered BBQ. Traditional charm and a warm Welsh welcome guaranteed...this is truly glamping at its best!!

PLEASE NOTE:

The hot tub has recently been upgraded to a fully heated electric one with jets and lights! We feel this is much more relaxing for our guests as they don‚Äôt have to tend the fire...so jump straight in and enjoy!!

COVID RULES:

Please do not book if you live in an area effected by lockdown restrictions. We are based in Powys, so currently have no restrictions.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Crazy Mazy, Peace & Tranquillity in East Yorkshire
Description:
['About this space', 'Each of our four eco glamping cabins sleeps up to two adults and one child.
They have their own cooking facilities and spacious en-suite shower room.
A 4 person hot tub is located on the private decking area.
We are very happy for you to bring up to two of your furry friends along too!
Freeview TV and free high speed wifi available. Each cabin has a BBQ area. With wonderful view over the Yorkshire Wolds countryside you are sure to ensure a peaceful stay in your own little bit of luxury.', 'The space', 'The space
Crazy Mazy cabin is located on the edge of the plot with open views of the surrounding farmland. Enjoy the view from your personal hot tub or simply relax on the decking or lawn. A BBQ is provided for you to cook your own meals. A perfect stay in wonderful East Yorkshire (with amazing views of the sunrise from your bed!)', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The cabin is for your sole use. There is plenty of parking, if arriving by taxi I would recommend booking this in advance as the area is fairly remote.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Highfield Farm is also home to the award winning Yorkshire Wolds Cookery School and also has a 9 bedroom B&B.']

Title: Flora‚Äôs Deluxe wooden cabin (Mini house!)
Description:
['About this space', 'Flora‚Äôs is a deluxe log cabin, fully fitted kitchen, luxury bathroom and central living/bedroom area.
Our cabin is furnished to a unique, high quality standard, TV with inbuilt NetFlix, Amazon and YouTube.
A large outdoor decked area with two separate seating areas offering unspoilt views of the surrounding Brecon Mountains and Brecon Mountain Railway.
Ideal for a romantic getaway, birthday treat or just a complete escape from the hustle and bustle in a little piece of paradise ‚ù§Ô∏è', 'The space', 'The space
Based in the village of Ponsticill- Flora‚Äôs boast easy access to some fantastic walks through The Beacons, a short drive from Pen y Fan and around 15 minutes from Ystradfellte, Bike Park Wales and Zip World with a growing choice of outdoor activities available within our own village - be it guides walks, Mountain Bike hire, abseiling, Sailing ..we have it all!', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
On site parking shared with adjoining cabin']

Title: The Little Lodge is a cosy luxury hideaway..
Description:
['About this space', 'Modern, light and airy Alpine style wooden lodge with beautiful open plan wooden-floored bedroom/lounge with toasty log burner. Modern kitchen with double oven, 4 ring hob, dishwasher. Dining area. Walk-in rainfall shower, wall mounted radiator/towel heater and underfloor heating.
Roku TV, dedicated broadband wifi, washing machine and tumble dryer.
Parking in a private self contained area. EXCLUSIVE use of hot tub.
Superking or Twin beds. Dog friendly :)', 'The space', 'The space
Perfect for couples or friends! An open plan, light and airy space that is comprised of a lounge / bedroom / kitchen area.
The underfloor heating in the kitchen, utility and shower room area keeps things very cosy. Woodburner for the complete snug effect!
Outside, a private enclosed garden area with EXCLUSIVE USE HOT TUB, and an acre of other garden areas to explore. Complete calm, surrounded by trees and nature. Twin/Superking bed available.', '', 'Guest access
Getting around is easiest and most flexible with a car or bicycle. However, there are regular bus services from the main A4080 and from the village linking to other transport hubs in Bangor, Llangefni and Holyhead. Bangor train station is some 15 minutes away by car, Llanfairpwll 5mins. Secure parking on site.', '', '']

Title: Secluded Eco Shepherds Hut with wood fired hot tub
Description:
['About this space', 'You‚Äôll love my place for its atmosphere, uniqueness and secluded, idilic location with stunning views over the Devon countryside.
It has an air of creativity and love, with a cosy natural feel.
The views overlook forest, valley, and stream. With hot tub it‚Äôs the perfect place to unwind. Dartmoor is a glorious play ground with wild ponies, bouldering for climbers, rivers and beaches nearby for swimming. Many Neolithic stone circles around. Ashburton, a town famous for antiques and fine foods.', 'The space', "The space
The hut is off grid, so you will have a taste of what living simply and close to nature is like, but still enjoy having the luxury and comfort of my hut. Hopefully you'll be inspired and go away with an experience of living off-grid, and a greater appreciation for nature, and what we take often for granted in this modern and busy world.
 
The woodwork is beautiful and the whole dwelling is uniquely crafted using only natural paints and materials so as to minimise anything harmful to both the environment and the people living in it.

Similarly the washing and cleaning is done with non toxic environmentally friendly products.

Do let us know in advance if you would like to use the hot tub so we can prepare it and treat the water with chlorine. We will need to know length of use as we charge ¬£85 for 3 days.

The water is not mains but spring water (and can be unpredictable in terms of pressure and consistency), it‚Äôs the farms own naturally sourced water and it is drunk by the family, however is is not possible to test water constantly so for this reason I can not say that it is drinking water.

Family‚Äôs wanting to stay with kids. Patients will need to take responsibility for their children. There are animals on the farm and areas with machinery and unusual terrine.

Dogs should be kept on leads and any mess safely disposed of.

But guests will have the benefit of having the entire feild to themselves with little if any interruption.

The hut is solar powered and this relies on there being enough sunshine. As such there may be occasional blip in power availability.

There are snacks and general food in the cupboard that your welcome to help yourself to during times that COVID guidelines do not stipulate that we are not allowed to. Along with fresh herbs from bay tree or herb pots.

If you want any fresh local produce, I can put you in contact with the farmer.", '', 'There is an exclusive private drive, leading to the Hut with parking in the bay right in front.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
 The toilets are compost ones and need a small handful of sawdust after use.

The shower is attached to the hut itself but positioned out side, with some screening for extra privacy and to act as a wind barrier.']

Title: Secluded rural cottage with hottub near the coast.
Description:
['About this space', 'The accommodation includes a fully equipped kitchen, log fired hottub, en-suite bedroom with comfy kingsize bed. There is a sofa bed in the lounge area, suitable for two small children or one adult. A large secluded garden, decked patio area, driveway and BBQ. Small dogs are welcome at an extra cleaning charge of ¬£25 per stay. The beach is 5 minute drive away, the local pub is a 2 minute walk. Deal, with its cool boutiques and cafes, is a 15 minute drive or 10 minutes on the train.', 'The space', 'The space
Wickets is a newly constructed luxury cottage. Situated at the end of a private country track, opposite the village cricket pitch. (Fixture dates are available if you like to spectate!) With a large secluded garden and log fired Scandi hot tub. The perfect location for local beaches and countryside walks. The accommodation has bi-fold doors out on to garden, Wifi and Netflix. Children are welcome, a travel cot and high chair are available on request. Dogs are also welcome, but please bring their own bed.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please note that the sofa bed is only suitable for two small children or one adult. The cottage is not really suitable for 4 adults as the bathroom is en-suite to the bedroom.

The hot tub is chemical free so will get cloudy after a few uses. If you are staying more than a few days and would like it emptied, re filled and heated, this will take around 4 hours. So please let us know the day before. You WILL need to know how to light and maintain a fire to use the hot tub.
We will light it for you on the day of your arrival. But you will need to keep the fire going once you get here to get the tub hot.
(It takes around 3 hours to get to temperature.)

We have the village cricket pitch on the other side of the field. They have a licensed bar, so some social noise can be heard on match days in the summer.']

Pengelli Lodge offers self-catering accommodation for five, with the added bonus of exquisite views across Carmarthenshire. Title: Gorgeous Glamping Pod with private Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', "The 'Wenlock' Pod is nestled snugly in the South Shropshire Hills, Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.
Situated alongside a working farm, with plenty of walks from the doorstep, this cosy Glamping Pod provides the perfect escape to relax and unwind.
The accomodation has been individually designed and furnished in a bespoke style to provide you with a restful stay, with a private hot tub included.
Luxury 100% cotton bed linen and towels are provided, along with tea, coffee, sugar.", 'The space', 'The space
Exclusive use 4-person Hot Tub
Wet room with shower
Double Induction hob and combination microwave/oven/grill
Double bed with Hybrid Memory Foam Mattress
32" LED Freesat TV
FREE WI-FI
All year round heating
Outdoor decking area
Uninterrupted views', '', 'Other things to note
Travel cot & high chair available for ¬£10 per stay

Title: The Lodge at Beacon Fell - Hot tub rural escape
Description:
['About this space', 'The Lodge at Beacon Fell offers a peaceful and beautiful location set within The Forest of Bowland AONB (Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty).

Ideally located to explore the nearby Ribble Valley, Lancashire and even the Lake District.

Open plan, light and modern lodge with amazing views of Beacon Fell and Parlick Fell, both of which are just on our doorstep. A hidden gem. Last year (2021) we added a Wood-burning hot tub to the property which looks out over the views.', 'The space', "The space
NEW: Guests can enjoy the luxury of a private log-burning hot tub! Plenty big enough for everyone. Air jets, LED lighting and even drinks holders so you can enjoy the idyllic scenery of the Forest of Bowland, or lie back and watch the stars in this 'Dark Skies' area. Water is changed between every booking. Toasty warm in just 1.5 hours. Fresh robes and provided for all guests.

The Lodge is a larch clad, 2 bedroom accommodation with an open plan living area boasting a pitched ceiling and exposed beams. The main bedroom is king-size and the second bedroom can be configured as either king-size or twin, with space for an extra floor bed or travel cot for a child. An adult camp bed can be provided for use in the main living space.

The bathroom is modern and has a shower over the bath. The large industrial style kitchen boasts a fully equipped kitchen with oven and induction hob, dishwasher and microwave making cooking up a breakfast or evening meal easy. There‚Äôs also a washing machine for those longer stays.

The open plan living area looks out onto the garden and Beacon Fell beyond through an almost fully glazed wall that leads out onto the decking. There‚Äôs also a large reclaimed wood dining table that seats 6 and a comfortable sofa to enjoy watching the smart TV, which includes the Netflix app. This space is finished off with a cosy log burner for those cold winter nights.

The Lodge also boasts a 1000Mbps (1Gbps) fibre internet connection, giving you the fastest speeds in the country so you won‚Äôt miss out on anything. Of course, if you would prefer to be unreachable we can always turn it off!

We wanted The Lodge to have a small carbon footprint so it is incredibly well insulated plus fitted with triple glazed windows and although each room has a programmable electric wall heater we‚Äôre not sure when you will need them! The solar panels on the roof help to heat the hot water and power the appliances so you can enjoy your holiday while helping the environment.

The Lodge is set in the grounds of our house whilst still offering the privacy needed to enjoy your holiday as it has its own private enclosed garden. When staying at The Lodge you will have an area of outstanding natural beauty on your doorstep and a public footpath leading from our garden takes you to the summit of Beacon Fell where you can view the whole of the area on a clear day.

There are many walks in the area and we are happy to share our favourites with you if required. The country lanes are also a favourite with cyclists so if cycling is your thing then you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

Locally you will have the towns of Longridge and Garstang just 15 mins drive away. Both towns offer supermarkets, restaurants and a variety of pubs/bars plus exceptional high street boutique shops where you can experience locally produced foods and gifts. Slightly further afield there are the larger towns of Clitheroe and Lancaster offering even more selection.

Being only 15 minutes from the motorway network the Lodge at Beacon Fell is also well placed for visiting the Flyde coast, Arnside & Silverdale, the Lake District and even the Yorkshire Dales. As hosts we enjoy visiting all of these places and have great local knowledge too so we‚Äôre happy to make recommendations if you want some ideas. There‚Äôs also plenty for the kids to do even on a rainy day!

Situated within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and a designated Dark Skies areas. You will need a car to get around.

<1 mile to Beacon Fell Country Park
<1 mile to Brock Bottoms picnic site
3 miles to Parlick Fell
11 miles to Longridge Fell

5 min drive/20 min walk to nearest pub
15 min drive to local shops and restaurants
15 min drive to M6 junction 32


22 miles to the beach at Lytham
41 miles to Manchester City Centre
50 miles to Manchester Airport", 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
We have a dedicated 1000Mbps fibre internet connection with very good wifi.

We provide all logs and kindling for your log-burning Hot Tub. Heating takes just 1-2 hours.

If you'd like us to pre-warm your hot tub ready for your arrival, just let us know at time of booking. A fee of ¬£20 is due upon arrival for this service.

We provide a starter pack of logs for the log burner stove. More are availableto purchase.

There is a 22kW fast EV vehicle charger available. Please let us know at time of booking if you‚Äôd like to use it, extra charges apply.

We have a BBQ available to use. Please provide your own charcoal and fire lighters and ensure it‚Äôs left clean after use"]

Title: Bluebell Pod with wood fired hot tub
Description:
['About this space', 'Set on a rural glamping site, the pod is a clever use of space with a side entrance light inside and great views to the outside. It has a kitchenette at one end with a breakfast bar and a bathroom with toilet, shower and basin at the other end. The double bed is made up with luxurious bed linen with a dressing table, vanity mirror and wardrobe next to it. Outside there is a large decked area with its own wood-fired hot tub and bbq where you can enjoy views over the water and ancient woodland.', 'The space', 'The space
The glamping site is in a beautiful Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty making it perfect for nature lovers, walkers and cyclists.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests can walk or cycle straight from the site to large areas of forestry and past a beautiful lake. Parking is right outside the pod.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We are in the process of having Wi Fi accessible in Bluebell but, at the moment, it is only available in and around the outside of the caf√© on site. We hope to rectify this as soon as possible.
The hot tub is a wood burning hot tub which does not use electricity and so does not have a jacuzzi mode. We chose this option as it is more fitting to the area but the main reason was hygiene. The tub is emptied, deep cleaned and refilled between every stay rather than relying on chemicals which electric tubs use to keep the water clean between stays. We hope you enjoy it - it looks great!']

Title: A Hidden Gem - Tranquil Barn in the New Forest
Description:
['About this space', 'The Barn is a delightful studio apartment, situated next to our family home in the quaint village of Burley, New Forest.
Recently refurbished, the barn features an open plan living, kitchen and sleeping area with its own private entrance and small outside space with eating area and space for a BBQ.

It is a truly fantastic base for you to enjoy what the national park has to offer; including walking, bike riding, horse riding, or exploring the beaches of the south coast.', 'The space', 'The space
Inside, the barn features a full kitchen which includes an oven, hob, microwave and tea/coffee making facilities. A choice of eating areas either at the breakfast bar or at the dining area table.

There is a comfortable sitting area with Smart TV, wireless internet and whole range of DVD‚Äôs, books, board games - something for every one to enjoy. Our guests can enjoy a cosy reading corner with high back chair and a overhead lamp.

There is also a self-contained shower room which features a sink, toilet and freestanding shower.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
LocationThe Barn is located off the open forest around 1km along an unmade forest road, we regularly grade the track but there are few potholes and we would advise that it is not suitable for low sports cars.

There is a separate private gated parking area and entrance.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Parents with babies / young children - we have a cot and loads of toys etc which you are welcome to use if you would like to bring your little person to The Barn.

Pets
Dogs are welcome at The Barn providing they are small to medium breeds - please contact us to discuss prior to booking if you would like to bring your dog.
Apologies but large dog breeds are not suitable due to the size of the indoor and outdoor spaces.

Booking and Availability

For ease of use please note that the AIRBNB booking calendar is up to date and accurate.

Please use the AIRBNB help section via the booking confirmation to make any amendments or cancellations.

Please contact us should you have any questions.']

Title: Cosy shepherds hut, hot tub, log burner & Alpacas
Description:
['About this space', "A romantic shepherds hut in a beautiful rural setting with Alpacas for neighbours. Located in the village of Trematon on the outskirts of Saltash also known as the gateway to Cornwall. Plymouth centre is just 30 mins by car.
Set in a field you will be able to enjoy the quiet seclusion of the hut and at no extra cost the hot tub will be exclusively for you throughout your stay.
It's in close proximity to amazing coastline, Dartmoor and Bodmin moor, with an abundance of local walks and footpaths.", '', 'The space
The Shepherds hut has been built to accommodate your needs for an authentic experience with all mod-cons. The toilet and shower are standard size however the bathroom is small and compact. The kitchen workstation has a sink, two ring electric hob, fridge and a combination microwave and oven, just enough to get by with the basics.

The cabin double bed is snugly tucked away behind curtains with access from one side only. We provide 100% cotton bedding to make your sleeping experience as special as possible.

Although there is electric heating provided if you want the more traditional warm and cosy feel there is a cast iron log burner.

For your entertainment there is a wall hung TV with an integral DVD player and we have a digital radio for music lovers. There is wifi provided but it can be a bit sketchy sometimes inside the hut.

As well as a decorative fence we have planted over 60 trees to provide natural privacy. We also have our own solar power panels to produce locally grown electricity.

Along with the compact space there are steep wooden steps up into the hut. You will also need to walk across grassland so sensible shoes are a must. Please contact us if you have any mobility concerns.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Treehouse living
Description:
['About this space', 'The treehouse at Derrington is a simple space where you can sit among the trees with the stream rippling below and enjoy the peace of the country -side.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
There‚Äôs a double bed, twin beds on a mezzanine floor for the kids and a log burner to keep you snug and warm. Gas hob/Oven for cooking and a rustic bathroom and nothing else in the way of modern distractions. It‚Äôs a chance to ditch the WiFi and unwind for a while, wondering the woods or sitting out on the decking gazing at the stars or listening to the creatures of the night.

Fire pit provided for outdoor cooking with plenty of sticks. Amenities less than a mile away shop, pub, butchers, tea rooms and garage can be accessed via picturesque route through the woods. Local towns such as Bridgnorth, Ludlow, Much wenlock and Iron bridge are between 15-30 minutes drive.
The tree house has been created using recycled materials from the farm and locality.
The farm is a traditional mixed farm of sheep and cattle, been in our family for four generations. You are encouraged to explore the various foot paths in and around the farm, information will be provided at the accommodation of the time of your stay.']

Title: Snowdonia cabin in nature with hot tub
Description:
['About this space', 'Our secluded cabin is surrounded by ancient oak tree forest and all the wildlife that comes with it. It is so peaceful that you will only hear the river and the birds. Set in 10 acres of our own land for you to explore and easy access to Snowdonia public foothpaths, it is perfect for those looking to spend some time in nature. The cabin itself features private hot tub, wet room, underfloor heating, large deck with bbq, kingsize bed, kitchen, living and dining area and a private cinema.', 'The space', "The space
*Our cabin is very popular and if it‚Äôs full for your dates we have another equally wonderful place to stay ‚ÄòThe Barn Owl‚Äô. Find it by clicking on our host profile photo*

Our cabin is a nature lovers retreat for those looking for an adventure on foot or 2 wheels, or merely an escape from hustle and bustle of everyday life.
It's located in the heart of Snowdonia, surrounded by native ancient forest and the wildlife it supports, nothing but the sound of the river and birdsong.
After leaving your car at the garage, make the rest of your journey on foot, a short walk over a bridge by a waterfall and up a tree lined track up towards the cabin.
The cabin is a long stone's throw from the main house but enjoys complete privacy through it's own gate and is hidden amongst trees and shrubs. It comprises large furnished deck complete with hot tub, perfect for relaxing in nature and under the stars. Inside there is underfloor heating, kingsize bed, fully equipped kitchen & dining area, wet room and large comfy couch on which to enjoy a full cinema experience.
The cabin is a perfect way to explore this part of Snowdonia, the surrounding area is crisscrossed with walkers paths and bike trails, there are outdoor pursuits galore from surfing to zip wiring over the slate mines. Snowdon itself is close for more great walking, as is Coed y Brenin for mountain biking and Bala for watersports or simply amble through nearby forests, by beautiful rivers and lakes. On a sunny day, the beautiful white sandy beaches of Harlech, Borth y Gest and the Llyn Peninsula are all within a short drive away.

Now for the basics, we provide bedding and towels, small welcome pack (for 3+ nights). Eco-sensitive toiletries are provided which we encourage you to use. The cabin comfortably accommodates 2 adults and a further 2 small children or babies and we can supply travel cot, blow up bed and high chair. The cabin has full cinema experience and we have an extensive library for you to choose from. We are both keen walkers and can supply maps or advice on the many local hikes. You can even borrow 'Jake' - our perfect dog - if you promise to take him for a walk!!", '', '', '', '']

Title: The Pool House
Description:
['About this space', 'Relax at the Pool House- enjoy the hot tub and swimming pool. Very close to Oxford, ideal for sight seeing. Very close to the Cotswolds , Cotswold Wild Life Park, Bicester Village, Blenheim Palace. Suitable for couples or families with 2 young children. Also ideal for athletes who would like to keep up their fitness.', 'The space', 'The space
Our lovely Pool House is tucked away but near the bustling city of Oxford.

After a day of sightseeing, shopping or long walks you can relax in the endless fast lane pool.
(Heated at 30c 1st April - 31 st October but available for private use all year around ). For the ones with still some energy left you can swim against the pump. The pool has an electric safety cover, very easy to use with a turn of a key- ideal for families with young children. Or you can simply relax and unwind in the hot tub. Inside the Pool House you can relax with tv, stream your music on the Sonos or have a go at the arcade machine. We have a Nespresso coffee machine for you to enjoy. The Pool House also has a microwave and fridge.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
We have off road parking on our drive way, use of the pool with an outdoor heated shower and hot tub. The Pool House has a lovely outdoor seated area- ideal for relaxing.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
You will be staying at the bottom of our garden. There is a fence to ensure your privacy- you will not be over looked. We are a family of four with two friendly dogs. We welcome couples and families but please no hen or stag parties- or any groups who would like to party. Our Pool House is ideal for couples or small families. We will make sure we will greet you when you arrive to make you feel welcome and help you with settling in.
Please note this is a non smoking accommodation.']

Title: Waterfront apartment with pool.
Description:
['About this space', 'Beachfront apartment of 50m2 in Arromanches les Bains on the landing beaches. Large private terrace of 120m2 with direct access to the beach . A large living room with open plan kitchen . A master bedroom overlooking the sea with a 140 bed, a 2nd bedroom with 2 90 beds and a bathroom with a shower.
Access to the heated swimming pool from mid-May to mid-October
During the school holidays, rentals are by the week , from Saturday to Saturday. Otherwise 3 days minimum.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Linens are provided at an extra cost , ‚Ç¨15/person, towels and tea towels are not provided during the Covid period.

Possibility to privatize the pool. 35‚Ç¨/day from mid-May to mid-October.

Calendar is not necessarily up to date as we also use leboncoin to rent , please contact us before blocking dates. thank you']

Title: Secluded Oak Barn Retreat with Hot Tub & Pool!
Description:
['About this space', 'Relaxation at The Oak Barn Danbury is inevitable. Surrounded by oak trees, the secluded fenced patio with comfy seating, hot tub and BBQ will allow quiet relaxation after a day exploring the Essex countryside on your doorstep. Inside, enjoy a beautiful open plan oak beamed kitchen / living area with all the amenities you could need to enjoy your stay, 3 luxurious beds and a large bathroom. Being child friendly, free parking and fast Wifi are a given. A seasonal pool is just an added luxury!', 'The space', 'The space
Welcome to the beautiful Oak Barn in Danbury. 1000 sq ft of light, quiet, secluded space for a relaxing get away.

Bedroom 1 has a luxurious king size bed with memory foam mattress, quality linen and is double aspect looking out over the tree lined garden and horses (when they arn't on their holidays!).

Bedroom 2 has an equally luxurious sprung double mattress, quality linen and enjoys views of the horses and National Trust Forest behind.

The large bathroom comprises of an overized bath for relaxing after a day exploring picturesque Essex, a seperate shower, toilet and basin. All amenities such as shampoo, soap and toilet paper are provided as would be expected.

The open plan, oak beamed Living/Dining/Kitchen area is light and spacious even for 6 people. The double sofa bed can be made up or left folded for your arrival.

The 42" TV in the living area is linked up to a Firestick for App access and live TV.

A seperate nook is available for reading or if you need to check the laptop and Wifi signal is strong so you can keep connected!

The dining table can be set for 6 and the kitchen is equipped with oven, hob, microwave, fridge (with small freezer), dishwasher, toaster, coffee machine, kettle and all equiptment you need for self catering. A selection of tea and coffee is also provided to get you started.

Washing is available at a small fee.

Outside, the barn becomes even more delightful as you can choose to see in the evening on your private patio either from your 6 person hot tub or outside seating area whilst someone BBQ's for dinner.

During the summer months (weather dependent) a private heated outdoor pool is available daily between 9am and 12.30pm unless otherwise agreed.

Parking for 2 cars on the shared drive is available.

The Oak Barn Danbury is family friendly (2 little boys live on site!), so if there are any specific child requirements please just message me before you come and I will try and accomodate.

We hope to see you soon x']

Title: Delightful cottage in 15 acres of countryside
Description:
['About this space', 'The cottage is situated on a private estate with complete solitude in 15 acres of orchards and fields. Guests are able to use our indoor leisure complex of pool and hot tub at no charge. This is on the left of our family house 2 minutes walk from the cottage

The 2 floor cottage has recently been fully renovated and you will find it to be warm, welcoming and decorated and furnished beautifully with full SKY TV, SKY Movies and Netflix available

Our family home is very close by if you need us', 'The space', "The space
As you enter the cottage through the pretty front door you come into the integrated shaker kitchen. Turning left you have the lounge diner with a cloakroom adjacent. A neat white staircase in the corner takes you up with no door to the open plan family bedroom with double bed and 2 singles. Adjacent to the bedroom is a shower room and landing with large wardrobe. From the landing is a door which takes you onto a small balcony with staircase that leads to the grounds. The L shaped sofa can double up as a child's bed if you have more than 4 guests. In total the area in the cottage is 750 square feet.", '', 'Guest access
Private parking space outside the cottage', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
No pets']

Title: The Warren - Lodge with Private Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', "Set in a peaceful area of the Hoburne Cotswold park is this beautifully equipped mobile home within a few minutes walk to the main park entertainment area and lakes.

Complete with a private hot tub and decking

We are perfectly positioned for easy reach to explore the Cotswold's and surrounding areas.", 'The space', "The space
If you are traveling in a large group then look at our other listings as many are very close together


This is a luxury home with Private Hot Tub, full kitchen including, Oven/Hob, Fridge, Freezer, Washing Machine and Dishwasher.
TV with DVD player in the lounge and TV's in both bedrooms.
Music can be streamed using the built in Bluetooth speakers.
Table and chairs inside for a cosy family meal.
There are 2 bedrooms - one with a kingsize bed and ensuite shower room. The other has 2 3ft beds. Both bedrooms have ample storage space.

There is an additional family shower room.
Outside there is a table and chairs on the decking", '', '', '', 'Other things to note']

Title: Stunning Modern Lodge with Hot Tub on the Lake
Description:
['About this space', 'There is everything you need for a relaxing break with lake views. The lodge has a lovely family bathroom and the master bedroom has a stylish ensuite. The lounge, dining and kitchen are open plan. The kitchen is modern and fully equipped with a full size dishwasher. There is fast wifi. The large decking has a private sunken hot tub with lovely views over the lake. The perfect place to relax.
The lodge is on Chichester Lakeside Holiday Park and you have full use of all amenities.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please bring your own bed linen and towels.
My cleaning lady doesn‚Äôt have the facility to do this level of laundry.']

Title: THE OLD SUNDAY SCHOOL
Description:
['About this space', "The Old Sunday School is in the grounds of a Grade-II listed Georgian rectory, opposite a medieval church. It has been newly converted and refurbished in an open-plan contemporary style, and finished to a very high specification. It has a private entrance and garden and patio area. Guests have access to the hosts' seven-acre landscaped garden in an area of outstanding natural beauty. In the summer months [MAY-mid SEPTEMBER] guests will have shared use of the outdoor pool with the owners.", 'The space', 'The space
This is a separate and private property, and includes a mezzanine-level bedroom, fully fitted kitchen, bath and shower room, spacious orangerie (with bi-fold windows overlooking the swimming pool), and a double-height open-plan living area (with sofa bed and TV). Private garden and patio. With own front and back doors, and ample parking.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests have full access to the beautiful rectory grounds and the swimming pool [MAY-SEPTEMBER]
High-speed broadband and unlimited wi-fi on the property.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
THE POOL IS HEATED IN THE SUMMER (MAY-SEPTEMBER) and then CLOSED IN THE WINTER (OCTOBER-APRIL)
We have 2 dogs (black Labradors), 1 cat, 1 cockerel, 10 hens and 3 ducks!']

Title: The Stables Cottage, hot tub & pool
Description:
['About this space', 'Charming, single-story barn-conversion, just three miles from the historic town of Stratford-upon-Avon with good access into Warwick and Leamington Spa. With shared hot tub and indoor swimming pool. Award winning artisan Farm Shop with caf√©, butchers and bakery all on site.

Keys are collected using a code for a keybox so this gives you flexibility on arrival and departure times.', 'The space', 'The space
This cottage sleeps four guests and is all ground floor. Two bedrooms; one with king size bed, the other is twin room with two single beds - both have TV & Freeview. Family bathroom / full wet room roll top bath, shower, basin, WC. Well equipped kitchen with separate dining area & sitting area. Vaulted ceilings with open timber beams.

Outside you have a private decking area and private lawned garden with rattan garden furniture for alfresco dining. Enjoy a walk around our 4 acre grounds or take a pic-nic out and enjoy the stunning views.', 'Guest access', "Guest access
The cottage and it's garden are is exclusively for your use.

You will share access to the indoor heated pool and the outdoor hot tub with guests in our two other smaller holiday cottages. This will be between 9:00 ‚Äì 18:00 daily. 

There is a diary planner in the pool house where you can reserve private hourly time slots simply write your name, or cottage name, next to the time you would like to use the facilities.", '', 'Other things to note
We are really lucky as we have an award winning Farm shop next door. They also do takeaway pizzas and Sunday lunches, picnics etc. We have a great little village shop called Snitterfield Stores and they are open every day with a very good selection.

The next closest places to eat are No.19 Restaurant which is 1 mile and The New Inn which is an award winning pub run/owed by the villagers in Norton Lindsey. Stratford, Warwick, Leamington Spa and Henley in Arden all have a fabulous range of restaurants, so something for everyone. If you dont want to eat out we can recommend other food deliveries, private chefs or takeaways.

Snitterfield boasts two impressive USGA golf courses within 5 minutes of the village. The Ingon Manor golf club has a 18-hole par 72 championship course. The Stratford Oaks golf club is a welcoming and friendly club with our guests. With lots of other activities in the local area including horse riding, tennis, bowling, fishing, gliding and cycling. The Monarchs Way runs across the entrance drive giving walkers access to some stunning countryside.']

Title: Cottage Farm - farmhouse with pool and hot tub.
Description:
['About this space', 'A three double bedroom property with 3 Sofa Beds, pool, jacuzzi. Pool is available April - October, Hot tub available all year.

Downstairs:
Kitchen: A larder, an Aga, cooker and oak flooring.
Living: Double Fireplace main lounge oak flooring.
Snug: Sofabed.

Upstairs:Three Double Bedrooms: Superking or twins. Spacious Landing: Double sofa bed with fantastic views. All covered in herringbone sisal carpets.
Bathrooms: Jacuzzi bath and shower room with separate shower outside.', 'The space', 'The space
History:
Lower Berrow Farm once was a shooting lodge of the Norgrove estate of which Cottage Farm was once two workman cottages that have now been converted to a beautiful chocolate box cottage set in 20 acres with no footpaths.

Cottage Farm is situated just a mile away from Lower Berrow Farm.
Rental of Cottage Farm includes parking at Lower Berrow Farm for use of playground and walking trails

Outside:
A climbing frame, outdoor heated swimming pool with pool room and changing room.']

Title: Idyllic, private & unique countryside holiday
Description:
['About this space', 'Our Granary is a stylish, sustainable barn conversion set in idyllic countryside at the end of a quiet country lane, surrounded by a horseshoe of downs and near wonderful beaches. It truly is a picturesque spot, and all just 3 hours from London.

The Granary has just been renovated from two agricultural buildings. With two comfy bedrooms, a large kitchen diner to inspire a great meal, a lounge with a wood burner and a huge window seat in which to gaze out at the garden, courtyard and the pool.', 'The space', 'The space
Traditionally finished on the outside, our barn is unique on the inside. Style, space, and light define The Granary - so relaxing and rejuvenating is it here, that many people who stay here with the intention of exploring the Island never leave Manor Bottom. With a private a courtyard, your own pool (unheated), a yoga studio on the grounds, a picturesque wood, and views from an elevated garden to calm your soul, why would you need to go further?

The two comfortable bedrooms (one with en-suite bathroom) are ideal for a family of four or two couples. The second bedroom can be set up with twin beds or a super king size bed. There is a second bathroom (with wet-room style shower) and we provide pure linen bathrobes for guests to lounge about in comfort.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
An entire house (c80m sq), sole use of swimming pool (unheated), private courtyard and garden. Not overlooked. A small callisthenic gym space (located in the garden of the main house) can be accessed by guests who would like to use it for a yoga, Pilates or kickboxing workout.', '', "Other things to note
The Granary is a perfect choice if you are looking for a comfortable, stylish and low carbon footprint holiday.

The Granary's underfloor heating and hot water are provided by a heat source heat pump. The solar panels on the roof generate electricity. Additional energy purchased is from 100% renewable sources.

The timber for the wood stove comes from own own woodland which is regularly replanted.

The charred timber on the outside of the barn comes from reclaimed floorboards. The indoor joinery (wide window seats and some of the furniture) are made with worn and lovingly up-cycled scaffold boards.

The remote location at the end of a country lane, bordering fields and woodland, means that Manor Bottom is an excellent place to see undisturbed wildlife."]

Title: The Potting Shed, 5* ‚ù§Ô∏é Luxury escape Cirencester
Description:
['About this space', 'The Potting Shed is the quintessential 5* Cotswold escape. Following an 18 month restoration completed in May 2019, this stone barn conversion is the perfect retreat. Located within the grounds of an elegant Grade II listed Georgian town house on Cecily Hill - voted one of the prettiest streets in England, this romantic getaway is accessed by a private stone bridge which leads through through a formal kitchen garden to a stunning private terrace.', 'The space', "The space
COVID-19 POTTING SHED UPDATE - Your safety and protection is our top priority, we are deep cleaning the Potting Shed between visits and have plenty of anti-bacterial wipes and hand wash throughout the property. In addition you are totally isolated, with your own private entrances, plenty of private outside space and the largest park (Cirencester Park) in the county right on your doorstep to roam around in complete privacy. Further details are listed in our guidebook. Send us a message, we are here to help!

The Potting Shed is a self-contained converted stone barn which occupies 550 sq ft of living space and has a generous 200 sq ft private terrace. This gorgeous hideaway sits in our grounds but, with its own separate entrance, it is a very private and quiet cottage.

Following an extensive restoration from the ground up in 2018/19, we have used local materials and Cotswold craftsmanship to create a retreat that‚Äôs been decorated to a very high standard throughout using beautiful fittings, Farrow and Ball paints and designer fabrics.

Upstairs under the eaves, with their original lime-washed oak beams and exposed Cotswold stone walls, are 4 heritage double glazed conservation windows, fitted with black out blinds for the light early mornings. The queen sized (1400) pocket sprung bed with luxurious 400 thread Egyptian cotton pressed linen (Nb. Can also be set up as a twin room) occupies one end of the bedroom while a generous cupboard sits at the other end with a hanging rail and masses of hangers for your clothes and space for your bags. All the upstairs lighting controls are conveniently located next to both sides of the bed. In addition, there is a DAB Roberts radio on the bedside table.

Downstairs features a great living space with excellent wifi and underfloor heating installed throughout. There‚Äôs a fully equipped kitchen containing a Nespresso coffee machine, dishwasher, fridge with ice compartment, gas cooker, microwave, kettle, toaster, washing machine and masses of kitchen utensils, pots and pans‚Ä¶ so if you fancy dining in, there‚Äôs everything you need to create delicious meals while the drop-leaf dining table can be extended from 2 to 4 places.

In the cosy living area, there‚Äôs a deep sofa and a 4k TV with access to both Catch-up and Netflix. Finally, for those chilly evenings, a stylish Chesneys gas fire will keep you lovely and warm and as it‚Äôs operated by remote control, you need only to lift a finger !

The luxurious bathroom is also located downstairs and is equipped with underfloor heating and high end fittings such as a Hanns Grohe shower, Burlington taps and natural Bramley bathroom products, all designed for complete indulgence.
To ensure your stay is as comfortable as can be, we‚Äôve kitted out the cottage with a fully integrated heating system operated by Nest, which also controls the underfloor heating. But your safety is vital so we‚Äôve also installed an intelligent AutoMist¬Æ fire suppression system.

Outside, the terrace is perfectly set-up for alfresco drinks and dining and it is there exclusively for your use. There is a shared formal kitchen garden / potager, bordered by a mature hedge which forms the boundary of the shared space, beyond which the rest of the garden is private. The Gumstool Brook bridge was also rebuilt last year and the iron decorative railings and pillars which we added won the Cirencester 2019 Civic Design award.

Checking-in, Dropping off & Parking

The Potting Shed is set up for self check-in, with a keypad entry system on the bridge and a key safe by the front door. Unfortunately, we do not provide parking on site, however there is a drop off point at the end of the Gumstool Brook path, where guests can unload. Cars can be parked at The Old Station, The Brewery, Waterloo or The Beeches car parks; there is also free on-street parking on Barton Lane (subject to availability) just 3 minutes‚Äô walk away. Please be aware Cecily Hill is resident only parking. Alternatively, private parking can be arranged for a small charge 5 minutes walk away, including a Type 2 EV charge point. For those travelling without a car, Kemble train station is situated 10 minutes from Cirencester ‚Äì and trains from London take 1hr 20mins.

From May until September, the beautiful Cirencester open air swimming pool, with its warm spring-fed water, is open from 7am. It‚Äôs a couple of minutes' walk along from the Gumstool Brook bridge so why not go for a refreshing early morning dip!", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests have access to their own private terrace and shared kitchen garden which lead on from the Gumstool Brook bridge. However, the wider gardens of Cecily Hill House are private.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We are an active family with children and young fox red labrador. We use the garden throughout the year, so we will be around, enjoying life, gardening and socialising.']

Title: Cosy Wooden Cabin by the Woods
Description:
['About this space', "Spend your days in a cosy timber-framed cabin enveloped by rhododendrons.

With a wood-burning stove, a garden and terraces you'll be sure to have what you need for a relaxing stay. Head out of the garden gate and you‚Äôll enter Ringwood Forest with a cycle trail, Moors Valley Country Park, a golf course and a lake.

A 5min drive will take you to the historic market town of Ringwood. Go east and you‚Äôll hit the beautiful New Forest National Park or head south to the sandy beaches of Bournemouth.", 'The space', "The space
The cabin has everything you'll need to stay comfortably: a log-burner, a fully equipped kitchen, a modern bathroom, a pull-out sofa bed, and a TV. Sleeps 4 comfortably (double bed in the attic bedroom and a pull-out sofa bed in the living area).

It is particularly suitable for nature lovers, with a fireplace, BBQ and garden access for guests to enjoy the open forest air.

Note that due to the bedroom being located under an A-line roof, tall people may not be able to stand upright upstairs. However, the communal area downstairs is spacious, so movement is not restricted in day-to-day living.
We can provide a travel cot and a high chair for infants. Should you want us to make up an extra bed, then you need to add an extra guest when booking so that we know to make up an extra bed.

The cabin now has its own private Kirami wood fired hot tub. It is filled with fresh water for each new guest and then heated with firewood. Please contact us for prices.

Parking availability for one car.

We are dog-friendly!

There is a sauna cabin on the property with a small pool which is heated with an air heat pump in the summer months. You can use the pool free of charge. Please speak to us if you would like to book the sauna (log fired), which we charge extra for.", '', '', '', '']

Title: Beautiful converted barn with hot tub & pool
Description:
['About this space', 'Lovely barn with private hot tub (all year) and heated shared pool (May to Sept). Countryside walks from the barn, including to one of three excellent pubs. Huge variety of places to visit within a short distance... Abbeys,Market towns, Tors, Henges to Smokeries, Cider Farms, Moors and Gardens.', 'The space', 'The space
This lovely barn has been sympathetically converted to provide a fabulous holiday home on the edge of the Somerset Levels, less than 1 mile from the traditional town of Langport it provides the perfect retreat for a couple. Walk to one of the three dog friendly local pubs serving great food and local beer and cider, watch the wildlife along one of the walks across the levels or cycle along the car-free tracks or flat roads. Alternatively travel a short distance to visit one of the many local attractions or market towns. At the end of the day relax in the hot tub or swim in the heated pool in season (up to 28 degrees in summer), snuggle in front of the wood burner or sit under the Cherry tree in the private garden.

Set within a perfect spot for touring the beautiful countryside with a wealth of attractions to suit all tastes, within a short drive, including Longleat, Clarks Village at Street, Roman Bath and beaches on the north and south coastline. Enjoy delightful scenery and walks direct from the property and in the evenings visit one of many local excellent dog friendly pubs, all serving good food.

Leisure facilities: Private hot tub (Available all year), shared outdoor, heated swimming pool (May to end of September). Table tennis on request. Outside: field available to exercise dogs with walks straight out. Amenities: ample parking. Bed linen and electric included. Wi-fi available in the barn. Towels provided. Regret no smoking in the property. Location: beach 30 minute drive, shop and pubs under 1 mile.

Accessed through a separate driveway, the accommodation is spacious and furnished to a good standard and offers ONE bedroom: double with en-suite shower room and WC, please take care as the bedroom is accessed via a steep open-tread space saver staircase, there is also an external stone staircase which provides access to the bedroom. Lounge/kitchen/diner: downstairs open-plan with TV, chromecast and bluetooth sound system , woodburner (first basket of logs free), cooker, fridge and microwave. Shared utility: with washing machine in outbuilding. Outside: enclosed private garden with hot tub, seating and BBQ. Amenities: electric heating included. 2 dogs welcome by arrangement (¬£20 per dog).', '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please note there is WIFI but it comes from an extended outside so can be a little tricky sometimes.']

Title: Three en-suite bedroom cottage with indoor pool
Description:
['About this space', 'This cottage is like a tardis! Very large en-suite bedrooms, huge open plan living area, and large private outdoor courtyard by the fully-equipped kitchen with a barbecue and table for outside eating. Freeview TV, Apple TV & Wifi and access to private indoor heated swimming pool.

Please note: we do not accept bookings with a Saturday check in or out. Please ensure your check out day is either a Friday or Sunday for week long bookings.', 'The space', 'The space
In a quiet location, a very spacious cottage in a quiet courtyard with 3 large, upstairs double bedrooms, all with ensuite bathrooms & an open plan kitchen, living room and dining area with fireplace, opening out to a private gravelled courtyard. Dogs welcome.

Isolated at the end of a long, bumpy driveway, this very quiet cottage comes with three large bedrooms, all three with en-suite bath or shower rooms. It has a spacious open plan kitchen, dining and living room.

Wood burning stove in inglenook fireplace.

Private outside space in gravelled courtyard, perfect for outside dining in the summer.

Very peaceful quiet setting.

Ideal for families, or small parties looking to get up to 8 people together for a (long!) weekend away.

There are 2 further single camp beds or a sofa bed available which will allow the cottage to sleep 8.

There is 4 hours per day of private access to the indoor heated pool. Times can be arranged in advance of the stay.

Please note: if you are booking a bank holiday weekend we require a 3 night minimum booking.

Please ensure that you add the correct number of guests to your booking to ensure that the correct price is quoted.

In order to prevent food wastage, we only leave welcome food items for guests staying more than one night.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Dotty's Hut at Old Rectory House
Description:
['About this space', 'Old Rectory House is a grade II listed property with 8 acres of gardens and meadows with stunning coastal and countryside views. We have two luxury shepherd huts, both with spectacular sea views, wood burner and private hot tub. Also, we have lovingly renovated our outbuildings to create The Coach House, a large 4 bedroom self-catering guest accommodation. Guests in The Coach House have their own private outdoor swimming pool, pool house and hot tub.', 'The space', "The space
For the ultimate countryside experience treat yourself to a stay in one of our luxury, oak clad shepherd huts made by the master craftsmen at Blackdown Shepherd Huts. The huts are nestled within our fields with stunning coastal views with our Dexter cattle and Herdwick sheep for neighbours!

Dotty's Hut has been lovingly handmade in Somerset with amazing attention to detail and the highest quality of finish. Each hut has a log burner for cosy evenings. There is comfortable corner seating with a coffee table which expands into a full dining table. When it's time for sleep there is a pull down double bed made up with luxury bed linens. Over the bed you will be greeted with a curved glass skylight for a magical stargazing experience. The bathroom has an electric shower, heated towel rail, marble sink and flushing toilet. We provide towels, hair dryer and complimentary Bramley toiletries. The kitchen area has an lovely oak work top, induction hob, fridge/freezer and Belfast sink.  There is a toaster, kettle and coffee pot as well as all the utensils and crockery you will need. We provide tea, coffee, milk, sugar, oil and salt & pepper to get you started.

Each hut is surrounded by it's own private garden with a Kadai fire pit, grill and bowl for an immersive outdoor cooking experience. Let the stresses of everyday life fade away while soaking in your own Hikki Bohemen wood fired hot tub. Drink in the breathtaking countryside and sea views by day or luxuriate under the stars by night. All logs are included.

BBQ and breakfast packs from our home reared produce are available to purchase as well as 'in hut' meals delivered to your door loving prepared by us!

For use during your stay every property has a selection of board games, cards, local maps and books, as well as a bird watching kit and a fossil hunting kit.

Guests are free to explore our stunning grounds which include a walled orchard and a willow tunnel taking you to our croquet lawn. There are peaceful seating areas nestled within the wild flower meadow where you can take in the sea views and enjoy a picnic. In the evening relax around the fire pit, toasting marshmallows while star gazing.

Access to the huts is by foot and a short walk from the parking area. We are happy to assist with any luggage."]

Title: Apple Store with use of Pool, Jacuzzi & Sauna
Description:
['About this space', 'The Apple Store self catering lodge has been expertly decorated in a French Style. The open plan bedroom, living and dining area includes a Smart TV and WiFi. There is a very comfortable king size bed.
The en-suite bathroom has a high specification shower.
The seperate well equipped kitchen has an oven, hob and fridge.
Situated in the patio area, it has its own tables and chairs and is by the swimming pool, jacuzzi and sauna
Set in seven acres of gardens and fields of grazing horses', 'The space', 'The space
The Apple Store features private use of the indoor heated swimming pool, jacuzzi, sauna and gym.

Surrounded by the Cotswolds and Malvern Hills, yet conveniently located close to the historic towns of Cheltenham Spa, Gloucester and Tewkesbury,
the Apple Store self catering lodge has been expertly decorated in a French Style. The open plan comfortable bedroom, living and dining area includes a Smart TV and WiFi. There is a very comfortable king size bed.
The en-suite bathroom has a high specification shower.
The seperate well equipped kitchen has an oven, hob and fridge.

Enjoy the pleasures of the Cotswolds air, rolling countryside, picturesque villages, our garden and paddocks of grazing horses. The accommodation opens on to the patio with seating and a purpose built barbecue to sit round at the end of the day and relax whilst making plans for the rest of your stay!
Manor Barn is close to ancient sites including Neolithic barrows, hill forts and Roman remains. You are near to the Cotswolds Way, so if you like walking you can follow one of the walks from the National Trail, which can be downloaded from their website. The Malvern Hills are also nearby, which also provide pleasant walks and spectacular views. The River Severn is also a short walk away.', '', '', '', 'The Cheltenham Festival and Races are world famous.
The Cotswold towns and villages with their wild life parks, country shows, independent shops, market stalls, pubs, restaurants, bars, art galleries, theatres and cinemas are a great attraction.
We have maps and can suggest walks, tours and places to visit.']

Title: Countryside retreat, swimming pool, stunning views
Description:
['About this space', 'NEW BUILD FOR 2021! A brand-new jewel in the SummerHouse Luxury Holiday Lets crown! A beautiful countryside retreat with access to luxury heated swimming pool with a hot tub, steam room & changing rooms, all bookable for fully exclusive use.

The complex is a grand house in the middle of the Chew Valley overlooking the stunning Mendip foothills. East Wing has three luxury, en-suite bedrooms, comfortably sleeping six people with a sofa bed for two more in our spacious reception room.', '', 'The space
To the right of the front door is the Sitting Room with ceiling-to-floor windows, large, luxurious sofa with a comfortable bed, and a magnificent fireplace. There is a large HDTV with a Wii, Android TV box and a Blu-Ray player. Skylights stream natural light into the room making it nice and bright. Just off the Sitting Room, there is a modern kitchenette with a brand new kitchen containing a gas cooker, electric oven, built-in microwave, and a slimline dishwasher.

Directly opposite the front door is Wisteria, a super king bedroom with a private shower room. This space also allows access to the shared Laundry Room with a washing machine, tumble dryer and an additional dishwasher.

Just off the Sitting Room are two luxurious en-suite bedroom. The nearest one is Willow with a super-king bed, a superb en-suite bathroom containing a freestanding slipper bath and a walk-in shower. The next bedroom, Magnolia, has a double bed. Magnolia's en-suite has a bath and shower.

In our grounds you will find a 200-year old converted stables, a Georgian horse wash, a well, and a purpose built swimming pool. The pool complex houses a ten-metre swimming pool with a "Fluvo jet" to exercise against, a hot tub which takes 5 people (at a squeeze) a shower and steam cubicle, robes, slippers, spa towels, hair dryer. The temperature of the pool is 88 ¬∞F / 31 ¬∞ C and the temperature of the hot tub is 101 ¬∞ F / 38 ¬∞ C. Bring your own CDs, use ours or listen to the radio or Bluetooth; feel free to just sit in the pool room to read, relax or meditate. Groups are to book sessions for exclusive use of the pool complex - ask for details. We have personally approved people to offer you Massages, Aromatherapy Treatments and Personal Trainer Assessment which can be arranged by yourselves at an extra charge if required.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Garden Cottage, heated indoor  pool,  tennis court
Description:
['About this space', 'Self contained barn conversion, Very spacious , light, open and airy.

Totally secluded and peaceful except for the sound of local birds.

Private decking area and courtyard with views over 4 acres of private park like gardens, containing a small private lake and stream.

Indoor pool and private tennis court.
Huge wood burner and plentiful supply of logs', 'The space', "The space
The Cottage is a fantastic self contained barn conversion.
Please note that the driveway is somewhat cambered so may not be suitable for very unstable guests, though there is parking very close to the Cottage so the amount of walking required to access the building is limited. The cottage is all on one level with no steps internally

The space is large , light, open and airy but is cosy in colder weather with a huge wood burning stove and highly efficient underfloor heating through out.

One bedroom has a king bed and the other a twin and single bed. We can put a temporary bed in the king room for a 6th guest.

The hosts live in the main house on site some 30 metres away from the Cottage and are available when required.

The Cottage benefits from a private decking area and courtyard and has
gorgeous views over 4 acres of private park like gardens, containing a small private lake and stream.

Please note the following
1. The cottage is directly above a riding menage and occasionally horses may be exercised there-in.

2.Please also note that there are steep terraced flower beds immediately below the decking so small children must be supervised at all times.



3. The Wifi is good but mobile phone reception in the building is limited. It is however available at the top of the driveway around 100 metres away
Make sure you login to the WiFi as soon as you arrive Mobile phone signal is not existent at the Propety but you can use your mobile plan through WiFi it you switch WiFi calling on on your mobiles.


Guests have use of indoor pool and private tennis court which is near the main house but please note the following .

1...The pool will be available for your exclusive use at times agreed with the host during your stay. ...times of use are flexible . Please also note that the pool is currently undergoing redecoration after a small leak to the roof so some marks remain visible. There is a plentiful supply of children's floats and toys. All swimming is undertaken at your own risk!. There is a changing room available in the pool house but note that there may be family members elsewhere in that environment (although the pool will not be shared whilst you are in it).

2 Please note that the use of the pool is STRICTLY FOR RECREATIONAL PURPOSES. Any COMMERCIAL USE including filming will only be permitted under separate negotiation

3 Please also note that the tennis court is unavailable on Sunday mornings between 10.30 and noon but is otherwise fully accessible.

4 Dogs may be accepted subject to prior agreement with the hosts on a case by case basis and subject to an additional charge depending on the size and breed of the dog. This will be payable on arrival Note...we have our own small terrier. All guests dogs will need to be kept indoors or on a lead at all times because fencing is not dog proof !

5 Cycles may be available to hire at a rate of ¬£10 per day each , subject to separate agreement.

6 There is a plentiful supply of DVD' s available to suit all ages, plus a children's keyboard and a supply of games. Please note that there is a TV screen with a Chrome cast facility and for playing DVDs only...there are currently no other TV screening services on site at present.

7 Please message me about flexibility regarding check in time...I am always happy to help subject to the limitations of cleaning on change over days.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests have access to the barn and decking .

The pool and the tennis court are also available ( see separate notes)']
