Title: The Potting Shed - cosy country cottage
Description:
['About this space', 'The Potting Shed is part of the original Gardners Buildings of a large country house. Beautifully updated to provide a truly snug and romantic place to stay. A log burner is the focal point of the lounge/living area as well as exposed wooden beams and stonework. Wifi, Smart TV and all you will need for a memorable get away. Well fitted kitchen with fridge, microwave and dishwasher. Double bedroom, shower/WC. Ample Parking. We want to make your stay cosy, comfortable and enjoyable.', '', "The space
We want to welcome you to our 'Potting Shed' which is a beautifully restored cottage.
The Potting Shed is located in the grounds of an old family home now updated and offering a complex of converted barns including a cafe, beauty parlour, hairdresser and gym. Please see our other cottages 'The Apple Store' and 'The Cellar Barn' which could be booked with extended family groups. The complex is set in 12 acres of grounds, gardens and an old apple orchard. Guests are invited to take a walk down the Orchard to see the beautiful views across to Cheddar Gorge or stroll around to meet the friendly animals.
Our neighbours 'Crossfit Wyvern' allow our guests to use their gym and leisure facilities including for the summer season: swimming pool, hot tub and sauna. This can be arranged by booking and payment online directly with them. There is also a cafe on site selling delicious homemade food.

In the Potting Shed we have included all we can to give you home-from-home comforts in peaceful country surroundings. We offer a welcome pack when you arrive, there is free Wifi (just in case you want to contact the outside world) ! A log burner is available- please bring your own logs or they can be purchased at our local store in the village. We are very flexible so please ask if there is anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable or anything that you need.
Outside the Potting Shed is a table and chairs for you to sit and have your morning coffee, and a small BBQ. As well as this there is a larger grass area with BBQ and seating for the use of guests located just across from the parking area. Or if you would like a little walk you can wander across the grass area of the walled garden and through into our apple orchard with a seating area looking out across the Somerset Levels towards Cheddar Gorge - if you come in September you are welcome to try the different varieties of apples.
If you like animals a walk around the grounds gives you the opportunity to meet some unusual friends including : 2 friendly pigs : Pepper & Barry, Pigmy Goats - Murph and Cindy, and some Alpacas, sheep and chickens as well as our friendly cats and dogs. Or if you would rather just sit in the orchard you can see the views of the beautiful Somerset Levels out towards Cheddar Gorge or watch the sun go down with a glass of wine.

There is a laundry room opposite the Potting Shed - washing machine, tumble drier, iron and ironing board are available for the use of our guests. A rotary clothes line is located in the small guests garden across the car park.

The cafe next door serves homemade food and delicious coffee and cafe. It is accessed via the wooden gate and across the car park. Down the driveway from the cafe is a gym and swimming pool which guests can book in to and use on a pay-as-use basis. There is also a nails and massage parlour and hairdresser in the gym/cafe complex.

The village has a well-stocked grocery store for all your food and drink needs, a post office and 2 pubs within walking distance.

If it's the countryside you like then there is Shapwick Heath and Ham Wall Nature Reserve (10/15 mins), Cheddar Gorge or the Quantock Hills (30 mins) or the sea at Minehead (45 mins), or simply go down on to the Somerset Levels for some fantastic walks around the area.

The village is on the Somerset Cycle route so an idea place to stay during a cycling break to see the wonderful Somerset Levels or take the challenge of the steep climb up Cheddar Gorge. Chilton Polden is on many Somerset cycle routes. For more information about some of the routes that pass the door look up 'Overview of cycling in Chilton Polden'.

The near town of Street (5 miles away) boasts the large retail outlet of Clarks Village if you are in to shopping.

A file with information of local places to visit is available in the Potting Shed along with tourist information leaflets.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Our postcode brings you to Broadway via SatNav but you will need directions to get to our accommodation. We will send these through to you via air bnb message after booking.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We have 2 small dogs - Bertie(dad) and Albe (his son) - they may come and say hello when you arrive because they are very friendly and love all our guests.
Do not charge electric cars from the property - the supply is not set up for this.']

Title: Family & dog friendly static caravan on 5* park
Description:
['About this space', 'SPACIOUS 3 BEDROOM FAMILY & DOG FRIENDLY STATIC CARAVAN IN A QUIET LOCATION ON SHOREFIELD COUNTRY PARK, A 5* HOLIDAY PARK, 5 MINUTES FROM THE BEACH & ON THE EDGE OF THE NEW FOREST NATIONAL PARK. It has every amenity including indoor and outdoor swimming pools, bars, restaurant, indoor & outdoor play areas, fitness suite, health spa, large supermarket, small fishing lake etc. Wi-fi is freely available throughout the park including in the caravan.', '', 'The space
The home is a modern 3 bedroom property that sleeps up to 6 guests with 1 double and 2 twin bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. It has a secure decking area safe for children and dogs and a garden backing on to woodland.

The unit itself is complete with all the facilities that you would expect. There is central heating and double glazing and usb charging sockets in every room. The kitchen has a gas hob with fan assisted electric oven, fridge / freezer, microwave, kettle and toaster along with all the cutlery, crockery and utensils. The living room has a large sofa with a 32" smart tv, DVD player, HiFi system with internet radio, DAB radio, cd player, usb connectivity, a portable weatherproof bluetooth speaker / lantern / power-bank for outside or inside, a large variety of family film DVD's, games and books. All of the bedrooms have plenty of storage with wardrobes with drawers and hangers, charging sockets, bluetooth DAB clock radios and a hairdryer. The main bedroom also has another 32" Smart TV. Please note that the bedrooms are a little bit snug / compact as with most static caravans, so please bear this in mind. Update - 1 of the single bedrooms now have full sized adult bunk beds which offers larger beds and more room in the bedroom. The living space on the other hand, you could quite comfortably fit in at least 12 people with room for more! The bathroom has a very large powerful shower, hand basin and toilet. There is also a second toilet and hand basin. An iron, ironing board, clothes dryer, vacuum cleaner etc are all provided as is bedlinen. Please bring your own towels. The outside decking area has a dining area and additional seating with small drinks table, 4 led security lights and a floodlight for al fresco dining.

A travel cot and high chair are also provided.

If you want somewhere to get away from it all, then this is the place for you. The amount of wildlife right by the caravan is truly extraordinary - Whether they are rabbits, squirrels, deer, green woodpeckers [ my favourite! ]. pheasant, a huge array of tits, finches and other birds that feed off the bird feeders provided, there is always something to see. Please feel free to top up the bird feeders when necessary from the food provided as they seem to get through it at an astonishing rate. There is also a bird bath for our feathered friends.', '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
A family pass to access the swimming pools and the fitness centre etc is ¬£50 per week.']

Title: The 'Cart Shed' - cosy space in a scenic setting
Description:
['About this space', 'Situated in the scenic Chalke Valley, an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, the Cart Shed provides a welcoming and comfortable base to relax in and explore the numerous sites of Wiltshire, Dorset and Hampshire.

Newly renovated, it is a warm and well furnished private space to enjoy the surrounding countryside.', 'The space', 'The space
The 'Cart Shed' has been extensively renovated to create a well proportioned self-contained private outbuilding to the farmhouse. The living space has everything you would need; flexible sleeping arrangements (Twin or Super King) for 2 persons, in a gallery bedroom overlooking the large living/dining room.

There is a separate well equipped kitchen, with Nespresso machine, fridge, dishwasher, microwave, oven & induction hob. Opposite a modern shower room with guest amenities.

The living space has a large central wood-burner with three large sofas. There is a 42" TV at one end of the space, with Sky TV (Sports / Movies), Blu Ray player connected to a Bose surround sound system. At the other end, a dining table and work desk with chairs. There is also a large chest of drawers.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Crocus at Stancombe Manor, pool and tennis
Description:
['About this space', 'Crocus, apartment on the ground floor of Stancombe Manor‚Äôs tithe barn, is a place of peace, tranquility and beauty.
Sleeps 2-4, perfect for a couple or small family
Shared use of Stancombe‚Äôs facilities: indoor pool, tennis, 7 acres of lovely gardens
Close to award-winning beaches and fabulous walking
Half-way between Salcombe and Dartmouth
Great pubs and restaurants a short drive away
One well-behaved dog', 'The space', 'The space
Crocus is a recently renovated apartment on the ground floor of the tithe barn at Stancombe Manor, a walled Devon hamlet listed in the Domesday Book. It‚Äôs a great base for a couple or small family to explore Salcombe, Dartmouth and the surrounding beaches. There are 17 privately owned properties which share 7 acres of gardens. This part of Devon is known for beautiful countryside and beaches, secret green lanes, and a host of good pubs and restaurants. We are 3 miles from the sea at Torcross, and 10 miles from both Salcombe and Dartmouth.

Here is what the apartment includes:

OPEN PLAN

Living area
- one 3-seater sofa and armchair
- TV and DVD/blue ray player with some DVDs
- comfortable pull-down double bed (4‚Äô 6‚Äù wide) if needed

Kitchen
- under counter fridge with small inbuilt freezer
- oven and hob
- dishwasher
- kettle and cafeti√®re

Title: Bucks Green Place Beautiful Converted Barn
Description:
['About this space', 'A recently converted barn finished to a very high standard set in the grounds of a Grade II Georgian country house. Situated in idyllic Sussex countryside, nestled close to the Surrey Hills and South Downs. With stunning views across seven acres of garden and open pastures.', 'The space', 'The space
Beautifully appointed small barn conversion, with original oak beams and features. Well proportioned open plan kitchen living space with breakfast bar, comfy seating, new kitchen with all mod cons. Flat screen Smart TV. Upstairs a spacious double bedroom with luxurious king size bed, built in wardrobes and cupboards, flat screen TV, dressing table. Ensuite shower room stylishly designed, heated towel rail and heated floor. Space for a single air bed or travel cot upstairs and / or double air bed downstairs in living area.

The barn is located within our family garden next door to our outdoor swimming pool. We have assigned an area of the garden for your personnel use.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Coded electric gate access to secure parking. Guests will have access to 7 acres open pasture, leading onto public footpaths. Access to our private swimming pool in the summer months can be arranged upon request', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Long term let Monday - Friday is also available for working professionals, please enquire if you are interested in this arrangement.']

Title: Luxury Studio Apartment with Pool, near London
Description:
['About this space', 'A large, luxurious modern studio apartment, sleeping up to 3. Set in a large private garden with heated indoor/outdoor pool (pool open May-September inc); ideal for relaxing after a hard day at work, sightseeing or having fun.

Off-road private parking; 5 minutes drive to Redhill station and 30 mins train to central London. Gatwick is 15 mins drive as are the M25 and the local amenities of Redhill/Reigate.

The traditional local village pub is 2 mins walk, ideal for dining and entertaining.', 'The space', 'The space
This location is ideal for links to London and the South East. In addition, local amenities include water sports, mountain biking, Surrey Hills, cycling, aerodromes and traditional Surrey villages. Famous tourist attractions in London plus others, e.g. Windsor, Hampton Court and Thorpe Park are all less than 1 hr away. Wimbledon, Ascot, Henley, Lords, Wembley, Twickenham, many famous football and rugby stadiums and entertainment venues, are within easy reach (less than 1 hr) by car or public transport.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The apartment is stand alone in the large lower garden. You have independent private access to the apartment. The lower garden is available for use, as is the large pool. The pool enclosure is fully retractable to create an outdoor pool when weather permits. In those days that it is sunny but "cool" the enclosure creates a 25 deg+ indoor environment. Note: The pool is shared access with householder. The pool and lower garden can be provided as sole private access for for you and your guests for an additional charge of ¬£150 per day. NOTE: THE POOL IS SHUT FROM 1ST OCTOBER TO 30TH APRIL INCLUSIVE.', '', 'Other things to note']

Description:
['About this space', 'Each solid wood log cabin is encircled by trees for your privacy yet open enough to let sunlight through. We aim to give you that cosy, romantic log cabin retreat experience with a solid wood burner.
Free Access to a Seasonal Outdoor Heated pool (end May - Sept).', 'The space', 'The space
Genuine Scandinavian Log Cabin tucked away in mature oak woodland', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Explore 8 acres of woodland with WWII Pill Boxes Balcony, Play area, Heated Outdoor pool (seasonal - end May to Sept)', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note

Woodpecker Lodge and Tawny Owl Lodge, both with private hot tubs) and Roe Deer Lodge.']

Title: The Duck House. A child/dog friendly rural chalet
Description:
['About this space', "The Duck House is a lovely child/dog friendly chalet nestling in the orchard at Plenty Cottage.
The perfect retreat for a family/group - and dogs are especially welcome! Open plan living is around a pot-bellied stove and it‚Äôs a comfortable and home from home. A wonderful rambling garden, summerhouse, BBQ and a (free) heated swimming pool (1st April - 31st Sept). The mantra is 'No Stress'. Ample parking, dog/child friendly pub 7 mins walk away. Wonderful NT beaches just five min drive. Relax.", 'The space', "The space
The Duck House is fully furnished. It's centrally heated but in addition, there's everything you need to light the wood burner. The second bedroom is child orientated with a double bed and a single bed so it sleeps three kids (or adults!). There are strict safety rules regarding the pool but other than that, the garden/BBQ are for you to enjoy.", 'Guest access', "Guest access
The Duck House is completely separate in the orchard near the swimming pool. You have your own key so you can come and go as you wish. There's plenty of free off-road parking.", 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
The pub 'The Five Bells' is ten minutes walk. It serves food and is both child and dog friendly. The Shave Cross Inn is a thatched ye olde pub and worth a visit (two miles). Felicity's Farm Shop is just up the road too. Charmouth beach is great for dog walking"]

Title: Gothic House Cottage
Description:
['About this space', "Gothic House Cottage is situated opposite the imposing Church of St Peter and St Paul in Clare, which sits in the Upper Stour Valley. The cottage is ideally placed, just a 5 minute walk from the shops, restaurants and pubs in Clare and within walking distance of the Country Park, where the remains of Clare Castle stand. With so much on the doorstep, you can park the car up for your stay until it's time to head home.

The ground floor of the cottage has an open and airy living space with a large dining kitchen and garden room with floor to ceiling windows providing lovely views over the extensive garden at the rear. The sitting room has an electric, living flame stove to gather around when night time draws in. Upstairs, both bedrooms overlook the church and have the choice of the first floor bathroom with separate shower, or the ground floor shower room. Bedroom two has the flexibility of a super-king size bed which can be separated into twin single beds on request.

Outside, a small, enclosed garden and courtyard has access to a shed to store bicycles if you fancy exploring the local countryside on two wheels; along with use of an additional, larger garden beyond. The outdoor, heated swimming pool is available for use from mid-May until the end of August by arrangement with the homeowners. There is also a grass tennis court which although not Wimbledon championship standard, guests are welcome to use and enjoy as well, again from mid-May to the end of August.

Ground Floor:
Hallway
Open-plan dining kitchen
With dishwasher, microwave, fridge/freezer and electric oven and hob. Table and seating for four guests.
Garden room
With french doors leading to the garden.
Sitting room
With electric living flame stove, television and DVD player.
Shower room
With a shower, wash basin, WC and washing machine.

First Floor:
Bedroom one
With a king-size bed.
Bedroom two
With a super-king size bed. This can be separated into two 3' single beds on request at booking.
Bathroom
With a bath, separate shower, wash basin and WC.

Outside:
Enclosed garden and courtyard for private use by guests along with access to the larger garden. Garden furniture is provided and a charcoal barbecue is available. There is an outdoor heated swimming pool and grass tennis court which can be used by arrangement with the owners. The swimming pool and tennis court are available mid-May to the end of August.
A storage shed is available if you wish to bring your own bicycles with you.
Unrestricted parking on the street.

Additional Information:
Infants welcome, please bring your own cot and high chair. Stair gate available on request.
One well behaved dog welcome between May and September. Please contact the Bookings Team to arrange this.
There is restricted head height over the bath in the bathroom upstairs."]

Title: Outshot Barn (M536009)
Description:
['About this space', 'If you are looking for the unusual then Outshot Barn is the place for you. It‚Äôs a perfect luxury holiday retreat for a family or for two couples travelling together who are looking to enjoy true Herefordshire countryside whilst being close enough to visit the well known town of Hay-on-Wye.. This property is all on the Ground Floor
Sitting room area: seating for four, log burner with starter basket of logs, TV with Freeview and DVD player
Kitchen/Dining area: table and seating for four, large electric range cooker, fridge with freezer box (spare shared freezer next door in the farm kitchen for bigger items if needed), microwave and dishwasher
Master Bedroom (sleeps 2): Super King size bed
Master Bathroom: walk-in shower and heated towel rail
Bedroom 2 (sleeps 2): Super King size bed. If you would like the beds as twins then please contact the booking team
Bathroom 2: with bath, shower overhead and heated towel rail. Outside
A large enclosed courtyard garden with table and seating for four and BBQ. A small grass paddock can be used for children to play or to walk dogs. Please ask on arrival. Exclusive use of the swimming pool (open 1st May - 30th September). The modern design of this home is complimented with a stylish collection of the fun and quirky features. The spacious open plan kitchen, living and dining area creates the central hub of Outshot Barn, floor to ceiling glass and high ceilings create a spacious and relaxed feel.
The two bedrooms both with their own bathroom, offer peace and tranquillity to help with a good night‚Äôs sleep so you will be feeling refreshed and ready to enjoy the day ahead.
If you are an outdoor lover, private trails around the farm offer beautiful walks to start the day and observe the wildlife. The large farm grounds offer plenty of animals and space for children to enjoy. A private courtyard with outdoor seating and a BBQ, create the perfect recipe for long summer evenings outside.
A great place to stay for animal lovers, collect eggs from the chickens and ducks, meet the ponies and the piglets if you‚Äôre lucky too. The farm is eco friendly with solar panels providing electricity and there is a spring for water.']

Title: The Beach Hut
Description:
['About this space', "The Beach Hut:

The Beach Hut is located on Sandhills Holiday Park in Mudeford.

It includes one double en-suite bedroom, one twin bedroom, both with plenty of storage space and a family bathroom (with bath). The kitchen is fully equipped, including a gas hob and oven, large fridge/freezer, washing machine and dishwasher. The main bedroom has space for a travel cot. A high-chair and travel cot are both available on request.

Bed linen and towels are provided, we just ask you to bring your own beach towels.

The indoor living space is light and airy and there is plenty of outdoor space with seating on the decking. There is a flat screen TV and DVD player and free WiFi.

Sandhills Holiday Park has a clubhouse, a children's play area, two outdoor heating pools and a launderette. Just 5 minutes' walk from Avon Beach and Mudeford Quay where you can catch a ferry to Hengistbury Head.

An excellent choice for all your holiday needs."]

Title: The Bothy at Launceston Farm, cottage with indoor swimming pool & sauna
Description:
['About this space', 'The Bothy is one of the two small self catering cottages at Launceston Farm near Blandford in Dorset. This single storey cottage, attached to the main farmhouse has its own private courtyard with outdoor bateau bath for soaks under the stars. Popular with dog owners, you can step out of the front door onto farm tracks which run for miles across the chalk downlands of the surrounding Cranborne Chase, Area of Oustanding Natural Beauty. Guests have access to the farmhouse gardens and the indoor swimming pool. The local pub is a five minute walk into the village.

If it‚Äôs not walking weather, while away the afternoon in the 12m indoor swimming pool and sauna (available to guests 7:00am-7:00pm). Curl up on the sofa in front of the wood burner with a DVD or a good read. If you don‚Äôt feel like cooking, order one of Sarah‚Äôs two course farmhouse suppers delivered hot to your door or take a 5 minute stroll down to the award winning village pub.

Take a trip to the World Heritage Jurassic Coast for a paddle in the ocean and the catch of the day. Enjoy a large slice of British heritage at one of the nearby National Trust and English Heritage Properties including Corfe Castle, Stourhead Gardens and Stone Henge. Nature lovers must visit Monkey World and Abbotsbury Swannery. Shop in independent boutiques for homewares and fashion in the Georgian market towns of Shaftesbury, Salisbury, Sherborne and Wimborne.', '', '', '', '', '', '']

Title: Stunning house with swimming pool and WOW views
Description:
['About this space', 'Looking for an extra-special holiday home on the South coast? Fairways is a beautiful, detached, four-bedroom house with private swimming pool and glorious views over a golf course to the South Downs beyond.

Set in the popular residential Old Town area of Eastbourne, the house offers easy access to walks to Beachy Head, the Seven Sisters and Cuckmere Valley. The Old Town area has a Waitrose, various shops and facilities, plus restaurants - including the 12th century Lamb Inn.', 'The space', "The space
This Exclusively Eastbourne house has an interesting 'upside-down' design, being set on a slope. The entry level has the living areas, and then you go downstairs to reach the bedrooms.

The huge dining lounge is the focal point for sociable gatherings, and has floor-to-ceiling windows and patio doors at the rear opening on to a balcony that stretches the width of the house. Step out, and you'll soak up the views over the swimming pool, garden, adjoining golf course and the lovely hills beyond.

A separate modern kitchen is well equipped for self catering holidays, with a fridge freezer, oven, hob, microwave and dishwasher, plus an informal breakfast table that's handy if you want to catch up with your emails.

The washing machine is in a separate utility room and a cloakroom/toilet completes this level.

Downstairs is equally spacious and comfortable. A second sitting room is an ideal breakout room for the children, or if you can't agree what to watch on TV.

The master bedroom has a super kingsize bed, plus a whole wall length of fitted wardrobes - so no need to skimp on your packing.

The second and third bedrooms are also large in size - one with a super kingsize bed, the other a twin. The fourth, smaller bedroom is a twin for children's use only - so this property can sleep a maximum of six adults and two children.

There is a large family bathroom with a bath and separate walk in shower, plus a separate shower room.


WiFi is provided, along with towels and linen. There is driveway parking for two cars and further street parking available. Bookings are for a week long minimum, and run from Friday to Friday in peak season, however weekends/short stays and flexible arrival days are possible out of season - just talk to the Exclusively Eastbourne team.

Talk to the Exclusively Eastbourne team if you've any questions that can help you reach a decision or check out our own website for best prices and alternative places to stay in the area.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The whole house and gardens', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Outside the garden is attractive and regularly maintained. The swimming pool is heated for use between Spring bank holiday (end of May) to mid September only. Parents need to be aware that as well as the pool (which is fenced in), there is a laburnum tree in the garden (plant/berries poisonous), so children must be supervised at all times.']

Title: Furnace House (UK33635)
Description:
['About this space', 'You‚Äôll love the history, lake, and the contemporary designed interior with topiary in the gardens - truly a magical place to have a staycation this year.. Ground Floor:
Living room: With wood burner.
Dining room: With wood burner.
Kitchen: With breakfast area, electric oven, microwave, American-style fridge/freezer, wine cooler, dishwasher, coffee machine, washing machine and tumble dryer.
Study.
Separate toilet.
First Floor:
Bedroom 1: With super kingsize bed and en-suite with bath, shower cubicle, toilet and heated towel rail.
Bedroom 2: With kingsize bed and en-suite with walk-in shower and toilet.
Bedroom 3: With kingsize bed and en-suite with walk-in shower and toilet.
Second Floor:
Low ceilings throughout.
Bedroom 4: With twin beds (for children).
Bedroom 5: With twin beds (for children).
Bathroom: With bath and toilet.. Garden with patio. Grounds. Private parking for 8 cars. Please note: There is an unfenced lake in the grounds. This property has a security deposit of ¬£250. The floors throughout the property are uneven and there are steps leading to some rooms. This property is not suitable for guests with restricted or limited mobility.. All properties: Oil central heating, electricity, bed linen, towels and Wi-Fi included. Welcome pack. Outdoor heated swimming pool open between May - September (shared with owner and another property on-site, 15m x 10m, depth 1m x 2.5m. Please bring own towels for use at the pool) with changing facilities. No smoking.. Furnace House Annexe (ref UK35202) is a heritage building with gorgeous, refurbished interiors. Throughout your stay you‚Äôll have access to a massive lake and forested grounds, as well as a swimming pool. Located in Furnace Wood, this is a period property with stunning interiors including many aspects of its heritage past. The property has been restored to the highest quality by the owners, who now live in a house in the grounds. Furnace House Annexe is so much more than you‚Äôd expect from an annexe. It is a luxurious and exciting property. There is a large living room with a wood burner and a massive sofa. There is another living room area with adjacent dining area. The kitchen is modern and beautifully presented.
Located in Furnace Wood, Furnace House (ref UK33635) is a period property with an extremely unique difference and the most amazing interior with all the quirkiness you‚Äôd usually find with a period house. The house itself was originally two workman‚Äôs cottages dating to about 1758 when the Iron industry was operating for the second time. The woods are situated in what is known as the ‚ÄòWeald‚Äô from Old English meaning forest.
From the very moment you walk into Furnace House you know how opulent and luxurious your stay is going to be as the interior is exceptionally decorated with some amazing furniture, fixtures and fittings. Downstairs you will find the main living room with a huge inglenook fireplace, an extremely well-equipped modern kitchen and dining room which also has an Inglenook fireplace for those extremely personal evening banquets. There is also an office should you need to catch up with some work whilst you are enjoying your staycation in this rather gorgeous home. Upstairs you will find a plethora of versatile bedrooms with master having a super kingsize bed with an en-suite with shower cubicle and bath, which is well fitted with a contemporary feel that matches the whole house. The second bedroom has a kingsize with an en-suite shower room as does the third. The fourth and fifth bedrooms for the children have small single beds in them with their own bathroom with a child-size bath. Please note that this area on the top floor has very limited head room in both the rooms and the staircase.
Stepping outside is just as amazing as you meander your way through the immaculate topiary gardens to the bottom steps it opens up to an amazing lake for you to use for fishing, or just simply relaxing by as it is one of the most remarkable venues. The lake contains many species of fish, including carp, tench, and perch. You are literally surrounded by all the fun you are going to need for your staycation of a lifetime. There is so much to do here and not enough room to list all the special features of this beautiful property in a very private and gated area. This will truly blow your mind when you drive into the property through its security gates and the memories you will make will last a lifetime.
These properties can be booked together to accommodate up to 18 guests.
Free WiFi']

Title: Old Orchard Barn - The Annexe (UK31384)
Description:
['About this space', 'Situated in the Blackdown Hills Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty with its wonderful scenery, perfect for walking and cycling.. All on the ground floor.
Open plan living space.
Wooden floors throught.
Living area: With electric wood burner, Smart TV with Netflix and Amazon Firestick.
Step to...
Dining area.
Kitchen area: With breakfast area, electric oven, electric hob, microwave and fridge/freezer.
Bedroom: With kingsize bed and en-suite with shower cubicle, toilet and heated towel rail.. Electric wall heaters, electricity, bed linen, towels and Wi-Fi included. Welcome pack and doggy extras. Enclosed lawned garden with sitting-out area, garden furniture and barbecue. Heated swimming pool (private, 10m x 5m, depth 1.2m, open May - September, 10am - 4pm). Tennis court. Private parking for 1 car. No smoking.. Old Orchard Barn - The Annexe is a beautiful converted property in the heart of Buckland St Mary, a gorgeous Somerset village, yet within easy access to the A303. Inside it has been lovingly converted as a relaxing holiday retreat for two to feature a cosy living area with electric wood burner and Smart TV, although with the large windows gazing out over the rolling fields you may never need to switch it on! The living room is open plan with the kitchen although this is up a step, giving it a slightly separate feel. The kitchen is well-equipped with an oven, hob, microwave and fridge/freezer, and there is a wonderful dining area making the most of the views. Into the bedroom you have an oak kingsize bed with bamboo mattress, Egyptian cotton bedding and an oak dressing table, as well as a hanging area for your clothes, off the bedroom there is a fabulously colourful en-suite with shower cubicle. Outside there is a private garden area with seating and views, perfect for a glass of wine as the sun goes down, there is also a private outdoor heated swimming pool available from 10am until 4pm (May-Sep only) and shared use of the tennis court - bring your own tennis rackets and tennis shoes (white soles only).
The property is located within the Blackdown Hills - an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, on the Somerset, Devon and Dorset border. There are some beautiful walks in the area, and a Covid-19 secure country public house less than ¬Ω mile away, as well as an Italian restaurant ¬Ω mile in the other direction.
It is set between the market town of Chard, with its shops and museums, and the larger county town of Taunton with its bustling shopping centre, restaurants, bars and entertainment facilities. There are many tourist attractions to visit, from woodland walks to National Trust estates such as Barrington Court and Montacute House. The Quantocks and Exmoor National Park are within easy driving, and for a trip back in time, travel from Taunton along the West Somerset Steam Railway to Minehead.
Further afield you have the Jurassic Coast beaches of Lyme Regis and West Bay, as well as some of Somerset‚Äôs great places to visit. Guests can drive to Glastonbury Tor for an exhilarating walk to the top with some magnificent views of Somerset, perhaps calling in at The Clarkes Factory Village and Wells Cathedral and Palace, or head into the other direction into Devon and visit the city of Exeter and have lunch on the quays! Beach 15 miles. Shop 5 miles, pub and restaurant 1 mile.
Free WiFi']

Title: Large luxury house & pool in Henley on Thames
Description:
['About this space', 'A new award-winning house set in extensive grounds with a view over an area of outstanding natural beauty and backing on to Henley Golf Course. Set amidst mature gardens, lawns and a large wildflower meadow, the house sleeps 4 adults and 4 children very comfortably. It is not intended for use as a venue for large receptions or parties but is ideal for large families who enjoy luxury living and lots of outdoor fun and games to include a heated (covered) pool, football pitch and much more.', 'The space', 'The space
Designed in contemporary style with a touch of mid-century chic, everywhere you go within Incline Cottage you will experience a feeling of space from the 12 seater circular dining table for fab diner parties to a sitting room with 2 x 4 seater sofas and 3 bedrooms with en suite bathrooms (2 of which have large balconies!) You have 3 rooms to watch Sky/Netflix/Amazon and a large playroom crammed with games for all ages. You even have a large pool house/bar with 2 x outdoor sofas and a firepit, as well as additional dining table and chairs on the decking outside the kitchen.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests have full access to the house and garden.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note

Title: Osprey 2 - The Cove
Description:
['About this space', 'A luxury holiday apartment with uninterrupted sea views. The Cove development just outside of Brixham sits next to Battery Gardens and the South West Coastal Path in an area of outstanding natural beauty. Osprey 2 is on the front row of this development in what is quite probably the best location, with uninterrupted sea views from the lounge, double bedroom, and large decked balcony.

Whether relaxing in the lounge or eating alfresco on the large balcony, be entranced by the amazing views surrounding you - to your right are the green woods of Battery Park (National Trust Woodland) and straight ahead, the majestic blues of Torbay unfold. The large balcony is accessed from the master bedroom and the lounge. The on site heated swimming pool (seasonal opening) is sure to be a hit with the children. A dedicated parking space is included as are wi-fi and quality bed linen & towels.

The apartment is furnished and decorated in slick modern style with high quality furniture and fixtures.

Short breaks of 2 nights or more are available most of the year except the 5 peak summer holiday weeks.

Please note: Due to Coronavirus social distancing measures the pool may be closed during your visit.

Summary of features:

Panoramic sea views from both the lounge and double bedroom
Large decked balcony area with dining table and chairs and spectacular sea views
Direct access to the decked balcony from the lounge and double bedroom
Dedicated on site parking space
Heated outdoor swimming pool (May to September)
Modern kitchen with washer/dryer & dishwasher
Set in an area of outstanding natural beauty
Non Smoking
No pets allowed
Wi-Fi included
Bed linen & towels included

Title: Your Own Private Estate Getaway
Description:
['About this space', "Welcome to the Dower House.

This grade 2 listed gatehouse is the historical entrance to 500 year old Parnham House.

The Dower House is a unique property, set in it‚Äôs own acre of private grounds with a heated pool overlooking Parnham's deer parks. Recently renovated, relax within period furniture and curated curiosities, you will find yourself in a bucolic paradise.

This is the perfect escape to your very own slice of the countryside. Downstairs areas are open to dogs.", 'The space', "The space
The Dower House is a beautifully furnished 3-bedroom home, with a large garden and pool.

The House is fitted with great wifi, sky and Netflix on both TV's and all the modern conveniences you could need. There is plenty of room to eat together in the beautiful dining space or to relax together in front of the large open fire in the dining room.

Bedrooms feature huge sumptuous beds and high quality 700 thread count linen. The bathrooms are similarly induglent with beautiful fixtures and a deep roll top bath.

During your stay, you can pick up fresh eggs from our chickens and enjoy walks to local Beaminster via the public footpaths across the Parnham Estate.", '', '', '', '']

Title: The Pool House
Description:
['About this space', 'The Pool House is a contemporary spacious, private, hideaway, perfect for a romantic getaway or just a stay to explore the surrounding area. Styled with a shabby chic vibe.

THE SPACE IS ONLY SUITABLE FOR TWO ADULTS & TWO CHILDREN AGE 12 AND UNDER

NEW FROM MARCH 22, A LUXURY HOT TUB SPA IS NOW AVAILABLE ALL YEAR ROUND.

PLEASE NOTE THE POOL & POOL AREA IS CLOSED FROM OCTOBER TO THE 29th OF APRIL 22', '', 'The space
Set behind private, electric, gates and within the grounds of a large converted barn, The Pool House is completely self contained, it has a king size bed, with a very comfortable Emma mattress.

A dining table and 4 chairs, a comfortable sofa bed for extra accommodation, for children, a dressing table and mirror, with a hair dryer in the drawer. A dressing mirror with a hanging rail. It has heating and air conditioning.

The wide screen smart television can be used to watch channels with your own login details, via the WiFi. Also you will have use of a blue tooth speaker, and a Pure digital radio.

The space has a door leading to a kitchenette, with a fridge freezer, a James Martin electric table top grill, that will cook bacon, eggs, sausages, chicken breast, salmon, vegetables, etc, a microwave oven, grill.
Toaster, kettle, Nespresso coffee machine, cafeti√®re, slow cooker, crockery, cutlery, water & wine glasses. Complimentary tea, milk & coffee pods, sugar, salt & pepper.
Separate door leading to the WC.

Walk through doorway leading to the stunning shower room with complimentary use of premium, toiletries.

Finally a door leading out to the swimming pool area, which has its own large cushioned seating area. It has a bar area with stools and a table and chairs. Sun loungers and various floats.

THIS DOOR WILL BE LOCKED FROM OCTOBER TO APRIL.

The owner cannot accept any liability for using the pool area. Guests use it entirely at their own risk!

Extras
Breakfast can be arranged by prior arrangement with the host who offers a Continental or a full English breakfast, for an additional cost.
We can also provide delicious sharing boards.
Special occasions can be catered for, by prior arrangement.

Check in anytime after 3pm Check out by 11am Early and late check in available at small extra charge.

Access to the Pool house can be gained by a key safe next to the entrance gates, which will contain a gate fob and keys to the Pool House.

The host lives on site and will be available for any help or advice.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The pool house is completely self contained, set in a private area away from the main house.
It has security lighting around the building, with secure parking adjacent to the property.

Guests will have access to their own outdoor area with a table and chairs, fire pit and barbecue, with far reaching views of the beautiful surrounding countryside. The hosts horses use the paddock next to the Pool House.


From the beginning of May to the end of September guests will have direct access, from the kitchenette to the heated swimming pool.

The pool will have shared access with the hosts, at separate times. The host is very flexible arranging private access. The hosts own garden sides on to the pool area, but the hot tub and bar area does have partial natural screening and is not overlooked from the hosts house. However the pool seating area can be seen from the hosts house as shown in the photos of the pool seating area.

Please note the pool is not suitable for anyone unable to swim, with the exception of babes in arms!

Towels are provided but please bring your own swimming towels?

No glass is allowed in the pool area, but plastic glasses will be provided.

We are animal lovers and have 5 dogs and 3 horses and 2 miniature Shetland ponies on site. They love fuss and attention. Please be aware that horses may walk past from 8.30am when they are taken out riding. Also the dogs can be vocal at times, but they are quiet most of the time.

One well behaved dog is allowed, (possibly two, but please request first, subject to size?) but strictly dogs are not allowed on the furniture, or bed, please! Dogs must also be kept on a lead in the pool area, and the open area outside of The Pool house, because of the horses!

Please be mindful that staying within the vicinity of horses, dogs and farm animals, there are associated noises of being in the countryside!', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please note that the pool and the pool area, will be closed from October to May!']

Title: 3 Bed Relaxing Getaway with Hot Tub!!!
Description:
['About this space', 'Set in Newport, the county town of Isle of Wight: Sedum cottage offers the best of both worlds. It offers the quiet tranquil countryside with fantastic views and easy access to shops and restaurants within walking distance.

Guests at Sedum cottage can enjoy a good selection of local attractions and being centrally located is accessible to popular attractions around the island.

This is the perfect summer destination to enjoy with family !!!', 'The space', 'The space
Sedum cottage is family friendly, newly built cottage beautifully set on one level. Guests can enjoy swimming pool from June to Mid-September. It has also hot tub to be enjoyed all year round!

Three well equipped bedroom & two living spaces.

The cottage has sliding doors from living room and master bedroom with full access to rear garden and enjoy the hot tub for relaxing evenings.

Wi-Fi with TV, login to your own Amazon prime or Netflix account.

Private driveway for two cars.

There is also swimming pool available in the summer months from June-Mid September.

NB. Use of the pool & Hot Tub are entirely at guests own risk.']

Title: Luxury Apartment with pool,indoor heated.
Description:
['About this space', 'Pitfield apartment is in a lovely old village. We are in-between Exeter and Taunton. Easy access from M5. Exeter offers shopping, restaurants, cathedral, and scenic quay area with lots to do. We are very close to The Grand Western canal, which provide some pretty walks or bike rides. Near the Blackdown Hills, the coast is about a 35-minute drive away. Great place to explore beaches too. They are lots of lovely pubs to walk or cycle too. As well as the countryside. Breakfast provided.', 'The space', 'The space
It is in a lovely old village with lots of country pubs nearby. It‚Äôs a very peaceful and safe area. It‚Äôs a lovely, beamed room with double bed and sofa bed suitable for two children to share. Or one adult. We also have a travel cot available. A kitchen with small fridge and combi microwave. A bathroom with shower.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
You will have access to a very sunny courtyard and use of an indoor heated pool (times restricted). We have lessons taking place at various times during the day.
On arrival you can book slots to use the pool. You may book as many as you like, but just not back to back.
Please note the courtyard and pool is shared with one other apartment.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Slippers, bath robes and pool towels are provided for your use during your stay. Please note - there is a two-night booking minimum.']

Title: NEW 'Bluebell Beach'  Luxury Lodge @ Hoburne Park
Description:
['About this space', "'Bluebell Beach' is a luxury 2 Bed 2 Bath lodge in a tranquil and peaceful destination sited on the 5* Hoburne Park, with beautiful beaches and the New Forest on your doorstep but all the fun for the family with the onsite facilities.", 'The space', 'The space
Our 36' x 20' Pathfinder lodge is located in stunning Christchurch on 5* Hoburne Park and designed to make those precious moments for relaxation priceless. A time to unwind is a luxury in itself nowadays, that‚Äôs why from its bedroom suites to living quarters, this two bedroom luxury lodge is the perfect solution. There is parking adjacent to the lodge.

As a self-catering lodge, you'll find everything you need for a perfect stay. The kitchen has a fridge, freezer, gas hob with 4 burners and electric oven, a toaster, kettle, with complimentary tea, coffee, sugar, a dishwasher, washing machine and microwave. The lodge is a perfect place to relax and offers a 50" Smart HDTV in the lounge, a 32" HDTV in the master bedroom, a 19" tv in the twin bedroom.

This lodge has 2 bedrooms and can comfortably sleep 4. In the first bedroom, you will find a king size double bed. The second bedroom contains 2 6 x 3 ft single beds.

There are 2 bathrooms. The first bathroom is ensuite, has a toilet and sink and a walk-in shower. The second bathroom has a toilet and sink and a bath with shower hose.

There are also essentials, a hair dryer, an iron, mini ironing board and clothes dryer to make your stay more comfortable.

All bed linen, bathroom towels, kitchen towels, oven gloves are provided.

* You will need to provide your own beach / swimming towels *

HOUSE RULES:

- Check-in time is 3:00pm and check-out is 10am, unless agreed prior with host
- Smoking is not allowed anywhere inside or outside on the decking area.
- Sorry, pets are not allowed at the property.
- The washing machine /dishwasher are included for your use.


LOCATION:

Bluebell 22 is located in a quiet, spacious area, close to the main facilities of Hoburne Park in Christchurch, Dorset. Just a 10 min walk to Friar‚Äôs Cliff beach it is also only 10 mins drive to The New Forest. Nearby golf courses include, Highcliffe, Brockenhurst Manor, Barton-on-Sea, The New Forest Golf Club and Remedy Oak and are all in easy driving distance.

The lodge is perfect for families and couples alike, due to it‚Äôs location you can choose to get involved with the park‚Äôs activities, or be left to enjoy the peace and quiet.

On-site facilities include: two heated swimming pools (indoor and outdoor - summer months only), gym, mini-golf, bars, outdoor playgrounds for toddlers and older children, a multi games area, boules court, restaurant, cafe, indoor play area, arcade and entertainment venue.

Temporary Membership passes for access to the clubhouse activities, entertainment etc are available. The cost is ¬£50 and this gives up to 6 people, access for up to 7 nights or ¬£25 for 1 day. We require 72 hours notice to process the passes which are collected from reception. Please contact the Hosts for more details.

Access to the beach at Steamer Point and Mudeford Quay are also within walking distance. Sainsbury‚Äôs, Waitrose, Lidl and Aldi are all nearby, and there‚Äôs a local Spar is located just outside of the park boundary for that emergency pint of milk! Nearby attractions include the New Forest, Beaulieu, Swanage, Durdle Door, Bournemouth, Monkey World, as well as some fantastic pubs and restaurants, including The Waterloo Arms, James & White, The Noisy Lobster, The Boathouse and the Kings Arms Hotel, to name just a few!

Highcliffe Castle, the Isle of Wight and the quaint port town of Lymington are all well within reach.

LODGE FACILITIES INCLUDE:

‚Ä¢ Adjacent parking for several cars ‚Ä¢ Large, private decking area ‚Ä¢ Rattan decking furniture with seat/back cushions ‚Ä¢ Linen & towels provided for master and twin room ‚Ä¢ LG 50" HD Smart TV in living area (Netflix, Amazon Prime, YouTube) ‚Ä¢ Sound Bar for tv and your own device connection ‚Ä¢ Electric real effect fire in lounge ‚Ä¢ King size bed in master bedroom, wardrobe and storage ‚Ä¢ En-suite shower room and toilet off master bedroom ‚Ä¢ LG 32" HD TV in master bedroom ‚Ä¢ Hairdryer ‚Ä¢ Twin room with two 6 x 3ft single beds, wardrobe ‚Ä¢ Family bathroom with toilet and bath ‚Ä¢ Washing machine ‚Ä¢ Kettle (tea, coffee and sugar provided) ‚Ä¢ toaster ‚Ä¢ Microwave ‚Ä¢ Dishwasher (rinse aid/dishwasher salt is monitored and refilled on changeover day) ‚Ä¢ gas hob, electric oven and grill ‚Ä¢ Fridge ‚Ä¢ Freezer ‚Ä¢ saucepans and oven trays ‚Ä¢ Kitchen utensils ‚Ä¢ Crockery ‚Ä¢ Cutlery ‚Ä¢ Dining table & 4 chairs ‚Ä¢ Gas central heating

PLEASE NOTE: Although we‚Äôre happy for babies and infants to enjoy the lodge too, we do not supply cots or high chairs. Of course, please feel free to bring your own.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Parking adjacent to lodge
Park facilities very close by

Local bus service outside park or short walk away
Nearest mainline station Hinton Admiral, 1.4m away, with access to Bournemouth, Poole, Southampton etc.']

Title: Silverwood Coach House, with Indoor Swimming Pool
Description:
['About this space', 'Part of the idyllic Bleets Farm Private Estate, Silverwood Coach House offers the perfect countryside stay. Remote enough for quiet walks in acres of adjacent land, but still only a few miles from the award-winning town, Frome. Also Longleat, Bath, Wells & Glastonbury are a short drive from Silverwood Coach House. This makes an ideal hub for an action packed break. If time to unwind is just what you need, you can kick back and relax in the countryside.

Check pool availability prior to booking.', 'The space', "The space
Silverwood Coach House is a brand-new holiday cottage situated on the Bleets Farm Estate. In direct view of the main house, the Coach House is above the quadruple garage with nobody below (so no risk of being disturbed). With ample free parking and a garden seating area amongst fruit trees, you'll be sure to have the perfect stay.

Inside, at one end, you have the open-plan lounge/kitchen area which is spacious and modern with a brand-new fitted kitchen. The master bedroom, with a luxurious double bed and en-suite is at the opposite end of the Coach House. In between there is another bedroom with 2 low, small single beds and a family bathroom; equipped with a sunken bath and shower.

If you would like a disposal BBQ, we keep some onsite at ¬£5.00 each. Please message if you would like one so we can arrange payment.

Free use of our private heated indoor pool, however, please ensure you check the availability prior to booking as it is not always available.", '', 'Guest access
Upon arrival, there is a short private drive with an exclusive free private car park suitable for 4 cars. There is a short gravel walkway to the right of the electric gates, through a small orchard and under an archway onto the main drive where you will arrive right next your accommodation. The painted grey door is your front door.', '', '']

Title: Barton Le Clay, the Gem of the Chilterns
Description: ['About this space', 'This house is a perfect house for families or large group to get together and experience all this beautiful country side has to offer. The pool complete with 6 person sauna is a wonderful attraction along with the out door entertainment kitchen with Italian pizza oven and gas bbq this is the ultimate entertainment property. The village and surrounding chiltern hills is an area of natural beauty with stunning walks and lots of out door activities. Located 15 min from luton airport.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access\nBlack electric gates with own private drive', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note\nAll amenities and the whole property are for the guest unshared use during their stay. That includes pool & sauna and everything else.']

Title: Lapwing 3  - The Cove - sea views & shared swimming pool
Description:
['About this space', "Set on the private Cove resort in beautiful Torbay, Lapwing 3 has everything you need for that family break on the coast. The open plan living area makes a relaxing space to unwind in style, and you can step out onto the terrace when the weather beckons. Perfect for a family barbecue or an al fresco dinner, the terrace means you'll never be more than a step away from that sea breeze.

Back inside, the apartment is home to two welcoming bedrooms. From the master bedroom relax and curl up with a book, whilst the kids dream of their next day's adventures.

Speaking of adventures, The Cove is home to a seasonal outdoor swimming pool, and you'll find two beaches and the South West Coast Path within easy reach of the apartment. And, for those family outings, the fishing resort of Brixham is just a short drive away in one direction, and you'll find Paignton and Torquay in the other. If you fancy a walk, Brixham is approximately 10-minute walk from the apartment.

Summary of features:

Large terrace area with dining table and chairs and spectacular sea views
Direct access to the terrace from the lounge and double bedroom
Dedicated on site parking space
Heated outdoor swimming pool (May to September)
Modern kitchen with washer/dryer & dishwasher
Set in an area of outstanding natural beauty
Short breaks from 3 nights available most of the year
Secure rear storage area for bikes, canoes, paddle boards etc.
Non Smoking
No pets allowed
Wi-Fi included
Bed linen & towels included

Room descriptions:

Living Room/Area
Open plan with the kitchen and dining area
Access to the terrace
One sofa with seating for four
Flatscreen 4K Smart TV with Freeview

Kitchen/Utility
Open plan with the living and dining area
Single electric, fan-assisted oven with integrated grill and electric hob
Fridge with freezer box, dishwasher, washing machine and tumble dryer
Nespresso coffee machine

Dining Room/Area
Open plan with the kitchen and living area
Table and seating for four

Master Bedroom
Double bed, bedside tables with lamps and built in wardrobe
Flatscreen Smart TV with Freeview

Bedroom 2
Twin beds, bedside table, built in wardrobe and under bed storage drawers.
Flatscreen TV with Freeview and DVD player

Family Bathroom
Bath with shower over, wash basin and WC

An infant (under 2) is welcome in addition to the maximum occupancy of 4. A travel cot and high chair are provided.

Property is accessed by one low step at front door
Terrace with rattan style table and chairs
Gas BBQ
Communal outdoor swimming pool, seasonal opening from May until mid September. The pool opening times are from 10am to 7pm."]

Title: The Plovers, Cotswolds (with pool access)
Description:
['About this space', 'Located within the family (and pet) friendly Lower Mill Estate on the River Thames, The Plovers offers guests a spacious 3 bedroom property with a large private garden. Outdoor shared heated pool and sauna access year-round. On site there are lakes with boating access (non-motorised), fishing, tennis courts, playgrounds, trails, bike and boat rental shop including an on-site restaurant and shop. The estate is located in a protected nature reserve with many miles of hikes and trails to explore.', 'The space', 'The space
Ground Floor
- Spacious living room with lots of seating and a wood burning fireplace
- 50 inch smart TV, Blu-ray/DVD player with assortment of films for children and adults
- Large extendable dining table
- Large kitchen with an assortment of cooking tools and spices
- Utility room washing machine and separate dryer

First floor
- Master Bedroom with king bed, large closet, lovely views over lake, full ensuite bathroom with rain shower and bath tub, sofa chair which converts to a single bed (great for children)
- Second Bedroom with king bed and ensuite bathroom with shower
- Third bedroom with 2 single beds, full family bathroom the hall

Large outdoor garden with back and side patio with views of the Thames and Mill lake. Weber charcoal BBQ.', '', '']

Title: Curlew 3 - The Cove. Sea views, patio, swimming pool and parking.
Description:
['About this space', "Settings don‚Äôt come much more idyllic than The Cove, and Curlew 3 is a bright, open plan property with a stylish design throughout. The open plan living space makes the perfect spot to sit back with a book and enjoy the sea views, and if you step out onto the private decked terrace you can breathe in the fresh air straight from the sea below the resort.
Stunning coastal views from a large balcony with dining table & chairs and gas BBQ

Please note: Due to Coronavirus social distancing measures the pool may be closed during your visit.

Sea views and balcony access from both the lounge and master bedroom
1 double master bedroom, 1 twin bedroom
Heated open air Swimming Pool - open end of May to mid-September
Luxury kitchen with clothes washer dryer and dishwasher
Cool, sleek modern design and top quality furnishings
Wi-Fi
Rear games room with table football, air hocky & pool
On site dedicated parking space
Quality bed linen & towels included
No smoking
No pets
Short breaks from 2 nights available most of the year

If the sea air has the whole family feeling ravenous, the open plan dining space makes a bright space for that relaxed family meal and just off the kitchen is a games room with an additional freezer and storage space. When your beds beckon, you‚Äôll find the master bedroom has access to the terrace, so you can step out in the morning and watch the sun rise while you plan your day‚Äôs adventures. The second bedroom has twin beds, so Curlew 3‚Äôs perfect for a family break in South Devon.

The Cove‚Äôs one of those resorts that blends into the landscape so you can truly experience Devon life. The outdoor heated swimming pool (open mid May to mid September) makes a refreshing sight on a summer‚Äôs day, and for the walkers, the South West Coast Path runs right past, taking visitors past some of the region‚Äôs most striking scenery.

A dedicated onsite parking space, close to your apartment, is included as is wi-fi, access to the heated open air swimming pool (summer only), quality bed linen & towels and all utilities.

Short breaks of 2 nights or more are available at most times except summer school holidays.

Living Room/Area
Open plan with the kitchen and dining area
Access to the terrace
Two sofas seating four
Smart TV with Netflix etc., DVD player and Bluetooth speaker
Selection of board games & DVD's

Games Area
Games room off the kitchen with triple games table (air hockey, pool & table football), additional freezer and storage space

Kitchen/Utility
Open plan with the living and dining area
Single electric oven with halogen hob and integrated grill
Microwave, fridge/freezer, dishwasher, washing machine and tumble dryer

Dining Room/Area
Open plan with the kitchen and living area
Table and seating for four

Master Bedroom
Access to the terrace
Double bed, built in wardrobe and chest of drawers
Flatscreen TV with Freeview

Bedroom 2
Twin beds and built in wardrobe
Flatscreen TV with Freeview

Family Bathroom
Features a bath with shower over, wash basin and WC

Large decked terrace area
Table and four chairs
Gas barbeque

Communal outdoor swimming pool, seasonal opening from May till mid September. The pool opening times are from 10am to 7pm

Allocated parking for one car in the on-site car park
Additional visitor parking is available on a first-come-first-served basis"]

Title: Relaxing pool house
Description:
['About this space', 'Whitmoor Farm, Whitmoor Lane, GU47QB, is in the heart of Surrey in Sutton Green between the towns of Woking and Guildford. Beautiful and relaxing two bedroom, two bathroom pool house, with loads of charm. Very cosy living room overlooking the sparkling blue swimming pool. The pool is not heated but great in the summer. The Farm also offers a tennis court and trampoline. Unfortunately we do not allow visitors to guests for security reasons. Only booked guests allowed on site.', 'The space', 'The space
Two bedrooms with King size beds. Two bathrooms, one with a shower and one with a bath. Ideal for two couples or a small family. Located between Guildford and Woking towns.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The Pool and tennis court is shared with 3 other units on the farm, but there‚Äôs loads of space for everyone. The pool is not heated but great in the summer', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We supply a few coffee PODs for the Nespresso machine and dishwasher tablets as a starter pack, but please bring some with you for your stay.']

Title: Homely Rustic Country Retreat within National Park
Description:
['About this space', "Escape to a secluded retreat within the National Trust's Hindhead Commons and Devil's Punch Bowl, only an hour's drive from London. Enjoy local nature in extreme privacy. The house is set in beautiful surroundings with a large garden with swimming pool and a walled garden with outdoor fireplace for magical evenings. The house offers rustic English charm for the perfect country getaway. From the property there is direct access to the national park for walking, hiking plus many cycle tracks.", 'The space', "The space
The house is full of rustic charm. There are many books, curiosities and snug reading corners in the large lounge overlooking the garden. There is a formal and informal dining room with dinnerware and glasses to match and a downstairs WC. There is an office area with a BT Smart Hub 2 with Wi-Fi Disc allowing Wi-Fi connection throughout the property and the formal and informal dining rooms can be used as further office spaces or breakout areas. The fully equipped kitchen comes with two ovens, one conventional and an Aga style oven with hotplate, plus a large fridge/freezer, microwave, dishwasher and walk in larder fully stocked with dishes and gadgets for cooking and baking. Through the kitchen is the utility/boot room with washing machine, dryer, detergents, ironing board and iron plus access to the garden. Upstairs there are 5 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms with one being en-suite to the master bedroom, both bathrooms have power showers, shampoo, conditioner and shower gel. There are three fireplaces in the house, one open fireplace in the lounge, a wood stove in the formal dining room and an outdoor open fireplace in the walled garden. There are also three TV's in the house; the one in the lounge has a Amazon Fire Stick and DVD player, there is also one in the informal dining room with a DVD player and one upstairs in the master bedroom which has a built in DVD player. Outside there is a beautiful garden with wysterias, a large lawn, benches to sit to watch the local nature and an outdoor unheated swimming pool. Private pool is available for use from April to September for an additional fee. *Pool closed for Winter* At the back of the house is the walled garden; a beautiful secluded area with a water feature, gas BBQ and outdoor fireplace. There is private parking with room for 4 vehicles.

The house is the most perfect venue for a special occasion, staycation, work-from-home alternative or as a remote working office for small businesses. The house is not ideal for wild parties as we are in a quiet neighbourhood surrounded by a national park.

Due to the recent pandemic, we would like to reassure you that the house is professionally cleaned, and we are taking extra care to disinfect frequently touched surfaces and provide alcohol gel in the house for our guests.", '', '', '', '']

Title: Cosy Coach House with Private Garden and Pool
Description:
['About this space', 'Luxury newly renovated 2 bedroom coach house set in the grounds of a Georgian Manor House with its own private gardens and duck pond over looking the National Trust Tithe Barn.

The Coach House is within walking distance of the quaint village of Bredon which boasts 2 pubs, a village shop and playground. Bredon is ideally located for Malvern, Cheltenham and the Racecourse, Worcester and the rest of the Cotswolds.

The Owners live in the Manor House so are at hand for any questions.', 'The space', "The space
Decorated in a classic and restful style, this home away from home features carefully sourced artworks and antiques.

The Master Bedroom is situated on the first floor along with the main bathroom which has a large shower and a large free-standing bath and luxury toiletries from Bramley Products are supplied for you to enjoy during your stay. At the top of the spiral staircase there is a charming reading nook with a large comfy armchair and plenty of natural light. The downstairs bedroom can be arranged as a twin or superking with ziplink mattresses.

The cosy sitting room is perfect for relaxing in after a long day out or for lazy weekends. The kitchen is well stocked with seating for 4 people and there is the added bonus of a large utility room with washer/dryer and butler's sink for cleaning up after muddy walks. There is an additional shower room on the ground floor.

One well behaved dog is welcome to join you, we will even provide a dog bed and luxury toiletries for your four legged friend as well!

The mature garden is an ideal sun trap and there are 4 sun loungers provided as well as a BBQ and outdoor seating. You will be able to enjoy use of the large swimming pool (May to September), shared with the owners who rarely use it during the week, and luxury pool towels are provided for your stay."]

Title: Holiday Home in Poole
Description:
['About this space', 'Our holiday home is situated on the lovely Rockley Park in Poole, Dorset. Great for families or anyone looking for a relaxing break away. The caravan is a short, less than 5 minute walk from the amenities, which include a number of restaurants, a pool with waterslides, rock climbing and lots of activities for the kids. The park has its own private beach along with water sports and sun loungers and is great in the summer. Entertainment passes can be purchased at reception when you arrive.', 'The space', 'The space
Our holiday home sleeps 6, with 2 bedrooms and a sofa bed. The kitchen is fully equipped, and outside you will find a parking space (along with additional spaces elsewhere) , outdoor seating, and space for the kids to play.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Rockley Park has lots of activities and entertainment available, all of which can be booked at reception on arrival. Message me when booking for more info and the play pass form which needs to be filled out in order to book activities!
Please note, most of of the facilities are shut in November & December. If you are looking to go for a swim with the kids in these months, the Dolphin Leisure Centre in Poole has a pool and a sauna, or if not I‚Äôd be happy to recommend places a little further away :)']

Title: Cosy and modern with outdoor pool open in summer
Description:
['About this space', 'Gavenny Cottage is a self contained annex that has an enclosed private courtyard and a private outdoor swimming pool that guests can use from 26th April - 30th September 2021. ***THE POOL IS CLOSED OUTSIDE OF THESE DATES FOR AUTUM/WINTER.***

Situated on the edge of Abergavenny town with views of the Blorenge, Gavenny Cottage is the perfect little base for any walking, cycling or foodie break away.

Inside you will find everything you need for a comfortable stay.', 'The space', "The space
The property is modern inside and has an equipped kitchen, wi-fi, smart TV, comfy seating and dining area and a large bedroom upstairs with extra seating.

We have an electric stove heater, washing machine, iron and ironing board.

We have two enclosed outdoor areas: a small private patio with seating and a raised patio with an outdoor swimming pool. The pool is 24 foot long and is 3 foot deep at one end and 6 foot deep at the other. It is open to our guests from 26th April through to 30th September but it is closed during autumn/winter.

'Covid-confident' stay

We want our guests to have a very enjoyable, relaxing stay at Gavenny Cottage. We have all been living through a very stressful time so we want to remove as much worry as possible for your stay. Therefore we have introduced the following important changes to protect you and all of our guests, staff and community and to help minimise the risk of contracting and spreading coronavirus:
- Enhanced cleaning on top of our already meticulous standards
- Extra cleaning supplies and hand sanitizer/soap and available inside the cottage
- Socially distanced check-in and out with no-contact key collection
- Amended check-in and out times (check-in: 3pm and check-out: 10am)
- Keys are disinfected before your arrival and Gavenny Cottage is not entered after its deep clean

We are constantly monitoring and adapting to the most uptodate government advice and our changes and new rules will be constantly revised and are subject to change with government advice and best practices."]

Title: Shepherds Hut with use of Pool, Hot Tub & Sauna
Description:
['About this space', 'Our beautiful Shepherds Hut, located within our gardens is a unique self-catering accommodation with interior and exterior design to a high specification. Set in seven acres of grounds and surrounded by delightful countryside, Manor Barn is a special place to spend your holiday.
Bedroom with a quality double bed.
Open plan living area with a fully equipped kitchen
Bathroom with a shower.
Use of the 12 metre indoor heated Swimming Pool with Jacuzzi and Sauna
Patio and landscaped Gardens.', 'The space', 'The space
Surrounded by the Cotswolds and Malvern Hills, yet conveniently located close to the historic towns of Cheltenham Spa, Tewkesbury, Gloucester and Malvern.
This fully equipped accommodation has an open plan living area consisting of a bedroom with a quality double bed, living, dining and kitchen area. The kitchen has an oven and a hob. The en suite bathroom has a shower. The living area has a Smart TV and WiFi.
You have your own space with views across the garden to the horse paddocks. Outside there is a decked terrace area to sit round at the end of the day and relax whilst making plans for the rest of your stay!
The accommodation features use an onsite heated indoor swimming pool, jacuzzi and sauna, patio, and beautiful grounds. There is a barbecue and a fire pit.
Manor Barn is close to ancient sites including Neolithic barrows, hillforts and Roman remains. You are near to the Cotswold Way, so if you like walking you can follow one of the walks from the National Trail, which can be downloaded from their website. The Malvern Hills are also nearby, which also provide pleasant walks and spectacular views. The River Severn is also a short walk away.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Cosy rural retreat with hot tub and indoor pool
Description:
['About this space', 'Nestled in the stunning Wye Valley, May Hill View barn offers a relaxing and fun break. Whilst at May Hill View barn you can enjoy our indoor heated pool (march to September) and outdoor hot tub. You can also use the garden and paddock for a quiet afternoon or a game of rounders. May Hill View barn is also in easy reach of many great days out including the Wye Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (5 mins) and the Forest of Dean (20 mins).', 'The space', 'The space
May Hill View is a self-contained converted barn, and you will have the entire place you yourself. It has two bedrooms and sleeps four.


May Hill View is adjacent to our main house, Lower Ryelands. The accommodation is private and has its own entrance. Cosy and warm, and with all the usual amenities. The accommodation is all on the same floor and consists of a kitchen area, lounge, bathroom first bedroom and master bedroom.

The kitchen area has an undercounter fridge with small freezer compartment, a two ring electric hob, a kettle, coffee machine, toaster and a microwave that also works as an oven.

The first bedroom has two single beds and a chest of drawers.

The master bedroom has a king-size bed, chest of drawers and bedside tables.

There is also free wi-fi, a TV, various board games and maps of the area. There is one shower in the barn and two in the pool house. Bedding and towels are included.

Access to May Hill View is via an outside stairway (see Checking-in Details). There is space for two cars on the private driveway. Bike storage and cleaning facilities are also available. There are no street lights by the barn (prepare for spectacular skies on clear nights), and so there are motion-activated security lights. You will find a torch in the holiday let, but we recommend bringing your own if you plan to take the short stroll up to the Moody Cow.', '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The pool is solar thermal heated and therefore available from March until September.']

Title: Self Contained Studio The New Forest National Pk
Description:
['About this space', 'Enjoy the studio and secluded patio plus access to our heated pool (*open mid April to end Oct. Pool temp varies on the time of year*) all in lush surroundings in a quiet neighbourhood.

1000 pocket sprung medium firm king-size double bed, wet room with sliding door, wifi, smart TV, silent fridge, microwave tea coffee toaster.

Donkeys, ponies, cows & deer roam freely (pigs close by too) step into the National Park, 71.000 acres of protected land within 140,000 acres of The New Forest.', 'The space', "The space
The studio is new (transformed in 2021) it has a contemporary feel along with the new secluded patio with outdoor furniture.

The 25x12 ft pool is what Airbnb classes as a 'shared space' seeing as we use it too. Guests can use the pool between 9am and 7pm - we‚Äôre often at work. Ask about sole use of the pool if required. Pool towels are provided.", '', "Guest access
Access to the room is down by the side of our house. The key will be in the keysafe by the door, we'll give you the code nearer the check-in date. Parking is on our drive to the right of our garage.", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The en-suite has a macerator toilet which only takes toilet paper NOTHING ELSE! No wipes, latex or food etc. Thanks.

The en-suite has ‚Äúcountryside plumbing‚Äù : a shower and sink pump - so excuse the momentary pump sounds and suction sounds, Thanks again!

WE CLEAN AND SANITIZE:
- sanitize high-touch surfaces, down to the doorknob
- use approved cleaners and disinfectants
- wear protection to help prevent cross-contamination
- refer to cleaning checklists to thoroughly clean the room
- provide extra cleaning supplies, so you can clean as you stay.

Due to carrying out the extra safe cleaning, washing and laundry expenses we have added a small cleaning fee.']

Title: Brummell Barn with indoor pool on Isle of Wight
Description:
['About this space', "Lovely old converted barn on a beautiful working farm with animals and amazing views
Suited to large family occasions and celebrations
Sleeps 12 in 5 bedrooms
Large kitchen/diner
Upstairs sitting-room with picture window
Free use of indoor pool - shared with one other cottage with simple booking system
Childrens' playgound
Snooker room
Games room
Farm butchery
Allows 2 well- behaved dogs
Sorry no stag/hen parties.", '', "The space
We would recommend that the house has a maximum of 11 adults as one bed space is a bunk bed. We offer guests the use of an indoor heated swimming pool which is shared with one other holiday property but with a private booking system. We also provide a games room, snooker room and children's playground. Guests can walk or cycle on our 730 acre downland farm and buy superb dry-aged meat from our own award - winning farm butchery. Two miniature donkeys, pigs, chickens, beef cattle and sheep can be enjoyed. Brummell Barn has far reaching countryside views from the spacious upstairs living-room. The large kitchen diner can seat 12 adults comfortably.", '', '', '', '']

Title: Dog & Family Friendly Cottage, Swimming Pool, Lake, Play area & Games Room.
Description:
['About this space', 'Idyllic country estate with historic manor house and cottages, in 27 acres of gardens, fields, pastures, ponds, lake and woods and indoor heated swimming pool.

Ideally situated to explore the North Devon coast and Exmoor National Park, we welcome dogs and families.', 'The space', "The space
Fantastic contemporary designed converted Georgian barn cottage with views across rolling Devonshire hills. With a child size third bedroom this small but perfectly formed cottage sleeps 5.
27 Acres for you to enjoy, dog walk and picnic in, with Woodland and lakes, a games room with pool table and children's play area, giant trampoline and indoor heated SWIMMING POOL for those who don't enjoy lake wild swimming!
Close to Exmoor and the fantastic coastline with some of Britain's best beaches within 30 minutes.
(Our photos are limited at this time of Carter cottage interiors, please have patience whilst we unload more.)"]
