Title: Newly Renovated Cottage with Far Reaching Views
Description:
['About this space', 'The Orchard is a beautiful, 3 bedroom & 2 bathroom newly renovated cottage in the heart of the South Downs with spectacular views. Ideally situated with a host of stunning walks from the doorstep, yet close to the pretty town of Haslemere. Also conveniently placed for Cowdray Polo, Goodwood events & the Witterings. The property has its own pretty garden, seated terrace area & bbq. A tennis court and heated swimming pool are available for use on request. Long term lettings are also available.', 'The space', "The space
The property has it's own private parking area and is approached by a gravel path winding through a pretty orchard garden leading up to the Cottage. Tucked away with its own front door the Cottage is on the edge of our garden and driveway. The orchard garden has a sunny terraced area fitted with new comfortable garden furniture to be enjoyed with over a morning coffee or evening drink. There is also a Weber BBQ for al fresco meals.

Inside the Cottage is designed upside down so the 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms & utility cupboard (with washing machine/hoover etc), are located on the ground floor. The open plan sitting room, dining area and kitchen, are on the first floor, with windows spanning the entire length so that the far reaching views can be fully enjoyed.

The entire Cottage has been newly renovated and the kitchen has granite surfaces and all the mod cons you could wish for including oven, fridge, freezer, microwave, dishwasher and nespresso maker. The kitchen has a convenient breakfast bar and stools, ideal for working from home, or just reading papers.

The Living Area has been designed in a boutique style with a range of luxurious upholsteries & cushions and is a lovely space to relax and unwind. Board games are included and the Satelitte TV is equipped with Netflix etc. Wifi is available throughout the property.

The 3 bedrooms are all spacious with luxurious bedlinen, towels, chest of drawers, new carpet and fully lined and interlined curtains. Bedroom 2's singles can be joined and the mattress zipped together producing a very comfortable super king size bed. Bedroom 3 has 2 envelope single beds - so additional sleeping is available (for one additional guest on prior request). The bathroom and shower room are also newly fitted. The main property has a tennis court which you are very welcome to use on request.

We are happy to welcome one small pet on request.", '', '']

Title: Stunning Cotswolds Water Park
Description: sleeps 6 with pool
Amenities:
['About this space', 'Enjoy a discount for booking 7 nights or more.

Modelled on the style of local villages, Forge House is set in a secluded, traffic free location within the Water Garden on the exclusive Lower Mill Estate. Built in a traditional Cotswold style, this well furnished and welcoming property comprises of 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms a good sized lounge and dining area with cosy wood burning stove and French doors leading to an enclosed decked area, which is perfect for sitting and for children to play.', 'The space', 'The space
Forge House is a delightful Cotswold stone cottage offering a tranquil haven for nature lovers (5 large lakes within 500 acres of secluded parkland).

Complimentary Wifi is available, which has an ultra fast connection, ideal if you need to make video calls or use your time here to ‚Äòwork from home‚Äô. Use of our Netflix account is also included.

We welcome pets but please note this is limited to two maximum.

A high chair and a good-sized travel cot is available for our smaller guests to use.

There is also a Dolce Gusto coffee machine
So feel free to bring your own pods (a few complimentary will be provided).

You can enjoy cooking some great food on the BBQ and the wood fired pizza oven.

An outdoor heated swimming pool, sauna, tennis court, table tennis, playground and indoor soft play area complement this stunning property and is included in your stay. Please bring extra towels if you wish to use the pool or sauna - towels will be provided for use in the house.

Bikes, kayaks and canoes are available on site for rental and local fishing is also available on the estate.

Please note that we do not have access to the onsite spa.', '', '']

Title: The Burrow - Luxurious Pet Friendly, 3 Bed Lodge
Description:
['About this space', "Set in a peaceful area of the Hoburne Cotswold park is this beautifully equipped mobile home within a few minutes walk to the main park entertainment area and lakes.
We are perfectly positioned for easy reach to explore the Cotswold's and surrounding areas.", 'The space', "The space
The space
This is a luxury home with full kitchen including, Oven/Hob, Fridge, Freezer, Washing Machine and Dishwasher.
TV with DVD player in the lounge and TV's in 2 bedrooms.
Music can be streamed using the built in Bluetooth speakers.
Table and chairs inside for a cosy family meal.
There are 3 bedrooms - one with a King bed and plenty of storage space. The other 2 bedrooms each have 2 single beds. All bedrooms have ample storage space.

Maximum capacity 6 people
There is a family shower room as well as a separate toilet and washbasin room.
Outside there is a table and chairs on the decking.", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We do have other lodges on site so if you are staying in a group please contact us.
You are welcome to bring up to 2 Dogs ‚Äì charged ¬£20 per dog (paid after booking)']

Title: Idyllic country cottage with Heated Pool (May-Sep)
Description:
['About this space', 'In a stunning rural location 4 miles from the Jurassic coast, The Granary is beautifully equipped with outstanding views over the lawns and tennis court to the surrounding countryside. The pool is open from the beginning of May to end of September and is shared with a small number of other guests. Games room, tennis court. One well behaved dog is welcome at ¬£20 per pet (if more please ask first). There are lovely walks all around. Historic Colyton is 2 miles away with pubs, eateries and shops.', 'The space', 'The space
Liz and Gordon provide a warm welcome and the cottage is extensively equipped with welcome pack of basic food, household and toiletry items, so you can cut down on your packing. It has a private garden with furniture and barbeque.
All linen and towels (two each) are provided.
The Bunk bedroom is not suitable for two adults.']

Title: Stylish converted Stables in Dulcote nr Wells
Description:
['About this space', 'The Stables is located in Dulcote village, just a short walk from Wells in Somerset.', 'The space', 'The space
The Stables, to the rear of the main house, is furnished with an eclectic mix of modern and period furniture. A large open plan living space contains an extremely comfortable squishy sofa, a 46‚Äô flat screen TV, I-phone dock (cunningly disguised as a retro radio) and of course, super-fast Wifi. A well equipped kitchen has everything you could possible want to create a feast ‚Äì and after a visit to the delectable farmers‚Äô market in Wells, you may well want to! A stylish zinc-topped dining table completes the picture.
Beds are supremely comfortable with pocket sprung mattresses and crisp, white cotton bedlinen. There is a modern bathroom containing a bath with a shower over and underfloor heating . A second bathroom, boasts a large walk-in shower. Outside there is an enclosed area for your own private use, with decking, seating and a BBQ. The cottage is on one level so is suitable for all, although there is a small step up to the front door. In the summer, guests may share our 12m outdoor heated swimming pool, situated in the walled courtyard, between 11am and 6pm. We open the pool at the start of June/May half term and close it at the end of August: Weather permitting of course! It is quite a deep pool, even at the shallow end, so is not suitable for non-swimmers or young children (sorry, NO TODDLERS or UNDER 5s).
Although we are unable to welcome under-5s, the property is great for those with babes in arms and we have a travel cot and high chair you may use. There is also a pram-friendly path that leads from Dulcote directly into Wells ‚Äì just long enough to get them off to sleep! We can also arrange babysitting if you so require.

DURING JULY & AUGUST WE ONLY TAKE ONE WEEK BOOKINGS STARTING ON A FRIDAY. At other times there is a 3 night minimum stay midweek and 2 nights at weekends.
From September till May (except bank and school holidays) our WEEKEND RATE includes a late check out - whenever you like on Sunday.
GLASTONBURY WEEK - 5 night minimum stay. We also have 2 b&b rooms in the main house sleeping an extra 4 people should you be a party of 8. Please ask for rates.

We are in a great location for exeat visits to the following schools: Millfield Prep (15mins), Millfield (20mins), Downside School (20 mins), Wells Cathedral School (2mins), All Hallows Prep (20mins)
The following local attractions are also nearby: Bath & West Showground, Wookey Hole Caves, Glastonbury Festival Site, Kilver Court Designer Village and the Mulberry Factory Shop. Bath and Bristol are both a 45 minute drive away.
We have tried to think of everything to make your stay as relaxing and comfortable as possible but we or our trusted friends in the village are always on hand should you need anything else.', '', '', '', 'We own a very friendly Labrador Retriever who may come and greet you when you arrive. Please let us know if this may be a problem and we will keep her inside. Note: She is NOT allowed in The Stables or in your private decked area, nor are any other dogs/pets.']

Title: Contemporary Georgian Coach House with Heated Pool
Description:
['About this space', 'Set within the ground of our Georgian Manor house, the Coach House provides a wonderful retreat for those looking to escape to the country whilst being a short drive from the seaside town of Sidmouth and nearby city of Exeter. The Coach House was renovated in 2020 to provide a high standard of accommodation perfect for families, providing a King bed and 2 single beds in the 2nd bedroom (rollaway available) Set behind a private gate, facilities include a sauna and heated swimming pool (seasonal)', 'The space', 'The space
Guests will love the cosy yet modern decor, the tranquil front gardens and use of the heated outdoor pool (from June - September.)

A additional rollaway bed is available for an extra charge.

For families of 6 or more, the Pool House may also be booked in conjunction with the Coach House. https://abnb.me/jnnxlVyrugb', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
We are happy for our guests to relax by and use the pool between 11am and 6pm. We are happy to share the pool with our guests but do not offer exclusive use as our family and friends also use.

Guests are invited to enjoy the front gardens. Rear gardens are not accessible to guests other than for access to the pool.', '', '']

Title: Under the Walnut Tree Shepherds Hut with Hot Tub
Description:
['About this space', 'Under the Walnut Tree is a beautiful shepherd‚Äôs hut in a fabulously romantic setting with far-reaching views down the Painswick Valley. The bright and light, hut sleeps two in an elevated double bed and has a well-equipped kitchenette, a dining table, log burner, and ensuite shower room with a toilet. Guests have their own south-facing garden with a wood-fired hot tub, firepit, armchairs, BBQ, picnic table, and the seasonal use of a spring-fed, heated swimming pool and garden room.', 'The space', 'The space
Inside, every amenity has been thought of and cleverly designed to fit tidily away, providing a stylish and welcoming space for guests to escape to. The sleeping area has a double bed (6‚Äô2‚Äù x 4‚Äô6‚Äù) on a raised platform, with LED candles lining the mantle above the curtains. There is a step to easily access the bed and storage underneath it.

The dining area has a large pull-out table with a bench seat on either side and a view up the main garden and down the Painswick Valley. The kitchen area is equipped with everything guests need to cook simply but well, with a double gas hob, a sink (under a wooden work top) and an electric cooler box. Box. The cool box is situated under the bench opposite the door. The super-efficient cool box is provided with ice blocks that can be changed upon request, which usually last up to three days. On chilly days and evenings, light the little woodburner and enjoy the cosy ambiance. Next to the kitchen area is a compact shower room with a cubicle shower and toilet.

Under the Walnut Tree is set in a private area of the owner‚Äôs delightful garden. Follow a steppingstone path past the swimming pool terrace‚Äôs stone pillars (entwined with roses in the summertime), to your own south-facing garden, with magnificent views down the Painswick Valley. Guests have use of a spring-water, wood-fired hot tub, charcoal BBQ, fire pit, picnic table, and two armchairs. At the front door are two large planters full of fragrant flowers and herbs. Sit back and watch the local wildlife, including ravens, kestrels, deer and the occasional badger. Guests can also use the summer house at the bottom of the pergola, a delightful place in the cool on hot summer days. There is also a mini fridge/freezer in this summer house for guests exclusive use.

Guests may use the owner‚Äôs swimming pool, which is spring fed and heated and in the most idyllic of settings. The pool is adjacent to the shepherd hut‚Äôs garden and sun loungers are provided poolside, making it a fabulous place to relax. The use of the swimming pool is seasonal, with the season running from early summer to mid-autumn but varying from year-to-year - with the start entirely dependent on the date the last walnut tree fronds drops off and warm nights to maintain the day‚Äôs gain in temperature. If use of the pool is essential for your stay, please enquire if it‚Äôs open before booking.

FACILITIES

 Sleeps 2 in a raised, standard double bed (6‚Äô2‚Äù x 4‚Äô6‚Äù)
 1 ensuite shower room with cabinet shower and toilet
 Hot tub: wood fired and spring fed (first night‚Äôs fuel provided) - extra, kiln-dried, Forest Stewardship Council (FSC)-certified wood can be purchased from the owner for ¬£6 per box.
 Parking for 2 cars (private, secure driveway)
 Private, south-facing garden area with far-reaching views
 Spring-fed, heated, outdoor swimming pool with terrace and sun loungers ‚Äì seasonal use only (shared with owners)
 Wood burner ‚Äì logs and kindling supplied
 Solar powered garden lighting
 Gas cooking and electric hot water; indoor power point
 Free Wi-Fi ‚Äì available in garden area only
 Kitchenette with twin gas hob, kettle, utensils, crockery, cutlery, glassware (champagne flutes, tumblers and wine and water glasses) cafetiere, bakeware, food preparation (grater, jug, sieve), saucepans, bread bin, kitchen foil, kitchen paper
 Cool box: large, Esky cooler box with pre-frozen ice blocks provided
 Fridge-freezer (in Garden Room)
 Bed linen, bath towels, bath robes and tea towels
 Kitchen starter consumables: teabags, fresh and instant coffee, sugar, fresh milk, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar
 Complimentary breakfast hamper available (usually contains milk bread butter eggs and bacon but can be changed to suit dietary requirements) ‚Äì please request when booking.
 Cleaning starter pack: brush, cloth, washing up liquid, bin bags
 Shower room essentials: hand soap, toilet paper, shampoo, shower gel
 Fire pit (first logs provided) - extra, kiln-dried Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) certified wood available to purchase from owner (¬£6 per box)
 Garden furniture: picnic table and two armchairs
 BBQ (charcoal) and utensils ‚Äì initial supply of instant lighting charcoal provided
 Garden Room: open-sided, stone-built room near the hut with fridge-freezer and seating (available during the late spring/summer months)
 Games: Board game, cards, Scrabble
 Safety equipment: fire extinguisher, fire blanket, carbon monoxide monitor, smoke alarm, First Aid kit.', 'Guest access', "Guest access
Guests have full access to the shepherd's hut, garden and hot tub, and seasonal access to the outdoor swimming pool and garden room with fridge-freezer. The use of the swimming pool is seasonal, with the season running from early summer to early autumn but varying from year-to-year and with the start entirely dependent on the date the last walnut tree fronds drops off and ambient night-time temperatures. If use of the pool is essential for your stay, please enquire if it‚Äôs open before booking.", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The use of the swimming pool is seasonal, with the season running from early summer to early autumn but varying from year-to-year and with the start entirely dependent on the date the last walnut tree fronds drops off and ambient night-time temperatures. If use of the pool is essential for your stay, please enquire if it‚Äôs open before booking.

The owners have three, friendly dogs who may come out to greet you when you park.

Wood: Guests are provided with sufficient wood for the wood burner for the duration of their stay. (The wood burner‚Äôs logs are specifically for the burner, please do not use them in the firepit). A one-night supply of logs for the firepit is also provided. Extra, kiln-dried, Forest Stewardship Council (FSC)-certified wood for the firepit can be purchased from the owner for ¬£6 per box. The wood is provided in a recyclable cardboard box (rather than the plastic netting used by supermarkets/garden centres).

Hot tub: wood fired and spring fed (first night‚Äôs fuel provided) - extra, kiln-dried, Forest Stewardship Council (FSC)-certified wood can be purchased from the owner for ¬£6 per box. No use of the hot tub after dark or after 10pm, whichever is first, or before 10am.

Please note that additional guests above the maximum capacity are not permitted to stay overnight.']

Title: Romantic Secluded Cottage
Description:
['About this space', 'A stunning cottage standing in its own grounds in the heart of the Wiltshire countryside with access to amazing walks right outside your front door. Wonderful countryside, great local pubs all within easy reach. Enormous comfy bed with ensuite makes this cottage a truly romantic get away. Small private garden with garden chairs where you sit out and enjoy the stunning views.', 'The space', 'The space
You can enjoy the features of this truly splendid cottage, with separate dining room, sitting room with large TV and kitchen which is small but well equipped with quality cooking equipment but please note no dishwasher. The bedroom is large and has 6ft comfy bed with cotton sheets. The ensuite bathroom has a very large bath with a shower above it. You will be provided with bath robes, bath towels, hand towels and flannels. The cottage has a contemporary feel yet retaining the original features.
Sorry no pets', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The entire cottage is yours. There is no over looking and it is completely secluded.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Swimming pool is closed from October till May.']

Title: Hamlet of converted barns with shared indoor pool.
Description:
['About this space', 'COVID-19 UPDATE: Indoor facilities (snooker room and games room) open. Swimming pool open and on a rota system with all properties on the Estate. Sorry - no pets. Stancombe is a small hamlet of several converted stone barns that now consist of about 15 properties set within 20 acres of idyllic Devon valley in the heart of the beautiful South Hams. Snowdrop is positioned on the 1st floor of the Tythe Barn.', 'The space', 'The space
This area is best known for its peaceful rolling countryside, outstanding coastal walks and beautiful beaches. The original stone buildings of the Stancombe Estate have been converted into holiday accommodation. There are eight stone-built properties that make up the converted Tythe Barn as well as several other properties on the Estate. Snowdrop is on the first floor of the Tythe Barn has one double bedroom and one twin bedroom. There is also room for a fold-up bed or cot in the twin room.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
All shared outside areas.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
10% discount for 7 night stays. Sorry no pets.']

Title: Footmans  - Outdoor Recovery Spa Available to Book
Description:
['About this space', 'Originally part of the servants quarters to West House, this part of the North Wing has been made into a comfortable studio flat with kitchen and beautiful en-suite bathroom including roll top bath and walk in shower. There is a further Air BnB flat opposite and another beneath. Access is up a stairs. With an on-site quirky cafe; gym; beauty parlour and animals this is an unusual place to stay with plenty going on and choices of places to visit and things to do.', 'The space', 'The space
West House is set on the edge of Chilton Polden on the Polden Hills between Street and Bridgwater and overlooking the Somerset Levels towards the Mendip Hills. The main house is of Gothic Victorian style with a beautiful old Coach House set behind the house and plenty of other quirky buildings around. We have lots of animals on site here - sheep and lambs; Barry (our Saddleback pig); cats and dogs; chickens; alpacas, two naughty pygmy goats called Murph and Cindy, our two Red Deer called Saffron and OG; two larger goats called Bruno and Clover; horses and currently a donkey called Patch. You may well see some of these during your visit!

We also have a gym on site - The Goat Shed (home of CrossFit Wyvern); we are primarily a weight lifting and conditioning gym but offer open gym sessions and CrossFit classes; PT is also available. Our Outdoor Recovery Spa is linked to our gym and is available to book (at additional cost) (hot tub; sauna and pool for cold water swimming in the winter; heated in the summer; closed Christmas Day and Boxing Day). We do offer an exclusive option or hourly slots (limited availability) with limited numbers. You are very welcome to make use of the facilities - just go to CrossFitwyvern.com to book the gym or westhouse21.com for booking the spa or for more information on the site here.

A chiropractor works part of the week from our gym plus sports therapists (please ask for details).

Have you ever wanted to try Alpaca Trekking? Somerset Alpacas is based here at West House so if you want to learn more about these fascinating animals plus other rare breeds and try your hand at trekking with them go to fb Somerset Alpaca Trekking and send Sue a message!

You will find a pint of milk in your room when you arrive; this is from our Milk From the Moor milk station in the old Donkey Barn just across from Js Bistro; you can also buy some real local farm milk from here to take home or sample one of the many delicious milk shakes. Yummy milk from a local herd of cows grazed on Somerset grass with minimal food miles.

In addition there is a beauty parlour offering a range of treatments "The Parlour" and also Salon V hair salon. Somerset Silver designs and makes silver jewellery on site here which is also on sale.

Visit Js Bistro, our on site cafe (open 10am - 6pm Tues - Weds; 10am - 8pm Thurs - Sat and 10am - 3pm Sun; closed Monday) to have a delicious breakfast cooked for you. Coffees, lunches and other drinks are on offer as well and wonderful freshly made pizza (please book in advance for pizza to ensure your order). Alternatively you may wish to prepare your own food and use the kitchen with oven and hob, microwave, toaster and fridge. The bathroom has a walk in rainfall shower and roll top bath. Access is through a door shared with The Old Dairy and a further Air BnB flat (The Coachman's Flat) up a stairs. There is a private locked door to the Footman's Flat.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Although Chilton Polden is served by a bus route most people do have alternative means of transport. The 75 bus is the one which will take you to places locally and there is a stop in Chilton Polden within easy walking distance at the old post office or Leather and Lace. The road that the house driveway joins is part of the National Cycle Network so we often see cyclists in the village. If you do drive through the village be aware of tractors, cyclists, horses and people walking on the road with dogs - the roads really are used by a multitude of different people! If you want to get away from most traffic then head down Goose Lane just a short distance from the house and out onto the moor where you can walk or cycle for miles and see very little traffic.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We do have a number of animals here - dogs and cats sometimes like to visit our guests; please do just say if any are a nuisance and I will come and remove them; most of the rest of our animals should be behind fences although the odd one escapes ocasionally!']

Title: Bwythyn Cerrig (W41454)
Description:
['About this space', 'Relax in the shared indoor heated swimming pool, hot tub or sauna, or keep fit in the on-site gym during your stay here.. Beams and wooden floors throughout.
Ground Floor:
Living room: With wood burner, satellite TV, DVD player with a selection of DVDs, CD player and patio doors leading to patio.
Kitchen/dining room: With Aga, microwave, fridge, freezer and dishwasher.
Utility room: With washer/dryer.
Wet room: With shower and toilet.
First Floor:
Bedroom 1: With double bed and en-suite with shower cubicle and toilet.
Bedroom 2: With twin beds.
Bedroom 3: With twin beds.
Bathroom: With bath and toilet. . Underfloor central heating. Lawned garden with patio, garden furniture and portable barbecue. Private parking for 4 cars. Please note: Family bookings only.. Both properties: Electricity, bed linen, towels and superfast broadband included. Logs for wood burner included. Travel cot and highchair. Indoor heated swimming pool (shared with other properties on-site, 9.1m x 4.2m, depth 0.9m to 1.8m), with sauna, hot tub and children‚Äôs play area. No smoking. Visit Wales 5 Star. . Shared indoor heated pool / Hot tub / Sauna & gym. Situated within the heart of the Dulais Valley at the edge of the village of Crynant, these barns have been converted to a good standard, with splendid views of March Hywel Mountain and numerous walks directly onto the mountain behind. Bwthyn Cerrig (ref W41454) is semi-detached, whilst The Old Stables (ref W42528) stands detached. Situated on a working farm with the owner‚Äôs friendly dogs, each property has shared use of the on-site facilities including an indoor heated swimming pool, sauna and hot tub. Cefn Coed Coal Museum, Aberdulais Waterfalls and activities such as golfing, driving ranges, archery, paint balling and quad biking, are all available within a three mile radius. The famous Dan Yr Ogof Caves, and Craig y Nos Country Park are just 10 miles. The magnificent Gower Coast is approximately 18 miles and the Brecon Beacons are within 35 miles. Swansea town centre and Cardiff, both with excellent shopping, bars and clubs, are within driving distance. An ideal holiday base. Shop, pub and restaurant 1¬Ω miles.
Bwthyn Cerrig (W41454) can be booked together with The Old Stables (W42528) to accommodate up to 11 guests.']

Title: Nutkins Retreat, Whippingham, East Cowes
Description:
['About this space', 'Tucked away in a secluded spot and surrounded by woodlands and rural areas, Nutkins retreat is a delightfully peaceful place to get away from it all, and enjoy a daily dip in the outdoor heated pool.

Located just on the outskirts of the historical village of Whippingham, and a short stroll from the popular English Heritage site of Osborne House, the accommodation is an ideal spot for exploring.

The accommodation has two bedrooms and overlooks a very scenic natural stream and pond, within the grounds of the property, which back onto a wooded area. The accommodation benefits from the use of a 30ft heated pool open between April and September and shared with an additional smaller lodge within the grounds.

There are two bedrooms, a shower room with pod shower, open plan living room and kitchen/diner. The master bedroom is very spacious and recently refurbished with views over the garden. The 2nd bedroom has a single bed with pull out trundle bed, making it into a twin.

In the living area, there is ample soft and dining seating, TV, Dvd player and wifi. Outside the living area is a large decking, seating area with views over the garden and stream. There are plenty of wild visitors to the garden, including red squirrels to watch for.

Nutkins retreat really is a hidden gem, in an excellent spot for exploring, and there‚Äôs even a great pub within walking distance, on the bank of the river medina a leisurely stroll away.

NB: As the property has a pond and pool, we must restrict bookings with children to 8 years and above.', '', '']

Title: Paignton pet friendly holiday lodge c/w hot tub
Description:
['About this space', 'Luxury 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 berth timber clad, pet friendly, double width holiday lodge c/w private 5/6 seat hot tub, 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms (1 en suite), large vaulted lounge/dining area, fully fitted kitchen, large private outside decking area with outdoor seating and panoramic devon countryside views situated on a five star country park. On park facilities include indoor swimming pool, sauna, gym, tennis court, archery, kids play area, dog walking areas, pet friendly on site pub/restaurant.', 'The space', 'The space
Welcome to our beautiful fully furnished pet friendly timber clad lodge c/w 5/6 seater hot tub on the 5* Devon Hills Holiday Village/Country Park situated between Paignton & the historic market town of Totnes. A perfect place from which to visit the holiday attractions of Torbay, Torquay, Brixham, Dartmouth, Teignmouth, Dawlish & the many blue flag & pet friendly beaches of the area, the cities of Exeter & Plymouth are nearby, lovely little market towns like Totnes, Newton Abott & the dramatic scenery of Dartmoor. Paignton Zoo is less than a five minute drive & is also well worth a visit. The lodge is beautifully furnished with everything you need to make your stay in this lovely part of Devon a pleasure. The lodge features..
large vaulted lounge /dining area,
3 Bedrooms (1 x king size with ensuite), 1 x twin, 1 x double
1 main bathroom,
beautiful landscaped park,
dog friendly lodge & park,
large decking area with outside seating,
private 5/6 seat hot tub, maintained daily
free wifi,
free use of on site indoor swimming pool, sauna, steam room & gym, (gym tuition is chargable if required) plus other on site facilities,
15th century thatched roof coaching inn on site serving food, wines & fine ales, just a 5 minute quiet stroll away. This is also dog friendly inside or out.

The lodge is situated on the newest part of the park with sweeping views into the valley & the rolling hills beyond. It has its own car parking space adjacent to the lodge, and an extended decking area, to while away the hours..
The 5* park itself is very quiet & relaxing with beautifully landscaped grounds & boasts among its attractions a lovely indoor pool with separate kiddies pool, a sauna & steam room. The Gym at Devon Hills is modern & well equipped with personal trainers on hand if required. There is also a beauty salon & hairdressers situated in the main building.
Free passes for use of the pool & gym are included in your stay at the lodge for up to six people (seperate charges may apply for gym tuition etc). Also on the park you can try Tennis, Table Tennis, Archery & there is a small play park for the younger members of your family.
Dogs are welcome on the park & in the lodge (see below) & there is a lovely large dog walking field/area just 100mtrs from the lodge which leads to a small pond & picnic area. A further field is available at the other end of the park.
Also on site is the Blagdon Inn a 15th century coaching house serving good food & fine wines & ales...The Blagdon also has sky tv & a pool table, all this just a five minute quiet walk from your lodge (dogs are welcome there too, inside & out). The Inn now does a takeaway/collection/delivery menu service & also features an onsite shop selling basic essentials & local produce.

Onto the lodge itself.....which is a 3 bedroom 2 bathroom fully fitted lodge finished to a luxurious standard...of course with D/G & central heating if you are visiting out of season...
Complimentary Wi-Fi is also included in your stay & mobile signals are excellent.
Enter into a superb open plan living/kitchen area with vaulted ceilings... the large kitchen is fully fitted including a hob, oven, microwave, dishwasher, fridge, freezer, washing machine & the all important wine cooler, as well as kettle, toaster & all the other small kitchen essential items that you may need to make your stay a pleasure... oh & nearly forgot we supply a small welcome pack for your arrival.
The spacious & bright lounge area has 2 x 3 seater sofas, a modern electric fire, a 42‚Äù flat screen TV with built in freeview ....then onto the dining area which has a large modern dining table & 6 chairs..
Views from both the lounge & the dining area are onto the decking area & beyond to the rolling hills. The outside area itself has a rattan dining patio set for up to 8 people .it also features the 5/6 seater hot tub, outside lighting & a wet storage box..
Through the hallway where you will find hanging space & shoe cupboard are doors leading of to the 3 bedrooms & the main bathroom.
Bedroom 1 (master).. King size divan, large wall mirror, ample wardrobe & drawer space, 32‚Äù samsung wall hung tv & door leading to En Suite with a beautiful tiled quadrant shower, washbasin, w/c,
Bedroom 2....2x single beds, ample wardrobe & drawer space
Bedroom 3....1x double bed, ample wardrobe & drawer space
Main Bathroom... featuring full size bath with shower over, washbasin, w/c, .. welcome toiletries are supplied in each bathroom area....
All bed linen, towels etc are provided & we even leave a few childrens games in the wardrobe
The whole property is tastefully decorated & furnished & is protected by smoke & CO alarms & all necessary testing to appliances is to standard. Gas & electricity is of course included. If you have any further questions about the property or area please just ask.

Please note ..2 small/med dogs allowed only.....strictly no smoking within the lodge or on the decking area.... Due to insurance purposes please only a max of 6 occupants per stay... from 16/07 to 02/09 only 7 or 14 day bookings accepted with checkin/out day being saturdays', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
full use of 3 bedroom luxury lodge including large private decking area with panoramic views & private 5/6 person hot tub', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
please note covid19.. please also be aware that on park facilities as described may be closed or restricted during your stay dependant on the current situation.']

Title: Escape to Country Living at its Finest!
Description:
['About this space', 'Escape to the country and unwind at this charming, elegant cottage in 2 acres of lovely gardens with swimming pool, tennis and badminton, and county walks starting from your door. Located on the edge of the award winning village of Cuddington, walk to the thatched roof pub for drinks and dinner or village store for supplies and news papers. Only 10 minutes drive to the bustling market town of Thame, 35 minutes to Oxford, 40 minutes to London by train and 45 minutes to London Heathrow Airport.', 'The space', 'The space
Tyringham Small, as it is affectionately called, is on the grounds of Tyringham Hall, a 16th century Elizabethan manor house. At nearly 1800 sq. ft. and freshly remodelled, the cottage is bright, clean and open. Furnished with country antiques, modern amenities central heating and log fire with private garage parking.

A comfortable and relaxing retreat with the master bedroom en-suite on the ground floor, along with the fully updated kitchen with new appliances. The dining area leads to the ample living room with wood burning fire and flat screen TV. Two additional bedrooms and a bathroom are upstairs. Every room has an internet connection', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Private entrance to the Tibbys Lane with another private entrance to garden. The expansive 2 acre garden with pool (opened and heated May 1 - Sept 30) Tennis and Badminton is available for your exclusive use.
.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
For special events or weddings, there are 5 additional en-suite bedrooms in the main house with a separate garden entrance to Tyringham Small that can be made available on request. During your stay we offer, Massage,Manicures and Pedicures, Brows and Lashes,waxing, and skin cleansing plus sustainable flower arranging classes, making wreaths, and table decorations, clay shooting, tennis lessons prices on application.']

Title: Natural pool, Luxury hot tub with Glamping & Barn
Description:
['About this space', 'Two luxury glamping tents both with king size beds, set in the quiet Cambridgeshire countryside. Additional bedroom with double bed in the barn. Use of natural swimming pool and luxury scandavian wood fired hot tub. Guests also have access to an inside toilet, hot outdoor shower,small indoor kitchenette area and outdoor Webber BBQ. Check out our socials @StonesGlamping', 'The space', 'The space
Two luxury glamping tents both with king size beds, set in the quiet Cambridgeshire countryside. Additional bedroom in the barn. Use of natural swimming pool and luxury scandavian wood fired hot tub. Guests also have access to an inside toilet, hot outdoor shower, small indoor kitchenette area and outdoor Webber BBQ.

GARDEN / POOL

The mature grounds are a very special feature indeed and enjoy total privacy and seclusion and are bordered on three sides by farmland and enjoy breathtaking and far-reaching views particularly from the end of the garden over surrounding unspoilt countryside. The gardens are principally laid to lawn with a great variety of mature shrubs, bushes and trees around and extend in all to approximately 1.4 acres.

Within the central part of the grounds, there is a wonderful natural swimming pond which provides pure, clean water for bathing and a complete haven for relaxing. There is a large timber deck and adjacent to this there is a delightful thatched changing room/summerhouse. The aim of a natural swimming pool is to avoid chemicals such as chlorine and instead, encouraging an organic environment. A natural swimming pool offers the feeling of swimming in a freshwater mountain lake.

The woodfired hot tub is perfect for relaxing with a glass of bubbly! All logs are provided, light the stove and have a hot bubbly tub within two hours!

BARN

The barn is for private use and is accessible 24 hours a day. Providing guests with a king-sized bedroom. Kitchennette and dining room that includes two ring hob, microwave oven, full sized fridge with small freezer compartment. The room also has a six-person dining table perfect for breakfast. The living room/ sung area includes comfy seating & a TV connected with an xbox, perfect for rainy days.

GREENHOUSE

What to try your hand at gardening? The property includes a large vegetable garden. Help your self to fresh produce or grab a shovel and give gardening a go!

ACCESS

Parking is private land, you will need a car to access the local area. The host will meet you at the property show you around and then leave you to enjoy your holiday.

EXTRAS

Want to make your trip extra special? From putting away your shopping before you arrive to organising private chefs, yoga lessons or days out. No question or activity is to big to ask for! Send us a message for more details.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Parking is private land, you will need a car to access the local area.']

Title: The Country Retreat - fabulous holiday lodge
Description:
['About this space', 'Comfortable and spacious lodge in 5 Star Edgeley Park in the Surrey Hills, an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The Country Retreat offers self-catering accommodation, use of sauna, swimming pool, and gym. Free WiFi.

Ideal for relaxing holidays with the whole family, quick getaways with friends, or the perfect romantic break.

Well behaved pets welcome - extra ¬£35.
No commercial vehicles/vans allowed, if in doubt please ask first.', 'The space', 'The space
This lodge is completely detached and isolated from all others on the park. The only shared spaces here are the pool, gym and reception area, none of which need to be entered during your stay.

The property is deep cleaned after each guest, surfaces sanitised and all fabrics washed - with the exception of carpets, curtains and sofas.

The accommodation sleeps 6 adults in 3 bedrooms: includes a master bedroom with ensuite, twin bedroom, and one bedroom with bunk beds for two, family bathroom, stylish open plan living area and modern kitchen, with separate utility room. The kitchen is equipped with an oven, dishwasher and washing machine, and towels and bed linen are included.

There is a dining area and seating area with a flat-screen Smart TV and DVD player, a sun terrace, complete with furniture for al-fresco dining.

You can play swim, have a sauna and use the gym on site, there are also tennis courts at the park, and the area is popular for golfing and cycling. The swimming pool and gym close at 5pm.

Dorking is 9.1 miles away, while University of Surrey is 5.6 miles from Country Retreat. London Gatwick Airport is 14.3 miles away.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Lilly Pad
Description:
['About this space', 'Our lakeside lodge offers comfortable, modern accommodation with stunning views across the lake, perfect for a memorable get away.
It is perfectly positioned, a stones throw from the waters edge, a perfect place to relax after a busy day.', 'The space', "The space
Situated in the Cotswolds, an area of outstanding natural beauty, our lodge is perfectly placed. We're just a 15 minute drive from Bibury Burton on the Water and all the Cotswold villages.
If you wish to use the Hoburne facilities then please ask about passes
The lodge has a great lakeside view
There are 2 bedrooms:
Master Bedroom has a king size bed with en suite shower/toilet and a walk in Dressing room/Wardrobe
The twin room has 2 single beds with additional storage
The kitchen is fully equipped with, Oven, Fridge/Freezer, Dishwasher and Washing machine as well as other small appliances such as Kettle, Toaster and Microwave.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
You will have access to the whole lodge', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
We do have other lodges on site so if you are staying in a group please contact us.']

Title: Apple Cottage - Barn with Log Burner, Private pool/spa sessions & Alpacas, Nr Beach
Description: ['About this space', "Berehayes has 8 self-catering holiday cottages set around a delightful courtyard in a tranquil rural village just 2 miles from the beaches of the World Heritage Jurassic Coast in West Dorset near Lyme Regis. Some parts of the cottages are over 500 years old and they have been rated 4 star by the AA. The Berehayes Spa includes a heated indoor swimming pool, sauna and jacuzzi (open all year). Its all about the pool!  - You can now have the indoor pool complex all to yourselves (covid-safe). 1 free session is bookable in the pool complex each (full) day. To be fair to other guests bookings can only be made once you arrive on site* Converted from 16th century listed stone barns * Outside table in the courtyard for 'Al fresco' dining * Village pub with good food * Games Room * Free 30 Mbps in-cottage WiFi * Smart TV * Alpaca feeding in large paddock *Designated car park space *2 miles from Britain‚Äôs premier fossil beaches (sand & pebbles) * A peaceful, relaxing, sanctuary in an Area of Outstanding National Beauty just 2.5 hours from the M25. We are adhering to all Government Guidelines for extra cleaning and have been approved by the AA 'Covid Confident' scheme. If there is a Government lockdown that effects your stay full refunds will be given.", '', 'The space', '', 'Guest access', '', 'Other things to note']

Title: Stunning Coastal Apartment with Parking & Pool
Description:
['About this space', 'Situated in a secluded cove this 2 bed apartment in a gated development offers breathtaking panoramic sea views across Torbay from the large balcony.
Avocet 2 at The Cove makes a peaceful, coastal retreat for a family, couples or single travellers keen to enjoy Devon life in style. Avocet 2 is set in a prime location and boasts spectacular sea views from its position on the first level of the building.', 'The space', 'The space
The full width balcony is accessible via sliding doors from both the living room and the master bedroom and provides plenty of space to relax, BBQ and dine and to take in the breathtaking panoramic views across Torbay and on clear days as far as the dramatic coastline of the East Devon Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. 

The communal grounds offer a boules court, barbeque area and an outdoor swimming pool with seasonal opening from June until mid September*. There is direct access to the secluded Fishcombe Cove where you can enjoy freshly prepared food and drinks and even catch a glimpse of the local seals if you are lucky. Follow the South West Coast Path 5 minutes down through the adjacent National Trust woodland and you will find yourself at the very picturesque and sheltered Churston Cove.  

As well as the contemporary decor, the property benefits from stunning coastal views and is close to Battery Gardens and Churston Woods for those who enjoy a nice stroll. For those who like to wander further afield, you‚Äôre only metres from the famous South West Coast Path.

The apartment also includes access to an outdoor heated swimming pool on the grounds of this breathtakingly beautiful development.

Living Room/Dining Area;
-Full width sliding doors with access to the balcony
-Open and bright with fantastic views
-Open plan living room and dining area 
-4 seater dining table
-Two 2-seater sofas and footstool
-32‚Äù Flatscreen TV with Freeview
-Bluetooth wireless speaker.

Master Bedroom;
-Access to the balcony via sliding patio doors
-Double bed and built in wardrobe
-19" flatscreen TV with Freeview.

Bedroom 2;
-Twin single beds and built in wardrobe with hanging space.

Kitchen;
-Open plan kitchen off living and dining area 
-Single electric oven with grill and hobs
-Under counter fridge with freezer drawer, dishwasher, washer/dryer.

Family Bathroom;
-Bath with over head shower.

Outdoors;
-Large balcony spanning whole width of apartment with stunning panoramic sea views
-Private and enclosed with four piece rattan set with table and foot stools
-Gas barbeque
-Communal outdoor heated swimming pool, seasonal opening from June until September
** FOR SUMMER 2021 THE SWIMMING POOL IS ANTICIPATED TO OPEN AFTER 21ST JUNE SUBJECT TO GOVERNMENT CONFIRMATION THAT ALL SOCIAL RESTRICTIONS CAN BE EASED**
-Allocated parking for one car in the secure gated car park on site. 

All Saltwater Escapes properties have acquired the Industry Standard and has followed Government and industry COVID-19 guidelines. All properties have Risk Assessments in place and a process to maintain cleanliness and aid social distancing.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Avocet 2 is a first floor apartment and is accessed either via the boardwalk which runs along the front of the site and then up a set of stairs to access the front door, or along the level paved path which runs from the car park between the first and second rows of apartments. From this path it is only a couple of steps down to the front door of the property. Please note it is not permissible to park directly outside the apartment. Roller cases and soft luggage which can be easier stored are recommended. 

Once inside the property, it is single level and there are no stairs.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
- Early check in: 3pm. Check out: 10am
- *Outdoor pool is open from June - September annually however the dates are at the discretion of the site management. Please contact us with any questions.
** FOR SUMMER 2021 THE SWIMMING POOL IS ANTICIPATED TO OPEN AFTER 21ST JUNE SUBJECT TO GOVERNMENT CONFIRMATION THAT ALL SOCIAL RESTRICTIONS CAN BE EASED**
- No pets permitted on the development.

All Saltwater Escapes properties have acquired the Industry Standard and has followed Government and industry COVID-19 guidelines. All properties have Risk Assessments in place and a process to maintain cleanliness and aid social distancing.']

Title: The Shed
Description:
['About this space', 'The Property:

The Shed is named somewhat tongue in cheek by the owners' family as it is about as far from a shed as you can get. Whether sitting out on the decking with its clear view glass balustrade or in the comfort of the lounge you have stunning views across Avon Beach and the Solent to the Isle of Wight and The Needles; there is always something to watch at any time of year. When you talk about a property one of the most important factors is location. New for 2015, the chalet has it all from its prime sea front position to its proximity to such places as the beautiful New Forest, Bournemouth, Lymington and Christchurch. There is so much to do right on your doorstep or within a very short drive.

The Shed is fully equipped to a high standard with all you need to make your stay one of comfort and luxury. There is a dishwasher "so no arguments over the washing up!", separate fridge and freezer, microwave and extra touches like a built in coffee maker, Bose Sounddock and TVs in both bedrooms. You have private parking adjacent to the chalet so you do not have to haul your luggage and shopping far.

The Shed is based within the boutique Sandhills Holiday Park. With its historic main house and leafy grounds the whole ambiance is one of relaxing in the country but with the sights and sounds of the sea. The park facilities are available to all guests and include an adventure playground, family bar with Sky TV, heated outdoor pool, small gymnasium, pool table, launderette and mini mart store. Additionally there is free WiFi in the lounge and bar areas.
About the Local area:
Christchurch was a renowned smuggling town and 'The Shed' is just a short walk from the historic Mudeford Quay where in 1784 smugglers skirmished with Customs and Excise officers. So kids bring those cutlasses, eye patches and skull and crossbones, oh and a parrot if you have one!

It is still a working quay today with fishing boats venturing out most days so why not say hello to Pete on boat Deja Vu (SU21) and see how his day has been, or wave to him from your decking as he heads back from another successful day out. If you fancy testing your skills out and bringing the catch home yourself pleasure fishing trips are available directly from the quay, or we can help you organise in advance. There are many pleasure trips to be had or if you fancy a thrill then why not hang on to your seats on the Bay Blast rib ride.

The Quay is also famous for its crabbing from the quayside (crabbers quay!) and has a children's play park, fish stall, cafe, The Haven House Inn and a large green area which is perfect for picnics, ball games and kite flying. You can catch the ferry to Hengistbury Head directly from the Quay and visit its fantastic beaches and beach huts.

Christchurch harbour is a great place for watersports from windsurfing to sailing and the Highcliffe sailing club is based on the Quay. There is also an active RNLI lifeboat station which practices launching weekly so you are almost bound to see their rather unusual lifeboat launch and recovery system in action!

If walking or bird watching is your thing then you can do both without even getting in the car. Within an easy stroll you will find a nature reserve on the cliff top adjacent to Highcliffe Castle. If you fancy a little longer out then why not try the circular walk through Stanpit Marshes and on to Christchurch for a spot of lunch. Then take the Tuckton ferry from outside the Captains Club to cross the river, or walk over Tuckton bridge a little further on if the ferry is not running, and head across more picturesque marshes to the back of Hengistbury Head. From there you can skirt the inside shoreline, head up and over the top or use the beach as your route back to the beach huts and ferry home at the tip of the Head. Who knows, the Haven House Inn may tempt you with a thirst quencher before heading back to the luxuries of the chalet.

Down at Avon beach, there is a caf√©/restaurant, the Noisy Lobster, and kiosks serving fish and chips, coffee and ice cream. There is a shop selling anything from local/national papers to clothes and holiday souvenirs and even a bakery on site.

If you head out in the car then the walks available to you are endless with The New Forest on your doorstep and The Purbecks within easy reach. Easily missed and of particular note is the area around Keyhaven and Lymington and, in particular, the sea wall walk past the now disused salt works and the spit and Hurst Castle, which in itself is worth entry but make sure you have a few hours to spare.

Historically sailing and fishing are all part of the local heritage with such famous local sailing clubs as Christchurch and Lymington to hand. More recently wind and kite surfing have become extremely popular along with kayaking and paddle boarding. Don't worry if you have never tried any of these or do not have any equipment as Shore Sports base themselves in the harbour and are more than happy to help out.

About the area in general:

Christchurch - the sign says 'Where Time is Pleasant' and it's right. From the lively Monday market to the great shops and restaurants along the high street it is a great coastal town. It is a short trip in the car or by the Ferry that leaves from Mudeford Quay. Christchurch Priory is the longest parish church in the country and is surrounded by beautiful grounds, riverside walks and Christchurch Quay. The Priory is a must see and is steeped in history. The Priory contains the 'miraculous beam' said to be placed there by a carpenter locals believed was Christ himself.

The New Forest - a National Park situated on the south coast of England. The landscape is a mix of heathland, grassland, bogs and woods. Domestic animals are permitted to roam freely throughout the Forest. Visit Beaulieu Motor Museum, catch a ferry from the pretty town of Lymington to the Isle of Wight or just enjoy the many cycle trails, walks and forest villages.

Bournemouth - the famous seaside resort with miles of beaches, loads of restaurants, bars, clubs and great shopping. Just 9 miles away, it has so much to see and do.

Other Attractions - Alice in Wonderland maze Theme Park, Serendipity Sams, Go Ape at Moors Valley, TowerPark with its Multiplex Bowling and Splashdown Indoor Water Park, Paulton's theme park on the edge of the New Forest, the Bournemouth Oceanarium, Compton Acres, Poole Old Town & Harbour, Sandbanks and Brownsea Island to name but a few.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests have full access to the full property along with access to the Sandhills Holiday Park site facilities']

Title: 17thC  thatched cottage in farming hamlet
Description:
['About this space', "This pretty self-contained 17thC thatched cottage is situated in a farming hamlet near historic Abbotsbury village and World Heritage Coast. The cottage is annexed to the owner's farmhouse and cottage guests are welcome to use our heated swimming pool (June - end August) hot tub and to relax and unwind in our extensive garden. The hamlet is a walker's paradise surrounded by footpaths, including the Dorset Coast Path. The cottage is available to hire on a weekly basis with a Friday changeover", 'The space', 'The space
This pretty thatched 17thC Grade 2 listed cottage has oak beams & inglenook fireplace with log effect electric stove. The garden is in excess of 2 acres with tables, chairs and benches where guests can relax and unwind. There are no other holiday cottages on site and outdoor facilities are only shared with myself and very occasionally when my family may visit.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests are welcome to use our hot tub, swimming pool, BBQ, all outside garden furniture and to relax in our extensive garden.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Both Abbotsbury and Portesham have farm shops and pubs. Abbotsbury also has a general grocery store, post office and various craft shops.']

Title: The Hunting Lodge (NQ4)
Description:
['About this space', 'A unique, tranquil hideaway a mile from pretty Bourton-on-the-Water, with fishing, swimming and tennis by arrangement.. All on the ground floor.
Living/dining room: With TV and DVD player.
Kitchen: With electric cooker, microwave, fridge/freezer and dishwasher.
Bedroom: With twin beds and dressing area.
Bathroom: With bath and toilet.. Oil central heating, electricity, bed linen and towels included. Garden with garden furniture. Outdoor swimming pool (shared with owner, available on request). Tennis court (shared with owner). Private parking for 1 car. Please note: No children under 12 years old. There is a stream that runs at the back of the property.. This enchanting detached holiday cottage is set in the grounds of a Grade II listed mill house, where guests can enjoy trout fishing in the grounds, and use of the owners‚Äô tennis court and outdoor swimming pool (by arrangement), while outside is a pretty, enclosed garden. It lies close to Riverside Lodge (NVG), with the picturesque Cotswold village of Bourton-on-the-Water only a mile away, with its beautiful old houses and many attractions, including the elegant bridges spanning the River Windrush. Also nearby is 18-hole golf at Lynham, Cotswold Farm Park, Burford Wildlife Park, and the attractive spa town of Cheltenham, with its art galleries, pump room and museums, all within 12 miles. Ideally situated for exploring the Cotswolds‚Äô picturesque villages, National Trust houses and old market towns. Stratford 35 miles. Shop and pub 1 mile.']

Title: Bramble Pye - New Converted Barn In The New Forest
Description:
['About this space', 'Rob & Claire welcome you to Bramble Pye; a newly renovated barn on the edge of the New Forest, which is renowned for its wild ponies & scenery.

Located on our family farm within an idyllic courtyard of converted barns, beautifully decorated & furnished to a high standard. Accommodating between 6 to 8 guests + infants.

Situated within the charming Hampshire countryside close to historic Romsey, Salisbury & Winchester, there are plenty of places to visit. 10 MINUTE DRIVE TO PEPPER PIG WORLD.', '', "The space
SHORTER STAYS (2 nights minimum) ACCEPTED DURING THE WINTER MONTHS (from November until March), PLEASE CONTACT US FORE MORE INFO :-)

We are a family run cattle and sheep farm, explore the farm during your stay - guests can get involved in lambing and feed lambs at lambing time (April/May only) - make use of our indoor heated SWIMMING POOL & sauna (use of the pool is shared with the other cottages, but you can book private, hourly swimming sessions in the pool when you arrive.)
We also have a well stocked course fishing lake on the farm (own equipment and license needed).

The ground floor of Bramble Pye comprises of a spacious open plan living area, which includes a bespoke kitchen with washing machine & dishwasher, a large farmhouse dining table that seats 6-8 and a comfortable sofa area.

The first bedroom with a king-size bed is also found on the ground floor and is equipped with an en-suite bathroom with a generous walk in 'rainfall' shower.

The master bedroom is located upstairs and has an impressive king-size bed and a substantial velux window looking out onto the courtyard and farm beyond.

The third bedroom is upstairs and has two single beds (sleeping two) as well as daybed/sofa that sleeps another 1 to 2 guests (please note that if you are a booking of 6 or less guests, then there will be an extra charge for making up the daybed if required). This room also has a large velux window with views across the courtyard and farm.

Outside there is a large patio area (which is shared with the cottage next door) with a rattan table and chairs that seats 6. There is also a communal courtyard, grass gardens and plenty of fields to play in nearby.

There is a communal laundry room (which is shared with the five other barns) which is stocked with DVDs and games as well as leaflets and ideas of things to do and places to see in the area. The laundry room has a washing machine and dryer that is coin operated.

You have exclusive use of the entire barn which includes a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher and washing machine.
Private, hourly swimming sessions in the swimming pool are bookable when you arrive.
The laundry room is shared with the guests in the other barns.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Being on the edge of the New Forest there are lots of walks and places to be explored! The nearest train stations are Romsey, Southampton Central or Salisbury. Bringing a car is recommended to explore the best places.

There is a dedicated parking area adjacent to the courtyard.
Please let us know if you are bringing more than two cars, we only have a finite number of parking spaces per cottage.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
We also have a Shepherd's Pye, a shepherd's hut located on one of our lakes for smaller groups (2 adults plus infant), as well as Cottage Pye another luxury barn conversion (sleeping 6-8 adults plus infants), and also four other cottages available for stays, please see our website 'pyesmead farm' for more info or visit us on insta; pyes_holiday_cottages


Takeaways unfortunately don't deliver to us, but you can have supermarket deliveries. There is a local shop close by, as well as a farm shop selling groceries, locally produced meats, bread and cakes.
If you don't fancy cooking the local shop sells ‚Äòcook‚Äô high quality frozen meals which are designed to be just like homemade food.
If you fancy eating out there is a great selection of pubs and restaurants nearby, the ones we recommend are listed in the welcome pack in the barn."]

Title: One bed Lodge in AONB Dorset with shared pool area
Description:
['About this space', 'Fully refurbished to a high spec, Brook Lodge sits in the grounds of the main house in the village of Iwerne Minster.
One bedroom with king sized bed. Bathroom with free standing bath and separate walk in shower. Open plan living area downstairs with sofa , dining area for 4, new fitted kitchen, separate cloakroom and entrance hall. Small outdoor semi private seating area.Free WiFi .TV. Welcome pack. Outdoor heated pool OPEN MAY/SEPTEMBER ONLY .NB Pool use is shared with property owners', 'The space', 'The space
The Lodge sits to the side of the main house. It is a private space with a small outdoor seating area to the side of the doors , and further seating around the shared pool area.
Pool is open air so it is only open from end May to end September .
Pool is CLOSED from October to mid May
Pool area is a shared space.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Parking is adjacent to the garage/workshop
The house is situated in a small village with a well stocked village shop and pub, both of which are walkable from the Lodge', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Pool is only open in the Summer months
During the remainder of the year it is covered but there is still access to the pool area for additional seating if required, or to catch some Winter sun!']

Title: Spacious house and garden in Itchenor
Description:
['About this space', "Located in Shipton Green, Itchenor, The Willows is surrounded by large gardens with tennis court and heated swimming pool. Close to W. Wittering Beach and Itchenor Harbour, and with easy access to local walks, bike rides and waterside pubs. Near Chichester and Goodwood.

'WOW. The house is absolutely fantastic, we couldn't have asked for a better setting to celebrate Christmas. If you are looking for a spacious, beautiful property then this is a must book house. We will 100% be back'. Dec 2021", 'The space', 'The space
Spacious ground floor with large kitchen/diner, living room and games room with pool table. The garden includes a trampoline, tennis court and bbq facilities. The new outdoor pool will be open from April - October and heated throughout this time. The pool will include a full safety cover and is visible from the house and patio area.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests can use any space within the house and back garden.']

Title: Silverlake, Dorset - Eco House - 2 bedroom
Description:
['About this space', 'Located in Silverlake, a Habitat Escapes development set in 500 acres of parkland & lakes, and situated in the centre of the crescent in Beaumont Village this Bijou cottage offers bright and airy accommodation & enjoys a sunny southerly aspect. With the lounge/kitchen/diner situated on the first floor adjacent to the master bedroom, these rooms have access to the south facing balcony that runs the full width of the property. There is a second bunk room situated on the ground floor.', 'The space', 'The space
Set in a private 500 acres lakeside reserve within a 10 minute drive of the Jurassic Dorset coast, this eco village boasts its own entertainment with its own private luxury spa, tennis court, football pitch, lakes, paths, trails and adventure you will be at home both inside and out of the house. There is now a new poolside bar.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Access all areas on the 500 acres estate. Free entry to swimming pool and sauna. Spa and massages available on request (for extra ¬£).
This property also benefits from full access to the Activity Hub‚Äôs facilities (subject to prior booking and availability) providing you with access to bikes, canoes, kayaks and stand up paddle boards during your stay.
PLEASE NOTE Latest COVID procedures and contact owner for further details.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
This cottage sleeps a family of 4 (2 adults + 2 children max). The master bedroom is located upstairs and has its own en suite. The bunk room downstairs is suitable for children only and access to the toilet / en suite upstairs is via the master bedroom.
Toilet role, bath towels and fresh linen is all provided. Please bring your own towels for the swimming pool, lake, beach etc. Pleas also bring condiments, shower gel, and other toiletries.']

Title: The Pool House
Description:
['About this space', 'A secluded pool house with private pool in its own private garden set in the Chiltern Hills of Hertfordshire, an area of outstanding natural beauty.', 'The space', 'The space
The property sits in an unshared private garden, with its own swimming pool. It is private from the main house which is approximately 50 metres away. There is a gate that leads straight onto footpath for some great walks.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Through a gate from the drive, you will have the private garden and the Pool House all to yourself and your guest.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The Pool House has wooden floors and rugs. In the Winter months it would be advisable to bring slippers/socks.']

Title: Birch Cottage located on a country working farm
Description:
['About this space', 'A peaceful and family run fully working farm, a country paradise for youngsters and adults alike, situated close to all major attractions.
Come and meet all our animals, free roaming chickens, feed our saddleback pigs, say hello to our ponies or pet goat. We also have petting lambs during the Spring.
We offer fully self-contained, comfortable and cosy cottages with access to our outdoor heated swimming pool, skittle alley, games room, play area, onsite bar or bistro.
Have fun down on the farm', 'The space', 'The space
Withy Grove Farm offers 10 fully self-contained, charming, comfortable and cosy cottages with their own individual access set around a courtyard and patio area with our family also living on site. We can accommodate for parties up to 4-5 in each cottage. All cottages have access to our outdoor heated swimming pool, as wells as a skittle alley and well-equipped games room including table tennis, a pool table and table football.
We are a family run business who are committed to providing the best experience for all of our guests. We put our guests at the heart of everything we do and pride ourselves on excellent customer service and will go out of our way to ensure you have an enjoyable and memorable stay with us on the farm!', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The Cottage has its own access via its own door with a key provided. We always try to greet our guests and provide a quick tour of the facilities.']

Title: lower grange park ,chacombe banbury ox17 2el

Title: The Stables - easy access and a swimming pool
Description:
['About this space', "The Stables is the ground floor apartment in the Old Rectory Coach House in the middle of Sampford Brett - a quintessential English village between Exmoor National Park, Quantock Hills & Somerset's coast. It provides bright spacious accommodation, has easy access from the parking area & is fitted to a high standard. Central heating keeps the property snug and warm even in the depths of winter. There are spacious grounds with a swimming pool, trampoline & climbing frame. Free Type 2 EV charging.", 'The space', "The space
The Stables has two bedrooms - one with a double bed and the other with two singles that can be configured as a double. Each has a generous wardrobe with drawers and bedside tables.

The large, bright lounge has a sofa bed, settee, and 2 armchairs. There's a dining table with 6 chairs and a wall mounted smart TV. WiFi Internet access is available throughout the property.

There is a separate kitchen which is fully equipped with ceramic hob, oven, fridge, freezer, dishwasher, microwave oven, toaster etc.

The modern bathroom has a good sized shower, toilet, washbasin, shelving and heated towel rail.

The Stables has a fast broadband connection but mobile phone signal varies between providers. Vodafone and O2 are good, but you have to go up the field to get an EE signal.", '', '', '', '']

Title: Shillings Cottage,  Hemyock, Devon
Description:
['About this space', 'Shillings has exclusive use by arrangement of a large outdoor pool. This has just had a new liner fitted. The surrounding terrace, with a table and reclining chairs is a sun trap. The cottage lies inside gardens, orchards and meadows, with footpaths close by. Upstairs, french windows open onto a balcony with a table and chairs for al fresco dining under a walnut tree. Steps from the balcony lead to lawns with teak loungers and comfy cushions. At night, you can gaze at the stars from your pillow.', 'The space', 'The space
The cottage is in the Blackdown Hills, which lie between the North and South coasts, in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. It is the only rentable property on the premises and is a field away from a quiet Devon lane. The kitchen is fully equipped and the bathroom, although tiny, is enough for a holiday stay and has a power shower. The bed is a continental king size. There is a cafeti√®re and microwave. Wi Fi is available everywhere, even next to the pool!', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Surrounding the cottage there are several areas of garden, a fruit orchard, grazing fields and a big pond where swallows dip and dragonflies fly..
The village lies within half a mile and has a Post Office and general store, a pub and Doctors surgery.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The parking is secure and off the road.
We allow one small dog, depending on age and breed, for which payment can be made on arrival. Please note that your dog must be closely supervised, on a lead, particularly around the pool, as they can cause damage if they fall in. There is a 4 acre stock proof field next the cottage where they can run freely. We have found that dogs left on their own in the cottage can be noisy and destructive. So we ask guests to please take your dog with you. The pubs in the area are happy to have dogs.']

Title: Coach House (DQC)
Description:
['About this space', 'Enjoy the shared, outdoor heated swimming pool at this lovely detached coach house with the Dorset coast nearby.. Ground Floor:
Open plan living space.
Living area: With wood burner, TV, DVD player and CD player.
Dining area.
Kitchen area: With cooker, microwave, fridge/freezer and dishwasher.
Utility room: With washing machine.
Bathroom: With bath, shower cubicle and toilet.
First Floor:
Sloping ceilings throughout.
Bedroom 1: Galleried with double bed and beams.
Bedroom 2: With double bed and leading to...
Bedroom 3: With twin beds.
Separate toilet.. Gas central heating, electricity, bed linen, towels and Wi-Fi included. Travel cot and highchair. Large enclosed garden with patio, garden furniture and barbecue. Outdoor heated swimming pool (shared, 9m x 6m, open 10am‚Äì7pm April-September). Private parking for 2 cars. No smoking. Please note: There is a river in the owner‚Äôs grounds.. Sympathetically converted, this lovely detached coach house stands within its own large garden, with views over the shared swimming pool from its open-plan living room. It enjoys use of the owners‚Äô woodland grounds, with shady walks leading down to a river. Bournemouth and Poole, 7 miles, with boat trips to the nature reserve island of Brownsea. Studland Bay nearby with sandy beach and ferries to the Channel Islands (summer only) and France. Corfe Castle, 6 miles. Wareham quay, ¬º mile. Birdwatching locally. Shops ¬º mile.
Free WiFi']

Title: Kingswood House (W40356)
Description: ['About this space', 'Stunning detached house, ideal for larger groups, heated swimming pool, Jacuzzi, spa and sauna, woodland walks from the door.. Living room. Dining room. Kitchen. Sun/games room. Utility room. 1 double bedroom. Shower room with shower cubicle, toilet and heated towel rail. First floor: 4 bedrooms: 2 double, one with en-suite bathroom with toilet, 2 single. Bathroom with bath, shower cubicle and toilet. Internal steps throughout.. Oil central heating, electricity, bed linen, towels and Wi-Fi included. Travel cot, highchair and stair gate. Doggy extras. Smart TV, DVD and CD players. Microwave, washer/dryer, dishwasher and fridge/freezer. Enclosed lawned garden with patio, garden furniture and barbecue. Heated swimming pool (Open April-October). Private hot tub. Private parking for 1 car. No Smoking. Please note: This property has a security deposit of ¬£200.. Stunning New Forest house with pool and spa bath. The stunning, spacious, detached house is located in a tranquil New Forest setting surrounded by ponies, donkeys, cows and often deer right outside the property. The house, set in a lovely enclosed garden, has been tastefully furnished to a very good standard. The holiday property boasts a covered, heated swimming pool, available from April to October, as well as a spa/Jacuzzi room, sauna and a multi-game table (table football, table tennis, pool, table hockey, chess, drafts and backgammon) in the sun lounge, all for the sole use of visitors. There is also wireless internet connection available. Then wander out into the forest where you can walk for miles, exploring the peaceful woodland where wild ponies, deer and cattle roam. A visit to nearby Beaulieu, home of the National Motor Museum and Palace House is a must, whilst a short drive leads to the picturesque riverside village at Bucklers Hard and beautiful Exbury Gardens. Moors Valley is a wonderful day out with tree top walkways, orienteering and Go Ape. You can spend a day on Bournemouth beach which has been voted as the UKs best beach. If you are looking for a good base to explore the New Forest and surrounding areas, Kingswood House is an excellent place to stay or you can spend your days enjoying the pool, hot tub and relaxing in the garden. Shop 2 miles, pub and restaurant 0.75 miles.\nFree WiFi']
