Title: The Silo House At Laughing Llama Farm
Description:
['About this space', 'Enjoy The Silo House At Laughing Llama farm, secluded and private, conveniently located within minutes to everything Waco, Temple & Belton have to offer. You can also follow along on Insta at @silohouselaughingllamafarm

Please see the detailed info about "The Space" in this listing.

**Extras**
Silo House S‚Äômores, Mimosas, Special Occasion Flower Arrangements & Laughing Llama Farm Experience packages are available.
Message us for details to arrange at least 3 days prior to your arrival.', 'The space', 'The space', 'Guest access', "Guest access
There is a pond on the property with gate access right outside the front door of the Silo House. Stocked with bass and perch for catch and release! Bring your gear and if you don't have any, we will be more than happy to loan you lures and rods if needed.", 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
This is a working farm with llamas, sheep, goats and cows occasionally. No matter what they say, please do not let them out of their designated areas into the fenced yard of the silo house. They'd love to sit on the silo house porch and have a beer with you if they could. :)
Our animals are fed a special diet and the sheep can not eat the llama feed. We will provide you with some llama feed and when you arrive, there will be instructions to how they are trained and fed so that you can feed the llamas if you like. Please do not take any feed past the gate at the Silo House. They are trained to know if you are in the pasture, there is no food involved.
Lil D, the brown goat, loves to hang out with you when you fish. He also loves fishing tackle, so please close all tackle boxes and watch your poles, lures and hooks.
We feed and put the animals up at night (depending on the weather and the season) at the barn and they know the routine about sundown and the routine at sun up.
Every day is a new adventure at Laughing Llama Farm."]

Title: Crystal Peak Lookout üå≤
Description:
['About this space', "The lookout is open year round with a wood fired stove to keep warm at night or heat your morning coffee. A wood fired sauna sits below to relax and rejuvenate your body after a big hike or snowshoeing adventure. What's that other little wooden building? No fire lookout is complete without an outhouse!", 'The space', "The space
Crystal Peak Lookout was built in 1959 and was originally located in Chewelah, WA on top of Stranger Peak. In 1983 it was moved to Northern Idaho to the cedar and tamarack lined slopes of Crystal Peak. Completely remodeled in 2018, Crystal Peak Lookout is now an immersive deep-forest getaway for adventurous couples. Surrounded by 13 wooded acres, you'll find yourself sharing the sunset view with mountain bluebirds in the tree tops, gazing at the starlit skies while an owl calls from its neighboring perch, and if you're lucky, waking up to the occasional passing moose.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
There‚Äôs 13 acres to wander around to your hearts content! Depending on the time of year you'll find huckleberries ripe for the picking, tamarack needles beginning yellow, blue bird boxes full of nestlings, or fresh moose tracks in the snow. You‚Äôll have full access to the lookout, an outhouse & sauna during your stay. Winter is accessed by snowmobile or by a ride in our vintage Snowcat. (see "getting around")', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
You must have a 4WD vehicle to access the lookout. In the winter which can start in late October you‚Äôll need snowmobiles or the equivalent to get to the property.

Now Available: Winter Wonderland Experience! It's a rare & absolutely stunning to stay in a lookout in the snow. Our caretaker David will greet you in town with gourmet hot cocoa (Baileys optional) & a Vintage 1960's Thiokol Snowcat. Snuggle up with your partner in the fully enclosed, heated, track vehicle that maneuvers over the snow. You'll enjoy breath-taking 360 degree views of the snow covered forest on your way to the lookout. We'll transport all your gear and food to the bottom of the driveway and pick you up at the end of your stay. We supply you with a sled and snowshoes to make the trek up the driveway fun and easy!

It's a beautiful addition to staying at the lookout. It's a $100 for the snowcat and we will add that to your booking if you'd like to reserve it. Also your welcome to tip your driver in person if you feel so inclined."]

Title: Semi Open Bamboo Bungalow + Instagram Hammock Net
Description:
['About this space', 'A unique 2 storey bungalow located in the South of Bali. The bungalow is part of a small resort and has a restaurant onside and a massive infinity pool. This will be a unique experience sleeping in this bungalow.

We have 4 of these types of bungalows and you will be placed randomly in one, depending on availability.

Wifi speed 50 mbps.', '', 'The space
The bed has 2 double beds. The bedrooms downstairs are closed and have a fan. There is no door between the upper floor and lower floor and does not stop any noise.

The room upstairs is open as per the pictures.

The rooms are not suitable for young kids.

ATTENTION:
We would like to inform you that construction has started next to Le Bamboo. As there can be construction noise during your stay, we will be flexible with cancellations. If you decide not to stay, we will refund the night that you did not stay at Le Bamboo. Some guests are not bothered by the noise and some days, there is no noise, but we cannot predict what is happening during your stay. We are sorry for this inconvenience.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Artist's Tower on the Sea
Description:
['About this space', "This is the kind of venture that is suitable for great and adventurous travelers. There is no air conditioning (only sea breeze), no television, and not many walls. It is a four-story tower with stunning views from high up spaces, accessed by rowing a boat 10 meters and going up a tiny elevator. It is never completely finished (I've been working on it for years). If you're an adventurous traveler who enjoys art, welcome to my humble home.", 'The space', "The space
I made this tower myself and I often live there while I work on it (but I won't be there while you stay). It is covered in my art and sculpture, as well as some beautiful objects I collected. The sea underneath includes many colorful fish, a little coral, and sometimes small stingrays. If you leave sweet water out, hummingbirds will visit. The bottom floor (above the sea) contains a cooking and showering space. The second floor is accessed only via the elevator and includes a full kitchen. The third floor is accessed via two staircases over the sea, and includes a living and sleeping area and bathroom with my own bathtub design. At the top includes a tiny bedroom, just big enough for one small double bed. It might be the highest point on the island.

I have another listing too, which is on stilts next to the pier to this one. You can see it here under my profile.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The whole tower is the sole home residence only for the guests renting the tower.']

Title: Leafy Greens Chiangmai : Mushroom M2
Description:
['About this space', 'Leafy Greens was built as a retreat center for our family and friends. It is where people would visit to refreshing their souls and mind. We work so hard to make this place to be one of the place that we can live in harmony with nature. That is why the cob houses are the right choice for us. Not only the buildings are eco-friendly but also the garden is organic. Visit here you will be able to take a deep breath and enjoy the fresh air with organic environment. It is a perfect place to getaway!!', 'The space', "The space
This clay house was built for meditation course and It was designed for people to learn being with themselves that is why the function of the house is simple. The house is 35 square meter with essential facilities. It might be considered as a tiny house, yet it‚Äôs comfortable for 2 people living together. It is a single floor house with bunk bed. The entire of the house was made by clay (earth), it is not only eco-friendly building but also good for our health. We believe that our body will absorb good energy from the earth, this means earthy house brings you close to nature and eliminate bad energy out. It is very special house for us, too special actually to keep it only for family and friends so we decided to share our paradise to everyone. Hope you would love it like we do.

DO NOT CLICK ON THE AIRBNB LINK FOR DIRECTIONS
Please only use our provided location to get here, otherwise, you might end up to other places.

PLEASE NOTE THAT OUR PLACE SURROUNDED BY NATURE
Our place is full of flowers and trees, you might see part of nature like birds, crickets, frogs, lizards, butterflies, bugs and insects in our garden, don't worry, they are harmless. However, if you are afraid of these creatures, our place might not suit you. We do not offer refunds if those creatures comes into the house but we will check the house before guests check in to make sure there is no any bugs and we have insect net, please keep it close every time during stay.

Please note that clay house has a thick wall and the clay is blocked the internet reception, so the internet might get slow sometime.

Please note that we are not hotel so we do not have reception to help you 24hr. However, you would do our best to help you out. To check-in, it is very important to read out message thoroughly in order to have a smooth arrive.

We have cat in our property. If you are allergic to cat or do not like them, our place might not a good fit for you.

If more people than the number declared at the time of booking stayed the room, additional fee and penalty will be charged.(Children over 3 years old is also count as 1 person).

No commercial photography shoots allowed", '', '']

Title: Kettle House Galveston - As Seen On TV DIY
Description:
['About this space', 'Welcome to the "Galveston" famous Kettle House. Enjoy this newly renovated 1960's home originally built as a steel storage tank. This home has foam insulation and central AC for ultimate comfort. We have high speed Wi-Fi, 4k Smart TV, and includes all the comforts of home. Large deck great for catching rays and relaxing in the breeze. Seen on HGTV/DIY show "Big Texas Fix"!

8 minute walk to the beach - have to cross FM 3005
12 miles to the historic Strand', 'The space', 'The space
IMPORTANT to Note:

There is an interior metal spiral staircase that is steep, tight, and can be difficult to navigate. There are NO HANDRAILS.

Downstairs bedroom with 2 queen beds requires going downstairs and bathroom is upstairs. These beds are also elevated. We do provide stairs with 3 steps for easy access. There are NO rails on bed! So if your worried about yourself or children falling off these beds won‚Äôt be for you! Got to work with the space we have :-)

Since this is a beach house there are 14 exterior stairs that take you to the main living space.

This is a West End beach house and like all Galveston there are mosquitoes. We supply big spray at the house and also a bug zapper but during certain times of the year they can be bad. If you leave the outside lights on at night they will attract June bugs and other insects.

Also to note this house is on the ‚Äúwest‚Äù end of Galveston by all the beach homes. This house is not in town by restaurants and downtown. It‚Äôs approx a 10 min drive back to Walmart and fast food.', '', '', '', '', '', '']

Title: Guard Tower Suite #1 with Pool
Description:
['About this space', 'Units designed to make the everyday extraordinary.

The ULTIMATE "GLAMPING" experience! Featured on HGTV: The Castle House Estate brings Tiny Home living to another level, located in the heart of Joshua Tree and minutes from the National Park. This unique medieval piece of architecture blends indoor-outdoor living with an emphasis on entertaining. The Castle House Estate is situated on eight picturesque acres, surrounded by many more private undeveloped acres.', '', 'The space
Guard Tower 1

3 LEVELS ¬∑ 1 BED ¬∑ 120 SQF PER FLOOR

The ULTIMATE "Tiny House" experience!

The Castle House Guard Tower is a custom three level living space & loft. Each piece of furniture has been custom made to fit this unique round space which includes a queen sized bed in the loft. Did we mention 1500 thread count sheets and Pure Care Plush memory foam pillows?

The full glass door and windows have been placed strategically to catch the desert light.

For outside adventurers step up to the rooftop hatch to enjoy your views or bring your sleeping bags and sleep under the stars. ***WEATHER PERMITTING***

Each tiny home includes it own outdoor wood burning fire-pit, grill top and two chairs, perfect for enjoying the outside elements of Joshua Tree & where you can enjoy a few cold ones and roast s'mores. Included in each tower is a mini-refrigerator and Nespresso coffee maker. The restroom facility is just 20 steps away and has two private toilets, two hand sinks and urinal. Two outside showers and one outdoor sink. Nothing can be compared to showering outside with 365 degree views of The National Park.

Instagram: @TheCastleHouseEstate', '', '']

Title: Unusual Luxury Accommodation in Champagne 1H Paris
Description:
['About this space', 'Our accommodations are unusual ecological constructions of great comfort in wood and glass nestled in a green setting in the Dawn, at the gates of Champagne. They all have a large equipped terrace where you can relax and enjoy your meals (optional from ‚Ç¨19) and breakfasts (included) in baskets served on request. Guests have free access to the swimming pool area, private deckchairs and bar and snack service', 'The space', 'The space
Accommodation at the Cherry Tree keeps the promise of an off-the-beaten-path stay that will leave you dreaming. A real cocoon, this small structure has all the comforts you need for a pleasant stay as a couple or a romantic getaway. You will particularly appreciate the panoramic roof of the bedroom and bathroom, promise of beautiful starry nights!', 'Guest access', "Guest access
Reserved parking is available upon arrival. Arrive at the entrance to La R√©serve's main residence and we'll accompany you to your accommodation. Once your keys are delivered, you can access the site freely through a dedicated entrance near the Parking lot.", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The Reserve of the Dawn is committed to maintaining its Luxury and Confidential character. You will therefore be only three couples at most on the site. Children are not allowed , parties beyond 6 people are systematically refused . Pets not allowed .
Your panoramic and private bathroom is independent of your listing. It is in close proximity to your bedroom door.
The 29 ¬∞ heated swimming pool is freely accessible from 10: 00 am to 8: 00 pm.
The pool is accessible from April 10th to October 31st and
Heated from May 1, September 30
Check-in times are from 5: 00 p.m. to 7: 00 p.m. and checkouts are from 10: 00 a.m. to 12: 00 p.m.']

Title: Honey's Silo Retreat
Description:
['About this space', 'Please go to the Glacier National park website updated 2021 visitation policy

Honey's Silo is in the very NW corner of my 20 acre property in the country surrounded by Alfalfa & Wheat fields, The property borders Blaine creek- a natural wet land & an abundance of wild life.
"Bring a license Plate to be placed in the rafters & receive a free Montana made goody"', 'The space', "The space
Unique 1950's Grain Silo converted over a year into this very cool vacation rental. Owned by a farmer in St. Ignatius & transported here. It's Quiet location next to Blaine creek, a wild life haven. My Grain Bin lies in the beautiful valley east of Kalispell at the base of the Swan Mountain Range. You will be impressed by the uniqueness of the interior style, and never feel like you are staying in a grain bin. I had a vision of how it would turn out and the vision came true. Breath taking sunrises and sunsets can be seen from this location. Your home away from home is conveniently located between all the major attractions that the area has to offer. Minutes to Bigfork, a small eclectic town at the north end of Flathead Lake and Glacier National Park with its outstanding vistas. The towns of Whitefish and Kalispell, with their many shops and restaurants, are also nearby.", 'Guest access', "Guest access
Well all of it of course. You're in Montana", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
I rent bear spray $5 per can per can-Refund if it saves your life from a bear!
Inflatable Paddle boards x 2 $25 per board per stay.
Bring a license plate sign it & date it & I will place it in the rafters-You will receive a home made local goody!']

Description:
['About this space', 'NO CLEANING FEE
Ticked off your bucket list, but still need more?
1960's: All aboard for the magical mystery tour with the Beatles and their Yellow Submarine, powered by love; because that's what makes the world go round.

Cold War superpower scenario: "Hunt for Red October"puts you in charge of nuclear mutually assured destructionn..will soviet or US flinch first?

Title: IGLU Hut Milzkalne
Description:
['About this space', "Iglu hut Milzkalne is likely to satisfy any urban people needs seeking a little recreation in nature‚Äîwithout foregoing any of life luxuries.

Iglu Hut is unique and fantastic glamping at it's best surrounded by spruce and pine trees and is perfect place to escape from city rush for totally revitalising rest.", 'The space', "The space
It's equipped with all needed for contemporary pepole and will provide with full comfort in the middle of forest.

It has high quaility aspen siding inside and covered with spruce tree wooden chips outside. It has comfortable fixed double bed, 2-3 extra places on couch, soft satin sheets, a shower and flushing toilet and small kitchenette. You have everything you need inside the iglu.

It will be comfortable for 2-4 adults of 2 adults plus maximum of 3 children.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
900 square metres of forest bounded by a fence with comfortable parking place.
IGLU has terrace, large enough for having a meal or rest outside during the hot seazon.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
Children under 12 doesn't count as additional person and there is not applied extra charge of 15 EUR per person.

Hot tub is for additional price of 60 EUR per day."]

Description: ['About this space', 'Beautiful and peaceful double occupancy dome house in the base of the Pachatusan Mountain, ideal for couple or a single person, one double bed, feather duvet, private bathroom with hot shower, complete kitchen, drinking well water, wifi access in the garden, and amazing 360 degrees of gardens and views.', 'The space', 'The space\nThe dome house is located at the base of Apu Pachatusan in a conscious little community called ‚ÄúLa Pacha‚Äù surrounded by magnificent mountains, 7km from Pisac by car. Title: Leafy Greens Chiangmai : Snail Dome (SND)
Description:
['About this space', 'Leafy Greens was built as a retreat centre for our family and friends. It is where people would visit to refreshing their souls and mind. We work so hard to make this place to be one of the place that we can live in harmony with nature. That is why the cob houses are the right choice for us. Not only the buildings are eco-friendly but also the garden is organic. Visit here you will be able to take a deep breath and enjoy the fresh air with organic environment. It is a perfect place to getaway!!', 'The space', "The space
This clay house was built for meditation course and It was designed for people to learn being with themselves that is why the function of the house is simple. The house is 100 square meter with essential facilities. The house is designed to fit for up to 5 people, with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. The entire of the house was made by clay (earth), it is not only eco-friendly building but also good for our health. We believe that our body will absorb good energy from the earth, this means earthy house brings you close to nature and eliminate bad energy out. It is very special house for us, too special actually to keep it only for family and friends so we decided to share our paradise to everyone. Hope you would love it like we do.

DO NOT CLICK ON THE AIRBNB LINK FOR DIRECTIONS
Please only use our provided location to get here, otherwise, you might end up to other places.

PLEASE NOTE THAT OUR PLACE SURROUNDED BY NATURE
Our place is full of flowers and trees, you might see part of nature like birds, crickets, frogs, lizards, butterflies, bugs and insects in our garden, don't worry, they are harmless. However, if you are afraid of these creatures, our place might not suit you. We do not offer refunds if those creatures comes into the house but we will check the house before guests check in to make sure there is no any bugs and we have insect net, please keep it close every time during stay.

Please note that clay house has a thick wall and the clay is blocked the internet reception, so the internet might get slow sometime.

Please note that we are not hotel so we do not have reception to help you 24hr. However, you would do our best to help you out. To check-in, it is very important to read out message thoroughly in order to have a smooth arrive.

We have cat in our property. If you are allergic to cat or do not like them, our place might not a good fit for you.

If more people than the number declared at the time of booking stayed the room, additional fee and penalty will be charged.(Children over 3 years old is also count as 1 person).

No commercial photography shoots allowed", '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Host might not be able to reply guests message or help after 21:00 PM, so that guests must read and study our house manual with care. All information about our house that guests need to know are in there.']

Title: Tree-house Experience on a river
Description:
['About this space', "Treat yourselves to an unforgettable experience! This is not some kid's tree-house, but rather a truly unique and one of a kind in Panama. The tree-house is located next to a river that will sooth you throughout your stay with its majestic sound.", 'The space', 'The space
You can soon tick off the Number One on your bucket list: the absolutely amazing experience of spending a couple of days in your own tree-house in tropical nature!
This large tree-house is situated in a private corner of our nature resort Rio Encantado . Let the soothing sound of the river, and the rushing of the leaves lull you to sleep in the comfortable double bed. The next morning you will be awoken by the beautiful song of the birds around you. From your half-open room in the tree-house you can control a light switch to illuminate the river at night. There is a comfortable bed for you, as well as a wet bar, and bathroom facilities.
Downstairs, a few meters from the tree-house is a rancho, where there is a full bathroom/hot water and a kitchen for your use. But for bathing you may probably prefer to use the natural pool in the river bend that your tree-house bedroom looks down to.
Many of our guests who came to try out the tree-house for a night - for the unique experience - ended up extending their stay, claiming they had never slept so soundly in all their lives! IT IS A TOTALLY NO SMOKING AREA.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Atlantis Villa @ A'Famosa
Description: ['About this space', 'The Leisure Beez resort at A‚ÄòFamosa in Alor Gajah is a resort located near to the Freeport A‚ÄôFamosa Outlet. At the Leisure Beez resort at A‚ÄôFamosa we offer guests free parking on site and other amenities such as air conditioning. The resort is ideal if you‚Äôre looking for a relaxing getaway from the hustle and bustle of daily city life. Title: HIDEOUT BALI - Eco Bamboo Home
Description:
['About this space', 'Your perfect little staycation in Bali is right here. We take relaxation seriously.
Now more than ever, we can be your safe hide-away from the world epidemic. Special discounts running now!

Hideout is a unique eco stay hidden in the mountains of Gunung Agung volcano - far from the city life it acts as the perfect hideaway for all adventurous travellers. We are honoured to be number 4. most wished accommodation at Airbnb in the world. ‚ô°

Follow our social media @hideoutbali for special promo!', 'The space', "The space
This experience is not like any other, Hideout is not some fancy hotel, it is truly an adventurous experience, rustic and authentic right in the middle of Balinese village life. Hideout is a perfect place for long-time travellers, lovers of nature, spiritual-minded people, trekking-lovers, backpackers, artists, musicians, and eco-enthusiast to have their own unique Bali experience. We are most happy with environmentally thinking guests, who treat this little bamboo home with love and care.

If you read further, you can find much important and interesting information, but for those in a hurry, these are some key points to know! :)
1. Breakfast is included in the price, served in the house (Lunch and Dinner can be ordered from Hideout Bistro for an extra charge, vegan options as well.)
2. Scooter for free during your stay!
3. There is an equipped kitchen, unlimited drinking water, fridge filled with cold Bintang.
4. Large cosy bed with mosquito net, wifi, music stereo system in the house, and a hot shower!
5. We can help to arrange your transport, find you the right guides, give you the best Balinese massage in-house or organise a great cooking class at Hideout Bistro.
6. Check-in from 3 pm, please no late-night arrivals. Check-out at 11 am.
7. We are in the middle of the jungle, please expect some wildlife. :)


IMPORTANT INFORMATION
Due to the ongoing pandemic of COVID19:
- All guests will be measured by a professional no-contact thermometer for their body temperature. If their body temperature is repeatedly measured as above 37,5 Celsius, they will not be allowed to check-in as this can be a sign of ongoing illness such as COVID19.
- All guests will sign a declaration of their current health status.
- All guests need to wear a face mask during check-in/check-out or when in contact with our team.
- Houses are cleaned and sanitized after each guest.
- We provide hand sanitisers in the house.


THE SPACE
The building has two floors, on the first floor, you can find a neat, fully equipped kitchen, cosy living/relaxing area (with extra hanging hammock), wardrobe with safety box, bathroom, and entrance to the outdoor shower. On the second floor, there is a spacious bedroom, providing king size bed with a mosquito net. Right in front of the unique triangular window, there are multiple bean bags for reading, cuddling and relaxing, the perfect place for meditation or playing a musical instrument, all with a direct view of the shimmering river.
Bamboo is well-known for its temperature stability, thanks to natural ventilation, there is no need for AC or a fan. It can be very cold up here. :)

In the kitchen, you will always find Balinese coffee, tea, sugar, salt, and some spices. If you don't feel like cooking, don't worry, we have a delicious Hideout Bistro - a kitchen concept! We provide breakfast (included in the price), lunch and dinner, and all can be brought to your house. We do not yet have restaurant seating, but you can enjoy the meals in the privacy of your Hideout.

Scooter for free! During your stay, you will have available one simple, basic and older, scooter with two helmets. If you are a motorbike racer you might be disappointed :). Always new towels and beddings are also provided.

GOOD TO KNOW
What is amazing about stay in Hideout? ‚ô°
Solitude. All Hideouts have their own private garden, and we do the best we can to provide you with full privacy and solitude. The closest family warungs are 5-15min away, easy to reach by scooter or by foot.
We love music. That is why we provide you with a nice stereo system and traditional Balinese music equipment.
Hideout is also a shelter for a Kikky cat, which is super cute and cuddly. You can also meet our friendly Hoki dog. They are the best security for night-time. Don't book Hideouts, if you have an allergy or if you don't want to be close to the animals.

You can experience authentic Balinese lifestyle, cultural habits and observe many wonderful things in nature. Especially in the river, which is sometimes used for cleansing ceremonies and baths. It's a wonderful thing to experience.

You can‚Äôt lock the bamboo house, you can close the garden gate from the inside.

FIRST TIME IN THE JUNGLE?
Hideout is part of local nature, our cleaning standards are at the highest, but that doesn't stop occasional insect, furry caterpillar (that should have a sign - do not touch), frog, snake or mouse from visiting the house. Please consider this before booking and do not book this house if you are not prepared for an occasional encounter. We are immersed in nature. :) Animals are friends, not enemies.

We urge you to always turn your lights on in the night when moving around the house or visiting the bathroom.

Did you know that a spider can make a new web in under 1 hour? With our biggest efforts to keep the houses perfect and insect free, you have to expect that there will be some spiders, some bugs and some mosquitos. That is just nature and we can't do anything more for it. If you don't feel comfortable with that, it is better to book a different type of accommodation than a bamboo house.
The Internet is very poor and sometimes not working at all. We recommend being prepared for the off-the-grid experience.

ABOUT US
We are not a hotel, we don't offer hotel services or 24/7 reception. We are a true Airbnb experience. :) We are here for you daily from 8am - 8pm. If you want a daily clean-up, please let us know when you check-in.
Beware that the nearest ATM is from a local bank, it only accepts Mastercard. International ATM is about 35 minutes by car away - do come prepared!
Check-in is 3pm - 7pm, please avoid check-in later than 8pm since it is very problematic and in some cases not possible! Check-out by 11am.

LOCATION
Please take a careful look at the map, we are over 90 minutes away from the Ubud and 2 hours from the city of Denpasar and the international airport. :)
The closest city is Amlapura, 30min away. There is no night-life here. No bars, clubs, coffee houses or shops with imported products. We are this far from the city by choice. In the middle of rice fields with a calm setting next to the running river.

Hideout is within walking distance from a resort where you can have a lovely dinner in the restaurant with an unforgettable view of Gunung Agung. You can easily reach many traditional small shops/warung. There are so many things to explore around - by foot or by bike. Just to mention.. you can go trekking through the rice fields, explore local waterfall Jagasatru, visit Tirta Gangga, Ujung Temple, go snorkelling or diving, visit the night market, visit shaman or local temples, go to experience Pura Besakih, have a wild day of rafting and many more.", 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
River surrounding the land is very clean. You can take a refreshing dip in a natural swimming pool which the river provides. You can observe here many of amazing animal species, lizards of all sizes, enormous butterflies, all you can count dragonflies and fireflies, chameleons, birds of all colours and not to forget our kitten Kikka and dogs Hoki and Tracy. It's a unique experience to fall asleep looking at the fireflies just behind your window. :)

The view from the house is focused directly on one of the most sacred places around, called Campuhan. Campuhan is Balinese term for a place where two rivers meet. This place is regarded by locals as a holy place for centuries. It's a source of holy water for ceremonies and cleansing the body and spirit. During your stay, you will have the opportunity to observe Balinese during their ceremonies and baths. Campuhan is a very magical place, attracting good vibes and positive energy.

By our experience in the Hideout, you can find an enormously inspiring environment, for your writing, music, an art of for work."]

Title: Veluvana Bali - Owl Bamboo House
Description:
['About this space', 'Veluvana is a unique bamboo house with a wonderful view of Sidemen Valley, a genuine tropical landscape with Mount Agung peak on its back. This getaway spot is a great place to bring into reality the dream adventure of the true wanderer. We invite you to feel the magnificent vibes of the entire house to escape the life that is full of drama into a journey with ultimate joy.', 'The space', 'The space
The bamboo house is located at the main tourist district of Sidemen, a small town with a magnificent landscape in the southern flank of Mount Agung. Sidemen is not a touristy area, it is about a 90-minute drive from Bali Airport and a 45-minute drive from Ubud. Besides the beautiful scenery and the indigenous culture Sidemen also surrounded by a lot of famous tourist destinations in Bali. Some of them include; Lempuyang Temple (The Gateway to Heaven), Besakih (The Mother Temple of Bali), Tirta Gangga Royal Water Palace, Telaga Waja River for Rafting, Amed Diving Spot, and Bias Putih the Virgin Beach.

Upon arrival at Veluvana bamboo house, you will find the upper ground parking area with a small gazebo on the west side of the entrance and a small front office building in the north-east edge. Take your time in the upper ground to enjoy the welcome drink served by our doorman while resting from a long journey through the wavy road of East Bali.

Once you finish your drink, the declining stairs down to the north edge of the upper ground will lead you to the bamboo house. You will not see the building until you reach the lower ground as it is secluded behind the bamboo wall and vegetation. At the lower ground, you will notice a small fish pond to be your silent neighbor during your stay. Spin the leaf door and follow the stone path to head into the ground level of the bamboo house.
All part of the building is fully designed for guest enjoyment. Sit back the bamboo couch to watch the painting-like scenery right from the ground level porch. On the left side of the house is a small pool to chill with your partner. While at the right end are the semi-open toilet and the lush rain-forest shower. There is also a kitchenette at the back of the couch that features a sink, a cooler, a coffee maker, a water heater, and seasonal fruit will also be served subject to availability.

Climb up to the upper level of the house through the bamboo stairs, you will enter the all bamboo bedroom that facing north to the Sidemen Valley with the green hills and Mount Agung on its back. Half of the room wall is windows with transparent glass that allows sunrise to light up your mind and sunset to color up your soul. The room features a comfort double-sized bed, a single reclining sofa bed, and a cozy bedroom chair where you can kick back and relax with a book or hustling on a laptop before rolling into bed.

The upper level of the house also features a balcony on the east side and the dreamy hanging net right in front of your bed. Carefully spin the east door to enjoy sightseeing from the east balcony especially when the sunlight softly appears to charm you up from your restful sleep. If you brave enough to try relaxing on the hanging net while enjoying the magnificent view of Mount Agung, open the north side window and go down slowly to the net. Layback and chill like you were floating on a soft cloud. It is okay to also bring pillows and blanket to the net because anyone can fall asleep by the soft wind of the Sidemen Valley.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
BEFORE YOU BOOK, PLEASE READ A FEW DETAILS FOR YOUR CONSIDERATION:

1. The Construction
The construction and furniture are mostly made of locally-sourced bamboo that covered with rice straw roofs. The building is designed and built by local bamboo artisans with serious consideration to the strength of the entire part of the construction and furniture. The lower level floor is a half meter from the ground with a higher edge on the north porch; please take care of your step while playing on this site. The upper level is 2.5 meters from the ground with stairs that are considered easy to climb; watch your head and hold the railing for your safety.

2. Water, Electricity, and Wi-Fi
The water you use in this house is supplied by the regional water company that distributes fresh water sourced from Mount Agung aquifer. Although the water is fresh, it is not ready to drink water, so please drink only water that is served in the bottle and ask the doormen to refill if it runs out. The electricity installed in the house is connected with the main east Bali grid system to assure you have reliable lighting in the night and optimum power supply to your device. Because we understand you may physically off-grid, but your digital presence can have no break. So, Wi-Fi is free as always.

3. The Location
The small town of Sidemen is less crowded compare to Ubud and any other tourist destination in Bali. This area is slowly growing as the indigenous culture and society remain preserved by its humility. You can explore the village in a short-range by foot, a scooter is also available to rent if you want to go a little bit further to the town center or the neighbor village.

4. Public Facility
The small town of Sidemen has a village hall, traditional market, small grocery, school, and hospital with an emergency care unit. Ride a scooter around 5 ‚Äì 10 minutes from the bamboo house to reach one of these facilities. Bigger public facilities are available in the nearest town of Semarapura that requires a 20-minute drive or Denpasar that is around 60 minutes from Sidemen.

5. The Climate
The climate is divided into two seasons, dry or wet. The dry season comes around May ‚Äì September while the wet season is from October ‚Äì April each year. However, climate change has made the weather a bit unpredictable. Sometimes there is a rainy day within the dry season, and not all day is rainy during the wet season. When you stay during the wet season please consider facing heavy rain with a wind that may blow water into the lower ground porch, the upper balcony, and the hanging net. However, we have installed curtains and roll-up blinds at the lower ground so you can protect yourself from rainwater or bugs in the night.

6. The Bugs
The bamboo house is located within a rice terrace with rich biodiversity. Our commitment to reducing the carbon footprint has led us to design the house with minimum impact on the surrounding living organism. Stay in this bamboo house means that you are willing to share your living space with other creatures. Ants, fly, mosquito, and other insects are commonly found outside of the building especially during fruit season. As long as you keep the space clean and not leave any left food open, they will not come to disturb you. If you notice mosquito entering the bedroom area, we highly recommend you to use the mosquito net on the bed during your sleep. If you have a specific insect allergy or afraid of these insects, we suggest this bamboo house is not good for you. Or you may go at your own risk.

7. Room Services
You have a doormen stand-by at 7.00 am ‚Äì 9.00 pm at the upper ground, you can ask him almost anything you need to make your stay enjoyable. He will help you with breakfast, food for lunch and dinner, find a masseur, room cleaning, laundry, transportation, area information, and tourist activities. You can also contact us online through Airbnb platform in case the onsite services do not meet your needs.

8. Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner
Breakfast for two is included in your booking. You can ask the doormen to serve the breakfast in the spot you want. Whether it is floating on the pool, on the couch or you feel too heavy to wake up from your bed, the breakfast will be served at your convenience. We plan to have a small restaurant in the upper ground so that you can order food for your lunch as well as dinner. For now, you can walk around as there are several restaurants available near the house. Or you can ask the doormen to buy one.

9. Air Conditioning
We do not install air conditioning in the house as it is against our spirit to maintain natural air remain fresh and healthy. Matter-fact we think we do not need that urban stuff around Sidemen Village, especially when you let the soft natural wind flows into your space.

10. Use of Hanging Net
The hanging net is made of strong string with iron steel pillars to sustain the weight of the user. Using the hanging net means you understand the risk that you may fell off to the side of the net if you are not careful. Only use the hanging net if you are confident that you have a good balance and always have your partner watching you in case you need help to get back to the room. Do not use the hanging net after hitting even a shoot of alcohol. Do not jump down from the hanging net and do not hang on it as it is your pull up bar.

11. The Neighborhood
As the bamboo house is located in the main tourist district of Sidemen, several accommodations and restaurants are situated near your space. You will see some buildings on the west side of the house. Right at the back of the house is also accommodation with several rooms. The neighbor is warm and friendly, especially the owner of the surrounding properties. However, to make sure you have great privacy during your stay, we have created a high bamboo fence at the back of the house and plant dense vegetation on each border with the neighbor property.

12. Irresponsible Behavior
Irresponsible behavior and threatening and abusive conduct towards the host, doormen, neighbors of the house, and the villager will not be tolerated. The host will refuse to allow check-in to the house if there is any case and or information that assume the guest (s) have related to any irresponsible behavior, threatening, and abusive conduct toward the mentioned person above. The host also has a full authority to end guest stay in the house if there is any case and or information that assume the guest (s) have related to any irresponsible behavior, threatening, and abusive conduct toward the mentioned person above. No refund will be given regarding the cancelation/canceled stay due to irresponsible behavior, threatening, and abusive conduct toward the mentioned person above.
The host will not have a further responsibility to the guest once the booking is canceled and or the stay is ended.']

Title: Bamboo eco cottage in rice fields
Description:
['About this space', 'This bamboo cottage is a secluded eco retreat down a quiet foot path nestled in the rice fields and only a five minute walk to central Ubud. Open air basket weave bedroom with mini loft, modern elegant bathroom and outdoor living area make this a truly unique Bali experience.', 'The space', 'The space
This is a woven house made almost entirely of bamboo. It is open air and as close to living in nature as you get. Our main lodge is down a private foot path only accessible to cottage guests. if you choose to join us for dinner, a swim or for socializing with other guests you are welcome to enjoy this common space with a saltwater pool and a swing. :)', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
We have a complete menu and full service to the cottage is just a phone call away with the complimentary cell phone we provide . We offer a complete menu of asian fusion snacks as well as a traditional balinese village style dinner served with candlelight and all accessories for a formal dining experience under the stars. dinner is prepared fresh from wild harvested or organic ingredients. Breakfast is not included in your stay but we do provide upon request at an extra fees and can be delivered when you awake on the patio overlooking a lush greenery as far as the eye can see.
he property is surrounded by rice fields with many opportunities for hiking.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
This is a unique place and is not for everyone. It is eco tropical living at its best but with that comes nature in all its glory. Things to note: There is no air-conditioning although because of the location there is a constant cool breeze and you may even enjoy the quilt we provide at night. This cottage is a woven basket with a living bamboo and traditional grass roof leaving it totally open and in nature. Some people have asked about security. It is very secluded and very safe. there is a cabinet you can lock up valuables in if you like. We have staff available to assist you and ensure you have what you need at all times. You will be very well cared for.

Sleeping in nature is something most of us don't do as we sleep in sealed rooms. It can be transformative to sleep in a natural setting, open to the cool night air, listening to the crickets and chirping geckos, the sounds of the nearby rushing stream with the fireflies glittering in the night. Don't let the unusual openness of the space deter you, this is an experience you won't soon forget.Bali 101:
Welcome to Bali, no this is not like where you are coming from. To hopefully enhance your experience we want to provide you with a bit of cultural context. People often feel disappointed when they try to make Bali what they are familiar with. We hope by describing a few scenarios that this helps as Bali has things about it that may be very different than you are used to.
1. ‚ÄúThere is a lizard staring at me from the ceiling who pooped on the floor and there are ants crawling along the wall in the bathroom‚Äù The outdoors will come inside. Crickets, spiders, and certainly a resident gecko and wasps will all join you in your living space. No matter how fancy the villa there is no keeping them out. Given that all of our bathrooms are open air this is something to embrace as part of the experience and not be afraid as they are all harmless.
2. ‚ÄúI can hear roosters and dogs and the temple and even the occasional pig being sacrificed at midnight, oh and the crickets are too loud to sleep.‚Äù Yes indeed, all true. When I think of Bali I think of roosters, they are very proud of their fighting cocks and spend a great deal of time with them, often keeping them quite close to living spaces so your neighbor may very well have one. our neighbor certainly has both and his dog barks a lot and has attempted to scare away many a guest but don't be afraid he is harmless. The temple is a charming sound that echo thru the night and adds the to atmosphere but it can be less charming when they begin to sacrifice pigs at midnight. Peaceful Bali? Well its all a matter of perspective bali is here to be itself not just to be a peaceful place for you to relax, enjoy these new and unique sounds as part of the atmosphere and don't expect it to be an instagram photo, it is a real living place.
3. ‚ÄúAn old lady with a machete and no shirt on just wandered into my living room‚Äù Balinese have a very different relationship to personal privacy than we do. It is not uncommon for neighbors or rice-field farms to wander into your space and personal property. because they are curious about you or simply because they want to borrow your sugar. They may not even ask as they would imagine you would do exactly the same. This can be very startling at first and takes some getting used to. You are welcome to ask them to leave but do keep in mind they are more than likely not there to harm you just used to sharing personal space.

4. ‚ÄúThere are naked people in the stream by the house‚Äù it wasn‚Äôt very many years ago that all Balinese women were topless as their normal daily attire. Now only the traditional old women still maintain this style of dress but it is still very common to see people publicly bathing in ricefield streams naked. You may even see this from your front porch. Don‚Äôt be alarmed this normal here and they will not even feel embarrassed if you wave 
5. ‚ÄúThe guy tried to over charge me‚Äù there is a very different relationship to money here. Think of it as a tug of war with a rope in the middle, it‚Äôs not that they are trying to steal from you or cheat you or have anything against you at all they are just pulling on the rope to get as much money as they can, if you don‚Äôt tug back then they won. Don‚Äôt get angry or feel the need to have hurt feelings just negotiate calmly to lower the price to something fairer. Negotiate everything in every situation, you will use these skills later when you need to ask for a raise with your boss. ;)
6. ‚Äúeverything is damp‚Äù yes this is the tropics and especially during the rainy season everything can feel a bit damp and can mildew quickly even within a day. If your clothes need fresh laundering after being in a suitcase or if the sheets need to be changed for this reason just let us know and we will assist you.
We hope these scenarios help you to be prepared if you face them and feel free to let us know should you need additional help navigating in this new environment. Also please be aware that this is a house with two cats who live there, we very much want to host people who are cat friendly as the cats are very much running the resort and we want you to be able to include them in your stay."]

Title: "Air Castle" by Highpoint Treehouses
Description:
['About this space', 'Most unique treehouse destination you will find. For ages 12+. 1600 SF living space, 2 bedroom / 1 bath treehouse uses 4 shipping containers. The interior has a modern farmhouse style. After waking up with an incredible view, move outside to 1 of 5 balconies, including the 3rd floor screened porch with hot tub or to the 6th floor crows-nest 50‚Äô in the air. Are looking for a couples get-away, adult trip, or a romantic celebration...the unique ‚Äúnature‚Äù will make for a memorable experience.', 'The space', 'The space
You will be immersed and be one with nature and the environment. Local animals that you may see include: deer, wild hogs, raccoons, armadillos, opossums, rabbits, bobcats, squirrels, owls, red-tailed hawk and many other varieties of birds. There are a number of trails to take by foot or bike.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The treehouse has all the amenities of home and many that only exist in your dreams. You can be comfortable in all seasons with a 20‚Äô wall of windows where you can watch birds and squirrels feed 20‚Äô off the ground from the comfort of power recliners. Each of the 5 balconies provide unique perspectives of nature and shade. Relax with a morning coffee on balcony adjacent to kitchen or take steps to the shaded crows nest to swing in a hammock 40‚Äô off the ground fully surrounded by extra tall railings. In the evening, start a fire in the covered fire pit and let nature and the crackle of the fire relax you.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
This treehouse is meant for ages 12+ and older ONLY.

** All registered guests must review, sign, and return a Waiver / Term of Conditions before checkin. **

PLEASE, No Pets! For safety reasons pets are not allowed; an exception is made for any registered service animal. We do this to protect you and your pet from any injury.

Closures: We retain the right to close or limit your access to the treehouse during your stay if we deem it unsafe due to heavy storms or other considerations. These facilities and activities can be inherently risky due to the unique nature of the experience, so safety must stay top priority for you during your stay.

Safety: Each unit has multiple smoke detectors and carbon monoxide sensors. Please do not tamper with these units. Also, keep in mind that, when staying in a treehouse, you're between 10‚Äô and 50‚Äô above the ground and should act in a responsible manner. Accommodations have been constructed in as safe as possible manner, but we need your help keeping you and your loved ones safe during the stay. Fire extinguishers are scattered around the treehouse, including one in each bedroom for your use in an emergency. Designated operational windows in each room are available for quick escape using a ladder in case of fire. Do not use these items unless there is an emergency. If there is an emergency, dial 9-1-1. EACH VISITOR AND GUEST SHALL CONDUCT THEMSELVES IN A RESPONSIBLE MANNER SO AS NOT TO ENDANGER THE LIVES OF OTHER GUESTS OR VISITORS, CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE PROPERTY, THEMSELVES OR OTHERS, OR CONSUME ALCOHOL TO EXCESS OR USE ILLEGAL DRUGS.

Disclaimer: We cannot control nor are we responsible for any acts of nature. This includes but is not limited to; weather, insects, rodents or the presence of wildlife (bugs, deer, squirrels, raccoons, bats, skunks, wild hogs, armadillos, snakes, etc.).

Liability / Risk Management: Inherently we do as much as possible to make our treehouses and the outside activities as safe as possible. All activities involve a certain inherent risk or injury up to and including death. It is expressly understood and agreed that neither the owner nor HPT Air Castle, LLC shall be liable for any damages or injury to guest, guest‚Äôs guest, or their families or to any of their property from whatever cause arising from the occupancy or use of the premises by guest and his/her family and guests. If an unregistered guest damages property, is injured or causes liability then the person making the reservation is personally liable and responsible for the acts of the unregistered guest.

Property Do‚Äôs / Don‚Äôts:

¬∑ No house parties

¬∑ All visitors must be registered and have a signed Assumption of Risk and Release from Liability Agreement on file prior to the commencement of their stay; a visitor may be replaced or added with at least seven (7) day notice to HPT Air Castles, LLC and having the new or replacement visitor sign and return to HPT Air Castles, LLC the Assumption of Risk and Release from Liability Agreement

¬∑ Exceeding maximum occupancy of any unit results in a $100 /person/per day charge

¬∑ There is a $20.00 service fee + postage for any items left behind that we mail to you

¬∑ No pets allowed. If non-compliant $150 charge will be applied to credit card on file

¬∑ No smoking inside. If non-compliant $150 charge will be applied to credit card on file

¬∑ Treehouses are to be left tidy. Your rate includes a basic cleaning fee, any excessive cleaning that is required will result in a minimum cleaning fee of $25 to $100, plus you agree to be financial responsible for any economic loss to HPT Air Castles, LLC due to any reservation cancellation or delay in reservation move-ins that are a result of excess cleaning needing to be done after your stay

¬∑ Any- type of foreign material, oil, or soap used in outdoor hot-tubs will result in a $50 to $100 fee

¬∑ Any items removed or damaged will result in extra fee charges including bedding and linens

¬∑ HPT Air Castle, LLC reserves the right to refuse service & cancel any reservations at any time

¬∑ No ATV‚Äôs or firearms are to be used on property

¬∑ Fires are to be burned in designated locations only

¬∑ Holdovers: Don‚Äôt holdover; we need to make sure our place is tidy for the next visitors and guests. Therefore, please check out by 11:00 am. Check in is at 4:00 pm. If you do not check out by 11:00 am, you will be subject to a stay-over penalty, which is the market cost for the next night, plus an additional cleaning fee and a 10% penalty on top of the market cost for the night.

**Your satisfactory stay is very important to us and we want to correct anything that is not in working order. Please report any issues or concerns to us prior to your first night stay. We will make every effort to get it immediately fixed. We cannot honor any requests for refund or compensation for any existing concerns or issues reported after the first night‚Äôs stay."]

Title: Underground Hobbit Hole @MMV Ecovillage
Description:
['About this space', 'Approximately 260 sq ft, earth sheltered structure within our permaculture-based, sustainable, off-grid village. It is one of a kind in architecture and theme with colored bottles built into the wall, stained glass windows, center tree pillar with atrium windows above, and medieval Celtic Cross above the Hobbit Hole (outside and atop) give it a Hobbit Church feel.', 'The space', 'The space
Heads up -- one of our Hobbit front door hinges just broke. darn it. Just a heads up. It usually takes a couple weeks to get a welder out here for such fixits.

This is a primitive cabin, it DOES have running water, but NO electricity (you bring your own candles BYOC). Common facilities (kitchen and bath) being shared with the larger community, about 200 yds away.

*Just so everyone knows, during heavy rains in our RainForest winter months, sometimes the floor can get a little wet and the underground cave can be damp --Utilizing the wood stove is ideal (please bring some firewood) keeps it drier and warmer.

Breakfast nook has a Hobbit mushroom table and there is a comfy sky chair suspended for luxuriating.

Built into the side of a mountain with a seasonal spring (there are springs everywhere here in the mountainous rain forest) that runs through the house -- on purpose -- so there is often the sound of a babbling brook in the HH November thru May.

If you are looking for a unique experience in a beautiful natural area and would like to experience life in an off-grid, sustainable, permaculture-focused ecovillage - and all the rough roads, dirt, mud, insects, messes, barking dogs, mosquitos, bees, mice, early morning roosters, communal living, composting toilets, ongoing construction projects in remote wilderness - then we invite you join us in our mountain village!

Our property encompasses 160 acres of pristine natural wilderness in Northern California's beautiful Smith River canyon - home of the only un-dammed river in the state. Lush fern-encrusted hillsides slope down to countless spring-fed streams, teeming with wildlife, from cute caterpillars to (also cute, sometimes!) black bears. Accessible only by forestry road from scenic Redwoon Hwy (CA-199,) this is an opportunity to experience our responsible natural relationship with Mother Earth.

This location is very beautiful and quite remote, so please be sure you've read through the full description and are prepared for certain elements of "roughing it" and adventure travel. The Village is also a work-in-progress so we are likely to be working and there may be construction, dirt, and messes around!

Amenities:

BEDDING. It seems weird and unnecessary to me, honestly, but (bending to some COVID requests) we are asking you to bring your own sheets/sleeping bags, etc. There will be a mattress pad, blanket and some sheets in a drawer if you really need/want them. We'll call it a rustic cabin theme instead of a paranoid germophobe motif.

‚Ä¢Lighting / Electricity: Your cabin does not have electricity; we try to keep a flashlight, lantern, and/or candle available for your use -- but we recommend that you bring your own lights.
‚Ä¢Kitchen: The outdoor kitchen, about 200yds away from the Hobbit Hole, has a small propane camping stove, and plenty of pots, pans, and utensils for your use. We do not have refrigeration but we do have a freezer (with ice packs) and coolers for storing food.
‚Ä¢Bathrooms: We use composting toilets (buckets with seats); there is an indoor toilet in the bathhouse. Hot shower in the sauna/bathhouse. It is about 200 yds on average away from most of our cabins
‚Ä¢(Lack of) Phone / Internet: Some Verizon and US Cellular service is available, but AT&T and T-Mobile do not service our area. We do not have wifi.

The Great Outdoors:
‚Ä¢Domestic animals: Between the three dogs who run around at night chasing forest creatures, springtime frog concerts, and the early-rising chickens, it is likely that there will be some animal noises occurring at unpredictable moments during the night and day.
‚Ä¢Wild animals: There are various of these that live in the forest, including skunks, chipmunks, foxes, black bears, and many birds and insects. Since we have dogs and people around, the wild animals tend to keep their distance from the areas that we use. If you are lucky, you might spot a black bear on a hike; they are basically like big raccoons and prefer to run away from humans.

If you are looking for a unique experience and up for rustic accommodations with a few off-grid perks, we welcome you to join us in our mountain paradise!', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
There is no key (or lock) to the Hobbit Hole. Just head up (the road) to the Lower Village common area. The Hobbit Hole is the first structure -- before the treehouse -- and just past the parking area on the right. Someone will probably be there to show you about the common areas -- otherwise, just make yourself at home. It's casual, not formal.

The Hobbit House is quite private and the furthest away from amenities in our Village. We provide a portable composting toilet. Our dining hall, bath house (with shower, bidet, and fancier indoor toilet) is about 200 yds away.
There are plenty trails to hike, a swimming hole, and garden benches and porch swings to enjoy the view.

The host (Dan) is sometimes around, sometimes not, often busy doing stuff, so it's all pretty straight forward check in yourself (no key or lock) make yourself at home, community areas are obvious. But there's almost always someone around (other residents, intern woofers) to answer questions if you have them.

There is a wood-fired sauna (usable November thru May), large organic garden and edible landscaping, chicken and goat pens, other animal residents include dogs, cats, chickens, fish and frogs.

From your cabin, you are welcome to wander at will amongst our 160 acres of mostly steep, forested land, and enjoy the streams and waterfalls leading into Little Jones Creek. A stroll down the" driveway" and back along the forestry road is a beautiful hike in itself, where you could easily spend all day in the company of only quiet woodland creatures.

We also offer custom bodywork sessions - holistic chiropractic and massage - more info available on request.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Driving here: You do NOT need 4WD or any special vehicle to reach our property. We drive in and out regularly in our small Honda hatchback and have had hundreds of visitors drive up in their "regular" cars. Indeed the forestry road has a few potholes worth slowing to 5mph, but otherwise can be driven at 20mph. The rainy winter season creates puddles but actually better traction than in summer, counter intuitively. The bridge ramps narrow and all you need to do is drive it slowly, consciously. Pretty easy.

Note: Plenty of people have very relaxing, enjoyable satisfying experiences here in our sustainable culture experiment, but this happens only when reality exceeds expectations. This is where I try to talk everyone out of coming to stay with us -- MMV is NOTHING like a resort or the Marriott hotel. Think some crazy combination of camping/glamping at a rugged, mountainous, off-grid, remote farm and sustainable community. There may be a compost pile outside your cabin after we weed the the beds around it. Our goats, chickens or dogs may wake you in the morning. There are all kinds of critters here including but not limited to spiders and bears and all in between. We live here and make messes, undertake all kinds of projects including big building projects sometimes. It is NOT polished, not always tidy (although we really try) convenient or even (sometimes) comfortable. You may have to split your own firewood. There is plenty of raw beauty and these forementioned functionalities are how it is here as we continue working towards Shangri La!
We love our visitors and appreciate them -- if you want to understand more about our project -- visit, join and/or support us -- search Maitreya Mountain Village']

Title: Unique glamping experience near Ely & Cambridge
Description:
['About this space', 'A beautifully converted 1945 boat nestled within a private forest overlooking the beautiful open fenland countryside. Perfect retreat for couples looking to relax, explore and visit the local towns. Located 15 minutes drive from Ely and 30 minutes from Cambridge.

The boat forms part of the overall space incorporating the bedroom with a king size double or two singles, accompanied by a adjoining boat shack with an eclectic industrial style kitchen and bathroom with walk-in shower.', 'The space', 'The space
The historic 1945 boat originally called the Anthony Stevenson sailed out of Penzance Cornwall, she has been converted in to a unique holiday retreat for couples. The modern boat interior has been designed to complement the beautiful oak beams and larch planking, it includes a double kingsize bed or two singles, running water, tea, coffee and WiFi.

The boat is positioned on a large deck made of reclaimed sleepers within a tranquil forest overlooking the beautiful fenland countryside. The perfect retreat for couples to relax, explore and enjoy the amazing sunsets.

Accompanied by an adjoining boat shack style building made from many reclaimed materials which contains your private eclectic industrial kitchen and bathroom. The kitchen contains a large vintage carpenters workbench, with butler sink, cooking hobs and fridge. The spacious bathroom includes a private walk-in shower, toilet and basin. If you would prefer to relax and bathe in nature on a fresh summers evening there is a secluded roll-top bath outside on the deck.

The boat is positioned on its own privately fenced three acre forest, on our small holding where we live in a 1760 Georgian property with our pet goats, horses, dogs and chickens.

We try to live a eco friendly sustainable lifestyle and as such the boat runs entirely off-grid with renewable energy produced by our solar panels.

If you have any questions about the BoatShack or local area please send us a message via Airbnb messenger.']

Title: Wee Nook- a Hobbit Hole
Description:
['About this space', "Wee Nook is a 360 square foot living space with a full kitchen and bathroom. It is tucked underground in the middle of the woods. Please come enjoy the woods, farm animals, trails, pond and wide open space while you're here!

As JRR Tolkien said: ‚ÄúIn a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit. Not a nasty, dirty, wet hole, filled with the ends of worms and an oozy smell, nor yet a dry, bare, sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or to eat: it was a hobbit-hold, and that means comfort.‚Äù", 'The space', 'The space
Wee Nook is a 360 sq foot house with a full kitchen, bath, queen bed and sofa. It boasts the most quiet spot on our property, with a lovely pavilion for outdoor sitting in the middle of the woods. The hobbit hole has a live roof, and several eatable plantings around this space for enjoying in spring and summer months. The fire pit in back allows guests to sit back and listen to nature while enjoying "nature's tv" (a fire).

Guests can enjoy walking the trails around and through the property. As well as visiting the pond for fishing and swimming, the horses, goats and highland cows.

We have a cream and white dog, LeeLoo, that has free range of the property. She will most likely greet you upon your arrival or join you on your walk. She's very sweet and social, she just wants to meet everyone! She will bark.

**There is no internet or tv in this space. There is also very little phone service! We recommend bringing books, games, journals or small hobbies. If weather is supposed to be rainy you might consider bringing a computer with movies DOWNLOADED on it. (Or one with dvd capabilities.)

We are 15 miles from Loretta Lynn‚Äôs Ranch/ Waverly (west of us), 30 miles from Dickson, Tn (east of us) and an hour from Nashville (east).

Other listings on the property:
https://abnb.me/QLxQi0mYsR

https://abnb.me/LPjARfoYsR

https://abnb.me/BcGwuYjUpR

https://abnb.me/Ky70EhHYsR', '', '', '', "We do allow pets at our hobbit house. We require that all pets are up to date on all flea and tick medication and a $40 pet fee that can be left upon your departure. Please bring a blanket or sheet to cover the furniture if your pup is accustomed to being on the sofa and bed.
Please keep animals on a leash if they are not responsive to their commands! We do have farm animals that can hurt your animal if they feel threatened and vice versa. (also our dog LeeLoo and the neighborhood dog Red have free range of the property. Both are very kind and love the opportunity to play if you are willing.)

Check in is not strictly at 2pm, as it is key code entry. So whenever you arrive you can unlock the door and make yourself at home.

Check out is at 10am.

Please feel free to share any photos of your experience to our Social Media page, Rock 'N Refuge, @rocknrefuge or #rocknrefuge."]

Title: Leafy Greens Chiangmai : Mushroom M5
Description:
['About this space', 'Leafy Greens was built as a retreat center for our family and friends. It is where people would visit to refreshing their souls and mind. We work so hard to make this place to be one of the place that we can live in harmony with nature. That is why the cob houses are the right choice for us. Not only the buildings are eco-friendly but also the garden is organic. Visit here you will be able to take a deep breath and enjoy the fresh air with organic environment. It is a perfect place to getaway!!', 'The space', "The space
This clay house was built for meditation course and It was designed for people to learn being with themselves that is why the function of the house is simple. The house is 35 square meter with essential facilities. It might be considered as a tiny house, yet it‚Äôs comfortable for 3 people living together. It got 2 stories:-2 futons on upper area and 1 bed on the ground floor. The entire of the house was made by clay (earth), it is not only eco-friendly building but also good for our health. We believe that our body will absorb good energy from the earth, this means earthy house brings you close to nature and eliminate bad energy out. It is very special house for us, too special actually to keep it only for family and friends so we decided to share our paradise to everyone. Hope you would love it like we do.

DO NOT CLICK ON THE AIRBNB LINK FOR DIRECTIONS
Please only use our provided location to get here, otherwise, you might end up to other places.

PLEASE NOTE THAT OUR PLACE SURROUNDED BY NATURE
Our place is full of flowers and trees, you might see part of nature like birds, crickets, frogs, lizards, butterflies, bugs and insects in our garden, don't worry, they are harmless. However, if you are afraid of these creatures, our place might not suit you. We do not offer refunds if those creatures comes into the house but we will check the house before guests check in to make sure there is no any bugs and we have insect net, please keep it close every time during stay.

Please note that clay house has a thick wall and the clay is blocked the internet reception, so the internet might get slow sometime.

Please note that we are not hotel so we do not have reception to help you 24hr. However, you would do our best to help you out. To check-in, it is very important to read out message thoroughly in order to have a smooth arrive.

We have cat in our property. If you are allergic to cat or do not like them, our place might not a good fit for you.

If more people than the number declared at the time of booking stayed the room, additional fee and penalty will be charged.(Children over 3 years old is also count as 1 person).

No commercial photography shoots allowed", '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
- Check in after 15:00 PM, Check out before 11:00 AM
- No smoking in the house, if guests break this rule, we have to ask for cleaning 2,000 THB.
- No durian in the house.

We can provide a pickup service to our place, please book it in advance.

We have 5 bicycles, you can use them for free.']

Title:
The best in tiny living!
TreehouseTopia
Description:
['About this space', 'The Barkhouse is the only fully tree supported structure in the Gatlinburg/Pigeon Forge area. Located just minutes from all the major attractions in the area and only 5 miles from the Greenbriar entrance to the GSMNP. Enjoy the seclusion of 25 acres of trees with amazing views of the river and the mountains plus all the comforts of home.
The Barkhouse is engineered with a beautiful live White Pine growing through the center of the treehouse. Enjoy stargazing through the skylight.', 'The space', 'The space
The Barkhouse has a kitchen area with a microwave, refrigerator/freezer combo, toaster oven, single electric burner, and coffee maker. Enjoy charcoal grilling outdoors on your private deck or using the fire pit shared with the other treehouse located on the property. Spend time inside resting on yoga mats in the suspended cargo net area.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
A door code will be given prior to arrival to enter the premise. Once inside the treehouse the entire (black circle) locking mechanism will need to be turned clockwise or counterclockwise to unlock or lock the door.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
No pets!']

Title: Alianz Loft
Description:
['About this space', 'Insta @ alianzloft. 20 minutes from San Jose airport. First loft built by Alianz.cr. It contains a decked terrace, jacuzzi, firepit, rabbits garden, two rooms, two balconies, entrance gate, private garden, private parking, BBQ area, AC in each bedroom, basketball court, luxury beds, and mountain views. Ideal for architecture lovers, romantic dates, or having a good time. It is a unique space of his kind. Only pets that do not harm rabbits are allowed.', 'The space', "The space
Entrance with keyboard, don't worry about arrival time. Only rented by the complete loft , my relatives houses and our architectural office are 800ft (75mts) away, the property has big green areas, Hall for group activities, BBQ, children playground, nice gazebo and a small farm. It's a gated community, will be weddings on the green areas at 300 feets away on weekends that takes 5 hours per day, with fireworks at night sometimes. No unauthorized meetings more than 4 or events are allowed. All loud music must end by 9pm because the place has a patent for events until that time.", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
You can use the property for walk, use the playground, gazebo (recommended for romantics) , trampoline, play with the horse, and visit the farm.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
On Saturdays or Sundays : There is an event room on the same property. (Aprox 70 meters) Occasionally will be events of weddings with 4 consecutive hours of music. All group activities must end at 9pm. No loud noise is allowed after 9pm please.']
