Title: The Boathouse on the beach in Seagrove Bay
Description:
['About this space', "Rare opportunity to enjoy a truly special holiday in an outstanding converted Victorian boathouse. The Boathouse sits in a totally unique setting, in one of the most sought-after premium locations on the Isle of Wight. The house itself commands central position in the bay and fronts onto a magical beach with far reaching views across to The Solent.

Seagrove Bay embodies the notion of a far-off sandy cove and is simply magical and alive with sailing boats of all shapes and sizes. The surrounding area ouzos blissful tranquillity, with buttery soft sands and glistening clear water punctuating the landscape.


The Boathouse is an upside-down house that is set over three floors, sleeping 6 guests on the ground floor, maximising the picturesque views of the beach and Bay to the other two floors. The sitting room is simply a gorgeous space, contemporary, light, extremely comfortable and those VIEWS! The dining room can sit up to 8 guest and has direct access via stairs to the front balcony area on the ground floor. The Boathouse also has the added benefit of having an enclosed rear lawned garden, plus the luxury of garage parking for one car.





Accommodation:
Ground Floor:
Three bedrooms: 1 King Double with a large wardrobe, 1 Double, 1 Twin. Family bathroom, with roll top bath and a separate shower, WC and basin.
First Floor:
A central staircase takes you up to the living area, where the sea and beach views are simply stunning.
The living area consists of a thoughtfully fitted kitchen with bar stool seating for three,
A gorgeous sitting room with log burner, plenty of comfortable seating looking towards those panoramic Solent views.
A separate dining room seating up to 8 guests.
Off the kitchen there is a utility room with WC, basin and laundry facilities.
Second Floor:
Sitting area with a freeview TV, a perfect retreat for the teenagers.
Outside:
Outside to the rear there is an enclosed lawned garden with an outdoor shower. To the front there is a balcony area overlooking the beach and Solent. Garage parking for 1 car.


Amenities:
Gas heating and hot water, log burner with a starter pack of logs
Cooker - electric double oven with a gas hob, microwave
Dishwasher, fridge freezer, toaster, kettle, cafeti√®re
Wifi, 2 x Freeview TV‚Äôs, DVD, bluetooth DAB radio
Travel cot, highchair, attached stairgates on all the stairs (top and bottom)
Hairdryer, iron, ironing board., Linen and towels inc in rent (not beach towels), heating inc in rent
Charcoal BBQ
Note:1 Dog is welcome on request ONLY
Note: Sorry no parties
Note: The property is set over three levels, with the bedroom being on the ground floor.
Note: Children must be supervised at all times while on the front balcony area. Note: The front balcony area is used at your own risk, please always take care. Garden furniture will be outside from the Spring to the early Autumn

The seaside resort of Seaview was built by the Edwardians due to the stunning panoramic sea views and great sandy beaches, and these assets are still very much true today. The Boathouse sits in the middle of Seagrove Bay which is a much sought-after holiday destination to be desired as you can quite simply gently melt into the sands for a long day of sun basking. The property itself faces a shallow bay with a host of water sports and inviting turquoise blue water to explore. A short walk along the beach and you find yourself on Priory Bay. ‚ÄòTreasure Island ‚Äò always comes to mind as you turn the corner from Seagrove Bay into Priory Bay, a view you simply cannot get board of, and just as wonderful in the winter months, especially on those crisp winters morning - simply breath taking. Look for the many oysters and scallops that regularly get washed up from these sparkling waters. Explore along the beachline, and let the children‚Äôs imagination go wild, play cricket or boule at low tide, or just relax and enjoy a delicious picnic. The Boathouse looks straight across the Solent to Portsmouth and the Spinnaker Tower, and the famous Solent forts. It is only a short walk into Seaview where you will find The Old Fort a newly refurbished gastro pub, AA award winning Seaview Hotel, Seaview Yacht Club, the wonderful Lily's Cafe, the new Lime & Chilli Indian restaurant (bring your own bottle), chemist, post office, community store stocked with delicious local produce, and a couple of boutique shops.
Shop, Pub and Restaurant 1.6 miles by car or just a short walk along the beach, or costal path which is directly outside of your rear gate. Nearest beach 0.0 miles, Ryde 3.6 miles by car.

Outside of Seaview discover English Heritage‚Äôs Carisbrooke Castle and Osbourne House. Take the family to Dinosaur Isle and the activity parks at Blackgang Chine and Robin Hill Country Park.
Alternately, a host of activities tempt the more adventurous visitors, such as hiking, horse riding or mountain biking across the famous Tennyson Downs all the way to the far West point of the island, discover the island‚Äôs greenery, exploring the breath-taking landscapes on route. Why not take the family and explore our caves by kayak, or challenge yourself with some paragliding from our chalk cliffs? For the water enthusiasts the island offers something for the whole family, from sailing, paddle boarding, kitesurfing, windsurfing, kayaking. Or simply just enjoy a picnic or bbq and enjoy some spectacular sun sets on one of the many beaches from Bembridge to Brook. Oh the possibilities", 'The space', 'The space
Three bedrooms all on the ground floor: 1 King Double, 1 Double, 1 Twin. Ground Floor family bathroom, with roll top bath and a separate shower. Stairs take you up to the living area, so you can benefit from the most stunning sea views. With a fitted kitchen, sitting room with log burner, and a separate dining room, both with those breath-taking seaside views. Off the kitchen there is a utility room with cloakroom facilities. Up the second set of stairs takes you to another sitting area, a perfect retreat for the teenagers. Outside to the rear there is a lawned enclosed garden with an outdoor shower. To the front there is a balcony area overlooking the beach and Solent.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
1. Please do not leave children unattended at the front of the property, there is quite a drop down to the beach.
2. No Smoking
3. No Pets allowed in the bedrooms, or on the furniture. Pets must not be unattended in the property or garden area. All No 2's to be picked up before you leave. We would appreciate if you could hoover up any excess dog hair before you leave as well.
4. No Parties
5. No parking in-front of the garage - Access is required at all times.
6. Please remember you have neighbours, so please be courteous and respectful - Thank You.
7. 2. There are storm doors in-front of the beach fronted windows, please close when windy, or if a storm is expected. The doors can be used as blackouts as well.
8. Please use the front balcony at your own risk, there is a big drop down to the beach.
9. Small children must be supervised at all times while out on the front balcony area.
10. Please advise on booking if bringing dogs, then we can get the property dog ready."]

Title: Beachfront Penthouse with Parking üñ§ Estuary Views
Description:
['About this space', 'A Coastal Retreat situated on the Beachfront. Boasting unspoilt Panoramic Sea Views for miles. Hear the birds sing & the Estuary Glisten!
Central to Four Blue Flag Beaches, Restaurants, Cafes, Water Sports & Local Attractions.

Renovated & Re-Designed with Bi-Folding Glass doors to bring the Outside, Inside, sit back & relax enjoy the views.

The property has been Intricately Designed embracing tiny details that define our property with Luxuries for a Cosy Stay with Continental Breakfast.', 'The space', 'The space
Looking for a coastal retreat for a dose of sea breeze? We are situated in the sort after area of Thorpe Bay, opposite the award-winning beach.

We are a hop, skip and a jump away from the waves (quite literally), & yet close enough to some fabulous bars, fine dining, coastal walks & the longest pier in the world!

We boast panoramic views overlooking boats in the estuary & across the blue flag beach. The bi-folding glass doors & the numerous glass skylights is just a few of the things that set us apart.

The only views you will enjoy from the sofa are the boats sailing past, tide coming in & out, & the sun setting at dusk & rising at dawn. The views are truly breathtaking.

The entire flat oozes style & boasts high-end fixtures and finishes. Designed with your modern comforts like high-speed Wi-Fi, Smart TV, down lighting throughout & fully equipped kitchen.

We offer a cosy stay with all your home comforts, providing less stress when you are packing for your stay.

This stylish Penthouse Apartment is the perfect escape for a luxury stay. It lends itself to romantic getaways, celebrations & a place to re wind down & re-energise

Breakfast Included: -
Fresh bakery product, Fruit, Tiptree Preserves, Tiptree Sauces, selection of packet cereal, butter & your choice of milk.
Speciality teas, coffee, sugar & an assortment of fine biscuits.

If you require any Hospitality Services during your Stay, please scroll down for more information.

The flat is equipped with: -
Wifi

Picnic essentials, cooler bag with plates & glasses etc, ice packs, beach chairs & umbrella.
Games cupboard with a few board games & playing cards.

Bathroom
Bluetooth bathroom speaker
Complimentary ‚ÄòWellness Exclusive‚Äô Shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, soap, shower cap, cotton pads, toothbrushes & paste.
Towels & face flannels.

Bedroom
Comfy King Size bed
Hairdryer
Full length mirror & illuminated top mirror
Mini Jukebox Bluetooth speaker
Extra pillows

Hangers

Disposable takeout cups
Olive oil, coconut oil, vinegar, salt & pepper.
Selection of spices & sauces.
Cling film, tin foil, baking sheets, food bags & ice bags.
Washing tabs
Home cleaning products
User manual of all appliances.

We are within a 5 min walking distance of the most popular restaurants.
Check out my guidebook for sightseeing, activities & great restaurants. Thorpe Bay, Southend offers something for everyone.

Hospitality Services:
With over 20 years of experience within the hospitality industry, it is my pleasure to source & execute services for you. Here is a list of some of the services that I can offer: -

~ Room D√©cor for a Birthday, Anniversary, or any special celebration
~ Afternoon Tea
~ Private Chef
~ Mini Bar
~ Food Packages from your morning fry up to Picnik on the Beach
~ Birthday Cake, Balloons, bubbles on ice & Reservations

If you have any other requests, please do not hesitate in contacting me.

Useful Information

Please note that during the joyful summer months, the weather may attract the pesky bugs!

We have two train stations,
C2C service into London Fenchurch Street, Approx 1 mile.
National Rail into London Liverpool Street, Approx 2 miles.

Southend Airport is Approx 6 miles.

Lots of Local Taxis companies', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
You have the entire place to yourselves.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note

Title: Stylish Seafront Flat
Description:
['About this space', 'Beautiful seafront, first floor, south facing apartment recently re decorated to a high standard. Direct sea views.', 'The space', 'The space
First floor sea front flat centrally located by Hasting Pier and walking distance to all the amenities of St Leonards On Sea and Hastings. Warm comfortable and welcoming.

LIVING ROOM
South facing with direct sea view. High ceilings with large sash windows and a door leading to private balcony. While the flat is no smoking am happy for you to smoke on the balcony. Large sofa which can also act as additional bed. (Extra duvet bedding available) TV with normal Freeview and also Amazon Fire Stick that includes Netflix, Amazon Prime and Disney+. The room also has 2 high quality Blue Tooth Sound Systems available. Raft wooden dining room table with 4 chairs.

Please note the fire is not operational and can not be lit.

International Plug adaptors and extension cables available.

Flat is fully gas central heated.

BEDROOM
Double bed with new mattress and lovely view from the bed through large window to hillside at the rear of the flat. Cupboard and chest of draws are empty and available to you. Bedside tables, bedside lamps. There are USB double plugs next to each bed.

KITCHEN
Tassimo Coffee machine with some welcome pods available. Fridge Freezer, Washing Machine, Microwave, Gas Hob and Electric Convention Oven, Kettle, Toaster and all utensils including pots and pans. Outside the kitchen is a lovely seating area.

BATHROOM
Bath, shower and toilet with soap, toilet paper provided.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Salty Lodge (UKC3456)
Description:
['About this space', 'Set in an idyllic location just steps from the beach, this bungalow is perfect for families, couples and friends alike.. 3 steps to entrance. All on the ground floor.
Living/dining room: With Freeview TV and patio doors leading to decked area.
Kitchen: With electric oven, induction hob, microwave, fridge/freezer, dishwasher and washing machine.
Bedroom 1: With kingsize bed and patio doors leading to decked area.
Bedroom 2: With twin beds.
Shower room: With shower cubicle and toilet.. Gas central heating, electricity, bed linen, towels and Wi-Fi included. Travel cot. Enclosed decked area with garden furniture and charcoal barbecue. Outside hot shower. Private parking for 6 cars. No smoking. Please note: There are 4 steps down to the beach. . Enjoying a wonderful coastal location, Salty Lodge is a light and airy single-storey, detached property, with fantastic sea views across to the Isle of Wight. It has a large, decked sitting-out area to the rear ‚Äì ideal for alfresco dining or enjoying a drink on a warm evening, and where beautiful sunsets can also be viewed. At the end of the back garden there are steps over the low wall directly onto the pebble/sandy beach, and fishing is available nearby. When the tide goes out it makes a great crabbing area, with many pools along the sand. Salty Lodge has been refurbished in 2018 and offers modern and tastefully presented accommodation for couples or families.
Hayling Island is well known for its sailing activities, it is sheltered by the Isle of Wight, making it ideal for watersports activities. It is renowned for its windsurfing, kayaking, power boating, jet ski-ing, kitesurfing and wake boarding. Local paddle boating and windsurfing lessons are available close by. Every year there is a national windsurfing event, and a hive of sailing and nautical activity can be seen along the coastline. Walk the Hayling Billy Trail, which starts at the former railway line where the theatre now is, or take a pleasant amble overlooking Langstone Harbour.
Many activities can be enjoyed locally for all ages, including a seaside railway and a small amusement park for the children. For the sports enthusiast, Seacourt is also worth a visit, with 5 racket sports including real tennis. Also, nearby activities including golf, horse riding, boat trips and scenic walks along the water‚Äôs edge or scenic walks along the South Downs National Park which are within easy reach. Chichester with its beautiful cathedral, festival theatre, pedestrianised shopping, leisure centre, Roman Villa and Goodwood or Fontwell races, it‚Äôs definitely worthy of a visit. Visit Portsmouth with waterside dining, ferry trips to the Isle of Wight, designer outlets, Natural Museum, leisure facilities, Spinnaker Tower, HMS Victory, or the maritime history at Southampton. Winchester with its cathedral, abbey and The New Forest are within easy driving distance. Plenty of National Trust homes and gardens can also be discovered nearby. Beach 4 yards. Shop 220 yards, pub and restaurant 330 yards.
Free WiFi']

Title: Hastings Gem on the seafront
Description:
['About this space', 'Stunning, newly-renovated, open plan apartment on the 1st floor with floor to ceiling windows looking out to sea. Hastings Pier and St Leonards train station are 5 mins walk and there are plenty of restaurants & bars within easy walking distance.

Contemporary kitchen, with central island where you can have a cup of coffee or glass of wine and watch the sunset...

In the bedroom, open the huge double doors and you can lie in bed and still see the sea!

Modern, en-suite bathroom.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
For the first time I‚Äôve had to add a cleaning charge due to COVID safety requirements.
Please note heating is via guest- controlled radiators, which switch off automatically between midnight and 6am.']

Title: Sea-view Retreat in Old Town
Description:
['About this space', 'A stunning 2 bedroom seaside apartment in the Grade II Listed building of Pelham Crescent.
Perfectly located in the Old Town with direct sea views and great local amenities.', 'The space', "The space
We are very happy to host our recently renovated apartment in the Grade II Listed building of Pelham Crescent in the Old Town, with amazing direct sea views through beautiful Georgian Windows on to the main strip of the beach.

The property is located within the oldest part of Hastings, a beautiful and exciting part of town full unique and stunning architecture and history. The apartment is also located next to the gothic St Mary' Church. The property is a historical building, with all it's charm, and is nestled amongst the apartments is Gothic St Mary's Church. Pelham Crescent and the Church was built in the late 19th century and still remains a beautiful and iconic building, perfectly located facing the sea.

The apartment is the perfect option for short lets or longer stays in Hastings. For singles, couples, friends or small families.

The flat is located on the second floor of a four storey building. There is a large open lounge which faces directly onto the sea, with a brand newly fitted kitchen, fully equipped at the back of the room.

The apartment is full of character and rustic charm and provides all the basic home comforts.

The kitchen is well stocked of cooking utensils, cutlery, crockery and spices.

The lounge has a seating and dining area (with an extra dining table in the kitchen if needed), as well as a record player, books and TV for entertainment. There is ample space for 4 or more people to share the room at any given time.

The lounge runs through into the hallway, which leads on to the two double bedrooms and bathroom. Both bedrooms face directly on to the ancient cliffs of Hastings and are very private with nothing but the cliffs and seagulls onlooking.

The small bathroom has also been fitted with a brand new toilet and bathroom set, and was newly decorated with a new high pressure shower. Please note, this is not a luxurious bathroom as it has taken pressure from leaky roofs from above is decorated when needed and is functional and clean.

The larger bedroom can accommodate a travel cot. Please request this via the enquiry option and specify you have a child so we can arrange accordingly.

The following is also available and provided during your stay.

Free wi-fi - very strong speed - password can be found on the router box on the shelf in the lounge.
Full use of all utensils, condiments, spices etc in flat including bathroom, kitchen, lounge.
Full kitchen utensils etc
Fresh sheets
Towels
Hair dryer

The vintage record player is unfortunately not working anymore but we have a vintage radio which you can enjoy.

Please can you remember to always use cup holders and place mats for the surfaces on the dining table and the nest of small tables as they stain pretty much immediately with heat or wine : )

Feel free to use anything you can see in the flat and feel comfortable in the flat as your own home. There will be a variety of condiments for you to cook up a nice meal, and there will be towels etc.

Parking should be easy, as it's just opposite the flat on the beach front at Pelham Place car park.

Please do not invite any unannounced guests to the flat. We may consider docking from your deposit if guests are found to have done so.

Please also remember to keep the noise down after 11pm sharp, out of respect for the neighbours. The building is also an old building so please note, as expected, that sound does travel through the floors. Please also be mindful not to let the front door bang or to make noise in the hallway as noise travels easily through the building.

If you have a pet your would like to accompany you, please enquire in advance as there is an extra charge of ¬£15 for cleaning. I will also require that your pet comes with bedding and is not allowed on the fabrics and sheets in the flat.

Many thanks.

There is parking in the Pelham Car Park, directly opposite the building (but across the road so there is no road noise or traffic). Parking in the other Old Town is difficult but we have never had any problems with this car park. All day parking costs ¬£8. Evening parking is ¬£1 from 6pm until 8am.

There are an array of great quirky shops, cafes and restaurants at a stones throw away from the flat. The High Street in the Old Town and St Leonard's have the most and best options for independent food and drink venues, shops and galleries.

Opposite the flat on the beach front, there is family entertainment such as crazy golf, volley ball and a cycle hire shack.

All of Hastings events, such as food festivals, bonfire night, carnival and Pirates day and much more, all happens in this part of the town, and the parades take place just outside the window facing this stretch of the seafront, so you can also have the best view and can enjoy the atmosphere from the comfort of the apartment if preferred.

George Street and the High Street, as well as Jerwood's Gallery are minutes walk from the flat, where you can take the lift to the Cliff Tops or start your adventures around the Old Town from.

The new town is also a stone's throw away. St Leonard's (Norman and London Road) is approx 15 minutes walking along the beach front, towards the opposite the opposite direction from the Old Town. It's definite worth a visit!", 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Please note, all bookings for 2 people will be assumed as using one bedroom. Please let me know if you need both bedrooms as the bedding will need to be made up for the extra room.

Free wi-fi - very strong speed - password can be found on the router box on the shelf in the lounge.
Full use of all utensils, condiments, spices etc in flat including bathroom, kitchen, lounge.

Full kitchen utensils etc
Fresh sheets
Towels
Good quality travel cot, plus mattress but you will be required to bring your own bedding. Please inform us that the cot is required on check in so we can organise.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
(Important - please read)

*please be mindful of noise on the communal stairs as some neighbours do night shifts and may be sleeping.

*please notify me if you wish to bring a pet. One pet is allowed with an extra cleaning fee of ¬£15. The pet is required to sleep on their own bedding and should not use be allowed on the beds and fabrics.

*For two people bookings who require the use of the additional bedroom, please let me know on enquiry so we can ensure the 2nd bedroom is made up on arrival.

Do let us know if you have any questions, how big or small.

Further information to follow on Hastings and St Leonards' and check in details to follow on booking."]

Title: Flat with Breathtaking Sea Views
Description:
['About this space', 'Our vintage shabby-chic one bedroom Victorian flat, with breathtaking, panoramic sea views across the English Channel, is only minutes from the beach and picturesque Old Town, with its boutiques, art galleries, restaurants, bric-a-brac shops, cafes and bars.

Follow us on Instagram on: @flatwithbreathtakingseaviews', 'The space', 'The space
The Flat:
An elegant 1 bedroom flat with unobstructed, panoramic sea views across the West Hill Common, the East Hill Nature Reserve and the English Channel.
Boasting dark wooden floors throughout, an open marble fire place, high ceilings, tastefully decorated in vintage seaside charm, making it a very attractive and convenient one-bedroom holiday apartment to suit 2 (or 4) people.

Bedroom:
Has a relaxing and extremely comfortable double bed with plenty of light during the day and black-out curtains at night.
The bedroom has two windows, facing the back of the house, which are double glazed, allowing you to have a quiet nights sleep.
There are a selection of books and magazines to read on the vast shelves of the bedroom (please leave the books and magazines in the flat, or have a chat with me about borrowing any, if you are too engrossed in a story to leave it behind ;-)
A cot bed can be provided for babies/ toddlers, with prior warning.
Just outside the bedroom, you will find an iron and ironing board as well as a useful umbrella for those rainy English days, and a sun tent to protect the little ones when it's too hot on the beach.
In this same cupboard you can find a laundry hanger, a wooden baby's high chair, a Henry Hoover, mop, broom and a wicker mat for the beach.

Living Room:
With a gorgeous grey marble fireplace as its centrepiece and TRULY unobstructed breathtaking sea views across the West Hill, East Hill and English Channel. The living room also benefits from a double sofa bed, to cater an additional two people.
I have also provided a wicker basket of children's toys, to entertain little ones, should they also be our guests and a backgammon/chess set, plus Trivial Pursuit for "bigger kids".
A retro DAB radio - with iPod/iPhone dock - can be found on the "gramophone", to add a bit of ambience to your stay (and charge up your iPhones).
There is also a selection of magazines, for your browsing pleasure, in the magazine rack.
(Please leave the books and magazines in the flat)

*Please note there is NO TELEVISION in the flat... although there is an active TV license so you can enjoy all licensed channels on laptops, iPads and other mobile devices.

Kitchen:
A tidy and intimate kitchen, with gorgeous reclaimed teak work surfaces, which benefits from a washer/dryer, fridge, double oven, 4 hob gas cooker and all the conveniences of a modern home.
You can find a kettle, toaster, hand blender, a wide selection of glasses, mugs, plates and vases as well as a few cook books to inspire you (if you are thinking of eating in).
A selection of "Take Away" menus can be found on the rack in the hallway - If you are a fan of Indian food Jali is a favourite of ours.
Under the sink you will be able to find any cleaning products you may need during your stay.
A fire extinguisher (in case of fire) is located to the left of the kitchen, on the counter.
Next to the kettle you will find an "HONESTY JAR", for you to add a contribution if you break or misuse anything. Please be as generous as you feel is right to, so that guests after you can also enjoy these added perks.
In the kitchen I have added a folder (grey/blue) with all my favourite places to eat, drink, see and do in Hastings.

Bathroom:
A light and modern bathroom, with toilet, sink, bathtub and hand held shower. Body soap, shampoo/conditioner can be found here too.
In the bathroom you will also find a small first aid kit, in case of bumps and grazes (and in case of Hair Emergencies, a Vidal Sassoon full power hair dryer, a curling wand and BabyBliss travel hair straighteners can be found in the bedroom on top of the red cupboard).

Recently, I have ensured that all beauty products (Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Wash, Hand Soap, Washing Up Liquid etc...) provided in my property are Vegan, Organic, Chemical & Sulphate Free. FAITH IN NATURE is the company that ticks all the boxes, and I purchase their products in bulk (which I then use to refill the glass jars in the bathroom and kitchen).
I have done this to play my part in reducing my (our) plastic, waste, chemical consumption & impact on the environment - as well as the more obvious animal welfare issues, which I feel passionate about. www.faithinnature.co.uk

The flat also uses 100% renewable energy, from a company called Bulb (who provides 100% of its electricity generated from Wind, Solar and Hydroelectrics). Click this link to join up in your UK property: www.bulb.co.uk/refer/bindud7875', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests will have the flat to themselves at all times.

It is situated on the first floor and of course, there are neighbours, on the floors above and below, who need to be respected. Many thanks for understanding this...

Guests have access to the flat via the main front door and up the stairs to the first floor.

An entryphone is situated inside the flat, to the right of the front door, for your convenience.

The Middle Bell outside the building pertains to the First Floor Flat.', 'Other things to note', "Other things to note
We can provide a travel Cot Bed and a Highchair should you need one.
Please let us know of your requirements when you make your booking.

If you are 2 people, who won't be sharing the double bed and you require the sofa bed as well, please make your booking by stating you are 3 people (as this required more linen, preparation etc).

All beauty products in the flat are Organic, Vegan, Sulphate and Chemical free from FAITH IN NATURE. www.faithinnature.co.uk

The flat uses only 100% renewable energy from a British provider called Bulb.
By switching to Bulb you're making the world a greener place to live in. Join the movement now with this link/code: www.bulb.co.uk/refer/bindud7875

Children under 2 years of age can stay for free. Please state the total number of people staying in the flat, when you make your booking.

Certain weekends (during high season or when special festivals are taking place in Hastings) we may require you to book a minimum of two nights.

Here are just a few of the many Festivals and local Events to note down for 2018:

February ‚Äì Fat Tuesday - from 9-13
March ‚Äì Hastings Half Marathon ‚Äì 18 March
April ‚Äì Beatles Day 19 ‚Äì on 8th at White Rock Theatre
May - Hastings‚Äô Jack in the Green
June ‚Äì Stade Saturdays - cultural events every Saturday on Stade Open Space; and free!
July ‚Äì Hastings Beer and Music Festival, The Oval
August ‚Äì Old Town Carnival Week
September ‚Äì Seafood & Wine Festival
October ‚Äì Hastings Bonfire ‚Äì 13 October
November ‚Äì Hastings Storytelling Festival
December ‚Äì It‚Äôs Christmas!

Please follow us on Instagram - @flatwithbreathtakingseaviews"]

Title: 2 Bed Seafront Regency Apartment with Sea Views***
Description:
['About this space', 'Welcome to our hideaway by the sea. Our cosy home is within a beautiful coastal Grade II Listed building near the shores of Brighton beach, with direct and uninterrupted panoramic sea views. Well located on a prestigious main street in Kemptown village, the sea is literally across the road while the Pier, The Lanes, Brighton Marina and all the other amazing places are just a stroll away. The interior has been crafted for comfort, relaxing and snoozes, with a sprinkle of style on top.', 'The space', "The space
Our coastal retreat is on the 3rd floor of a grand Regency Grade II Listed building on Brighton‚Äôs seafront. So as you step into the apartment you‚Äôll be welcomed by the stunning direct sea views, neatly framed by the sash bay windows. We‚Äôve kept other original features (inc. the slight wonkiness of the floors and ceilings), but have combined that period character with a modernity to create a home that is relaxed, delightful and practical. Our apartment has two good sized double bedrooms, an open lounge/dining/kitchen main area, and a bathroom.

-THE LOUNGE is airy and bright with wooden flooring and casual furniture. There‚Äôs also a writing desk/chair with USB charging. The dining area is placed by the window, so meals can be enjoyed with a sun lit sea view.

-THE KITCHENETTE is compact but serves most short holiday needs inc. electric induction hob, oven, fridge freezer and ample storage space. There‚Äôs also a microwave, toaster and cutlery, crockery and basic cooking utensils.

-THE LARGER BEDROOM is very generously sized with a king size bed, side tables, dressing table, built-in wardrobes with plenty of hanging space and other furnishings to ensure a restful experience. The quirkier second bedroom hides behind a sliding door and has bedside tables, furnishings, and a double bed facing out at the ocean.

-THE BATHROOM is clean, functional and includes storage, vanity unit, washing machine and a bath tub offering the option of a good long soak or a quick shower.

The apartment has gas central heating. It also has a hair dryer, iron, ironing board, and fresh towels and bed linen are provided. The building doesn‚Äôt have a lift though but the elevated views will hopefully make the short ascent to the apartment worthwhile.

-PARKING
Finally, whilst we don‚Äôt have a dedicated parking space but our guests normally dont have a problem on getting a good spot. It is basically on street metered parking (between ¬£12-16/day), closest space is right opposite to our building.
Using the ‚ÄòPaybyphone' parking app is a great way to monitor the parking time remotely. Highly recommend.", '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Our apartment is within a friendly Regency building shared with a few other households, some with young children, so it‚Äôs not suited to any guests thinking of parties or other noisy activities. It is also on the 3rd floor, so do bear that in mind when booking as there is no lift.']

Title: Turritella, West Wittering
Description:
['About this space', "A stunning Art Deco house directly on the beach. Turritella's exceptional features include an amazing roof terrace with panoramic sea views.

Beautifully and lovingly re-modelled the property also includes two spiral staircases, a first floor sun room and a beachside patio. The property also benefits from a ground floor bedroom with ensuite shower room, ideal for guests who might find stairs difficult to manage to the further bedrooms, and an additional ground floor shower room for refreshing away sand and seawater after a day on the beach.

Sleeps 8.
Beach front.
No smoking.
No dogs, sorry.
WiFi.", '', 'The space', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The whole house.']

Title: Beautiful sea view Victorian apartment
Description:
['About this space', 'This raised ground floor apartment has direct sea views in an architect refurbished 1838 Decimus Burton house. The apartment is exceptionally spacious, with light and airy decor and a selection of original artwork. It is a wonderful space to relax, admire the sea views and watch the world go by.

The apartment and entire building have been restored , it has a modern spacious kitchen and living room with underfloor heating. There is a South facing balcony with sea views and a garden terrace.', 'The space', 'The space
The apartment has been lovingly restored, retaining the beautiful Victorian features, including a huge elaborate fireplace, original coving and ceiling roses.

The front room and kitchen are connected in a very large airy space with amazing views of the sea, which can be enjoyed from the balcony. Guests love watching the world go by from the window, and enjoy the sea, whatever the weather.

The furnishings include mid century modern pieces, Heals sofas and eclectic lighting. The original wooden floors have been restored and benefit from underfloor heating in the front room.

There are modern fittings in the smart kitchen area, which is fully fitted with washer/dryer, dishwasher, fridge, freezer, induction hob and gas cooker.

The bathroom/wet room has modern fittings with heated towel rail and underfloor heating.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Amazing Beach Apartment
Description:
['About this space', 'Stunning modern apartment right on the beach with unlimited views of the sea and beach. 20 minutes outside of Brighton.

The apartment has a 15 meters run of floor-to-ceiling windows, facing south directly out to sea. Huge open plan living, dinning, kitchen and entertaining space. We have installed an apple home pod and a large TV with Netflix.

This apartment is not suitable for loud parties, stag or hen dos. It has steps up to the entrance. We ask guests to be respectful of everyone.', 'The space', 'The space
Open plan kitchen and living area and three separate bedrooms to the back. The flat is an eco building with triple glazing - its is quiet inside.
The apartment has access to the balcony that wraps around the South aspect of the apartment.

Three bedrooms, one with an ensuite bathroom and two with additional sofa beds. The apartment can sleep up to ten people.', 'Guest access', "Guest access
The apartment is self contained and the guests have access to all parts. The balcony isn't segregated from the other apartments. But 20m is for exclusive access of this apartment.", 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
On Friday Nights in the summer we put on an outdoor cinema on the beach for a local charity. The balcony has the best view. For the films being shown please look at the facebook page of the perch cafe.']

Title: Beautiful Beachside Chalet, Gurnard, Cowes
Description:
['About this space', 'Our seafront chalet, Beachcombers, is situated in the pretty village of Gurnard.

Beachcombers is part of an eclectic mix of chalets and bungalows - come the evening you can take in some of the finest sunsets across the Solent.', 'The space', 'The space
Beachcombers includes three bedrooms, two with king size double beds and one with a standard double, bunk bed and pull out mattress.

We have a spacious kitchen with a cooker, fridge and washing machine.

Also included: Corner sofa, central heating, two bathrooms, wi-fi and tv.

The beach is pebble and shingle and the front is lined with pretty beach huts and the beach currently holds a Seaside Award.

We are a stones throw away from Gurnard Sailing Club - water sports and sailing are a popular past time in this area.

There are a few small shops in Gurnard as well as two pubs, both of which serve food and offer a selection of drinks including Island ale. The Woodvale is located right at the seafront and serves food all day. Also located on the front is a sloping green and kids play area located near a small cafe serving snacks and ice cream.

There are some great walks and cycle routes to be explored in the area and for those wanting a little more life in the evening, Cowes town is a short walk away.

By walking:

Beach< a minute
Woodvale < 5 minutes
Shops < 10 minutes
Cowes < 30 minutes

Our chalet has been handed down the generations and was recently renovated. We love the Isle of Wight and hope you will too.', '', '']

Title: Sea to Sky Cottage: On BEACH fantastic SEA views
Description:
['About this space', 'Sea to Sky- great sea views & Isle of Wight from upstairs lounge & balcony.
Sleep 6 max (including children), in 5 beds
Two level townhouse has stairs
Courtyard onto beach over flood defence stairs
Shower rain & hand over bath
Bath towels provided per guest numbers booked and 4 hand towels
2 wifi TV‚Äôs
Travel cot & highchair, if requested
Garage bike storage
3 Car off-street parking
Key safe check-in after 4pm
No 3rd party bookings
NOT wheelchair or walker accessible
No animals on property.', '', 'The space', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Sea to Sky Cottage is a two storey townhouse style residence in a quiet neighbourhood on the bus route;
- free off street parking for 3 cars;
- enclosed back courtyard with direct access stairs over wall onto the beach;
- garage to store bicycles, wind & kite surfers and kayaks, which is for guest use for the duration of their booking.
Closest local pub is 1/2 mile.
Childrens park 1/2 mile west opposite The Nab parking area.
Walk/Cycle beach promenda west from Sea to Sky courtyard gate to outdoor fitness equipment area, ice cream parlor, pizza, fish & chips, beach railway, Funfair and amusment hall.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
No additional guests in addition to the number of people listed for the booking, are to be invited to Sea to Sky.
No family and/or friends gatherings and no parties inviting people who are not booked guests, to join you at the property.

This is a residential neighbourhood so please respect the quiet hours between 10pm to 9am and no loud music at anytime.

A travel cot and/or highchair is available if requested at the time of booking, as these items are only made available in Sea to Sky when requested.

The heating/hot water is adjusted on the Hive thermostat next to the front door. Press buttons on top left and right for boost of hot water or heating.

If the temperature is warm due to weather please open windows and sliding door for a through breeze. A high volume fan is located in the dining room.

For heating check that radiators are turned up to 6 in each room and a large free standing oil heater is located in the conservatory for additional local heating.

Hot water is by a Solar Water Panel on the roof which is supplemented by a gas boiler when dark.']

Title: SEA VIEW FLAT Rottingdean
Description:
['About this space', 'Enjoy a beautiful newly refurbished one bedroom apartment in the heart of Rottingdean. The flat has sea views and direct access to the beach with no road between. Sleeps 2-3 people. Located steps from Rottingdean Beach, and close to coffee shops, restaurants, pubs and shops. Brighton is just 10 mins away. It‚Äôs the perfect getaway!', 'The space', 'The space
Conveniently located on the ground floor, this one bedroom flat enjoys direct access to the beach and Undercliff Walk offering 5km of traffic-free walking, running and cycling. The comfortable living/dining area has a large southwest facing window and there‚Äôs a compact well-equipped kitchen. The spacious modern bathroom has a bath/shower and the cosy bedroom has a double bed and fitted wardrobes.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests have sole use of the entire flat.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
There is visitor parking which you can use for unloading. Public parking is 5 mins walk from the flat with charges capped at ¬£5.40/day.']

Title: Coast View
Description:
['About this space', 'Stylish detached seaside home, situated right on the beach at Pevensey Bay, the quiet shingle beach is the back garden, A set of wide steps with handrail lead you to the front of the property where you enter into a welcoming open lounge/kitchen/diner.

There is now a virtual guidebook link below, that can be downloaded prior to arrival that gives all the information you could need to help you enjoy your stay even more.

https://hostful.ly/gvlcwsq', 'The space', 'The space
The kitchen area is well-equipped for family entertaining with an electric oven and hob, fridge with ice compartment, wine cooler fridge, dishwasher, microwave, Tassimo coffee machine and washing machine. Relax at the breakfast bar or move to the lounge area which offers the perfect place to watch tv or look at the amazing sea-view from the comfy corner sofa. Catch up on your favourite TV programmes or Netflix on the Smart tv, listen to the DAB radio or play one of the board games that are kept in the footstool. The dining table with seating for six overlooks the rear beach sea-view garden and the wonderful horizon beyond. There are two bedrooms, a double with a large Freeview tv, an en-suite walk-in shower and WC. The second bedroom has a super-king-size zip-and-link bed (which can be made into twin beds on request). The property is completed with a second bathroom that has a rainfall type shower over bath and WC. In the garden that leads directly onto the beach is a dining table with 6 chairs and sun umbrella, bar b q, fire pit, swinging chair and reclining chairs. There is also a storage shed with buckets and spades and ball games for use on the beach.', '', '', '', '']

Title: SEASONG, LUXURY ON THE BEACH HSE FOR 12 & HOT TUB
Description:
['About this space', 'STUNNING AND TOTALLY LUXURIOUS 6 BEDROOM AND 5 BATH HOUSE DIRECTLY ON THE BEACH (ONE DOUBLE BEDROOM WITH OWN SHOWER ROOM ON THE GROUND FLOOR IDEAL FOR EASY ACCESS) WITH HOT TUB, BBQ PLUS SEATING FOR 12 ON THE DECK OVERLOOKING THE SEA. LARGE BALCONY WITH 2 FRONT BEDROOMS OVER BEACH. SEPARATE SITTING ROOM AND GAMES ROOM WITH LARGE TV,WII and WIFI. LUXURIOUS FITTINGS AND FURNITURE, BEDDING AND LINEN, DRESSING GOWNS & TOWELS. Beauty therapist & babysitter available.
1 WELL BEHAVED DOG ALLOWED', 'The space', 'The space
YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED - THIS IS A LITTLE PIECE OF PARADISE WITHIN JUST OVER AN HOUR OF LONDON (FULHAM) - with all home comforts you can totally relax and sleep to the sound of the sea. Take it one step further with our excellent masseuse/beauty therapist coming to the house offering many treatments, use our recommended baby sitting service and head out for a lovely supper at the end of a beach fun day!', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
3 parking spaces outside the front of the property.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Bedroom locations and set up
Ground floor - 1) double bed with own shower room
First floor - 2) King size bed and 3) King size bed (with balcony) 4) double and single bunkbed. These 3 bedrooms share 2 large family bathrooms, both with bars and separate showers. 4) 2 single beds with ensuite shower room.
Second floor - Super king size bed and ensuite bathroom

Dressing gowns now provided - The White Company soaps etc all complimentary.

Chef available on request
Known nanny for babysitting available on request
Massage available on request
Balloons and champagne on ice for your special occasion available on request']

Title: 'Spindles', 2 bed house, near West Wittering beach
Description:
['About this space', 'This property has luxurious private accommodation. It sleeps up to 4 people - perfect for either 2 people, 2 couples or a family and an option of an additional single bed if 5 people wish to stay.
It is close to West Wittering beach, has many coastal walks, numerous family activities and restaurants.

Please note that there is another listing, Spindles Annex, which sleeps a further 2 people. Therefore, if available, it combines to make an ideal stay for a family and parents too.', 'The space', 'The space
Everything within the property (‚ÄòSpindles‚Äô) has been finished to a high standard. Upon entering through into the gated property there are secure allocated parking bays off the beautiful original driveway - one for each bedroom. A path leads you alongside the decked seating area to the private oak front door. Inside, there is a large entrance hall with doors leading to the bedrooms (both with luxury en-suite facilities) and the kitchen/diner/living room.', 'Guest access', "Guest access
The rented part of 'Spindles' is a very private 2 bedroom house with its own front garden. Within the garden there is a shed which residents may use to store their bicycles and other beach equipment. Behind the shed there are 2 kayaks (single and double) which you may use (obviously at your own risk!!). Inside the entrance, I have provided a selection of games (for all ages) for people to relax and enjoy. A selection of brochures will be available for those wishing to venture a little further from the beach."]

Title: Dunes View, waterside home with stunning views.
Description:
['About this space', 'A contemporary waterside home overlooking the sand dunes and Bembridge Harbour.

Whether it‚Äôs sundowners on the sunny terrace, watersports or watching the world go by, this is the perfect spot.

The idyllic village of Bembridge is within 5 minutes walking distance as are the many beautiful beaches. The living area, terrace and double bedrooms all have great Harbour views.

Off road parking for two cars and a large garage to safely store bikes or watersports toys.', 'The space', 'The space
All areas are available exclusively to guests.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Entire house, driveway, large garage, patio and grassed are to the front of the property.']

Title: Beach house on a idyllic private beach
Description:
['About this space', "This is our family holiday home. We absolutely love to go down there for a chilled out weekend with the kids.
We have three young children who Iove to play on the beach when the tide is low.
The beach is almost private, even in the high season there is barely anyone there. And the beach is the back garden! I'm sure your family will love this place as much as we do!
Please note that school holiday and summer it‚Äôs a minimum of seven nights stay.", 'The space', 'The space
The house has three bedrooms, one king size, one double and the kids room has four single beds. The beds are very comfortable ( mattress bought for our personal use)

New log burner and central heating system installed for the winter months. Please bring logs if you wish to lit up the fire.

There is a large living/ dinning room, and a sun lounge downstairs, kitchen and a toilet.
Please note the house is a bit outdated( cosmetically) but it has everything a family need to have a great and comfortable holiday in a the perfect location! It‚Äôs all about The Location!!!
It‚Äôs fully equipped with dishwasher, washing machine, a large fridge, freezer, microwave, Nespresso coffee machine, TV, DVD player, wifi, bed linen are provided but not towels( please bring your own) lazy chairs, toys, books, trampoline, swing.
Travel cot and high chair available.

The beach is the back garden with amazing sunrise and sunset. And the full moon is my favourite!', '', '', '', '']

Title: Seascape, panoramic views of the west hill and sea
Description:
['About this space', 'Sea Scape luxury apartment above Hastings Old Town with sea views over the green all the way to France. The seascape apartment has just been completely refurbished to a high standard with everything you might need for you stay. It is bright and airy with amazing views from all windows. A large section of DVDs Parking is street parking with no permits. If coming by train arrive at Hastings station there is a Sainsbury‚Äôs next to the station for any provisions. A taxi is about ¬£5 to the West Hill', 'The space', 'The space
An outstanding one bed apartment with orthopaedic mattress and an added deluxe sofa bed in the open plan living,
Fully equipped kitchen area. Dining area 4 chairs breakfast bar with 2 Stools.
Work Station to include a desk.
If you enjoy films there is a large collection of DVD‚Äôs for your stay.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Communal front door, one flight of stairs to the apartment door situated is on the first floor.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Please request travel cot if you need one for your stay as not stored at the apartment. Pub 2 minutes walk away. West Hill ideal for outdoor activities, or just sit back and sun bathe. Overlooking the Old town and sea.']

Title: Bright sea view 2 bedroom apartment by the pier
Description:
['About this space', "Welcome to our home-from-home opposite the English Channel and two minutes from Hastings pier. Enjoy big skies and stunning uninterrupted sea views from the living room & kitchen and serene cliff greenery from the bedrooms. Close to all local attractions it's under 20 minutes stroll to Hastings Old Town, situated between the heart of St Leonards & Hastings town centre.", 'The space', "The space
The apartment is on the second floor and is simply furnished with modern, mid-century and vintage stuff from and featuring the local area. It has recently been fully renovated and has new beds, bed linen and towels.

The kitchen includes a microwave, fridge with freezer section, gas hob & electric oven, digital/bluetooth/FM radio, blender, a washer-dryer plus all essentials.

Each bedroom has a fitted wardrobe and roller black out blinds behind the curtains. All bed linen is 100% cotton.

The bathroom has a heated towel rail, a bath with rainfall & handheld showers and a steam-free mirror with light. All towels are 100% Egyptian cotton.

In the living room there are two armchairs, a three-seater sofa and a dining table to seat four. The TV includes a DVD player and there are a selection of DVDs, books and board games.

Sorry, the apartment is not suitable for children under the age of 12 years.

The apartment is served by a lift, accessed via eight steps from the pavement to the ground floor lobby area. Please note the lift is quite old and isn't guaranteed to be operational during your stay.", '', '', '', '']

Title: Spectacular Beach House
Description:
['About this space', 'Westbeach is pleased to present this stunning beach house retreat comprising of 3 bedrooms, for up to 6 guests. This immaculate 3-storey beach house, with unrivalled sea views from every room, elegant decor and high quality bedding & linen, is perfect for a coastal getaway. You are spoilt with a lovely, split-level garden with direct access to the beach. There is a Chesney wood burning BBQ stove which is lovely to cook on and to sit around for cosy outdoor evenings.', 'The space', 'The space
The property comprises, on the ground floor, a beautiful living room with panoramic sea views and full length opening windows, a small study off the living room and a charming twin bedroom with sea views and en-suite shower room. Then on the first floor are two good sized double bedrooms one with Kingsize bed and en-suite shower room and the other with a double plus there is a single blow up bed for a small child. Both bedrooms offer spectacular sea views of the Sussex coastline. Also on this level is a separate family bathroom with WC, bath and shower over. On the lower ground floor is a spacious, fully fitted, well equipped kitchen, with open plan dining & living area, utility room and separate WC in hallway. There is a breakfast bar, good sized dining table and comfy sofa to one end with bi-fold doors opening out to the decked garden and beach beyond. Beachwear is also provided which includes beach towels, some wet suits, buoyancy aid jackets and some body boards. The house also provides some garden games and board games. In the decked garden there are loungers, a swing chair and dining table and chairs. This unique, stylish property is a special place to unwind and enjoy the beach life.', '', 'Other things to note
In respect of Covid-19, our cleaners are taking a more specific protocol on cleaning upon Check-In/Check-Out of properties, ensuring thorough and stricter cleaning activities are adhered too.

In line with these high cleaning standards we request a 4 pm check in to ensure our cleaners have plenty of time in-between guests.

In addition, the owner of this property leaves anti-bacterial wipes and spray for those that feel they want to use this where necessary for their own reassurance.

House Rules

No smoking
Not suitable for pets
No parties or events
Check-in time is 4PM - 9PM.
Check-out time is 10 am
Shoes are removed within the house to avoid sand damaging the flooring.']

Title: Lovely Annexe near the Beach, in Central Worthing.
Description:
['About this space', 'A lovely seaside ground floor Annexe, a stones throw from the Beach, Splash Point and Restaurants in Central Sunny Worthing. The Annexe has a bright open plan kitchen/lounge/diner with a lovely sofa bed and flat screen television. The bedroom has a comfortable double bed and flat screen TV. The family sized Bathroom has everything you need and huge fluffy towels. For parking your car, there is one dedicated space on our driveway allocated for guests. Also a Nespresso machine.', 'The space', 'The space
The Annexe is a good sized, bright, one bedroom ground floor flat. Freshly decorated in January 2021. The living area has a table that can comfortably seat four people and a wide sofa that easily turns into a comfortable double sofa bed. There is a flat screen Television and wi-fi. The living area also contains a good sized kitchen with an oven and hob, a family sized fridge/freezer and washing machine/dryer. There is also a sink with drainer. The kitchen comes equipped with toaster, kettle, nespresso machine and utensils and crockery.
The bedroom has a comfortable double bed, with clean fresh linen and huge fluffy towels. There are two bedside tables and lamps and a wardrobe with drawers. There is a flat screen television on the wall.
The Bathroom is also a good size with a bath, shower, sink and wc.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
The Annexe is all yours.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Pets and children welcome.']

Title: Beach front home with cosy, coastal interiors.
Description: ['About this space', 'Featured in The Times "50 Great British Beach Escapes"- 25th April 2015, ‚ÄúDriftwood‚Äù is a charming, end of terrace, two-bedroom house in the pretty town of Seaford on the Sussex coast.', 'The space', 'The space\nLocated directly on the esplanade with unspoilt views overlooking Seaford bay, it is decorated in fresh, neutral shades and furnished with simple, yet comfortable New England style furniture. It features a courtyard-style beach garden which links to a large decked terrace, perfect for enjoying a cocktail at sunset or for al-fresco dining. Large garage at the back of the house allows for safe storage of bikes or surfing equipment.The interior of the house is comfortable and cosy, with bare-wood floors and white walls which frame the stunning view. The open-plan reception room includes an area for relaxing or watching a movie on the 40inch flatscreen Smart TV equipped with complimentary Netflix and BT Sport. The house has free WiFI for those who like to stay in touch.There is a round-farmhouse style dining table for four and a fully-equipped kitchen with washing machine, fridge/freezer, micro-wave and breakfast bar. Upstairs on the second floor are two bright and airy double bedrooms. The ‚Äú shabby chic style‚Äù master bedroom boasts a spectacular ocean view and is furnished with a king-size bed and double wardrobe. The second bedroom overlooks the town and features two twin beds and ample storage. Crisp white linen and nautical stripes create a chic, contemporary look.There is a family bathroom with WC, basin and bath which is fitted with a shower mixer and overhead shower. Linen and towels are provided and gas central heating is fitted throughout. Sleeps up to 4 ( a collapsible guest bed is available for a 5th guest)Pets welcome with prior arrangement.', '', 'Guest access\nDriftwood‚Äù is in an excellent location, being only a 10 minute walk to the centre of Seaford town with its diverse range of shops and restaurants, including the excellent ‚ÄúTrawlers‚Äù for fantastic fish and chips. ‚Äú Olivers‚Äù a small family run restaurant offers a more discerning choice of menu and there is also a good selection of tea shops for cream tea lovers.Seaford is surrounded by stunning scenery, villages and countryside and is very popular with hikers. Nearby is the famous Seven Sisters, whose seven cliffs form part of the Seven Sisters County Park at Cuckmere Haven and which starts at the end of the beach, just a few hundred metres from the property.', '', '']

Title: Pagham Beach House, sea views,
Description:
['About this space', "Here is your opportunity to stay in an architect's own home. This exquisite single storey house was built in 2001 in a modernist style, designed by James Wells for his family as a weekend getaway, the house is now available to rent all year round.

Pagham Beach House is the perfect retreat for Goodwood Events: Festival of Speed, Glorious Goodwood and Goodwood Revival", 'The space', 'The space
www.paghambeachhouse.co.uk

Built on a shingle beach, the house is 40 meters from the sea. With one large living, dining and kitchen room, guests can enjoy panoramic views with all the comforts of modern living.

Located in a magical, peaceful hideaway, the beach house is tucked away from traffic but conveniently close to Chichester with its culture, restaurants, caf√©s and shopping.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Pagham Beach House is available for full use by guests, we no longer live there but we live 30 minutes away.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
There is off road parking for two cars, it is not possible to park on the road. The house is situated directly on Pagham Beach and the approach road is a track.']

Title: ‚ÄòEbb & Flow‚Äô stylish seaside flat
Description:
['About this space', 'Boutique style! Ideal for exploring St Leonards on Sea & surrounds & working from home. 2 mins from the sea, 5 from the station, easily accessible by car & free on street parking. Private entry, spacious open plan living, private gardens.
We respectfully ask for guests who are happy to observe a quiet time after midnight & do not mind hearing the odd voice or footstep above.', 'The space', 'The space
The living area is large and open plan for cooking in the kitchen space, sociable dining, and relaxing and watching TV in the lounge area.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests can access all spaces described within the flat including the back and front basement gardens.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Currently we are following a self check in procedure.

Ebb and Flow is a flat in a converted house so please bear in mind people do live above and you may hear the sound of footsteps and voices sometimes. Equally we respect our neighbours by asking for a quiet time after midnight.

It is a NON SMOKING apartment.

Although I have never charged for small breakages i will have to charge for larger damages.']

Title: Beautiful Beach House Winchelsea Beach East Sussex
Description:
['About this space', 'Beautiful 3-bedroom beach house (double, twin, bunk). 100m to Winchelsea Beach. Sea views from lounge and master bedroom balconies. Garden with deck area and outdoor table and chairs. Walking, cycling, water-sports, bird-watching (Rye Harbour Nature Reserve). The Ship deli (great butchers and bread!) and the Red Pig food truck. Good pubs, restaurants and cafes in Rye and Icklesham.', 'The space', 'The space
Fabulous 'New England' style beach house with stunning sea views!
The house is set on The Ridge just yards from Winchelsea Beach, near Rye in East Sussex. The house was featured in Coast Magazine in 2008 and Real Homes magazine Aug 2010. Located in the small village of Winchelsea Beach - where marshland meets the sea, the shingle beach gives way to flat wet sand at low tide. A wonderful four-mile walk is to follow the sea wall eastwards- stopping at the Bird Reserve, then following the River Rother towards Rye and returning across the field tracks past Camber Castle. Whether you want to go surfing, cycling, walking or beach-combing, Bramble Tye is the perfect place to sit back and decide - either in the summer house or gazing across the sea from your balcony. Shop: 0.1 mile Pub: 0.1 mile Coast: 100m.

Ground Floor:
Entrance porch
Kitchen/Dining Room - an extremely light and attractive space with wonderful oak flooring. There is a family room which can be closed off from the main living area furnished with a three seater sofa, occasional table, a variety of chairs, a gas "woodburning" stove and a flat screen TV. In the main room there is a dining table and six chairs plus sideboards and cabinets and the superbly stocked bespoke Kitchen provides an electric oven and gas hob, dishwasher, fridge, freezer, microwave.
Rear porch/ Utility Room houses a washing machine and tumble dryer.
Bedroom 1 with bunk beds, bedside table and clothes hanging rail.
Bedroom 2 with twin beds, bedside table, chest of drawers and double wardrobe
Bathroom with oak flooring, a bath, over-bath shower, heated towel rail, washbasin and w.c

Stairs with stairgates top and bottom to.

First Floor:
Sitting Room with oak flooring. This glorious room has a spectacular galleried roof with open rafters and fabulous sea views from the balcony and the dual aspect windows. There is a three seater sofa, antique leather and cane armchairs, occasional table, TV with DVD and gas "woodburning" stove
Bedroom 3 with double bed, bedside tables, wardrobe and private balcony with stunning sea views. En-Suite Bathroom with a bath, heated towel rail, washbasin and w.c.

Garden: Fully enclosed pebbled, decked and lawned areas, with summer house and wooden garden furniture.
Parking: Parking for one car in the drive plus parking for two cars outside on The Ridge.
Heating: Oil central heating and gas "woodburning" gas stoves for boost.

Wifi available. Mobile 'phone reception poor
Highchair available (attaches to adult chair)
Removable bed-side barrier available for toddlers.

All linen and towels provided.
All heating and electricity costs included.

Facilities for Babies and Small Children:
Mamas and Papas travel cot (please bring own linen, blankets and pillow etc. The cot mattress is thin so you may wish to bring your own thicker cot mattress).
Safety-rail for bed (secured under the mattress)
High chair (secured on to dining chair with straps)', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests have access to the whole house and one off-road parking space. Additional parking on road by pedestrian gate.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
Short breaks are available. 4 nights minimum.

The house sleeps a maximum of 6 and no additional people can be accommodated.']

Title: Caribbean Corner
Description:
['About this space', 'A secluded beach hideaway in the woods, at the top of the coastal slope on Priory Bay. It has been described by guests as "a little piece of paradise".

The north end of Priory Bay is locally known as Caribbean Corner. The mature woodland slope running all the way down to the sand makes it a uniquely romantic location.

Caribbean Corner along with its sister property The Hideaway gives a desert island experience, only 2.5 hours from London and 15 minutes from Portsmouth by RIB.', 'The space', 'The space
Beautifully constructed by local craftsman, Paul, this glamorous structure, inspired by Mongolian yurts provides the ultimate in glamping.

The "yurt" has a king size double bed built from our own oak, allows you to look both out to sea and up through the tree tops to the stars. The adjoining bathroom has all the essentials, champagne bucket, a roll-top Victorian bath, a flushing toilet and views to the stars.

The handcrafted kitchen with oak work-top and cupboards made from recycled pallets has a Belfast sink, fridge, twin induction hob.

Moving through the French doors to your barbecue, you step on to a viewing platform over the idyllic sandy beach and are surrounded by majestic native woodland - if you can find a shower with a better view we will fill the champagne bucket!

This yurt is really designed for two, but there is plenty of room for two little ones.

The main feature is the sheltered gently shelving sandy beach. It is completely protected from the prevailing winds and the morning sun warms the sea on a rising tide. On a spring tide you can take a morning walk all the way to St Helens Fort, getting wet only up to your knees. There is no better experience than coming back to barbecue a couple of locally caught mackerel for breakfast.

It is very important that this is only done when the tide times are safe.

If you're lucky enough to come in spring the woods are carpeted with wild garlic, bluebells, daffodils, primroses, wild violets and later in the year wild orchids cover the orchard.

As well as everything you might expect to find in rock pools, you can expect to see red squirrels, peregrines, stoats, buzzards, owls, sparrow hawks, swifts & swallows, bats, woodpeckers and if you're lucky a badger.', '', '', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The property is adjacent to the historic Priory Bay Hotel, which is currently closed awaiting refurbishment.

There are many other hostelries and restaurants in the local towns of St Helens, Seaview and Bembridge.']

Our enviable waterfront position with direct sea access is usually the first comment that our guests make. Our open plan kitchen, diner and lounge enables all guests to enjoy interaction at all times.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Full access to The Beach House can be enjoyed together with a double garage and forecourt in order to park four cars easily.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note

Title: Worthing Prom direct sea views! Free parking.
Description: ['About this space', 'Check our reviews! Self check-in, free parking. A big bright and sunny 1 bed flat located directly on Marine parade. Panoramic sea views from the huge open-plan living kitchen room. Big windows and high ceilings. Recently refurbed. Double bedroom with a king-size bed, ample storage, and double sofabed in the lounge. Perfect holiday pad, and offering easy access to the Sth Downs Nat Park, Arundel, Goodwood, Chichester, Shoreham and Brighton. 80mbps WiFi. 43inTV Netflix, M&S foodhall 200M.', 'The space', "The space\nThe flat will be fully sanitised by our professional team before check-in. IF YOU ARE USING AIRBNB FOR THE FIRST TIME, PLEASE MESSAGE US WITH YOUR REQUEST GIVING THE NAMES, AGES AND OCCUPATIONS OF YOUR GROUP, A LITTLE BIT OF INFORMATION ABOUT YOURSELVES AND THE NATURE OF YOUR TRIP. Please have your verification process complete. We will provide free parking vouchers for your full days, but not checkout day. Just let us know when you book. The flat is situated directly on the seafront, and is only yards away from the beach. The flat is on the ground floor and gives easy access with two small steps from the pavement. The front door and common parts have motion sensor lighting to assist while you enter the property. Worthing pier and the town centre is a couple of minutes walk (400m). Go and see Russell at the pier cafe for a freshly brewed coffee and an ice cream! Worthing mainline station is approximately 1km away. The fabulous Worthing Splashpoint leisure centre is also just 1km away along the promenade. The flat has a lovely big sunny South facing living room measuring 21 feet long by 15 feet wide, and has a newly fitted corner kitchen area. The kitchen has a slick black ceramic hob, a Bosch fan oven grill, and a Leibherr fridge-freezer - all new in 2020, a washing machine and microwave. The flat has been recently refurbished, and has a bay window four seater dining table area, a large double sofabed, two coffee tables, a new 43 inch LED flat screen SmartTV with Netflix and YouTube, and fibre optic 80mbps WiFi when hard wired. The flat benefits from gas central heating and double-glazing throughout. The flat has lovely high ceilings and large windows to let all that lovely seafront sunshine pour in! The rectangular 11 x 9 foot double bedroom comes with a pocket sprung luxury ¬£900 king-size double bed with two bedside storage drawers, a chest of drawers, and a wardrobe. We've put a superking-size duvet on the bed, and four pillows. Pure cotton bedding completes the opulent finish. The separate WC bathroom with shower finishes the private accommodation. There is access to the communal front and rear garden areas. The beautiful South Downs park is accessible only 3 km out of town. Superbly located for access to all the main attractions of the town. Bicycle hire is now available on the promenade via the Donkey Republic app. There's an M&S food hall a couple of hundred metres along the seafront heading into town, and there's a Co-Op at the top of the road 2 mins away. Montague Street and Rowlands road which are one block behind the flat, are the hub of the town. There's a superb selection of shops, coffee shops, restaurants, takeaways, and pubs", '', '', '', '']

Title: Isle of Wight home next to the sea
Description:
['About this space', 'Lovely modern maisonette that is part of a seafront complex neutrally decorated throughout , 3 good sized bedrooms, 2 new bathrooms, newly decked spacious garden with wonderful views. Fabulous situation with direct access to the beaches at Seagrove Bay and Seaview with wonderful walks at Low tide round to Priory Bay. You can fish off the sea wall at high tide.
We are 5 minutes walk to the centre of the village which has a local shop, cafes and a popular pub.', 'The space', 'The space
A secure home in a stunning position within a beachside complex. The apartment is on 2 floors and is spacious and comfortable with direct proximity to the sea. A much loved holiday home.', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Guests have full access to the property and garden. The complex has direct access to the beach.', 'Other things to note', 'Other things to note
The property is secure and there is a full time maintenance person on site.
PETS ARE NOT ALLOWED.']

Title: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! Desk WiFi Bed and Lock
Description:
['About this space', 'Central yet oasis- like residential area to return to after making the most of all the fun and festivities found virtually on the doorstep.
My home was rest rooms for the actors on location during the 1940s/50s when connected to the erstwhile film studio‚Äôs next door.
Delightful small double bedded lockable ground floor room with wash basin - desk - unlimited WiFi, large tv.

Decorative and quirky JPG wall coverings. Give the room a lovely nostalgic feel with pleasant view to the patio garden.', 'The space', 'The space
Female led household. You can be confident that thorough cleansing takes place between stays using premium products such as Method soaps and surface cleansers. Fairy soap and conditioner is used on laundering your 100% cotton bedding.

Great little bolt hole with handy desk.
Convenient,convenient, convenient in central Brighton yet a quiet residential oasis.
Pavilion, Dome, North Laines, The Lanes,Theatre Royal, Brighton Station, local buses serving Seven Sisters and beyond are 5 minutes away.
i360 The Brighton Centre and the beach is 10 minutes walk
This charming small double room (4x3.5 m) is ideal for Le Weekend or an ample cave/large screen tv for one.
Essentially Victorian in style juxtaposed with some modern objects such as the large screen television. Also, conveniently this room contains your very own hand basin and an Arts and Crafts writing bureau for penning your memoirs. There are books for your enjoyment in the antique bamboo shelving. Hanging space and drawers for your clothing. The Victorian style iron bed is situated - leaving approximately 2x2.5 of clear floor space and a view to my delightful patio garden.
The room has a lockable door.', '', '', '', '']

Title: Spacious seafront apartment
Description:
['About this space', 'Come and enjoy all Brighton has to offer. Right on the seafront in vibrant central Kemptown with its cafes, shops, delis, bars and restaurants. Newly refurbished spacious lower ground floor apartment offering flexible accommodation. Welcome families (KIDS FREE)', 'The space', 'The space
Perfect for couples, business people or families (KIDS FREE). Works well for two to four people. The main superking bed is a hotel zip-lock and can be divided into two 3' singles. There are two top quality full depth mattress 2' 6" fold away beds which adults are happy with and also makes it perfect for families. There is also a high chair and travel cot with mattress and bottom sheets (please bring your preferred top covers) and a cupboard with children's games, books, cutlery and crockery in the sitting room.

The fitted kitchen is fully equipped with electric oven, gas hob, fridge, microwave and washing machine, cutlery, crockery and basic cooking utensils. Gas central heating and hot water.

No charge for under 18yrs with responsible adult (FAMILIES please book only for adults on the system so that you are not charged for under 18's - just let us know they are coming by email).', 'Guest access', 'Guest access
Private access down narrow external stairs to front door means this flat is unsuitable for people with restricted mobility.

Parking is generally straightforward and available but all on road. If resident spaces are available we can provide visitor permits for ¬£7 per day, usual charge opposite the apartment is ¬£15 per day, with some cheaper places a short distance away', '', 'Other things to note
We can usually be very flexible with check in and check out times - please just ask']
